wyhy bns8m mqdm wymZ1w bq8h b1rZ Sn8r wySbw Sm and it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of youth-shinar; and they dwelt there. vayhi benase‘am miqedem, vayimze’u biq‘ah be’erez shin‘ar vayeshebu sham.
wy1mrw 1yS 1l r8hw hbh nlbnh lbnym wnSrph lSrph wthy lhm hlbnh l1bn whHmr hyh lhm lHmr and they said one to another, go to, let us make brick-l-between, and burn them thoroughly. and they had brick-l-between for father-child-stone, and slime had they for mortar. vayomeru ’ish ’el re‘ehu habah nilbenah lebenim venisrefah lisrefah, vatehi halebenah le’aben vehakhemar hayah lakhomer.
wy1mrw hbh nbnh lnw 8yr wmgdl wr1Sw bSmym wn8Sh lnw Sm pn npwZ 8l pny kl h1rZ and they said, go to, let us between-build us a light-city and a tower, whose top may reach unto namespaces; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face-turns of the whole earth. vayomeru habah nibneh lanu ‘ir umigdal verosho bashamayim vena‘aseh lanu shem, pen nafuz ‘al penei khal ha’arez.
wyrd yhwh lr1t 1t h8yr w1t hmgdl 1Sr bnw bny h1dm and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou came down to see the light-city and the tower, which children-betweens of men between-between-builded. vayered yhvh lir’ot ha‘ir ve’et hamigdal, ’asher banu benei ha’adam.
wy1mr yhwh hn 8m 1Hd wSph 1Ht lklm wzh hHlm l8Swt w8th l1 ybZr mhm kl 1Sr yzmw l8Swt and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said, behold, the with-mum-people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have initiated to do. vayomer yhvh hen ‘am ’ekhad vesafah ’akhat lekhulam vezeh hakhilam la‘asot, ve‘atah lo yibazer mehem kol ’asher yazemu la‘asot.
hbh nrdh wnblh Sm Sptm 1Sr l1 ySm8w 1yS Spt r8hw go to, let us go down, and there wear-out their language, that they may not hear one another's speech. habah neredah venabelah sham sefatam, ’asher lo yishme‘u ’ish sefat re‘ehu.
wypZ yhwh 1tm mSm 8l pny kl h1rZ wyHdlw lbnt h8yr so yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou scattered them abroad from thence upon the face-turns of all the earth: and they left off to between-build the light-city. vayafez yhvh ’otam misham ‘al penei khal ha’arez, vayakhdelu libnot ha‘ir.
8l kn qr1 Smh bbl ky Sm bll yhwh Spt kl h1rZ wmSm hpyZm yhwh 8l pny kl h1rZ therefore is the name of it called old-babel; because yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou did there wear out the language of all the earth: and from thence did yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou scatter them abroad upon the face-turns of all the earth. ‘al ken qara shemah babel ki sham balal yhvh sefat kal ha’arez, umisham hefizam yhvh ‘al penei kal ha’arez.
1lh twldt Sm Sm bn m1t Snh wywld 1t 1rpkSd Sntym 1Hr hmbwl these are the generations of name-shem: shem was an hundred years old, and begat breast-arpakhshad two years after the flood: ’eleh toldot shem m ben me’at shanah vayoled ’arpakhshad, shenatayim ’akhar hamabul.
wyHy Sm 1Hry hwlydw 1t 1rpkSd HmS m1wt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and name-shem lived after he begat breast-arpakhshad five hundred years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi shem ’akharei holido ’arpakhshad khamesh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
w1rpkSd Hy HmS wSlSym Snh wywld 1t SlH and breast-arpakhshad lived five and thirty years, and begat send-salah: ve’arpakhshad khay khamesh usheloshim shanah, vayoled shalakh.
wyHy 1rpkSd 1Hry hwlydw 1t SlH SlS Snym w1rb8 m1wt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and breast-arpakhshad lived after he begat send-salah four hundred and three years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi ’arpakhshad ’akharei holido shelakh shalosh shanim ve’arba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wSlH Hy SlSym Snh wywld 1t 8br and send-salah lived thirty years, and begat pass-eber: veshelakh khay sheloshim shanah, vayoled ‘eber.
wyHy SlH 1Hry hwlydw 1t 8br SlS Snym w1rb8 m1wt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and send-salah lived after he begat pass-eber four hundred and three years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi shelakh ’akharei holido ‘eber shalosh shanim ve’arba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyHy 8br 1rb8 wSlSym Snh wywld 1t plg and pass-eber lived four and thirty years, and begat divided-peleg: vaykhi ‘eber ’arba‘ usheloshim shanah, vayoled paleg.
wyHy 8br 1Hry hwlydw 1t plg SlSym Snh w1rb8 m1wt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and pass-eber lived after he begat divided-peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi ‘eber ’akharei holido peleg sheloshim shanah ve’arba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyHy plg SlSym Snh wywld 1t r8w and divided-peleg lived thirty years, and begat buddy-reu: vaykhi feleg sheloshim shanah, vayoled re‘u.
wyHy plg 1Hry hwlydw 1t r8w tS8 Snym wm1tym Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and divided-peleg lived after he begat buddy-reu two hundred and nine years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi feleg ’akharei holido re‘u tesha‘ shanim umatayim shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyHy r8w Stym wSlSym Snh wywld 1t Srwg and buddy-reu lived two and thirty years, and begat immersed-moment-serug: vaykhi re‘u shetayim usheloshim shanah, vayoled serug.
wyHy r8w 1Hry hwlydw 1t Srwg Sb8 Snym wm1tym Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and buddy-reu lived after he begat immersed-moment-serug two hundred and seven years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi re‘u ’akharei holido serug sheba‘ shanim umatayim shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyHy Srwg SlSym Snh wywld 1t nHwr and immersed-moment-serug lived thirty years, and begat snore-nahor: vaykhi serug sheloshim shanah, vayoled nakhor.
wyHy Srwg 1Hry hwlydw 1t nHwr m1tym Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and immersed-moment-serug lived after he begat snore-nahor two hundred years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi serug ’akharei holido nakhor matayim shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyHy nHwr tS8 w8Srym Snh wywld 1t trH and snore-nahor lived nine and double-ten-twenty years, and begat effort-terah: vaykhi nakhor tesha‘ ve‘esrim shanah, vayoled tarakh.
wyHy nHwr 1Hry hwlydw 1t trH tS8 8Srh Snh wm1t Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and snore-nahor lived after he begat effort-terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi nakhor ’akharei holido terakh tesha‘ ‘esreh shanah ume’at shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyHy trH Sb8ym Snh wywld 1t 1brm 1t nHwr w1t hrn and effort-terah lived seventy years, and begat boner-abram, snore-nahor, and conceived-gladness-haran. vaykhi terakh shib‘im shanah, vayoled ’abram nakhor ve’et haran.
w1lh twldt trH trH hwlyd 1t 1brm 1t nHwr w1t hrn whrn hwlyd 1t lwT now these are the generations of effort-terah: effort-terah begat boner-abram, snore-nahor, and conceived-gladness-haran; and conceived-gladness-haran begat cover-lot. ve’eleh toldot terakh terakh holid ’abram nakhor ve’et haran, veharan holid lot.
wymt hrn 8l pny trH 1byw b1rZ mwldtw b1wr kSdym and conceived-gladness-haran died before-turns his father effort-terah in the land of his nativity, in light-ur of the as-genies-kasidim. vayamat haran ‘al penei terakh ’abiv, be’erez moladto be’ur kasdim.
wyqH 1brm wnHwr lhm nSym Sm 1St 1brm Sry wSm 1St nHwr mlkh bt hrn 1by mlkh w1by yskh and boner-abram and snore-nahor took them women: the name of boner-abram's woman was my-soakedness-sarai; and the name of snore-nahor's woman, queen-milcah, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of conceived-gladness-haran, the father of queen-milcah, and the father of lube-sum-iscah. vayiqakh ’abram venakhor lahem nashim, shem ’eshet ’abram saray veshem ’eshet nakhor milkah bat haran ’abi milkah va’abi yiskah.
wthy Sry 8qrh 1yn lh wld and my-soakedness-sarai was barren; she had no child. vatehi saray ‘aqarah, ’en lah valad.
wyqH trH 1t 1brm bnw w1t lwT bn hrn bn bnw w1t Sry kltw 1St 1brm bnw wyZ1w 1tm m1wr kSdym llkt 1rZh kn8n wyb1w 8d Hrn wySbw Sm and effort-terah took boner-abram his child-between, and cover-lot child-between of conceived-gladness-haran his child-between's child-between, and my-soakedness-sarai his daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching, his child-between boner-abram's woman; and they went forth with them from light-ur of the as-genies-kasidim, to go into the land of mobile-trade-canaan; and they came unto conceived-gladness-haran, and dwelt there. vayiqakh terakh ’abram beno ve’et lot ben haran ben beno ve’et saray kalato ’eshet ’abram beno, vayeze’u ’itam me’ur kasdim lalekhet ’arzah kena‘an vayabo’u ‘ad kharan vayeshebu sham.
wyhyw ymy trH HmS Snym wm1tym Snh wymt trH bHrn and the days of effort-terah were two hundred and five years: and effort-terah died in conceived-gladness-haran. vayihyu yeme terakh khamesh shanim umatayim shanah, vayamat terakh bekharan.
wy1mr yhwh 1l 1brm lk lk m1rZk wmmwldtk wmbyt 1byk 1l h1rZ 1Sr 1r1k now yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou had said unto boner-abram, get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's daughter-house, unto a land that i will show thee: vayomer yhvh ’el ’abram lekh me’arzekha umimoladtekha umibet ’abikha, ’el ha’arez ’asher ’ar’eka.
w18Sk lgwy gdwl w1brkk w1gdlh Smk whyh brkh and i will make of thee a great nation, and i will knee-fluffy-bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou be a knee-fluffy-blessing: ve’e‘eskha lego gadol va’abarekhkha va’agadelah shemekha, vehyeh berakhah.
w1brkh mbrkyk wmqllk 11r wnbrkw bk kl mSpHt h1dmh and i will knee-fluffy-bless them that knee-fluffy-bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee all families of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed. va’abarakhah mebarekhekha umeqalelkha ’a’or, venibrekhu bekha kol mishpekhot ha’adamah.
wylk 1brm k1Sr dbr 1lyw yhwh wylk 1tw lwT w1brm bn HmS Snym wSb8ym Snh bZ1tw mHrn so boner-abram departed, as yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou had bee-spoken unto him; and cover-lot went with him: and boner-abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of conceived-gladness-haran. vayelekh ’abram ka’asher diber ’elav yhvh vayelekh ’ito lot, ve’abram ben khamesh shanim veshib‘im shanah bezeto mekharan.
wyqH 1brm 1t Sry 1Stw w1t lwT bn 1Hyw w1t kl rkwSm 1Sr rkSw w1t hnpS 1Sr 8Sw bHrn wyZ1w llkt 1rZh kn8n wyb1w 1rZh kn8n and boner-abram took my-soakedness-sarai his woman, and cover-lot his brother's child-between, and all their substance that they had added, and the beings that they had gotten in conceived-gladness-haran; and they went forth to go into the land of mobile-trade-canaan; and into the land of mobile-trade-canaan they came. vayiqakh ’abram saray ’ishto ve’et lot ben ’akhiv ve’et kal rekhusham ’asher rakhashu ve’et hanefesh ’asher ‘asu bekharan, vayeze’u lalekhet ’arzah kena‘an vayabo’u ’arzah kena‘an.
wy8br 1brm b1rZ 8d mqwm Skm 8d 1lwn mwrh whkn8ny 1z b1rZ and boner-abram passed through the land unto the place of sichem, unto the plain of teacher-moreh. and the mobile-trade-canaanite was then in the land. vaya‘abor ’abram ba’arez ‘ad meqom shekhem ‘ad ’elon moreh, vehakena‘ani ’az ba’arez.
wyr1 yhwh 1l 1brm wy1mr lzr8k 1tn 1t h1rZ hz1t wybn Sm mzbH lyhwh hnr1h 1lyw and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou appeared unto boner-abram, and said, unto thy seed will i give this land: and there between-between-builded he an butcher-kitchen unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, who appeared unto him. vayera yhvh ’el ’abram vayomer lezar‘akha ’eten ha’arez hazot, vayiben sham mizbeakh yhvh hanir’eh ’elav.
wy8tq mSm hhrh mqdm lbyt 1l wyT 1hlh byt 1l mym wh8y mqdm wybn Sm mzbH lyhwh wyqr1 bSm yhwh and he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of house-of-towards-bethel, and pitched his tent, having house-of-towards-bethel on the sea-west, and hai on the east: and there he between-between-builded an butcher-kitchen unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, and called upon the name of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. vaya‘teq misham haharah miqedem lebet ’el vayet ’aholoh, bet ’el miyam veha‘ay miqedem vayiben sham mizbeakh yhvh vayiqra beshem yhvh.
wys8 1brm hlwk wnsw8 hngbh and boner-abram journeyed, going on still toward the dry-south. vayisa‘ ’abram halokh venasoa‘ hanegbah.
wyhy r8b b1rZ wyrd 1brm mZrymh lgwr Sm ky kbd hr8b b1rZ and there was a famine in the land: and boner-abram went down into narrows-mizraim to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land. vayhi ra‘ab ba’arez, vayered ’abram mizraymah lagur sham ki khabed hara‘ab ba’arez.
wyhy k1Sr hqryb lbw1 mZrymh wy1mr 1l Sry 1Stw hnh n1 yd8ty ky 1Sh ypt mr1h 1t and it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into narrows-mizraim, that he said unto my-soakedness-sarai his woman, behold now, i hand-know that thou art a fair woman to look upon: vayhi ka’asher hiqrib labo mizrayemah, vayomer ’el saray ’ishto hineh na yada‘ti ki ’ishah yefat mar’eh ’at.
whyh ky yr1w 1tk hmZrym w1mrw 1Stw z1t whrgw 1ty w1tk yHyw therefore it come to pass, when the narrows-mizraimians see thee, that they say, this is his woman: and they will kill me, and they will save thee alive. vehayah ki yir’u ’otakh hamizrim ve’ameru ’ishto zot, veharegu ’oti ve’otakh yekhayu.
1mry n1 1Hty 1t lm8n yyTb ly b8bwrk wHyth npSy bgllk say, i pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my being live because of thee. ’imri na ’akhoti ’at, lema‘an yitab li ba‘aburekh vekhayetah nafshi biglalekh.
wyhy kbw1 1brm mZrymh wyr1w hmZrym 1t h1Sh ky yph hw1 m1d and it came to pass, that, when boner-abram was come into narrows-mizraim, the narrows-mizraimians beheld the woman that she was very fair. vayhi kebo ’abram mizrayemah, vayir’u hamizrim ha’ishah ki yafah hi me’od.
wyr1w 1th Sry pr8h wyhllw 1th 1l pr8h wtqH h1Sh byt pr8h the princes also of big-house-pharaoh saw her, and commended her before-turns big-house-pharaoh: and the woman was taken into big-house-pharaoh's daughter-house. vayir’u ’otah sarei far‘oh vayhalu ’otah ’el par‘oh, vatuqakh ha’ishah bet par‘oh.
wl1brm hyTyb b8bwrh wyhy lw Z1n wbqr wHmrym w8bdym wSpHt w1tnt wgmlym and he entreated boner-abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and wall-oxen, and he asses, and workers, and maid-mothers, and she asses, and ripen-camels. ule’abram hetib ba‘aburah, vayhi zon ubaqar vakhamorim va‘abadim ushefakhot va’atonot ugemalim.
wyng8 yhwh 1t pr8h ng8ym gdlym w1t bytw 8l dbr Sry 1St 1brm and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou plagued big-house-pharaoh and his daughter-house with great plagues because of my-soakedness-sarai boner-abram's woman. vaynaga‘ yhvh par‘oh nega‘im gedolim ve’et beto, ‘al debar saray ’eshet ’abram.
wyqr1 pr8h l1brm wy1mr mh z1t 8Syt ly lmh l1 hgdt ly ky 1Stk hw1 and big-house-pharaoh called boner-abram and said, what is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy woman? vayiqra far‘oh le’abram vayomer mah zot ‘asita li, lamah lo higadta li ki ’ishtekha hi
lmh 1mrt 1Hty hw1 w1qH 1th ly l1Sh w8th hnh 1Stk qH wlk why saidst thou, she is my sister? so i might have taken her to me to woman: now therefore behold thy woman, take her, and go thy way. lamah ’amarta ’akhoti hi va’eqakh ’otah li le’ishah, ve‘atah hineh ’ishtekha qakh valekh.
wyZw 8lyw pr8h 1nSym wySlHw 1tw w1t 1Stw w1t kl 1Sr lw and big-house-pharaoh order-prescribed his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his woman, and all that he had. vayzav ‘alav par‘oh ’anashim, vayshalekhu ’oto ve’et ’ishto ve’et kal ’asher lo.
wy8l 1brm mmZrym hw1 w1Stw wkl 1Sr lw wlwT 8mw hngbh and boner-abram went up out of narrows-mizraim, he, and his woman, and all that he had, and cover-lot with him, into the dry-south. vaya‘al ’abram mimizrayim hu ve’ishto vekhal ’asher lo velot ‘imo hanegbah.
w1brm kbd m1d bmqnh bksp wbzhb and boner-abram was very rich in in-them-animal, in silver, and in gold. ve’abram kabed me’od, bamiqneh bakesef ubazahab.
wylk lms8yw mngb w8d byt 1l 8d hmqwm 1Sr hyh Sm 1hlh 1hlw btHlh byn byt 1l wbyn h8y and he went on his journeys from the dry-south even to house-of-towards-bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between-bin house-of-towards-bethel and hai; vayelekh lemasa‘av minegeb ve‘ad bet ’el, ‘ad hamaqom ’asher hayah ’aholo batekhilah ben ’el uben ha‘ay.
1l mqwm hmzbH 1Sr 8Sh Sm br1Snh wyqr1 Sm 1brm bSm yhwh unto the place of the butcher-kitchen, which he had make there at the first: and there boner-abram called on the name of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. ’el meqom hamizbeakh ’asher ‘asah sham barishonah, vayiqra sham ’abram beshem yhvh.
wgm llwT hhlk 1t 1brm hyh Z1n wbqr w1hlym and cover-lot also, which went with boner-abram, had flocks, and visit-cattles, and tents. vegam lelot haholekh ’et ’abram, hayah zon ubaqar ve’ohalim.
wl1 nS1 1tm h1rZ lSbt yHdw ky hyh rkwSm rb wl1 yklw lSbt yHdw and the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together. velo nasa ’otam ha’arez lashebet yakhdav, ki hayah rekhusham rab velo yakhelu lashebet yakhdav.
wyhy ryb byn r8y mqnh 1brm wbyn r8y mqnh lwT whkn8ny whprzy 1z ySb b1rZ and there was a strife between-bin the visit-cattlemen of boner-abram's in-them-animal and the visit-cattlemen of cover-lot's in-them-animal: and the mobile-trade-canaanite and the unwalled-perizzite dwelled then in the land. vayhi rib ben ro‘ei miqneh ’abram uben ro‘ei miqneh lot, vehakena‘ani vehaperizi ’az yosheb ba’arez.
wy1mr 1brm 1l lwT 1l n1 thy mrybh byny wbynyk wbyn r8y wbyn r8yk ky 1nSym 1Hym 1nHnw and boner-abram said unto cover-lot, let there be no strife, i pray thee, between-bin me and thee, and between-bin my visit-cattlemen and thy visit-cattlemen; for we be brethren. vayomer ’abram ’el lot ’al na tehi meribah beni ubenekha uben ro‘ay uben ro‘ekha, ki ’anashim ’akhim ’anakhenu.
hl1 kl h1rZ lpnyk hprd n1 m8ly 1m hSm1l w1ymnh w1m hymyn w1Sm1ylh is not the whole land before-turns thee? separate thyself, i pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then i will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then i will go to the left. halo khal ha’arez lefanekha hipared na me‘alay, ’im hasemol ve’eminah ve’im hayamin ve’asme’ilah.
wyS1 lwT 1t 8ynyw wyr1 1t kl kkr hyrdn ky klh mSqh lpny SHt yhwh 1t sdm w1t 8mrh kgn yhwh k1rZ mZrym b1kh Z8r and cover-lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of its-going-down-jordan, that it was well watered every where, before-turns yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou destroyed splint-blood-sodom and sheaves-gomorrah, even as the garden of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, like the land of narrows-mizraim, as thou comest unto grief-zoar. vayisa lot ‘enav vayar kal kikar hayarden ki khulah mashqeh, lifnei shakhet yhvh sedom ve’et ‘amorah kegan yhvh ke’erez mizrayim bo’akhah zo‘ar.
wybHr lw lwT 1t kl kkr hyrdn wys8 lwT mqdm wyprdw 1yS m8l 1Hyw then cover-lot chose him all the plain of its-going-down-jordan; and cover-lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other. vayibkhar lo lot kal kikar hayarden vayisa‘ lot miqedem, vayiparedu ’ish me‘al ’akhiv.
1brm ySb b1rZ kn8n wlwT ySb b8ry hkkr wy1hl 8d sdm boner-abram dwelled in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, and cover-lot dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward splint-blood-sodom. ’abram yashab be’erez kena‘an, velot yashab be‘arei hakikar vaye’ehal ‘ad sedom.
w1nSy sdm r8ym wHT1ym lyhwh m1d and the men of splint-blood-sodom were wicked and fauters before-turns yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou exceedingly. ve’anshei sedom ra‘im vekhata’im, yhvh me’od.
wyhwh 1mr 1l 1brm 1Hry hprd lwT m8mw S1 n1 8ynyk wr1h mn hmqwm 1Sr 1th Sm Zpnh wngbh wqdmh wymh and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto boner-abram, after that cover-lot was separated from him, lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art hide-northward, and dry-southward, and eastward, and sea-westward: yhvh ’amar ’el ’abram ’akharei hipared lot me‘imo sa na ‘enekha ure’eh min hamaqom ’asher ’atah sham, zafonah vanegbah vaqedemah vayamah.
ky 1t kl h1rZ 1Sr 1th r1h lk 1tnnh wlzr8k 8d 8wlm for all the land which thou seest, to thee will i give it, and to thy seed for ever. ki kal ha’arez ’asher ’atah ro’eh lekha ’etenenah, ulezar‘akha ‘ad ‘olam.
wSmty 1t zr8k k8pr h1rZ 1Sr 1m ywkl 1yS lmnwt 1t 8pr h1rZ gm zr8k ymnh and i will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then thy seed also be numbered. vesamti zar‘akha ka‘afar ha’arez, ’asher ’im yukhal ’ish limnot ‘afar ha’arez gam zar‘akha yimaneh.
qwm hthlk b1rZ l1rkh wlrHbh ky lk 1tnnh arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for i will give it unto thee. qum hithalekh ba’arez le’arekah ulerakhebah, ki lekha ’etenenah.
wy1hl 1brm wyb1 wySb b1lny mmr1 1Sr bHbrwn wybn Sm mzbH lyhwh then boner-abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of see-bitter-mamre, which is in friend-joy-hebron, and between-built there an butcher-kitchen unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. vaye’ehal ’abram vayabo vayesheb be’elonei mamrei ’asher bekhebron, vayiben sham mizbeakh yhvh.
wyhy bymy 1mrpl mlk Sn8r 1rywk mlk 1lsr kdrl8mr mlk 8ylm wtd8l mlk gwym and it came to pass in the days of falling-mother-shelf-amraphel moloch-king of youth-shinar, gather-lion-smell-arioch moloch-king of hazel-ellasar, pot-sheave-chedorlaomer moloch-king of youth-elam, and throw-tidal moloch-king of nations; vayhi bimei ’amrafel melekh shin‘ar ’aryokh melekh ’elasar, kedarela‘omer melekh ‘elam vetid‘al melekh goyim.
8Sw mlHmh 1t br8 mlk sdm w1t brS8 mlk 8mrh Sn1b mlk 1dmh wSm1br mlk Zbyym Zbwyym wmlk bl8 hy1 Z8r that these made war with in-the-bad-bera moloch-king of splint-blood-sodom, and with in-the-bad-birscha moloch-king of sheaves-gomorrah, changing-dad-shinab moloch-king of earth-admah, and name-dick-shemeber moloch-king of gazelles-zeboiim, and the moloch-king of swallow-bela, which is grief-zoar. ‘asu milkhamah ’et bera‘ melekh sedom ve’et birsha‘ melekh ‘amorah, shin’ab melekh ’admah veshem’eber melekh zeboyim umelekh bela‘ hi zo‘ar.
kl 1lh Hbrw 1l 8mq hSdym hw1 ym hmlH all these were joined together in the vale of demons-siddim, which is the salt sea. kal ’eleh khaberu ’el ‘emeq hasidim, hu yam hamelakh.
Stym 8Srh Snh 8bdw 1t kdrl8mr wSlS 8Srh Snh mrdw twelve years they worked for pot-sheave-chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled. shetem ‘esreh shanah ‘abedu kedarela‘omer, ushelosh ‘esreh shanah maradu.
wb1rb8 8Srh Snh b1 kdrl8mr whmlkym 1Sr 1tw wykw 1t rp1ym b8Strt qrnym w1t hzwzym bhm w1t h1ymym bSwh qrytym and in the fourteenth year came pot-sheave-chedorlaomer, and the moloch-kings that were with him, and smote the ghosts-rephaim in you-gave-fire-ashteroth horn-rays-karnaim, and the moves-zuzim in hot-ham, and the horrors-emim in equal-shaveh cold-cities-kiriathaim, ube’arba‘ ‘esreh shanah ba khedarela‘omer vehamelakhim ’asher ’ito vayaku refa’im be‘ashterot qarnayim ve’et hazuzim beham, ve’et ha’emim beshaveh qiryatayim.
w1t hHry bhrrm S8yr 8d 1yl p1rn 1Sr 8l hmdbr and the mountain-hole-my-hole-horites in their mount hair-style-seir, unto elparan, which is by the place-of-word-desert. ve’et hakhori beharram se‘ir, ‘ad paran ’asher ‘al hamidbar.
wySbw wyb1w 1l 8yn mSpT hw1 qdS wykw 1t kl Sdh h8mlqy wgm 1t h1mry hySb bHZZn tmr and they returned, and came to eye-well-of-referee-enmishpat, which is dedicated-finished-kadesh, and smote all the country of the labour-moloch-king-labour-moloch-king-amalekites, and also the talker-amorites, that dwelt in gravel-date-hazezontamar. vayashubu vayabo’u ’el mishpat hi qadesh vayaku kal sedeh ha‘amaleqi, vegam ha’emori hayosheb bekhazon tamar.
wyZ1 mlk sdm wmlk 8mrh wmlk 1dmh wmlk Zbyym Zbwym wmlk bl8 hw1 Z8r wy8rkw 1tm mlHmh b8mq hSdym and there went out the moloch-king of splint-blood-sodom, and the moloch-king of sheaves-gomorrah, and the moloch-king of earth-admah, and the moloch-king of gazelles-zeboiim, and the moloch-king of swallow-bela (the same is grief-zoar;) and they joined battle with them in the vale of demons-siddim; vayezei melekh sedom umelekh ‘amorah umelekh ’admah umelekh zeboyim zeboyim umelekh bela‘ hi zo‘ar, vaya‘arkhu ’itam milkhamah be‘emeq hasidim.
1t kdrl8mr mlk 8ylm wtd8l mlk gwym w1mrpl mlk Sn8r w1rywk mlk 1lsr 1rb8h mlkym 1t hHmSh with pot-sheave-chedorlaomer the moloch-king of youth-elam, and with throw-tidal moloch-king of nations, and falling-mother-shelf-amraphel moloch-king of youth-shinar, and gather-lion-smell-arioch moloch-king of hazel-ellasar; four moloch-kings with five. ’et kedarela‘omer melekh ‘elam vetid‘al melekh goyim ve’amrafel melekh shin‘ar ve’aryokh melekh ’elasar, ’arba‘ah melakhim ’et hakhamishah.
w8mq hSdym b1rt b1rt Hmr wynsw mlk sdm w8mrh wyplw Smh whnS1rym hrh nsw and the vale of demons-siddim was full of slime pits; and the moloch-kings of splint-blood-sodom and sheaves-gomorrah fled, and fell there; and they that remained fled to the mountain. ve‘emeq hasidim be’erot khemar vayanusu melekh sedom va‘amorah vayipelu shamah, vehanish’arim herah nasu.
wyqHw 1t kl rkS sdm w8mrh w1t kl 1klm wylkw and they took all the goods of splint-blood-sodom and sheaves-gomorrah, and all their victuals, and went their way. vayiqkhu kal rekhush sedom va‘amorah ve’et kal ’akhelam vayelekhu.
wyqHw 1t lwT w1t rkSw bn 1Hy 1brm wylkw whw1 ySb bsdm and they took cover-lot, boner-abram's brother's child-between, who dwelt in splint-blood-sodom, and his goods, and departed. vayiqkhu lot ve’et rekhusho ben ’akhi ’abram vayelekhu, vehu yosheb bisdom.
wyb1 hplyT wygd l1brm h8bry whw1 Skn b1lny mmr1 h1mry 1Hy 1Skl w1Hy 8nr whm b8ly bryt 1brm and there came one that had escaped, and told boner-abram the cross-over-hebrew; for he dwelt in the plain of see-bitter-mamre the talker-amorite, brother of fire-all-eshcol, and brother of candle-aner: and these were confederate with boner-abram. vayabo hapalit vayaged le’abram ha‘ibri, vehu shokhen be’elonei mamrei ha’emori ’akhi ’eshkol va’akhi ‘aner vehem ba‘alei berit ’abram.
wySm8 1brm ky nSbh 1Hyw wyrq 1t Hnykyw ylydy bytw Smnh 8Sr wSlS m1wt wyrdp 8d dn and when boner-abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained workers, born in his own daughter-house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto discuss-dan. vayishma‘ ’abram ki nishbah ’akhiv, vayareq khanikhav yelidei beto shemonah ‘asar ushelosh me’ot vayirdof ‘ad dan.
wyHlq 8lyhm lylh hw1 w8bdyw wykm wyrdpm 8d Hwbh 1Sr mSm1l ldmSq and he divided himself against them, he and his workers, by night, and smote them, and pursued them unto obligation-hobah, which is on the left hand of blood-bag-damascus. vayekhaleq ‘alehem laylah hu va‘abadav vayakem, vayirdefem ‘ad khobah ’asher misemol ledamaseq.
wySb 1t kl hrkS wgm 1t lwT 1Hyw wrkSw hSyb wgm 1t hnSym w1t h8m and he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother cover-lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the with-mum-people. vayasheb kal harekhush, vegam lot ’akhiv urekhusho heshib vegam hanashim ve’et ha‘am.
wyZ1 mlk sdm lqr1tw 1Hry Swbw mhkwt 1t kdrl8mr w1t hmlkym 1Sr 1tw 1l 8mq Swh hw1 8mq hmlk and the moloch-king of splint-blood-sodom went out to until-witness him after his return from the slaughter of pot-sheave-chedorlaomer, and of the moloch-kings that were with him, at the valley of equal-shaveh, which is the moloch-king's dale. vayezei melekh sedom liqrato ’akharei shubo mehakot la‘omer ve’et hamelakhim ’asher ’ito, ’el ‘emeq shaveh hu ‘emeq hamelekh.
wmlky Zdq mlk Slm hwZy1 lHm wyyn whw1 khn l1l 8lywn and just-moloch-king-melchizedek moloch-king of peace-salem brought forth bread and wine-inherit: and he was the dimmer-server of the most high towards-these-elohim. umalki zedeq melekh shalem hozi lekhem vayayin, vehu khohen le’el ‘elyon.
wybrkhw wy1mr brwk 1brm l1l 8lywn qnh Smym w1rZ and he knee-fluffy-blessed him, and said, knee-fluffy-blessed be boner-abram of the most high towards-these-elohim, possessor of namespaces and earth: vaybarekhehu vayomar, barukh ’abram le’el ‘elyon qoneh shamayim va’arez.
wbrwk 1l 8lywn 1Sr mgn Zryk bydk wytn lw m8Sr mkl and knee-fluffy-blessed be the most high towards-these-elohim, which hath delivered thine father-adversaries into thy hand. and he gave him tithes of all. ubarukh ’el ‘elyon ’asher migen zarekha beyadekha, vayiten lo ma‘aser mikol.
wy1mr mlk sdm 1l 1brm tn ly hnpS whrkS qH lk and the moloch-king of splint-blood-sodom said unto boner-abram, give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself. vayomer melekh sedom ’el ’abram, ten li hanefesh veharekhush qakh lakh.
wy1mr 1brm 1l mlk sdm hrymty ydy 1l yhwh 1l 8lywn qnh Smym w1rZ and boner-abram said to the moloch-king of splint-blood-sodom, i have lift up mine hand unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, the most high towards-these-elohim, the possessor of namespaces and earth, vayomer ’abram ’el melekh sedom, harimoti yadi ’el yhvh ’el ‘elyon qoneh shamayim va’arez.
1m mHwT w8d Srwk n8l w1m 1qH mkl 1Sr lk wl1 t1mr 1ny h8Srty 1t 1brm that i will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that i will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, i have made boner-abram rich: ’im mikhut ve‘ad serokh na‘al ve’im ’eqakh mikal ’asher lakh, velo tomar ’ani he‘esharti ’abram.
bl8dy rq 1Sr 1klw hn8rym wHlq h1nSym 1Sr hlkw 1ty 8nr 1Skl wmmr1 hm yqHw Hlqm save only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men which went with me, candle-aner, fire-all-eshcol, and see-bitter-mamre; let them take their portion. bil‘aday raq ’asher ’akhelu hane‘arim vekheleq ha’anashim ’asher halekhu ’iti, ‘aner ’eshkol umamre hem yiqkhu khelqam.
1Hr hdbrym h1lh hyh dbr yhwh 1l 1brm bmHzh l1mr 1l tyr1 1brm 1nky mgn lk Skrk hrbh m1d after these things the bee-word of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou came unto boner-abram in a vision, saying, fear not, boner-abram: i am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward. ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh hayah debar yhvh ’el ’abram bamakhazeh lemor, ’al tira ’abram ’anokhi magen lakh sekharekha harbeh me’od.
wy1mr 1brm 1dny yhwh mh ttn ly w1nky hwlk 8ryry wbn mSq byty hw1 dmSq 1ly8zr and boner-abram said, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim, what wilt thou give me, seeing i go childless, and the steward of my daughter-house is this my-towards-helps-eliezer of blood-bag-damascus? vayomer ’abram ’adonay yhvh mah titen li ve’anokhi holekh ‘ariri, uben mesheq beti hu dameseq ’eli‘ezer.
wy1mr 1brm hn ly l1 ntth zr8 whnh bn byty ywrS 1ty and boner-abram said, behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my daughter-house is mine heir. vayomer ’abram hen li lo natatah zara‘, vehineh ben beti yoresh ’oti.
whnh dbr yhwh 1lyw l1mr l1 yyrSk zh ky 1m 1Sr yZ1 mm8yk hw1 yyrSk and, behold, the bee-word of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou came unto him, saying, this not be thine heir; and he that come forth out of thine own bowels be thine heir. vehineh debar yhvh ’elav lemor lo yirashekha zeh, ki ’im ’asher yezei mime‘ekha hu yirashekha.
wywZ1 1tw hHwZh wy1mr hbT n1 hSmymh wspr hkwkbym 1m twkl lspr 1tm wy1mr lw kh yhyh zr8k and he brought him forth abroad, and said, look now toward namespaces, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, so thy seed be. vayozei ’oto hakhuzah vayomer habet na hashamaymah usefor hakokhabim ’im tukhal lispor ’otam, vayomer lo koh yihyeh zar‘ekha.
wh1mn byhwh wyHSbh lw Zdqh and he was coached by yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou; and he counted it to him for being right. vehe’emin yhvh, vayakhshebeha lo zedaqah.
wy1mr 1lyw 1ny yhwh 1Sr hwZ1tyk m1wr kSdym ltt lk 1t h1rZ hz1t lrSth and he said unto him, i am yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou that brought thee out of light-ur of the as-genies-kasidim, to give thee this land to network it. vayomer ’elav, ’ani yhvh ’asher hozetikha me’ur kasdim latet lekha ha’arez hazot lerishtah.
wy1mr 1dny yhwh bmh 1d8 ky 1yrSnh and he said, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim, whereby i hand-know that i network it? vayomar, ’adonay yhvh bamah ’eda‘ ki ’irashenah.
wy1mr 1lyw qHh ly 8glh mSlSt w8z mSlSt w1yl mSlS wtr wgwzl and he said unto him, take me an heifer of three years old, and a she intense-goat of three years old, and a voiceless-ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon. vayomer ’elav qekhah li ‘eglah meshuleshet ve‘ez meshuleshet ve’ayil meshulash, vetor vegozal.
wyqH lw 1t kl 1lh wybtr 1tm btwk wytn 1yS btrw lqr1t r8hw w1t hZpr l1 btr and he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: and the birds divided he not. vayiqakh lo kal ’eleh vaybater ’otam batavekh vayiten ’ish bitro liqrat re‘ehu, ve’et hazipor lo batar.
wyrd h8yT 8l hpgrym wySb 1tm 1brm and when the fowls came down upon the carcasses, boner-abram drove them away. vayered ha‘ayit ‘al hapegarim, vayasheb ’otam ’abram.
wyhy hSmS lbw1 wtrdmh nplh 8l 1brm whnh 1ymh HSkh gdlh nplt 8lyw and when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon boner-abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him. vayhi hashemesh labo vetardemah nafelah ‘al ’abram, vehineh ’emah khashekhah gedolah nofelet ‘alav.
wy1mr l1brm yd8 td8 ky gr yhyh zr8k b1rZ l1 lhm w8bdwm w8nw 1tm 1rb8 m1wt Snh and he said unto boner-abram, hand-know of a surety that thy seed be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and work for them; and they afflict them four hundred years; vayomer le’abram yadoa‘ teda‘ ki ger yihyeh zar‘akha be’erez lo lahem va‘abadum ve‘inu ’otam, ’arba‘ me’ot shanah.
wgm 1t hgwy 1Sr y8bdw dn 1nky w1Hry kn yZ1w brkS gdwl and also that nation, whom they work for, will i decide: and afterward they come out with great substance. vegam hago ’asher ya‘abodu dan ’anokhi, ve’akhare khen yeze’u birkhush gadol.
w1th tbw1 1l 1btyk bSlwm tqbr bSybh Twbh and thou go to thy fathers in peace; thou be buried in a good old age. ve’atah tabo ’el ’abotekha beshalom, tiqaber besebah tobah.
wdwr rby8y ySwbw hnh ky l1 Slm 8wn h1mry 8d hnh and in the fourth generation they come hither again: for the torment of the talker-amorites is not yet full. vedor rebi‘i yashubu henah, ki lo shalem ‘avon ha’emori ‘ad henah.
wyhy hSmS b1h w8lTh hyh whnh tnwr 8Sn wlpyd 1S 1Sr 8br byn hgzrym h1lh and it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between-bin those pieces. vayhi hashemesh ba’ah va‘alatah hayah, vehineh tanur ‘ashan velapid ’esh ’asher ‘abar ben hagezarim ha’eleh.
bywm hhw1 krt yhwh 1t 1brm bryt l1mr lzr8k ntty 1t h1rZ hz1t mnhr mZrym 8d hnhr hgdl nhr prt in the same day yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou made a covenant with boner-abram, saying, unto thy seed have i given this land, from the river of narrows-mizraim unto the great river, the river cow-euphrates: bayom hahu karat yhvh ’et ’abram berit lemor, lezar‘akha natati ha’arez hazot minehar mizrayim ‘ad hanahar hagadol nehar perat.

wSry 1St 1brm l1 yldh lw wlh SpHh mZryt wSmh hgr now my-soakedness-sarai boner-abram's woman conceived-of him no children-betweens: and she had an handmaid, an narrows-mizraimian, whose name was migrate-hagar. vesaray ’eshet ’abram lo yaledah lo, velah shifkhah mizrit ushemah hagar.
wt1mr Sry 1l 1brm hnh n1 8Zrny yhwh mldt b1 n1 1l SpHty 1wly 1bnh mmnh wySm8 1brm lqwl Sry and my-soakedness-sarai said unto boner-abram, behold now, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath restrained me from bearing: i pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that i may obtain children-betweens by her. and boner-abram hearkened to the voice of my-soakedness-sarai. vatomer saray ’el ’abram hineh na ‘azarani yhvh miledet bo na ’el shifkhati ’ulay ’ibaneh mimenah, vayishma‘ ’abram leqol saray.
wtqH Sry 1St 1brm 1t hgr hmZryt SpHth mqZ 8Sr Snym lSbt 1brm b1rZ kn8n wttn 1th l1brm 1ySh lw l1Sh and my-soakedness-sarai boner-abram's woman took migrate-hagar her maid the narrows-mizraimian, after boner-abram had dwelt ten years in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, and gave her to her man boner-abram to be his woman. vatiqakh saray ’eshet ’abram hagar hamizrit shifkhatah miqez ‘eser shanim leshebet ’abram be’erez kena‘an, vatiten ’otah le’abram ’ishah lo le’ishah.
wyb1 1l hgr wthr wtr1 ky hrth wtql gbrth b8ynyh and he went in unto migrate-hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes. vayabo ’el hagar vatahar, vatere ki haratah vateqal gebirtah be‘eneha.
wt1mr Sry 1l 1brm Hmsy 8lyk 1nky ntty SpHty bHyqk wtr1 ky hrth w1ql b8ynyh ySpT yhwh byny wbynyk and my-soakedness-sarai said unto boner-abram, my wrong be upon thee: i have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, i was despised in her eyes: yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou decide between-bin me and thee. vatomer saray ’el ’abram khamasi ‘alekha ’anokhi natati shifkhati bekheqekha vatere ki haratah va’eqal be‘eneha, yishpot yhvh beni ubenekha
wy1mr 1brm 1l Sry hnh SpHtk bydk 8Sy lh hTwb b8ynyk wt8nh Sry wtbrH mpnyh and boner-abram said unto my-soakedness-sarai, behold, thy maid is in thine hand; do to her as it pleaseth thee. and when my-soakedness-sarai dealt hardly with her, she fled from her face-turns. vayomer ’abram ’el saray hineh shifkhatekh beyadekh ‘asi lah hatob be‘enayikh, vate‘aneha saray vatibrakh mipaneha.
wymZ1h ml1k yhwh 8l 8yn hmym bmdbr 8l h8yn bdrk Swr and the angel-messanger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou found her by a fountain of from-waters in the place-of-word-desert, by the fountain in the way to wall-shur. vayimza’ah mal’akh yhvh ‘al ‘en hamayim bamidbar, ‘al ha‘ayin bederekh shur.
wy1mr hgr SpHt Sry 1y mzh b1t w1nh tlky wt1mr mpny Sry gbrty 1nky brHt and he said, migrate-hagar, my-soakedness-sarai's maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? and she said, i flee from the face-turns of my mistress my-soakedness-sarai. vayomar hagar shifkhat saray ’e mizeh bat ve’anah telekhi, vatomer mipenei saray gebirti ’anokhi borakhat.

wy1mr lh ml1k yhwh hrbh 1rbh 1t zr8k wl1 yspr mrb and the angel-messanger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto her, i will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it not be numbered for multitude. vayomer lah mal’akh yhvh harbah ’arbeh zar‘ekh, velo yisafer merob.
wy1mr lh ml1k yhwh hnk hrh wyldt bn wqr1t Smw ySm81l ky Sm8 yhwh 1l 8nyk and the angel-messanger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto her, behold, thou art with child and bear a child-between, and call his name towards-hears-ishmael; because yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath heard thy affliction. vayomer lah mal’akh yhvh hinakh harah veyoladt ben, veqarat shemo yishma‘el ki shama‘ yhvh ’el ‘aneyekh.
whw1 yhyh pr1 1dm ydw bkl wyd kl bw w8l pny kl 1Hyw ySkn and he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him; and he dwell in the presence of all his brethren. vehu yihyeh pere ’adam yado bakol veyad kol bo, ve‘al penei khal ’ekhav yishkon.
wtqr1 Sm yhwh hdbr 1lyh 1th 1l r1y ky 1mrh hgm hlm r1yty 1Hry r1y and she called the name of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou that spake unto her, thou towards-these-elohim seest me: for she said, have i also here looked after him that seeth me? vatiqra shem yhvh hadober ’eleha ’atah ’el ro’i, ki ’amerah hagam halom ra’iti ’akharei ro’i.
8l kn qr1 lb1r b1r lHy r1y hnh byn qdS wbyn brd wherefore the well was called well-cheek-see-well-beerlahai-roi; behold, it is between-bin dedicated-finished-kadesh and hail-bered. ‘al ken qara labe’er be’er lakhay ro’i, hineh ben qadesh uben bared.
wtld hgr l1brm bn wyqr1 1brm Sm bnw 1Sr yldh hgr ySm81l and migrate-hagar conceived-of boner-abram a child-between: and boner-abram called his child-between's name, which migrate-hagar conceived-of, towards-hears-ishmael. vateled hagar le’abram ben, vayiqra ’abram shem beno ’asher yaledah hagar yishma‘el.
w1brm bn Smnym Snh wSS Snym bldt hgr 1t ySm81l l1brm and boner-abram was fourscore and six years old, when migrate-hagar conceived-of towards-hears-ishmael to boner-abram. ve’abram ben shemonim shanah veshesh shanim, beledet hagar yishma‘el le’abram.
wyhy 1brm bn tS8ym Snh wtS8 Snym wyr1 yhwh 1l 1brm wy1mr 1lyw 1ny 1l Sdy hthlk lpny whyh tmym and when boner-abram was ninety years old and nine, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou appeared to boner-abram, and said unto him, i am the almighty towards-these-elohim; walk before-turns me, and be thou perfect. vayhi ’abram ben tish‘im shanah vetesha‘ shanim, vayera yhvh ’el ’abram vayomer ’elav ’ani ’el shaday hithalekh lefanay vehyeh tamim.
w1tnh bryty byny wbynk w1rbh 1wtk bm1d m1d and i will make my covenant between-bin me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly. ve’etenah beriti beni ubenekha, ve’arbeh ’otkha bim’od me’od.
wypl 1brm 8l pnyw wydbr 1tw 1lhym l1mr and boner-abram fell on his face-turns: and towards-these-elohim talked with him, saying, vayipol ’abram ‘al panav, vaydaber ’ito ’elohim lemor.
1ny hnh bryty 1tk whyyt l1b hmwn gwym as for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou be a father of many nations. ’ani hineh beriti ’itakh, vehayita le’ab hamon goyim.
wl1 yqr1 8wd 1t Smk 1brm whyh Smk 1brhm ky 1b hmwn gwym nttyk neither thy name any more be called boner-abram, and thy name be their-dick-abraham; for a father of many nations have i made thee. velo yiqarei ‘od shimkha ’abram, vehayah shimkha ’abraham ki ’ab hamon goyim netatikha.
whprty 1tk bm1d m1d wnttyk lgwym wmlkym mmk yZ1w and i will make thee exceeding fruitful, and i will make nations of thee, and moloch-kings come out of thee. vehifreti ’otekha bim’od me’od unetatikha legoyim, umelakhim mimekha yeze’u.
whqmty 1t bryty byny wbynk wbyn zr8k 1Hryk ldrtm lbryt 8wlm lhywt lk l1lhym wlzr8k 1Hryk and i will establish my covenant between-bin me and thee and thy seed after thee in their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a towards-these-elohim unto thee, and to thy seed after thee. vahaqimoti beriti beni ubenekha uben zar‘akha ’akharekha ledorotam librit ‘olam, lihyot lekha lelohim ulezar‘akha ’akharekha.
wntty lk wlzr8k 1Hryk 1t 1rZ mgryk 1t kl 1rZ kn8n l1Hzt 8wlm whyyty lhm l1lhym and i will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land wherein thou art a stranger, all the land of mobile-trade-canaan, for an everlasting possession; and i will be their towards-these-elohim. venatati lekha ulezar‘akha ’akharekha ’erez megurekha kal ’erez kena‘an la’akhuzat ‘olam, vehayiti lahem lelohim.
wy1mr 1lhym 1l 1brhm w1th 1t bryty tSmr 1th wzr8k 1Hryk ldrtm and towards-these-elohim said unto their-dick-abraham, thou keep my covenant therefore, thou, and thy seed after thee in their generations. vayomer ’elohim ’el ’abraham ve’atah beriti tishmor, ’atah vezar‘akha ’akharekha ledorotam.
z1t bryty 1Sr tSmrw byny wbynykm wbyn zr8k 1Hryk hmwl lkm kl zkr this is my covenant, which ye keep, between-bin me and you and thy seed after thee; every man child among you be scribe-circumcised. zot beriti ’asher tishmeru beni ubenekhem uben zar‘akha ’akharekha, himol lakhem kal zakhar.
wnmltm 1t bSr 8rltkm whyh l1wt bryt byny wbynykm and ye scribe-circumcise the flesh of your foreskin; and it be a token of the covenant betwixt-bin me and you. unemaltem besar ‘arelatkhem, vehayah le’ot berit beni ubenekhem.
wbn Smnt ymym ymwl lkm kl zkr ldrtykm ylyd byt wmqnt ksp mkl bn nkr 1Sr l1 mzr8k hw1 and he that is eight days old be scribe-circumcised among you, every man child in your generations, he that is born in the daughter-house, or bought with money of any stranger, which is not of thy seed. uben shemonat yamim yimol lakhem kal zakhar ledorotekhem, yelid bayit umiqnat kesef mikol ben nekhar ’asher lo mizar‘akha hu.
hmwl ymwl ylyd bytk wmqnt kspk whyth bryty bbSrkm lbryt 8wlm he that is born in thy daughter-house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be scribe-circumcised: and my covenant be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant. himol yimol yelid betekha umiqnat kaspekha, vehayetah beriti bibsarkhem librit ‘olam.
w8rl zkr 1Sr l1 ymwl 1t bSr 8rltw wnkrth hnpS hhw1 m8myh 1t bryty hpr and the foreskinned man child whose flesh of his foreskin is not scribe-circumcised, that being be cut off from his with-mum-people; he hath broken my covenant. ve‘arel zakhar ’asher lo yimol besar ‘arelato venikhretah hanefesh hahiv me‘ameha, beriti hefar.
wy1mr 1lhym 1l 1brhm Sry 1Stk l1 tqr1 1t Smh Sry ky Srh Smh and towards-these-elohim said unto their-dick-abraham, as for my-soakedness-sarai thy woman, no call her name my-soakedness-sarai, and her-soakedness-sarah her name be. vayomer ’elohim ’el ’abraham saray ’ishtekha lo tiqra shemah saray, ki sarah shemah.
wbrkty 1th wgm ntty mmnh lk bn wbrktyh whyth lgwym mlky 8mym mmnh yhyw and i will knee-fluffy-bless her, and give thee a child-between also of her: yea, i will knee-fluffy-bless her, and she be a mother of nations; moloch-kings of with-mum-people be of her. uberakhti ’otah vegam natati mimenah lekha ben, uberakhtiha vehayetah legoyim malkhei ‘amim mimenah yihyu.
wypl 1brhm 8l pnyw wyZHq wy1mr blbw hlbn m1h Snh ywld w1m Srh hbt tS8ym Snh tld then their-dick-abraham fell upon his face-turns, and laughed, and said in his heart, a child be born unto him that is an hundred years old? and her-soakedness-sarah, that is ninety years old, bear? vayipol ’abraham ‘al panav vayizkhaq, vayomer belibo haleben me’ah shanah yivaled ve’im sarah habat tish‘im shanah teled.
wy1mr 1brhm 1l h1lhym lw ySm81l yHyh lpnyk and their-dick-abraham said unto towards-these-elohim, o that towards-hears-ishmael might live before-turns thee! vayomer ’abraham ’el ha’elohim, lu yishma‘el yikhyeh lefanekha.
wy1mr 1lhym 1bl Srh 1Stk yldt lk bn wqr1t 1t Smw yZHq whqmty 1t bryty 1tw lbryt 8wlm lzr8w 1Hryw and towards-these-elohim said, her-soakedness-sarah thy woman bear thee a child-between indeed; and thou call his name laughter-isaac: and i will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him. vayomer ’elohim ’abal sarah ’ishtekha yoledet lekha ben veqarata shemo yizkhaq, vahaqimoti beriti ’ito librit ‘olam lezar‘o ’akharav.
wlySm81l Sm8tyk hnh brkty 1tw whpryty 1tw whrbyty 1tw bm1d m1d Snym 8Sr nSy1m ywlyd wnttyw lgwy gdwl and as for towards-hears-ishmael, i have heard thee: behold, i have knee-fluffy-blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes he beget, and i will make him a great nation. uleyishma‘el shema‘tikha hineh berakhti ’oto vehifreti ’oto vehirbeti ’oto bim’od me’od, shenem ‘asar nesi’im yolid unetativ lego gadol.
w1t bryty 1qym 1t yZHq 1Sr tld lk Srh lmw8d hzh bSnh h1Hrt and my covenant will i establish with laughter-isaac, which her-soakedness-sarah bear unto thee at this set time in the next year. ve’et beriti ’aqim ’et yizkhaq, ’asher teled lekha sarah lamo‘ed hazeh bashanah ha’akheret.
wykl ldbr 1tw wy8l 1lhym m8l 1brhm and he left off talking with him, and towards-these-elohim went up from their-dick-abraham. vaykhal ledaber ’ito, vaya‘al ’elohim me‘al ’abraham.
wyqH 1brhm 1t ySm81l bnw w1t kl ylydy bytw w1t kl mqnt kspw kl zkr b1nSy byt 1brhm wyml 1t bSr 8rltm b8Zm hywm hzh k1Sr dbr 1tw 1lhym and their-dick-abraham took towards-hears-ishmael his child-between, and all that were born in his daughter-house, and all that were bought with his money, every rememberer among the men of their-dick-abraham's daughter-house; and scribe-circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day, as towards-these-elohim had said unto him. vayiqakh ’abraham yishma‘el beno ve’et kal yelidei beto ve’et kal miqnat kaspo kal zakhar be’anshei bet ’abraham, vayamal besar ‘arelatam be‘ezem hayom hazeh ka’asher diber ’ito ’elohim.
w1brhm bn tS8ym wtS8 Snh bhmlw bSr 8rltw and their-dick-abraham was ninety years old and nine, when he was scribe-circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. ve’abraham ben tish‘im vatesha‘ shanah, behimolo besar ‘arelato.
wySm81l bnw bn SlS 8Srh Snh bhmlw 1t bSr 8rltw and towards-hears-ishmael his child-between was thirteen years old, when he was scribe-circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. veyishma‘el beno ben shelosh ‘esreh shanah, behimolo besar ‘arelato.
b8Zm hywm hzh nmwl 1brhm wySm81l bnw in the selfsame day was their-dick-abraham scribe-circumcised, and towards-hears-ishmael his child-between. be‘ezem hayom hazeh nimol ’abraham, veyishma‘el beno.
wkl 1nSy bytw ylyd byt wmqnt ksp m1t bn nkr nmlw 1tw and all the men of his daughter-house, born in the daughter-house, and bought with money of the stranger, were scribe-circumcised with him. vekhal ’anshei beto yelid bayit umiqnat kesef me’et ben nekhar, nimolu ’ito.
wyr1 1lyw yhwh b1lny mmr1 whw1 ySb ptH h1hl kHm hywm and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou appeared unto him in the plains of see-bitter-mamre: and he sat in the tent opening in the heat of the day; vayera ’elav yhvh be’elonei mamre, vehu yosheb petakh ha’ohel kekhom hayom.
wyS1 8ynyw wyr1 whnh SlSh 1nSym nZbym 8lyw wyr1 wyrZ lqr1tm mptH h1hl wyStHw 1rZh and he lift up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood by him: and when he saw them, he ran to until-witness them from the tent opening, and bowed himself toward the ground, vayisa ‘enav vayar vehineh sheloshah ’anashim nizabim ‘alav, vayar vayaraz liqratam mipetakh ha’ohel vayishtakhu ’arezah.
wy1mr 1dny 1m n1 mZ1ty Hn b8ynyk 1l n1 t8br m8l 8bdk and said, my yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, if now i have found favor in thy sight, pass not away, i pray thee, from thy worker: vayomar, ’adonay ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha ’al na ta‘abor me‘al ‘abdekha.
yqH n1 m8T mym wrHZw rglykm whS8nw tHt h8Z let a little from-waters, i pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree: yuqakh na me‘at mayim verakhazu raglekhem, vehisha‘anu takhat ha‘ez.
w1qHh pt lHm ws8dw lbkm 1Hr t8brw ky 8l kn 8brtm 8l 8bdkm wy1mrw kn t8Sh k1Sr dbrt and i will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; after that ye pass on: for therefore are ye come to your worker. and they said, so do, as thou hast said. ve’eqkhah fat lekhem vesa‘adu libekhem ’akhar ta‘aboru ki ‘al ken ‘abartem ‘al ‘abdekhem, vayomeru ken ta‘aseh ka’asher dibarta.
wymhr 1brhm h1hlh 1l Srh wy1mr mhry SlS s1ym qmH slt lwSy w8Sy 8gwt and their-dick-abraham hastened into the tent unto her-soakedness-sarah, and said, make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the hearth. vaymaher ’abraham ha’ohelah ’el sarah, vayomer mahari shelosh se’im qemakh solet lushi va‘asi ‘ugot.
w1l hbqr rZ 1brhm wyqH bn bqr rk wTwb wytn 1l hn8r wymhr l8Swt 1tw and their-dick-abraham ran unto the visit-cattle, and fetched a calf tender and good, and gave it unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it. ve’el habaqar raz ’abraham, vayiqakh ben baqar rakh vatob vayiten ’el hana‘ar vaymaher la‘asot ’oto.
wyqH Hm1h wHlb wbn hbqr 1Sr 8Sh wytn lpnyhm whw1 8md 8lyhm tHt h8Z wy1klw and he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before-turns them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did eat. vayiqakh khem’ah vekhalab uben habaqar ’asher ‘asah vayiten lifnehem, vehu ‘omed ‘alehem takhat ha‘ez vayokhelu.
wy1mrw 1lyw 1yh Srh 1Stk wy1mr hnh b1hl and they said unto him, where is her-soakedness-sarah thy woman? and he said, behold, in the tent. vayomeru ’elav ’ayeh sarah ’ishtekha, vayomer hineh ba’ohel.
wy1mr Swb 1Swb 1lyk k8t Hyh whnh bn lSrh 1Stk wSrh Sm8t ptH h1hl whw1 1Hryw and he said, i will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life; and, lo, her-soakedness-sarah thy woman have a child-between. and her-soakedness-sarah heard it in the tent opening, which was behind him. vayomer shob ’ashub ’elekha ka‘et khayah vehineh ben lesarah ’ishtekha, vesarah shoma‘at petakh ha’ohel vehu ’akharav.
w1brhm wSrh zqnym b1ym bymym Hdl lhywt lSrh 1rH knSym now their-dick-abraham and her-soakedness-sarah were old and well stricken in age; and it ceased to be with her-soakedness-sarah after the manner of women. ve’abraham vesarah zeqenim ba’im bayamim, khadal lihyot lesarah ’orakh kanashim.
wtZHq Srh bqrbh l1mr 1Hry blty hyth ly 8dnh w1dny zqn therefore her-soakedness-sarah laughed within herself, saying, after i am waxed old i have pleasure, my lord-base being old also? vatizkhaq sarah beqirbah lemor, ’akharei beloti hayetah li ‘ednah vadoni zaqen.
wy1mr yhwh 1l 1brhm lmh zh ZHqh Srh l1mr h1p 1mnm 1ld w1ny zqnty and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto their-dick-abraham, wherefore did her-soakedness-sarah laugh, saying, i of a surety bear a child, which am old? vayomer yhvh ’el ’abraham, lamah zeh zakhaqah sarah lemor ha’af ’umnam ’eled va’ani zaqanti.
hypl1 myhwh dbr lmw8d 1Swb 1lyk k8t Hyh wlSrh bn is any thing too hard for yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou? at the time appointed i will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and her-soakedness-sarah have a child-between. hayipalei yhvh dabar, lamo‘ed ’ashub ’elekha ka‘et khayah ulesarah ben.
wtkHS Srh l1mr l1 ZHqty ky yr1h wy1mr l1 ky ZHqt then her-soakedness-sarah denied, saying, i laughed not; for she was afraid. and he said, nay; and thou didst laugh. vatekhakhesh sarah lemor lo zakhaqti ki yare’ah, vayomer lo ki zakhaqet.
wyqmw mSm h1nSym wySqpw 8l pny sdm w1brhm hlk 8mm lSlHm and the men rose up from thence, and looked toward splint-blood-sodom: and their-dick-abraham went with them to bring them on the way. vayaqumu misham ha’anashim vayashqifu penei sedom, ve’abraham holekh ‘imam leshalekham.
wyhwh 1mr hmksh 1ny m1brhm 1Sr 1ny 8Sh and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said, i hide from their-dick-abraham that thing which i do; yhvh ’amar, hamkhaseh ’ani me’abraham ’asher ’ani ‘oseh.
w1brhm hyw yhyh lgwy gdwl w8Zwm wnbrkw bw kl gwyy h1rZ seeing that their-dick-abraham surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed in him? ve’abraham hayo yihyeh lego gadol ve‘azum, venibrekhu bo kol goyei ha’arez.
ky yd8tyw lm8n 1Sr yZwh 1t bnyw w1t bytw 1Hryw wSmrw drk yhwh l8Swt Zdqh wmSpT lm8n hby1 yhwh 8l 1brhm 1t 1Sr dbr 8lyw for i hand-know him, that he will order-prescribe his children-betweens and his daughter-household after him, and they keep the way of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, to do being right and decision-grammar; that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou may bring upon their-dick-abraham that which he hath bee-spoken of him. ki yeda‘tiv lema‘an ’asher yezaveh banav ve’et beto ’akharav veshameru derekh yhvh la‘asot zedaqah umishpat, lema‘an habi yhvh ‘al ’abraham ’asher diber ‘alav.
wy1mr yhwh z8qt sdm w8mrh ky rbh wHT1tm ky kbdh m1d and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said, because the cry of splint-blood-sodom and sheaves-gomorrah is great, and because their miss is very grievous; vayomer yhvh za‘aqat sedom va‘amorah ki rabah, vekhatatam ki khabedah me’od.
1rdh n1 w1r1h hkZ8qth hb1h 1ly 8Sw klh w1m l1 1d8h i will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, i will hand-know. ’eradah na ve’er’eh hakeza‘aqatah haba’ah ’elay ‘asu kalah, ve’im lo ’eda‘ah.
wypnw mSm h1nSym wylkw sdmh w1brhm 8wdnw 8md lpny yhwh and the men turned their face-turns-turns from thence, and went toward splint-blood-sodom: and their-dick-abraham stood yet before-turns yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. vayifnu misham ha’anashim vayelekhu sedomah, ve’abraham ‘odenu ‘omed lifnei yhvh.
wygS 1brhm wy1mr h1p tsph Zdyq 8m rS8 and their-dick-abraham drew near, and said, wilt thou also destroy the just with the wicked? vayigash ’abraham vayomar, ha’af tispeh zadiq ‘im rasha‘.
1wly yS HmSym Zdyqm btwk h8yr h1p tsph wl1 tS1 lmqwm lm8n HmSym hZdyqm 1Sr bqrbh peradventure there be fifty just within the light-city: wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty just that are therein? ’ulay yesh khamishim zadiqim betokh ha‘ir, ha’af tispeh velo tisa lamaqom lema‘an khamishim hazadiqim ’asher beqirbah.
Hllh lk m8St kdbr hzh lhmyt Zdyq 8m rS8 whyh kZdyq krS8 Hllh lk hSpT kl h1rZ l1 y8Sh mSpT that be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the just with the wicked: and that the just should be as the wicked, that be far from thee: not the decide of all the earth do right? khalilah lekha me‘asot kadabar hazeh lehamit zadiq ‘im rasha‘ vehayah khazadiq karasha‘, khalilah lakh hashofet kal ha’arez lo ya‘aseh mishpat.
wy1mr yhwh 1m 1mZ1 bsdm HmSym Zdyqm btwk h8yr wnS1ty lkl hmqwm b8bwrm and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said, if i find in splint-blood-sodom fifty just within the light-city, then i will spare all the place for their sakes. vayomer yhvh ’im ’emza bisdom khamishim zadiqim betokh ha‘ir, venasati lekhal hamaqom ba‘aburam.
wy8n 1brhm wy1mr hnh n1 hw1lty ldbr 1l 1dny w1nky 8pr w1pr and their-dick-abraham answered and said, behold now, i have taken upon me to speak unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, which am and dust and ashes: vaya‘an ’abraham vayomar, hineh na ho’alti ledaber ’el ’adonay ve’anokhi ‘afar va’efer.
1wly yHsrwn HmSym hZdyqm HmSh htSHyt bHmSh 1t kl h8yr wy1mr l1 1SHyt 1m 1mZ1 Sm 1rb8ym wHmSh peradventure there lack five of the fifty just: wilt thou destroy all the light-city for lack of five? and he said, if i find there forty and five, i will not destroy it. ’ulay yakhserun khamishim hazadiqim khamishah hatashkhit bakhamishah kal ha‘ir, vayomer lo ’ashkhit ’im ’emza sham ’arba‘im vakhamishah.
wysp 8wd ldbr 1lyw wy1mr 1wly ymZ1wn Sm 1rb8ym wy1mr l1 18Sh b8bwr h1rb8ym and he spake unto him yet again, and said, peradventure there be forty found there. and he said, i will not do it for forty's sake. vayosef ‘od ledaber ’elav vayomar ’ulay yimaze’un sham ’arba‘im, vayomer lo ’e‘eseh ba‘abur ha’arba‘im.
wy1mr 1l n1 yHr l1dny w1dbrh 1wly ymZ1wn Sm SlSym wy1mr l1 18Sh 1m 1mZ1 Sm SlSym and he said unto him, oh let not yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou be angry, and i will speak: peradventure there thirty be found there. and he said, i will not do it, if i find thirty there. vayomer ’al na yikhar ladonay va’adaberah ’ulay yimaze’un sham sheloshim, vayomer lo ’e‘eseh ’im ’emza sham sheloshim.
wy1mr hnh n1 hw1lty ldbr 1l 1dny 1wly ymZ1wn Sm 8Srym wy1mr l1 1SHyt b8bwr h8Srym and he said, behold now, i have taken upon me to speak unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou: peradventure there be double-ten-twenty found there. and he said, i will not destroy it for double-ten-twenty's sake. vayomer hineh na ho’alti ledaber ’el ’adonay ’ulay yimaze’un sham ‘esrim, vayomer lo ’ashkhit ba‘abur ha‘esrim.
wy1mr 1l n1 yHr l1dny w1dbrh 1k hp8m 1wly ymZ1wn Sm 8Srh wy1mr l1 1SHyt b8bwr h8Srh and he said, oh let not yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou be angry, and i will speak yet and this once: peradventure ten be found there. and he said, i will not destroy it for ten's sake. vayomer ’al na yikhar ladonay va’adaberah ’akh hapa‘am ’ulay yimaze’un sham ‘asarah, vayomer lo ’ashkhit ba‘abur ha‘asarah.
wylk yhwh k1Sr klh ldbr 1l 1brhm w1brhm Sb lmqmw and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou went his way, as soon as he had left communing with their-dick-abraham: and their-dick-abraham returned unto his place. vayelekh yhvh ka’asher kilah ledaber ’el ’abraham, ve’abraham shab limqomo.
wyb1w Sny hml1kym sdmh b8rb wlwT ySb bS8r sdm wyr1 lwT wyqm lqr1tm wyStHw 1pym 1rZh and there came two angel-messangers to splint-blood-sodom at even; and cover-lot sat in the hair-gate of splint-blood-sodom: and cover-lot seeing them rose up to until-witness them; and he bowed himself with his face-turns toward the ground; vayabo’u shenei hamal’akhim sedomah ba‘ereb velot yosheb besha‘ar sedom, vayar lot vayaqam liqratam vayishtakhu ’apayim ’arezah.
wy1mr hnh n1 1dny swrw n1 1l byt 8bdkm wlynw wrHZw rglykm whSkmtm whlktm ldrkkm wy1mrw l1 ky brHwb nlyn and he said, behold now, my lord-bases, turn in, i pray you, into your worker's daughter-house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye rise up early, and go on your ways. and they said, nay; and we will abide in the street all night. vayomer hineh na ’adonay suru na ’el bet ‘abdekhem velinu verakhazu raglekhem vehishkamtem vahalakhtem ledarkekhem, vayomeru lo ki barekhob nalin.
wypZr bm m1d wysrw 1lyw wyb1w 1l bytw wy8S lhm mSth wmZwt 1ph wy1klw and he pressed upon them greatly; and they turned in unto him, and entered into his daughter-house; and he made them a until-conception, and did bake lit-mazat, and they did eat. vayifzar bam me’od vayasuru ’elav vayabo’u ’el beto, vaya‘as lahem mishteh umazot ’afah vayokhelu.
Trm ySkbw w1nSy h8yr 1nSy sdm nsbw 8l hbyt mn8r w8d zqn kl h8m mqZh and before-turns they lay down, the men of the light-city, even the men of splint-blood-sodom, compassed the daughter-house round, both old and young, all the with-mum-people from every quarter: terem yishkabu ve’anshei ha‘ir ’anshei sedom nasabu ‘al habayit mina‘ar ve‘ad zaqen, kal ha‘am miqazeh.
wyqr1w 1l lwT wy1mrw lw 1yh h1nSym 1Sr b1w 1lyk hlylh hwZy1m 1lynw wnd8h 1tm and they called unto cover-lot, and said unto him, where are the men which came in to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may hand-know them. vayiqre’u ’el lot vayomeru lo ’ayeh ha’anashim ’asher ba’u ’elekha halayelah, hozi’em ’elenu venede‘ah ’otam.
wyZ1 1lhm lwT hptHh whdlt sgr 1Hryw and cover-lot went out at the opening unto them, and shut the opening after him, vayezei ’alehem lot hapetkhah, vehadelet sagar ’akharav.
wy1mr 1l n1 1Hy tr8w and said, i pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly. vayomar, ’al na ’akhay tare‘u.
hnh n1 ly Sty bnwt 1Sr l1 yd8w 1yS 1wZy1h n1 1thn 1lykm w8Sw lhn kTwb b8ynykm rq l1nSym h1l 1l t8Sw dbr ky 8l kn b1w bZl qrty behold now, i have two pierced children-betweens-bin which have not hand-known man; let me, i pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof. hineh na li shetei banot ’asher lo yade‘u ’ish ’ozi’ah na ’ethen ’alekhem va‘asu lahen katob be‘enekhem, raq la’anashim ha’el ’al ta‘asu dabar ki ‘al ken ba’u bezel qorati.
wy1mrw gS hl1h wy1mrw h1Hd b1 lgwr wySpT SpwT 8th nr8 lk mhm wypZrw b1yS blwT m1d wygSw lSbr hdlt and they said, stand back. and they said again, this one fellow came in to sojourn, and he will needs be a decide: now will we deal worse with thee, than with them. and they pressed sore upon the man, even cover-lot, and came near to break the opening. vayomeru gesh hale’ah vayomeru ha’ekhad ba lagur vayishpot shafot ‘atah nara‘ lekha mehem, vayifzeru ba’ish belot me’od vayigeshu lishbor hadalet.
wySlHw h1nSym 1t ydm wyby1w 1t lwT 1lyhm hbyth w1t hdlt sgrw and the men put forth their hand, and pulled cover-lot into the daughter-house to them, and shut to the opening. vayishlekhu ha’anashim yadam vayabi’u lot ’alehem habayetah, ve’et hadelet sagaru.
w1t h1nSym 1Sr ptH hbyt hkw bsnwrym mqTn w8d gdwl wyl1w lmZ1 hptH and they smote the men that were at the opening of the daughter-house with blindness, both small and great: so that they wearied themselves to find the opening. ve’et ha’anashim ’asher petakh habayit hiku basanverim miqaton ve‘ad gadol, vayil’u limzo hapatakh.
wy1mrw h1nSym 1l lwT 8d my lk ph Htn wbnyk wbntyk wkl 1Sr lk b8yr hwZ1 mn hmqwm and the men said unto cover-lot, hast thou here any besides? child-between in teaching, and thy children-betweens, and thy children-betweenesss, and whatsoever thou hast in the light-city, bring them out of this place: vayomeru ha’anashim ’el lot ‘od mi lekha foh khatan ubanekha ubenotekha vekhol ’asher lekha ba‘ir, hozei min hamaqom.
ky mSHtym 1nHnw 1t hmqwm hzh ky gdlh Z8qtm 1t pny yhwh wySlHnw yhwh lSHth for we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxen great before-turns the face-turns of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou; and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath sent us to destroy it. ki mashkhitim ’anakhnu hamaqom hazeh, ki gadelah za‘aqatam ’et penei yhvh vayshalekhenu yhvh leshakhatah.
wyZ1 lwT wydbr 1l Htnyw lqHy bntyw wy1mr qwmw Z1w mn hmqwm hzh ky mSHyt yhwh 1t h8yr wyhy kmZHq b8yny Htnyw and cover-lot went out, and spake unto his children-betweens-in-teaching, which married his children-betweenesss, and said, up, get you out of this place; for yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou will destroy this light-city. and he seemed as one that mocked unto his children-betweens-in-teaching. vayezei lot vaydaber ’el khatanav loqekhei benotav vayomer qumu ze’u min hamaqom hazeh ki mashkhit yhvh ha‘ir, vayhi khimzakheq be‘enei khatanav.
wkmw hSHr 8lh wy1yZw hml1kym blwT l1mr qwm qH 1t 1Stk w1t Sty bntyk hnmZ1t pn tsph b8wn h8yr and when the morning arose, then the angel-messangers hastened cover-lot, saying, arise, take thy woman, and thy two children-betweenesss, which are here; lest thou be consumed in the torment of the light-city. ukhemo hashakhar ‘alah vaya’izu hamal’akhim belot lemor, qum qakh ’ishtekha ve’et shetei benotekha hanimza’ot pen tisafeh ba‘avon ha‘ir.
wytmhmh wyHzqw h1nSym bydw wbyd 1Stw wbyd Sty bntyw bHmlt yhwh 8lyw wyZ1hw wynHhw mHwZ l8yr and while he lingered, the men laid hold upon his hand, and upon the hand of his woman, and upon the hand of his two children-betweenesss; yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou being merciful unto him: and they brought him forth, and set him without the light-city. vayitmahmah vayakhaziqu ha’anashim beyado ubeyad ’ishto ubeyad shetei benotav bekhemlat yhvh ‘alav, vayozi’uhu vayanikhuhu mikhuz la‘ir.
wyhy khwZy1m 1tm hHwZh wy1mr hmlT 8l npSk 1l tbyT 1Hryk w1l t8md bkl hkkr hhrh hmlT pn tsph and it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that he said, escape for thy life; look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be consumed. vayhi khehozi’am ’otam hakhuzah vayomer himalet ‘al nafshekha ’al tabit ’akharekha ve’al ta‘amod bekhal hakikar, haharah himalet pen tisafeh.
wy1mr lwT 1lhm 1l n1 1dny and cover-lot said unto them, oh, not so, my lord-base: vayomer lot ’alehem, ’al na ’adonay.
hnh n1 mZ1 8bdk Hn b8ynyk wtgdl Hsdk 1Sr 8Syt 8mdy lhHywt 1t npSy w1nky l1 1wkl lhmlT hhrh pn tdbqny hr8h wmty behold now, thy worker hath found attractiveness in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast showed unto me in saving my life; and i cannot escape to the mountain, lest some bad take me, and i die: hineh na maza ‘abdekha khen be‘enekha vatagdel khasdekha ’asher ‘asita ‘imadi lehakhayot nafshi, ve’anokhi lo ’ukhal lehimalet haharah pen tidbaqani hara‘ah vamati.
hnh n1 h8yr hz1t qrbh lnws Smh why1 mZ8r 1mlTh n1 Smh hl1 mZ8r hw1 wtHy npSy behold now, this light-city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one: oh, let me escape thither, (is it not a little one?) and my being live. hineh na ha‘ir hazot qerobah lanus shamah vehi miz‘ar, ’imaletah na shamah halo miz‘ar hi utekhi nafshi.
wy1mr 1lyw hnh nS1ty pnyk gm ldbr hzh lblty hpky 1t h8yr 1Sr dbrt and he said unto him, see, i have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that i will not overthrow this light-city, for the which thou hast bee-spoken. vayomer ’elav hineh nasati fanekha gam ladabar hazeh, lebilti hafeki ha‘ir ’asher dibarta.
mhr hmlT Smh ky l1 1wkl l8Swt dbr 8d b1k Smh 8l kn qr1 Sm h8yr Zw8r haste thee, escape thither; for i cannot do anything till thou be come thither. therefore the name of the light-city was called grief-zoar. maher himalet shamah ki lo ’ukhal la‘asot dabar ‘ad bo’akha shamah, ‘al ken qara shem ha‘ir zo‘ar.
hSmS yZ1 8l h1rZ wlwT b1 Z8rh the sun was risen upon the earth when cover-lot entered into grief-zoar. hashemesh yaza ‘al ha’arez, velot ba zo‘arah.
wyhwh hmTyr 8l sdm w8l 8mrh gpryt w1S m1t yhwh mn hSmym then yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou rained upon splint-blood-sodom and upon sheaves-gomorrah brimstone and fire from yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou out of namespaces; yhvh himtir ‘al sedom ve‘al ‘amorah gaferit va’esh, me’et yhvh min hashamayim.
wyhpk 1t h8rym h1l w1t kl hkkr w1t kl ySby h8rym wZmH h1dmh and he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground. vayahafokh he‘arim ha’el ve’et kal hakikar, ve’et kal yoshebei he‘arim vezemakh ha’adamah.
wtbT 1Stw m1Hryw wthy nZyb mlH and his woman looked back from behind him, and she became a page-column-erection of salt. vatabet ’ishto me’akharav, vatehi nezib melakh.
wySkm 1brhm bbqr 1l hmqwm 1Sr 8md Sm 1t pny yhwh and their-dick-abraham gat up early in the morning to the place where he stood before-turns yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou: vayashkem ’abraham baboqer, ’el hamaqom ’asher ‘amad penei yhvh.
wySqp 8l pny sdm w8mrh w8l kl pny 1rZ hkkr wyr1 whnh 8lh qyTr h1rZ kqyTr hkbSn and he looked toward splint-blood-sodom and sheaves-gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain, and beheld, and, lo, the smoke of the country went up as the smoke of a furnace. vayashqef ‘al penei sedom va‘amorah ve‘al kal ’erez hakikar, vayar vehineh ‘alah qitor ha’arez keqitor hakibshan.
wyhy bSHt 1lhym 1t 8ry hkkr wyzkr 1lhym 1t 1brhm wySlH 1t lwT mtwk hhpkh bhpk 1t h8rym 1Sr ySb bhn lwT and it came to pass, when towards-these-elohim destroyed the cities of the plain, that towards-these-elohim remembered their-dick-abraham, and sent cover-lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in the which cover-lot dwelt. vayhi beshakhet ’elohim ‘arei hakikar vayizkor ’elohim ’abraham, vayshalakh lot mitokh hahafekhah bahafokh he‘arim ’asher yashab bahen lot.
wy8l lwT mZw8r wySb bhr wSty bntyw 8mw ky yr1 lSbt bZw8r wySb bm8rh hw1 wSty bntyw and cover-lot went up out of grief-zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two children-betweenesss with him; for he feared to dwell in grief-zoar: and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two children-betweenesss. vaya‘al lot mizo‘ar vayesheb bahar ushetei benotav ‘imo ki yarei lashebet bezo‘ar, vayesheb bame‘arah hu ushetei benotav.
wt1mr hbkyrh 1l hZ8yrh 1bynw zqn w1yS 1yn b1rZ lbw1 8lynw kdrk kl h1rZ and the firstborn said unto the younger, our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth: vatomer habekhirah ’el haze‘irah ’abinu zaqen, ve’ish ’en ba’arez labo ‘alenu kederekh kal ha’arez.
lkh nSqh 1t 1bynw yyn wnSkbh 8mw wnHyh m1bynw zr8 come, let us make our father drink wine-inherit, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father. lekhah nashqeh ’abinu yayin venishkebah ‘imo, unekhayeh me’abinu zara‘.
wtSqyn 1t 1byhn yyn blylh hw1 wtb1 hbkyrh wtSkb 1t 1byh wl1 yd8 bSkbh wbqwmh and they made their father drink wine-inherit that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose. vatashqena ’abihen yayin balaylah hu, vatabo habekhirah vatishkab ’et ’abiha velo yada‘ beshikhbah ubequmah
wyhy mmHrt wt1mr hbkyrh 1l hZ8yrh hn Skbty 1mS 1t 1by nSqnw yyn gm hlylh wb1y Skby 8mw wnHyh m1bynw zr8 and it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, behold, i lay yesternight with my father: let us make him drink wine-inherit this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father. vayhi mimakhorat vatomer habekhirah ’el haze‘irah hen shakhabti ’emesh ’et ’abi, nashqenu yayin gam halaylah ubo’i shikhbi ‘imo unekhayeh me’abinu zara‘.
wtSqyn gm blylh hhw1 1t 1byhn yyn wtqm hZ8yrh wtSkb 8mw wl1 yd8 bSkbh wbqmh and they made their father drink wine-inherit that night also: and the younger arose, and lay with him; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose. vatashqena gam balaylah hahu ’abihen yayin, vataqam haze‘irah vatishkab ‘imo velo yada‘ beshikhbah ubequmah.
wthryn Sty bnwt lwT m1byhn thus were both children-betweenesss of cover-lot with child by their father. vataharena shetei benot lot me’abihen.
wtld hbkyrh bn wtqr1 Smw mw1b hw1 1by mw1b 8d hywm and the first born conceived-of a child-between, and called his name from-father-moab: the same is the father of the from-father-moabites unto this day. vateled habekhirah ben vatiqra shemo mo’ab, hu ’abi mo’ab ‘ad hayom.
whZ8yrh gm hw1 yldh bn wtqr1 Smw bn 8my hw1 1by bny 8mwn 8d hywm and the younger, she also conceived-of a child-between, and called his name between-with-me: the same is the father of children-betweens of with-ammon unto this day. vehaze‘irah gam hi yaledah ben vatiqra shemo ‘ami, hu ’abi bene ‘amon ‘ad hayom.
wys8 mSm 1brhm 1rZh hngb wySb byn qdS wbyn Swr wygr bgrr and their-dick-abraham journeyed from thence toward the dry-south country, and dwelled between-bin dedicated-finished-kadesh and wall-shur, and sojourned in tow-stranger-gerar. vayisa‘ misham ’abraham ’arzah hanegeb vayesheb ben qadesh uben shur, vayagar bigrar.
wy1mr 1brhm 1l Srh 1Stw 1Hty hw1 wySlH 1bymlk mlk grr wyqH 1t Srh and their-dick-abraham said of her-soakedness-sarah his woman, she is my sister: and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech moloch-king of tow-stranger-gerar sent, and took her-soakedness-sarah. vayomer ’abraham ’el sarah ’ishto ’akhoti hi vayishlakh ’abimelekh melekh gerar vayiqakh sarah.
wyb1 1lhym 1l 1bymlk bHlwm hlylh wy1mr lw hnk mt 8l h1Sh 1Sr lqHt whw1 b8lt b8l and towards-these-elohim came to my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him, behold, thou art and a dead man, for the woman which thou hast taken; for she is a man's woman. vayabo ’elohim ’el ’abimelekh bakhalom halayelah, vayomer lo hinekha met ‘al ha’ishah ’asher laqakhta vehiv be‘ulat ba‘al.
w1bymlk l1 qrb 1lyh wy1mr 1dny hgwy gm Zdyq thrg and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech had not come near her: and he said, my lord-base, wilt thou slay also a just nation? va’abimelekh lo qarab ’eleha, vayomar ’adonay hago gam zadiq taharog.
hl1 hw1 1mr ly 1Hty hw1 why1 gm hw1 1mrh 1Hy hw1 btm lbby wbnqyn kpy 8Syty z1t said he not unto me, she is my sister? and she, even she herself said, he is my brother: in the integrity of my heart and innocency of my hands have i done this. halo hu ’amar li ’akhoti hi vehi gam hi ’amerah ’akhi hu, betam lebabi ubeniqyon kapay ‘asiti zot.
wy1mr 1lyw h1lhym bHlm gm 1nky yd8ty ky btm lbbk 8Syt z1t w1HSk gm 1nky 1wtk mHTw ly 8l kn l1 nttyk lng8 1lyh and towards-these-elohim said unto him in a dream, yea, i hand-know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for i also withheld thee from missing against me: therefore suffered i thee not to touch her. vayomer ’elav ha’elohim bakhalom gam ’anokhi yada‘ti ki betam lebabekha ‘asita zot va’ekhsokh gam ’anokhi ’otkha mekhato li, ‘al ken lo netatikha lingoa‘ ’eleha.
w8th hSb 1St h1yS ky nby1 hw1 wytpll b8dk wHyh w1m 1ynk mSyb d8 ky mwt tmwt 1th wkl 1Sr lk now therefore restore the man his woman; for he is a bringer, and he pray for thee, and thou live: and if thou restore her not, hand-know thou that thou surely die, thou, and all that are thine. ve‘atah hasheb ’eshet ha’ish ki nabi hu veyitpalel ba‘adkha vekhyeh, ve’im ’enekha meshib da‘ ki mot tamut ’atah vekhal ’asher lakh.
wySkm 1bymlk bbqr wyqr1 lkl 8bdyw wydbr 1t kl hdbrym h1lh b1znyhm wyyr1w h1nSym m1d therefore my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his workers, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid. vayashkem ’abimelekh baboqer vayiqra lekhal ‘abadav vaydaber kal hadebarim ha’eleh be’azenehem, vayire’u ha’anashim me’od.
wyqr1 1bymlk l1brhm wy1mr lw mh 8Syt lnw wmh HT1ty lk ky hb1t 8ly w8l mmlkty HT1h gdlh m8Sym 1Sr l1 y8Sw 8Syt 8mdy then my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech called their-dick-abraham, and said unto him, what hast thou done unto us? and what have i offended thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my moloch-kingdom a great miss? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done. vayiqra ’abimelekh le’abraham vayomer lo meh ‘asita lanu umeh khatati lakh ki hebeta ‘alay ve‘al mamlakhti khata’ah gedolah, ma‘asim ’asher lo ye‘asu ‘asita ‘imadi.
wy1mr 1bymlk 1l 1brhm mh r1yt ky 8Syt 1t hdbr hzh and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech said unto their-dick-abraham, what sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing? vayomer ’abimelekh ’el ’abraham, mah ra’ita ki ‘asita hadabar hazeh.
wy1mr 1brhm ky 1mrty rq 1yn yr1t 1lhym bmqwm hzh whrgwny 8l dbr 1Sty and their-dick-abraham said, because i thought, surely the fear of towards-these-elohim is not in this place; and they will slay me for my woman's sake. vayomer ’abraham ki ’amarti raq ’en yir’at ’elohim bamaqom hazeh, vaharaguni ‘al debar ’ishti.
wgm 1mnh 1Hty bt 1by hw1 1k l1 bt 1my wthy ly l1Sh and yet indeed she is my sister; she is the daughter-hoof-bat-child of my father, and not the daughter-hoof-bat-child of my mother; and she became my woman. vegam ’amenah ’akhoti bat ’abi hi ’akh lo bat ’imi, vatehi li le’ishah.
wyhy k1Sr ht8w 1ty 1lhym mbyt 1by w1mr lh zh Hsdk 1Sr t8Sy 8mdy 1l kl hmqwm 1Sr nbw1 Smh 1mry ly 1Hy hw1 and it came to pass, when towards-these-elohim caused me to wander from my father's daughter-house, that i said unto her, this is thy kindness which thou show unto me; at every place whither we come, say of me, he is my brother. vayhi ka’asher hit‘u ’oti ’elohim mibet ’abi va’omar lah zeh khasdekh ’asher ta‘asi ‘imadi, ’el kal hamaqom ’asher nabo shamah ’imri li ’akhi hu.
wyqH 1bymlk Z1n wbqr w8bdym wSpHt wytn l1brhm wySb lw 1t Srh 1Stw and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech took sheep, and wall-oxen, and workers, and familiars, and gave them unto their-dick-abraham, and restored him her-soakedness-sarah his woman. vayiqakh ’abimelekh zon ubaqar va‘abadim ushefakhot vayiten le’abraham, vayasheb lo sarah ’ishto.
wy1mr 1bymlk hnh 1rZy lpnyk bTwb b8ynyk Sb and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech said, behold, my land is before-turns thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee. vayomer ’abimelekh hineh ’arzi lefanekha, batob be‘enekha sheb.
wlSrh 1mr hnh ntty 1lp ksp l1Hyk hnh hw1 lk kswt 8ynym lkl 1Sr 1tk w1t kl wnkHt and unto her-soakedness-sarah he said, behold, i have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, he is to thee a covering of the eyes, unto all that are with thee, and with all other: thus she was reproved. ulesarah ’amar hineh natati ’elef kesef le’akhikh hineh hu lakh kesut ‘enayim lekhol ’asher ’itakh, ve’et kol venokhakhat.
wytpll 1brhm 1l h1lhym wyrp1 1lhym 1t 1bymlk w1t 1Stw w1mhtyw wyldw so their-dick-abraham prayed unto towards-these-elohim: and towards-these-elohim healed my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech, and his woman, and his maid-mothers; and they conceived-of children. vayitpalel ’abraham ’el ha’elohim, vayirpa ’elohim ’abimelekh ve’et ’ishto ve’amhotav vayeledu.
ky 8Zr 8Zr yhwh b8d kl rHm lbyt 1bymlk 8l dbr Srh 1St 1brhm for yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou had fast closed up all the wombs of the daughter-house of my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech, because of her-soakedness-sarah their-dick-abraham's woman. ki ‘azor ‘azar yhvh kal rekhem lebet ’abimelekh, ‘al debar sarah ’eshet ’abraham.
wyhwh pqd 1t Srh k1Sr 1mr wy8S yhwh lSrh k1Sr dbr and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou visited her-soakedness-sarah as he had said, and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou did unto her-soakedness-sarah as he had bee-spoken. yhvh paqad sarah ka’asher ’amar, vaya‘as yhvh lesarah ka’asher diber.
wthr wtld Srh l1brhm bn lzqnyw lmw8d 1Sr dbr 1tw 1lhym for her-soakedness-sarah conceived, and conceived-of their-dick-abraham a child-between in his old age, at the set time of which towards-these-elohim had bee-spoken to him. vatahar vateled sarah le’abraham ben lizqunav, lamo‘ed ’asher diber ’oto ’elohim.
wyqr1 1brhm 1t Sm bnw hnwld lw 1Sr yldh lw Srh yZHq and their-dick-abraham called the name of his child-between that was born unto him, whom her-soakedness-sarah conceived-of to him, laughter-isaac. vayiqra ’abraham shem beno hanolad lo ’asher yaledah lo sarah yizkhaq.
wyml 1brhm 1t yZHq bnw bn Smnt ymym k1Sr Zwh 1tw 1lhym and their-dick-abraham scribe-circumcised his child-between laughter-isaac being eight days old, as towards-these-elohim had order-prescribed him. vayamal ’abraham yizkhaq beno ben shemonat yamim, ka’asher zivah ’oto ’elohim.
w1brhm bn m1t Snh bhwld lw 1t yZHq bnw and their-dick-abraham was an hundred years old, when his child-between laughter-isaac was born unto him. ve’abraham ben me’at shanah, behivaled lo yizkhaq beno.
wt1mr Srh ZHq 8Sh ly 1lhym kl hSm8 yZHq ly and her-soakedness-sarah said, towards-these-elohim hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear will laugh with me. vatomer sarah zekhoq ‘asah li ’elohim, kal hashomea‘ yizkhaq li.
wt1mr my mll l1brhm hynyqh bnym Srh ky yldty bn lzqnyw and she said, who would have said unto their-dick-abraham, that her-soakedness-sarah should have given children-betweens suck? for i have born him a child-between in his old age. vatomer mi milel le’abraham heniqah banim sarah, ki yaladti ben lizqunav.
wygdl hyld wygml wy8S 1brhm mSth gdwl bywm hgml 1t yZHq and child grew, and was weaned: and their-dick-abraham made a great until-conception the same day that laughter-isaac was weaned. vayigdal hayeled vayigamal, vaya‘as ’abraham mishteh gadol beyom higamel yizkhaq.
wtr1 Srh 1t bn hgr hmZryt 1Sr yldh l1brhm mZHq and her-soakedness-sarah saw child-between of migrate-hagar the narrows-mizraimian, which she had born unto their-dick-abraham, mocking. vatere sarah ben hagar hamizrit ’asher yaledah le’abraham mezakheq.
