wt1mr l1brhm grS h1mh hz1t w1t bnh ky l1 yyrS bn h1mh hz1t 8m bny 8m yZHq wherefore she said unto their-dick-abraham, cast out this bondwoman and her child-between: for child-between of this bondwoman not be heir with my child-between, even with laughter-isaac. vatomer le’abraham garesh ha’amah hazot ve’et benah, ki lo yirash ben ha’amah hazot ‘im beni ‘im yizkhaq.
wyr8 hdbr m1d b8yny 1brhm 8l 1wdt bnw and the thing was very grievous in their-dick-abraham's sight because of his child-between. vayera‘ hadabar me’od be‘enei ’abraham, ‘al ’odot beno.
wy1mr 1lhym 1l 1brhm 1l yr8 b8ynyk 8l hn8r w8l 1mtk kl 1Sr t1mr 1lyk Srh Sm8 bqlh ky byZHq yqr1 lk zr8 and towards-these-elohim said unto their-dick-abraham, let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that her-soakedness-sarah hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in laughter-isaac thy seed be called. vayomer ’elohim ’el ’abraham ’al yera‘ be‘enekha ‘al hana‘ar ve‘al ’amatekha kol ’asher tomar ’elekha sarah shema‘ beqolah, ki beyizkhaq yiqarei lekha zara‘.
wgm 1t bn h1mh lgwy 1Symnw ky zr8k hw1 and also of child-between of the bondwoman will i make a nation, because he is thy seed. vegam ben ha’amah lego ’asimenu, ki zar‘akha hu.
wySkm 1brhm bbqr wyqH lHm wHmt mym wytn 1l hgr Sm 8l Skmh w1t hyld wySlHh wtlk wtt8 bmdbr b1r Sb8 and their-dick-abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of from-waters, and gave it unto migrate-hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the place-of-word-desert of well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba. vayashkem ’abraham baboqer vayiqakh lekhem vekhemat mayim vayiten ’el hagar sam ‘al shikhmah ve’et hayeled vayshalekheha, vatelekh vateta‘ bemidbar be’er shaba‘.
wyklw hmym mn hHmt wtSlk 1t hyld tHt 1Hd hSyHm and the from-waters was spent in the bottle, and she cast child under one of the shrubs. vayikhlu hamayim min hakhemet, vatashlekh hayeled takhat ’akhad hasikhim.
wtlk wtSb lh mngd hrHq kmTHwy qSt ky 1mrh 1l 1r1h bmwt hyld wtSb mngd wtS1 1t qlh wtbk and she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bow shot: for she said, let me not see the death of child. and she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept. vatelekh vatesheb lah mineged harkheq kimtakhavei qeshet ki ’amerah ’al ’er’eh bemot hayaled, vatesheb mineged vatisa qolah vatebek.
wySm8 1lhym 1t qwl hn8r wyqr1 ml1k 1lhym 1l hgr mn hSmym wy1mr lh mh lk hgr 1l tyr1y ky Sm8 1lhym 1l qwl hn8r b1Sr hw1 Sm and towards-these-elohim heard the voice of the lad; and the angel-messanger of towards-these-elohim called to migrate-hagar out of namespaces, and said unto her, what aileth thee, migrate-hagar? fear not; for towards-these-elohim hath heard the voice of the lad where he is. vayishma‘ ’elohim qol hana‘ar vayiqra mal’akh ’elohim ’el hagar min hashamayim vayomer lah mah lakh hagar, ’al tire’i ki shama‘ ’elohim ’el qol hana‘ar ba’asher hu sham.
qwmy S1y 1t hn8r whHzyqy 1t ydk bw ky lgwy gdwl 1Symnw arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for i will make him a great nation. qumi se’i hana‘ar vehakhaziqi yadekh bo, ki lego gadol ’asimenu.
wypqH 1lhym 1t 8ynyh wtr1 b1r mym wtlk wtml1 1t hHmt mym wtSq 1t hn8r and towards-these-elohim opened her eyes, and she saw a well of from-waters; and she went, and filled the bottle with from-waters, and gave the lad drink. vayifqakh ’elohim ‘eneha vatere be’er mayim, vatelekh vatemalei hakhemet mayim vatashq hana‘ar.
wyhy 1lhym 1t hn8r wygdl wySb bmdbr wyhy rbh qSt and towards-these-elohim was with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the place-of-word-desert, and became an archer. vayhi ’elohim ’et hana‘ar vayigdal, vayesheb bamidbar vayhi robeh qashat.
wySb bmdbr p1rn wtqH lw 1mw 1Sh m1rZ mZrym and he dwelt in the place-of-word-desert of magnificence-paran: and his mother took him a woman out of the land of narrows-mizraim. vayesheb bemidbar paran, vatiqakh lo ’imo ’ishah me’erez mizrayim.
wyhy b8t hhw1 wy1mr 1bymlk wpykl Sr Zb1w 1l 1brhm l1mr 1lhym 8mk bkl 1Sr 1th 8Sh and it came to pass at that time, that my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech and mouth-of-all-phichol the chief captain of his troop-cluster spake unto their-dick-abraham, saying, towards-these-elohim is with thee in all that thou doest: vayhi ba‘et hahiv vayomer ’abimelekh ufikhol sar zeba’o ’el ’abraham lemor, ’elohim ‘imekha bekhol ’asher ’atah ‘oseh.
w8th hSb8h ly b1lhym hnh 1m tSqr ly wlnyny wlnkdy kHsd 1Sr 8Syty 8mk t8Sh 8mdy w8m h1rZ 1Sr grth bh now therefore swear unto me here by towards-these-elohim that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my child-between, nor with my child-between's child-between: and according to the kindness that i have done unto thee, thou do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned. ve‘atah hishabe‘ah li belohim henah ’im tishqor li ulenini ulenekhdi, kakhesed ’asher ‘asiti ‘imekha ta‘aseh ‘imadi ve‘im ha’arez ’asher gartah bah.
wy1mr 1brhm 1nky 1Sb8 and their-dick-abraham said, i will swear. vayomer ’abraham ’anokhi ’ishabea‘.
whwkH 1brhm 1t 1bymlk 8l 1dwt b1r hmym 1Sr gzlw 8bdy 1bymlk and their-dick-abraham reproved my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech because of a well of from-waters, which my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech's workers had violently taken away. vehokhiakh ’abraham ’abimelekh, ’odot be’er hamayim ’asher gazelu ‘abdei ’abimelekh.
wy1mr 1bymlk l1 yd8ty my 8Sh 1t hdbr hzh wgm 1th l1 hgdt ly wgm 1nky l1 Sm8ty blty hywm and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech said, i wot not who hath done this thing; neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard i of it, and to day. vayomer ’abimelekh lo yada‘ti mi ‘asah hadabar hazeh, vegam ’atah lo higadta li vegam ’anokhi lo shama‘ti bilti hayom.
wyqH 1brhm Z1n wbqr wytn l1bymlk wykrtw Snyhm bryt and their-dick-abraham took sheep and wall-oxen, and gave them unto my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech; and both of them made a covenant. vayiqakh ’abraham zon ubaqar vayiten la’abimelekh, vayikhretu shenehem berit.
wyZb 1brhm 1t Sb8 kbSt hZ1n lbdhn and their-dick-abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves. vayazeb ’abraham sheba‘ kibsot hazon lebadehen.
wy1mr 1bymlk 1l 1brhm mh hnh Sb8 kbSt h1lh 1Sr hZbt lbdnh and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech said unto their-dick-abraham, what mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves? vayomer ’abimelekh ’el ’abraham, mah henah sheba‘ kebasot ha’eleh ’asher hizabta lebadanah.
wy1mr ky 1t Sb8 kbSt tqH mydy b8bwr thyh ly l8dh ky Hprty 1t hb1r hz1t and he said, for these seven ewe lambs thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that i have digged this well. vayomer ki sheba‘ kebasot tiqakh miyadi, ba‘abur tihyeh li le‘edah ki khafarti habe’er hazot.
8l kn qr1 lmqwm hhw1 b1r Sb8 ky Sm nSb8w Snyhm wherefore he called that place well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba; because there they sware both of them. ‘al ken qara lamaqom hahu be’er shaba‘, ki sham nishbe‘u shenehem.
wykrtw bryt bb1r Sb8 wyqm 1bymlk wpykl Sr Zb1w wySbw 1l 1rZ plStym thus they made a covenant at well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba: then my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech rose up, and mouth-of-all-phichol the chief captain of his troop-cluster, and they returned into the land of the griever-philistines. vayikhretu berit bib’er shaba‘, vayaqam ’abimelekh ufikhol sar zeba’o vayashubu ’el ’erez pelishtim.
wyT8 1Sl bb1r Sb8 wyqr1 Sm bSm yhwh 1l 8wlm and their-dick-abraham planted a grove in well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba, and called there on the name of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, the everlasting towards-these-elohim. vayita‘ ’eshel bib’er shaba‘, vayiqra sham beshem yhvh ’el ‘olam.
wygr 1brhm b1rZ plStym ymym rbym and their-dick-abraham sojourned in the griever-philistines' land many days. vayagar ’abraham be’erez pelishtim yamim rabim.
wyhy 1Hr hdbrym h1lh wh1lhym nsh 1t 1brhm wy1mr 1lyw 1brhm wy1mr hnny and it came to pass after these things, that towards-these-elohim did tempt their-dick-abraham, and said unto him, their-dick-abraham: and he said, behold, here i am. vayhi ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh veha’elohim nisah ’abraham, vayomer ’elav ’abraham vayomer hineni.
wy1mr qH n1 1t bnk 1t yHydk 1Sr 1hbt 1t yZHq wlk lk 1l 1rZ hmryh wh8lhw Sm l8lh 8l 1Hd hhrym 1Sr 1mr 1lyk and he said, take now thy child-between, thine only child-between laughter-isaac, whom thou lovest, and get thee into the land of bitter-teacher-moriah; and inward him there for a on-up upon one of the mountains which i will tell thee of. vayomer qakh na binkha yekhidekha ’asher ’ahabta yizkhaq velekh ’el ’erez hamoriyah, veha‘alehu sham le‘olah ‘al ’akhad heharim ’asher ’omar ’elekha.
wySkm 1brhm bbqr wyHbS 1t Hmrw wyqH 1t Sny n8ryw 1tw w1t yZHq bnw wybq8 8Zy 8lh wyqm wylk 1l hmqwm 1Sr 1mr lw h1lhym and their-dick-abraham rose up early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and laughter-isaac his child-between, and clave the wood for the on-up, and rose up, and went unto the place of which towards-these-elohim had told him. vayashkem ’abraham baboqer vayakhabosh khamoro vayiqakh shenei ne‘arav ’ito ve’et yizkhaq beno, vaybaqa‘ ‘azei ‘olah vayaqam vayelekh ’el hamaqom ’asher ’amar lo ha’elohim.
bywm hSlySy wyS1 1brhm 1t 8ynyw wyr1 1t hmqwm mrHq then on the third day their-dick-abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off. bayom hashelishi vayisa ’abraham ‘enav vayar hamaqom merakhoq.
wy1mr 1brhm 1l n8ryw Sbw lkm ph 8m hHmwr w1ny whn8r nlkh 8d kh wnStHwh wnSwbh 1lykm and their-dick-abraham said unto his young men, abide ye here with the ass; and i and the lad will go yonder and partake-shatakh, and come again to you. vayomer ’abraham ’el ne‘arav shebu poh ‘im hakhamor va’ani vehana‘ar nelekhah ‘ad koh, venishtakhaveh venashubah ’alekhem.
wyqH 1brhm 1t 8Zy h8lh wySm 8l yZHq bnw wyqH bydw 1t h1S w1t hm1klt wylkw Snyhm yHdw and their-dick-abraham took the wood of the on-up, and laid it upon laughter-isaac his child-between; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife; and they went both of them together. vayiqakh ’abraham ‘azei ha‘olah vayasem ‘al yizkhaq beno vayiqakh beyado ha’esh ve’et hama’akhelet, vayelekhu shenehem yakhdav.
wy1mr yZHq 1l 1brhm 1byw wy1mr 1by wy1mr hnny bny wy1mr hnh h1S wh8Zym w1yh hSh l8lh and laughter-isaac spake unto their-dick-abraham his father, and said, my father: and he said, here am i, my child-between. and he said, behold the fire and the wood: and where is the lamb for a on-up? vayomer yizkhaq ’el ’abraham ’abiv vayomer ’abi vayomer hineni beni, vayomer hineh ha’esh veha‘ezim ve’ayeh haseh le‘olah.
wy1mr 1brhm 1lhym yr1h lw hSh l8lh bny wylkw Snyhm yHdw and their-dick-abraham said, my child-between, towards-these-elohim will provide himself a lamb for a on-up: so they went both of them together. vayomer ’abraham ’elohim yir’eh lo haseh le‘olah beni, vayelekhu shenehem yakhdav.
wyb1w 1l hmqwm 1Sr 1mr lw h1lhym wybn Sm 1brhm 1t hmzbH wy8rk 1t h8Zym wy8qd 1t yZHq bnw wySm 1tw 8l hmzbH mm8l l8Zym and they came to the stand-up-place which towards-these-elohim had told him of; and their-dick-abraham between-built an butcher-kitchen there, and laid the wood in order, and bound laughter-isaac his child-between, and laid him on the butcher-kitchen upon the wood. vayabo’u ’el hamaqom ’asher ’amar lo ha’elohim vayiben sham ’abraham hamizbeakh vaya‘arokh ha‘ezim, vaya‘aqod yizkhaq beno vayasem ’oto ‘al hamizbeakh mima‘al la‘ezim.
wySlH 1brhm 1t ydw wyqH 1t hm1klt lSHT 1t bnw and their-dick-abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his child-between. vayishlakh ’abraham yado vayiqakh hama’akhelet, lishkhot beno.
wyqr1 1lyw ml1k yhwh mn hSmym wy1mr 1brhm 1brhm wy1mr hnny and the angel-messanger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou called unto him out of namespaces, and said, their-dick-abraham, their-dick-abraham: and he said, here am i. vayiqra ’elav mal’akh yhvh min hashamayim vayomer ’abraham ’abraham, vayomer hineni.
wy1mr 1l tSlH ydk 1l hn8r w1l t8S lw m1wmh ky 8th yd8ty ky yr1 1lhym 1th wl1 HSkt 1t bnk 1t yHydk mmny and he said, lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now i hand-know that thou fearest towards-these-elohim, seeing thou hast not withheld thy child-between, thine only child-between from me. vayomer ’al tishlakh yadekha ’el hana‘ar ve’al ta‘as lo me’umah, ki ‘atah yada‘ti ki yerei ’elohim ’atah velo khasakhta binkha yekhidekha mimeni.
wyS1 1brhm 1t 8ynyw wyr1 whnh 1yl 1Hr n1Hz bsbk bqrnyw wylk 1brhm wyqH 1t h1yl wy8lhw l8lh tHt bnw and their-dick-abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a voiceless-ram caught in a thicket by his horn-rays: and their-dick-abraham went and took the voiceless-ram, and inwarded him up for a on-up in the stead of his child-between. vayisa ’abraham ‘enav vayar vehineh ’ayil ’akhar ne’ekhaz basebakh beqarnav, vayelekh ’abraham vayiqakh ha’ayil vaya‘alehu le‘olah takhat beno.
wyqr1 1brhm Sm hmqwm hhw1 yhwh yr1h 1Sr y1mr hywm bhr yhwh yr1h and their-dick-abraham called the name of that place yeahoh-yhwh-aeioujireh: as it is said to this day, in the mount of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou it be seen. vayiqra ’abraham shem hamaqom hahu yhvh yir’eh, ’asher ye’amer hayom behar yhvh yera’eh.
wyqr1 ml1k yhwh 1l 1brhm Snyt mn hSmym and the angel-messanger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou called unto their-dick-abraham out of namespaces the second time, vayiqra mal’akh yhvh ’el ’abraham, shenit min hashamayim.
wy1mr by nSb8ty n1m yhwh ky y8n 1Sr 8Syt 1t hdbr hzh wl1 HSkt 1t bnk 1t yHydk and said, by myself have i sworn, saith yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy child-between, thine only child-between: vayomer bi nishba‘ti ne’um yhvh, ki ya‘an ’asher ‘asita hadabar hazeh velo khasakhta binkha yekhidekha.
ky brk 1brkk whrbh 1rbh 1t zr8k kkwkby hSmym wkHwl 1Sr 8l Spt hym wyrS zr8k 1t S8r 1ybyw that in knee-fluffy-blessing i will knee-fluffy-bless thee, and in multiplying i will multiply thy seed as the stars of the namespaces, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed possess the hair-gate of his father-adversaries; ki barekh ’abarekhkha veharbah ’arbeh zar‘akha kekhokhbei hashamayim vekhakhol ’asher ‘al sefat hayam, veyirash zar‘akha sha‘ar ’oyebav.
whtbrkw bzr8k kl gwyy h1rZ 8qb 1Sr Sm8t bqly and in thy seed all the nations of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed; because thou hast heard my voice. vehitbarakhu bezar‘akha kol goyei ha’arez, ‘eqeb ’asher shama‘ta beqoli.
wySb 1brhm 1l n8ryw wyqmw wylkw yHdw 1l b1r Sb8 wySb 1brhm bb1r Sb8 so their-dick-abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba; and their-dick-abraham dwelt at well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba. vayashab ’abraham ’el ne‘arav vayaqumu vayelekhu yakhdav ’el shaba‘, vayesheb ’abraham bib’er shaba‘.
wyhy 1Hry hdbrym h1lh wygd l1brhm l1mr hnh yldh mlkh gm hw1 bnym lnHwr 1Hyk and it came to pass after these things, that it was told their-dick-abraham, saying, behold, queen-milcah, she hath also born children-betweens unto thy brother snore-nahor; vayhi ’akharei hadebarim ha’eleh vayugad le’abraham lemor, hineh yaledah milkah gam hi banim lenakhor ’akhikha.
1t 8wZ bkrw w1t bwz 1Hyw w1t qmw1l 1by 1rm advice-huz his firstborn, and scorn-buz his brother, and get-up-towards-kemuel the father of high-aram, ‘uz bekhoro ve’et buz ’akhiv, ve’et qemu’el ’abi ’aram.
w1t kSd w1t Hzw w1t pldS w1t ydlp w1t btw1l and as-a-demon-chesed, and predict-hazo, and fiery-iron-pildash, and leak-jidlaph, and his-house-towards-bethuel. ve’et kesed ve’et khazo ve’et pildash ve’et yidlaf, ve’et betu’el.
wbtw1l yld 1t rbqh Smnh 1lh yldh mlkh lnHwr 1Hy 1brhm and his-house-towards-bethuel begat stall-rebekah: these eight queen-milcah did bear to snore-nahor, their-dick-abraham's brother. ubetu’el yalad ribqah, shemonah ’eleh yaledah milkah lenakhor ’akhi ’abraham.
wpylgSw wSmh r1wmh wtld gm hw1 1t TbH w1t gHm w1t tHS w1t m8kh and his concubine, whose name was buddy-reumah, she conceived-of also slaughter-tebah, and whim-gaham, and hurry-tahash, and from-acre-maachah. ufilagsho ushemah re’umah, vateled gam hi tebakh ve’et gakham ve’et takhash ve’et ma‘akhah.
wyhyw Hyy Srh m1h Snh w8Srym Snh wSb8 Snym Sny Hyy Srh and her-soakedness-sarah was an hundred and seven and double-ten-twenty years old: these were the years of the life of her-soakedness-sarah. vayihyu khayei sarah me’ah shanah ve‘esrim shanah vesheba‘ shanim, shenei khayei sarah.
wtmt Srh bqryt 1rb8 hw1 Hbrwn b1rZ kn8n wyb1 1brhm lspd lSrh wlbkth and her-soakedness-sarah died in light-city-of-four-kirjatharba; the same is friend-joy-hebron in the land of mobile-trade-canaan: and their-dick-abraham came to mourn for her-soakedness-sarah, and to weep for her. vatamat sarah beqiryat ’arba‘ hi khebron be’erez kena‘an, vayabo ’abraham lispod lesarah velibkotah.
wyqm 1brhm m8l pny mtw wydbr 1l bny Ht l1mr and their-dick-abraham stood up from before-turns his dead, and spake unto children-betweens of bold-heth, saying, vayaqam ’abraham me‘al penei meto, vaydaber ’el bene khet lemor.
gr wtwSb 1nky 8mkm tnw ly 1Hzt qbr 8mkm w1qbrh mty mlpny i am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that i may bury my dead out of my sight. ger vetoshab ’anokhi ‘imakhem, tenu li ’akhuzat qeber ‘imakhem ve’eqberah meti milefanay.
wy8nw bny Ht 1t 1brhm l1mr lw and children-betweens of bold-heth answered their-dick-abraham, saying unto him, vaya‘anu bene khet ’abraham lemor lo.
Sm8nw 1dny nSy1 1lhym 1th btwknw bmbHr qbrynw qbr 1t mtk 1yS mmnw 1t qbrw l1 yklh mmk mqbr mtk hear us, my lord-base: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us withhold from thee his sepulchre, and that thou mayest bury thy dead. shema‘enu ’adoni nesi ’elohim ’atah betokhenu bemibkhar qebarenu qebor metekha, mimenu qibro lo yikhleh mimekha miqebor metekha.
wyqm 1brhm wyStHw l8m h1rZ lbny Ht and their-dick-abraham stood up, and bowed himself to the with-mum-people of the land, even to children-betweens of bold-heth. vayaqam ’abraham vayishtakhu le‘am ha’arez libne khet.
wydbr 1tm l1mr 1m yS 1t npSkm lqbr 1t mty mlpny Sm8wny wpg8w ly b8prwn bn ZHr and he communed with them, saying, if it be your mind that i should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and entreat for me to pencil-ephron child-between of bleach-zohar, vaydaber ’itam lemor, ’im yesh nafshekhem liqbor meti milefanay shema‘uni ufig‘u li be‘efron ben zokhar.
wytn ly 1t m8rt hmkplh 1Sr lw 1Sr bqZh Sdhw bksp ml1 ytnnh ly btwkkm l1Hzt qbr that he may give me the cave of copy-product-machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you. veyiten li me‘arat hamakhpelah ’asher lo ’asher biqzeh sadehu, bekhesef malei yitenenah li betokhkhem la’akhuzat qaber.
w8prwn ySb btwk bny Ht wy8n 8prwn hHty 1t 1brhm b1zny bny Ht lkl b1y S8r 8yrw l1mr and pencil-ephron dwelt among children-betweens of bold-heth: and pencil-ephron the cut-hittite answered their-dick-abraham in the audience of children-betweens of bold-heth, even of all that went in at the hair-gate of his light-city, saying, ve‘efron yosheb betokh bene khet, vaya‘an ‘efron hakhiti ’abraham be’azenei bene khet lekhol ba’ei sha‘ar ‘iro lemor.
l1 1dny Sm8ny hSdh ntty lk whm8rh 1Sr bw lk nttyh l8yny bny 8my nttyh lk qbr mtk nay, my lord-base, hear me: the field give i thee, and the cave that is therein, i give it thee; in the presence of children-betweens of my with-mum-people give i it thee: bury thy dead. lo ’adoni shema‘eni hasadeh natati lakh vehame‘arah ’asher bo lekha netatiha, le‘enei bene ‘ami netatiha lakh qebor metekha.
wyStHw 1brhm lpny 8m h1rZ and their-dick-abraham bowed down himself before-turns the with-mum-people of the land. vayishtakhu ’abraham lifnei ‘am ha’arez.
wydbr 1l 8prwn b1zny 8m h1rZ l1mr 1k 1m 1th lw Sm8ny ntty ksp hSdh qH mmny w1qbrh 1t mty Smh and he spake unto pencil-ephron in the audience of the with-mum-people of the land, saying, and if thou wilt give it, i pray thee, hear me: i will give thee money for the field; take it of me, and i will bury my dead there. vaydaber ’el ‘efron be’azenei ‘am ha’arez lemor ’akh ’im ’atah lu shema‘eni, natati kesef hasadeh qakh mimeni ve’eqberah meti shamah.
wy8n 8prwn 1t 1brhm l1mr lw and pencil-ephron answered their-dick-abraham, saying unto him, vaya‘an ‘efron ’abraham lemor lo.
1dny Sm8ny 1rZ 1rb8 m1t Sql ksp byny wbynk mh hw1 w1t mtk qbr my lord-base, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred light-shekels of silver; what is that betwixt-bin me and thee? bury therefore thy dead. ’adoni shema‘eni ’erez ’arba‘ me’ot sheqel kesef beni ubenekha mah hi ve’et metekha qebor.
wySm8 1brhm 1l 8prwn wySql 1brhm l8prn 1t hksp 1Sr dbr b1zny bny Ht 1rb8 m1wt Sql ksp 8br lsHr and their-dick-abraham hearkened unto pencil-ephron; and their-dick-abraham weighed to pencil-ephron the silver, which he had named in the audience of children-betweens of bold-heth, four hundred light-shekels of silver, current money with the merchant. vayishma‘ ’abraham ’el ‘efron vayishqol ’abraham le‘efron hakesef ’asher diber be’azenei bene khet, ’arba‘ me’ot sheqel kesef ‘ober lasokher.
wyqm Sdh 8prwn 1Sr bmkplh 1Sr lpny mmr1 hSdh whm8rh 1Sr bw wkl h8Z 1Sr bSdh 1Sr bkl gblw sbyb and the field of pencil-ephron which was in copy-product-machpelah, which was before-turns see-bitter-mamre, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the borders round about, were made sure vayaqam sedeh ‘efron ’asher bamakhpelah ’asher lifnei mamre, hasadeh vehame‘arah ’asher bo vekhal ha‘ez ’asher basadeh ’asher bekhal gebulo sabib.
l1brhm lmqnh l8yny bny Ht bkl b1y S8r 8yrw unto their-dick-abraham for a possession in the presence of children-betweens of bold-heth, before-turns all that went in at the hair-gate of his light-city. le’abraham lemiqnah le‘enei bene khet, bekhol ba’ei sha‘ar ‘iro.
w1Hry kn qbr 1brhm 1t Srh 1Stw 1l m8rt Sdh hmkplh 8l pny mmr1 hw1 Hbrwn b1rZ kn8n and after this, their-dick-abraham buried her-soakedness-sarah his woman in the cave of the field of copy-product-machpelah before-turns see-bitter-mamre: the same is friend-joy-hebron in the land of mobile-trade-canaan. ve’akhare khen qabar ’abraham sarah ’ishto ’el me‘arat sedeh hamakhpelah ‘al penei mamrei hi khebron, be’erez kena‘an.
wyqm hSdh whm8rh 1Sr bw l1brhm l1Hzt qbr m1t bny Ht and the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto their-dick-abraham for a possession of a buryingplace by children-betweens of bold-heth. vayaqam hasadeh vehame‘arah ’asher bo le’abraham la’akhuzat qaber, me’et bene khet.
w1brhm zqn b1 bymym wyhwh brk 1t 1brhm bkl and their-dick-abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou had knee-fluffy-blessed their-dick-abraham in all things. ve’abraham zaqen ba bayamim, yhvh berakh ’abraham bakol.
wy1mr 1brhm 1l 8bdw zqn bytw hmSl bkl 1Sr lw Sym n1 ydk tHt yrky and their-dick-abraham said unto his eldest worker of his daughter-house, that ruled over all that he had, put, i pray thee, thy hand under my thigh: vayomer ’abraham ’el ‘abdo zeqan beto hamoshel bekhal ’asher lo, sim na yadekha takhat yerekhi.
w1Sby8k byhwh 1lhy hSmym w1lhy h1rZ 1Sr l1 tqH 1Sh lbny mbnwt hkn8ny 1Sr 1nky ywSb bqrbw and i will make thee swear by yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, the towards-these-elohim of namespaces, and the towards-these-elohim of the earth, that no take a woman unto my child-between of children-betweenesss of the mobile-trade-canaanites, among whom i dwell: ve’ashbi‘akha yhvh ’elohei hashamayim velohei ha’arez, ’asher lo tiqakh ’ishah libni mibenot hakena‘ani ’asher ’anokhi yosheb beqirbo.
ky 1l 1rZy w1l mwldty tlk wlqHt 1Sh lbny lyZHq and thou go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a woman unto my child-between laughter-isaac. ki ’el ’arzi ve’el moladti telekh, velaqakhta ’ishah libni leyizkhaq.
wy1mr 1lyw h8bd 1wly l1 t1bh h1Sh llkt 1Hry 1l h1rZ hz1t hhSb 1Syb 1t bnk 1l h1rZ 1Sr yZ1t mSm and the worker said unto him, peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must i needs bring thy child-between again unto the land from whence thou camest? vayomer ’elav ha‘ebed ’ulay lo tobeh ha’ishah lalekhet ’akharay ’el ha’arez hazot, hehasheb ’ashib binkha ’el ha’arez ’asher yazata misham.
wy1mr 1lyw 1brhm hSmr lk pn tSyb 1t bny Smh and their-dick-abraham said unto him, beware thou that thou bring not my child-between thither again. vayomer ’elav ’abraham, hishamer pen tashib beni shamah.
yhwh 1lhy hSmym 1Sr lqHny mbyt 1by wm1rZ mwldty w1Sr dbr ly w1Sr nSb8 ly l1mr lzr8k 1tn 1t h1rZ hz1t hw1 ySlH ml1kw lpnyk wlqHt 1Sh lbny mSm yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of namespaces, which took me from my father's daughter-house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying, unto thy seed will i give this land; he send his angel-messanger before-turns thee, and thou take a woman unto my child-between from thence. yhvh ’elohei hashamayim ’asher leqakhani mibet ’abi ume’erez moladti va’asher diber li va’asher nishba‘ li lemor lezar‘akha ’eten ha’arez hazot, hu yishlakh mal’akho lefanekha velaqakhta ’ishah libni misham.
w1m l1 t1bh h1Sh llkt 1Hryk wnqyt mSb8ty z1t rq 1t bny l1 tSb Smh and if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou be clear from this my toward-oath: only bring not my child-between thither again. ve’im lo tobeh ha’ishah lalekhet ’akharekha veniqita mishebu‘ati zot, raq beni lo tasheb shamah.
wySm h8bd 1t ydw tHt yrk 1brhm 1dnyw wySb8 lw 8l hdbr hzh and the worker put his hand under the thigh of their-dick-abraham his master, and sware to him concerning that matter. vayasem ha‘ebed yado takhat yerekh ’abraham ’adonav, vayishaba‘ lo ‘al hadabar hazeh.
wyqH h8bd 8Srh gmlym mgmly 1dnyw wylk wkl Twb 1dnyw bydw wyqm wylk 1l 1rm nhrym 1l 8yr nHwr and the worker took ten ripen-camels of the ripen-camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to high-rivers-aramnaharim, unto the light-city of snore-nahor. vayiqakh ha‘ebed ‘asarah gemalim migemalei ’adonav vayelekh vekhal tub ’adonav beyado, vayaqam vayelekh ’el naharayim ’el ‘ir nakhor.
wybrk hgmlym mHwZ l8yr 1l b1r hmym l8t 8rb l8t Z1t hS1bt and he made his ripen-camels to kneel down without the light-city by a well of from-waters at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw from-waters. vayabrekh hagemalim mikhuz la‘ir ’el be’er hamayim, le‘et ‘ereb le‘et zet hasho’abot.
wy1mr yhwh 1lhy 1dny 1brhm hqrh n1 lpny hywm w8Sh Hsd 8m 1dny 1brhm and he said yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of my master their-dick-abraham, i pray thee, send me good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master their-dick-abraham. vayomar yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham haqreh na lefanay hayom, va‘aseh khesed ‘im ’adoni ’abraham.
hnh 1nky nZb 8l 8yn hmym wbnwt 1nSy h8yr yZ1t lS1b mym behold, i stand here by the well of from-waters; and children-betweenesss of the men of the light-city come out to draw from-waters: hineh ’anokhi nizab ‘al ‘en hamayim, ubenot ’anshei ha‘ir yoze’ot lish’ob mayim.
whyh hn8r 1Sr 1mr 1lyh hTy n1 kdk w1Sth w1mrh Sth wgm gmlyk 1Sqh 1th hkHt l8bdk lyZHq wbh 1d8 ky 8Syt Hsd 8m 1dny and let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom i say, let down thy pitcher, i pray thee, that i may drink; and she say, drink, and i will give thy ripen-camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy worker laughter-isaac; and thereby i hand-know that thou hast showed kindness unto my master. vehayah hana‘ara ’asher ’omar ’eleha hati na khadekh ve’eshteh ve’amerah sheteh vegam gemalekha ’ashqeh, ’otah hokhakhta le‘abdekha leyizkhaq ubah ’eda‘ ki ‘asita khesed ‘im ’adoni.
wyhy hw1 Trm klh ldbr whnh rbqh yZ1t 1Sr yldh lbtw1l bn mlkh 1St nHwr 1Hy 1brhm wkdh 8l Skmh and it came to pass, before-turns he had done speaking, that, behold, stall-rebekah came out, who was born to his-house-towards-bethuel, child-between of queen-milcah, the woman of snore-nahor, their-dick-abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder. vayhi hu terem kilah ledaber vehineh ribqah yozet ’asher yuledah libtu’el ben milkah ’eshet nakhor ’akhi ’abraham, vekhadah ‘al shikhmah.
whn8r Tbt mr1h m1d btwlh w1yS l1 yd8h wtrd h8ynh wtml1 kdh wt8l and the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man hand-known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up. vehana‘ara tobat mar’eh me’od betulah ve’ish lo yeda‘ah, vatered ha‘aynah vatemalei khadah vata‘al.
wyrZ h8bd lqr1th wy1mr hgmy1yny n1 m8T mym mkdk and the worker ran to until-witness her, and said, let me, i pray thee, drink a little from-waters of thy pitcher. vayaraz ha‘ebed liqratah, vayomer hagmi’ini na me‘at mayim mikadekh.
wt1mr Sth 1dny wtmhr wtrd kdh 8l ydh wtSqhw and she said, drink, my lord-base: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink. vatomer sheteh ’adoni, vatemaher vatored kadah ‘al yadah vatashqehu.
wtkl lhSqtw wt1mr gm lgmlyk 1S1b 8d 1m klw lStt and when she had done giving him drink, she said, i will draw from-waters for thy ripen-camels also, until they have done drinking. vatekhal lehashqoto, vatomer gam ligmalekha ’esh’ab ‘ad ’im kilu lishtot.
wtmhr wt8r kdh 1l hSqt wtrZ 8wd 1l hb1r lS1b wtS1b lkl gmlyw and she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw from-waters, and drew for all his ripen-camels. vatemaher vate‘ar kadah ’el hashoqet vataraz ‘od ’el habe’er lish’ob, vatish’ab lekhal gemalav.
wh1yS mSt1h lh mHryS ld8t hhZlyH yhwh drkw 1m l1 and the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou had made his journey prosperous or not. veha’ish mishta’eh lah, makharish lada‘at hahizliakh yhvh darko ’im lo.
wyhy k1Sr klw hgmlym lStwt wyqH h1yS nzm zhb bq8 mSqlw wSny Zmydym 8l ydyh 8Srh zhb mSqlm and it came to pass, as the ripen-camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a light-shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten light-shekels weight of gold; vayhi ka’asher kilu hagemalim lishtot vayiqakh ha’ish nezem zahab beqa‘ mishqalo, ushenei zemidim ‘al yadeha ‘asarah zahab mishqalam.
wy1mr bt my 1t hgydy n1 ly hyS byt 1byk mqwm lnw llyn and said, whose daughter-hoof-bat-child art thou? tell me, i pray thee: is there room in thy father's daughter-house for us to lodge in? vayomer bat mi ’at hagidi na li, hayesh bet ’abikh maqom lanu lalin.
wt1mr 1lyw bt btw1l 1nky bn mlkh 1Sr yldh lnHwr and she said unto him, i am the daughter-hoof-bat-child of his-house-towards-bethuel child-between of queen-milcah, which she conceived-of unto snore-nahor. vatomer ’elav bat betu’el ’anokhi, ben milkah ’asher yaledah lenakhor.
wt1mr 1lyw gm tbn gm mspw1 rb 8mnw gm mqwm llwn she said moreover unto him, we have both straw-t-between and provender enough, and room to lodge in. vatomer ’elav gam teben gam mispo rab ‘imanu, gam maqom lalun.
wyqd h1yS wyStHw lyhwh and the man bowed down his head, and partook-shatakh yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. vayiqod ha’ish vayishtakhu yhvh.
wy1mr brwk yhwh 1lhy 1dny 1brhm 1Sr l1 8zb Hsdw w1mtw m8m 1dny 1nky bdrk nHny yhwh byt 1Hy 1dny and he said, knee-fluffy-blessed be yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of my master their-dick-abraham, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: i being in the way, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou led me to the daughter-house of my master's brethren. vayomer barukh yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham ’asher lo ‘azab khasdo va’amito me‘im ’adoni, ’anokhi baderekh nakhani yhvh bet ’akhei ’adoni.
wtrZ hn8r wtgd lbyt 1mh kdbrym h1lh and the damsel ran, and told them of her mother's daughter-house these things. vataraz hana‘ara vataged lebet ’imah, kadebarim ha’eleh.
wlrbqh 1H wSmw lbn wyrZ lbn 1l h1yS hHwZh 1l h8yn and stall-rebekah had a brother, and his name was white-laban: and white-laban ran out unto the man, unto the well. uleribqah ’akh ushemo laban, vayaraz laban ’el ha’ish hakhuzah ’el ha‘ayin.
wyhy kr1t 1t hnzm w1t hZmdym 8l ydy 1Htw wkSm8w 1t dbry rbqh 1Htw l1mr kh dbr 1ly h1yS wyb1 1l h1yS whnh 8md 8l hgmlym 8l h8yn and it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the bee-words of stall-rebekah his sister, saying, thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the ripen-camels at the well. vayhi kir’ot hanezem ve’et hazemidim ‘al yedei ’akhoto ukheshame‘o dibrei ribqah ’akhoto lemor koh diber ’elay ha’ish, vayabo ’el ha’ish vehineh ‘omed ‘al hagemalim ‘al ha‘ayin.
wy1mr bw1 brwk yhwh lmh t8md bHwZ w1nky pnyty hbyt wmqwm lgmlym and he said, come in, thou knee-fluffy-blessed of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou; wherefore standest thou without? for i have prepared the daughter-house, and room for the ripen-camels. vayomer bo berukh yhvh, lamah ta‘amod bakhuz ve’anokhi piniti habayit umaqom lagemalim.
wyb1 h1yS hbyth wyptH hgmlym wytn tbn wmspw1 lgmlym wmym lrHZ rglyw wrgly h1nSym 1Sr 1tw and the man came into the daughter-house: and he ungirded his ripen-camels, and gave straw-t-between and provender for the ripen-camels, and from-waters to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him. vayabo ha’ish habaytah vayfatakh hagemalim, vayiten teben umispo lagemalim umayim lirkhoz raglav veraglei ha’anashim ’asher ’ito.
wyySm wywSm lpnyw l1kl wy1mr l1 1kl 8d 1m dbrty dbry wy1mr dbr and there was set meat before-turns him to eat: and he said, i will not eat, until i have told mine errand. and he said, speak on. vayusam lefanav le’ekhol vayomer lo ’okhal ‘ad ’im dibarti debaray, vayomer daber.
wy1mr 8bd 1brhm 1nky and he said, i am their-dick-abraham's worker. vayomar, ‘ebed ’abraham ’anokhi.
wyhwh brk 1t 1dny m1d wygdl wytn lw Z1n wbqr wksp wzhb w8bdm wSpHt wgmlym wHmrym and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath knee-fluffy-blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and visit-cattles, and silver, and gold, and workers, and maid-mothers, and ripen-camels, and asses. yhvh berakh ’adoni me’od vayigdal, vayiten lo zon ubaqar vekhesef vezahab va‘abadim ushefakhot ugemalim vakhamorim.
wtld Srh 1St 1dny bn l1dny 1Hry zqnth wytn lw 1t kl 1Sr lw and her-soakedness-sarah my master's woman conceived-of a child-between to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath. vateled sarah ’eshet ’adoni ben ladoni ’akharei ziqnatah, vayiten lo kal ’asher lo.
wySb8ny 1dny l1mr l1 tqH 1Sh lbny mbnwt hkn8ny 1Sr 1nky ySb b1rZw and my master made me swear, saying, no take a woman to my child-between of children-betweenesss of the mobile-trade-canaanites, in whose land i dwell: vayashbi‘eni ’adoni lemor, lo tiqakh ’ishah libni mibenot hakena‘ani ’asher ’anokhi yosheb be’arzo.
1m l1 1l byt 1by tlk w1l mSpHty wlqHt 1Sh lbny and thou go unto my father's daughter-house, and to my kindred, and take a woman unto my child-between. ’im lo ’el bet ’abi telekh ve’el mishpakhti, velaqakhta ’ishah libni.
w1mr 1l 1dny 1ly l1 tlk h1Sh 1Hry and i said unto my master, peradventure the woman will not follow me. va’omar ’el ’adoni, ’ulay lo telekh ha’ishah ’akharay.
wy1mr 1ly yhwh 1Sr hthlkty lpnyw ySlH ml1kw 1tk whZlyH drkk wlqHt 1Sh lbny mmSpHty wmbyt 1by and he said unto me, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, before-turns whom i walk, will send his angel-messanger with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou take a woman for my child-between of my kindred, and of my father's daughter-house: vayomer ’elay, yhvh ’asher hithalakhti lefanav yishlakh mal’akho ’itakh vehizliakh darkekha velaqakhta ’ishah libni mimishpakhti umibet ’abi.
1z tnqh m1lty ky tbw1 1l mSpHty w1m l1 ytnw lk whyyt nqy m1lty then thou be clear from this my toward-oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou be clear from my toward-oath. ’az tinaqeh me’alati ki tabo ’el mishpakhti, ve’im lo yitenu lakh vehayita naqi me’alati.
w1b1 hywm 1l h8yn w1mr yhwh 1lhy 1dny 1brhm 1m ySk n1 mZlyH drky 1Sr 1nky hlk 8lyh and i came this day unto the well, and said, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of my master their-dick-abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which i go: va’abo hayom ’el ha‘ayin, va’omar yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham ’im yeshkha na mazliakh darki ’asher ’anokhi holekh ‘aleha.
hnh 1nky nZb 8l 8yn hmym whyh h8lmh hyZ1t lS1b w1mrty 1lyh hSqyny n1 m8T mym mkdk behold, i stand by the well of from-waters; and it come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw from-waters, and i say to her, give me, i pray thee, a little from-waters of thy pitcher to drink; hineh ’anokhi nizab ‘al ‘en hamayim, vehayah ha‘almah hayozet lish’ob ve’amarti ’eleha hashqini na me‘at mayim mikadekh.
w1mrh 1ly gm 1th Sth wgm lgmlyk 1S1b hw1 h1Sh 1Sr hkyH yhwh lbn 1dny and she say to me, both drink thou, and i will also draw for thy ripen-camels: let the same be the woman whom yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath appointed out for my master's child-between. ve’amerah ’elay gam ’atah sheteh vegam ligmalekha ’esh’ab, hi ha’ishah ’asher hokhiakh yhvh leben ’adoni.
1ny Trm 1klh ldbr 1l lby whnh rbqh yZ1t wkdh 8l Skmh wtrd h8ynh wtS1b w1mr 1lyh hSqyny n1 and before-turns i had done speaking in mine heart, behold, stall-rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew from-waters: and i said unto her, let me drink, i pray thee. ’ani terem ’akhaleh ledaber ’el libi vehineh ribqah yozet vekhadah ‘al shikhmah vatered ha‘aynah vatish’ab, va’omar ’eleha hashqini na.
wtmhr wtwrd kdh m8lyh wt1mr Sth wgm gmlyk 1Sqh w1St wgm hgmlym hSqth and she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, drink, and i will give thy ripen-camels drink also: so i drank, and she made the ripen-camels drink also. vatemaher vatored kadah me‘aleha vatomer sheteh vegam gemalekha ’ashqeh, va’eshet vegam hagemalim hishqatah.
w1S1l 1th w1mr bt my 1t wt1mr bt btw1l bn nHwr 1Sr yldh lw mlkh w1Sm hnzm 8l 1ph whZmydym 8l ydyh and i asked her, and said, whose daughter-hoof-bat-child art thou? and she said, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of his-house-towards-bethuel, snore-nahor's child-between, whom queen-milcah conceived-of unto him: and i put the earring upon her face-turns, and the bracelets upon her hands. va’esh’al ’otah va’omar bat mi ’at vatomer bat betu’el ben nakhor ’asher yaledah lo milkah, va’asim hanezem ‘al ’apah vehazemidim ‘al yadeha.
w1qd w1StHwh lyhwh w1brk 1t yhwh 1lhy 1dny 1brhm 1Sr hnHny bdrk 1mt lqHt 1t bt 1Hy 1dny lbnw and i bowed down my head, and partook-shatakh yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, and knee-fluffy-blessed yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of my master their-dick-abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter-hoof-bat-child unto his child-between. va’eqod va’eshtakhaveh yhvh, va’abarekh yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham ’asher hinkhani bederekh ’emet laqakhat bat ’akhi ’adoni libno.
w8th 1m ySkm 8Sym Hsd w1mt 1t 1dny hgydw ly w1m l1 hgydw ly w1pnh 8l ymyn 1w 8l Sm1l and now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that i may turn to the right hand, or to the left. ve‘atah ’im yeshkhem ‘osim khesed ve’emet ’et ’adoni hagidu li, ve’im lo hagidu li ve’efneh ‘al yamin ’o ‘al semol.
wy8n lbn wbtw1l wy1mrw myhwh yZ1 hdbr l1 nwkl dbr 1lyk r8 1w Twb then white-laban and his-house-towards-bethuel answered and said, the thing proceedeth from yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good. vaya‘an laban ubetu’el vayomeru yhvh yaza hadabar, lo nukhal daber ’elekha ra‘ ’o tob.
hnh rbqh lpnyk qH wlk wthy 1Sh lbn 1dnyk k1Sr dbr yhwh behold, stall-rebekah is before-turns thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's child-between's woman, as yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath bee-spoken. hineh ribqah lefanekha qakh valekh, utehi ’ishah leben ’adonekha ka’asher diber yhvh.
wyhy k1Sr Sm8 8bd 1brhm 1t dbryhm wyStHw 1rZh lyhwh and it came to pass, that, when their-dick-abraham's worker heard their bee-words, he partook-shatakh yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, bowing himself to the earth. vayhi ka’asher shama‘ ‘ebed ’abraham dibrehem, vayishtakhu ’arzah yhvh.
wywZ1 h8bd kly ksp wkly zhb wbgdym wytn lrbqh wmgdnt ntn l1Hyh wl1mh and the worker brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to stall-rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things. vayozei ha‘ebed kele khesef ukhelei zahab ubegadim vayiten leribqah, umigdanot natan le’akhiha ule’imah.
wy1klw wyStw hw1 wh1nSym 1Sr 8mw wylynw wyqwmw bbqr wy1mr SlHny l1dny and they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, send me away unto my master. vayokhelu vayishtu hu veha’anashim ’asher ‘imo vayalinu, vayaqumu baboqer vayomer shalekhuni ladoni.
wy1mr 1Hyh w1mh tSb hn8r 1tnw ymym 1w 8Swr 1Hr tlk and her brother and her mother said, let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she go. vayomer ’akhiha ve’imah tesheb hana‘ara ’itanu yamim ’o ‘asor, ’akhar telekh.
wy1mr 1lhm 1l t1Hrw 1ty wyhwh hZlyH drky SlHwny w1lkh l1dny and he said unto them, here-hinder me not, seeing yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath prospered my way; send me away that i may go to my master. vayomer ’alehem ’al te’akharu ’oti yhvh hizliakh darki, shalekhuni ve’elekhah ladoni.
wy1mrw nqr1 ln8r wnS1lh 1t pyh and they said, we will call the damsel, and inquire at her mouth. vayomeru niqra lana‘ara, venish’alah ’et piha.
wyqr1w lrbqh wy1mrw 1lyh htlky 8m h1yS hzh wt1mr 1lk and they called stall-rebekah, and said unto her, wilt thou go with this man? and she said, i will go. vayiqre’u leribqah vayomeru ’eleha hatelekhi ‘im ha’ish hazeh, vatomer ’elekh.
wySlHw 1t rbqh 1Htm w1t mnqth w1t 8bd 1brhm w1t 1nSyw and they sent away stall-rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and their-dick-abraham's worker, and his men. vayshalekhu ribqah ’akhotam ve’et meniqtah, ve’et ‘ebed ’abraham ve’et ’anashav.
wybrkw 1t rbqh wy1mrw lh 1Htnw 1t hyy l1lpy rbbh wyyrS zr8k 1t S8r Sn1yw and they knee-fluffy-blessed stall-rebekah, and said unto her, thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the hair-gate of those which hate them. vaybarakhu ribqah vayomeru lah ’akhotenu ’at hayi le’alfei rebabah, veyirash zar‘ekh sha‘ar sone’av.
wtqm rbqh wn8rtyh wtrkbnh 8l hgmlym wtlknh 1Hry h1yS wyqH h8bd 1t rbqh wylk and stall-rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they pene upon the ripen-camels, and followed the man: and the worker took stall-rebekah, and went his way. vataqam ribqah vena‘aroteha vatirkabnah ‘al hagemalim vatelakhnah ’akharei ha’ish, vayiqakh ha‘ebed ribqah vayelakh.
wyZHq b1 mbw1 b1r lHy r1y whw1 ywSb b1rZ hngb and laughter-isaac came from the way of the well i-see-to-my-life-lahairoi; for he dwelt in the dry-south country. veyizkhaq ba mibo be’er lakhay ro’i, vehu yosheb be’erez hanegeb.
wyZ1 yZHq lSwH bSdh lpnwt 8rb wyS1 8ynyw wyr1 whnh gmlym b1ym and laughter-isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the ripen-camels were coming. vayezei yizkhaq lasuakh basadeh lifnot ‘areb, vayisa ‘enav vayar vehineh gemalim ba’im.
wtS1 rbqh 1t 8ynyh wtr1 1t yZHq wtpl m8l hgml and stall-rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw laughter-isaac, she lighted off the ripen-camel. vatisa ribqah ‘eneha vatere yizkhaq, vatipol me‘al hagamal.
wt1mr 1l h8bd my h1yS hlzh hhlk bSdh lqr1tnw wy1mr h8bd hw1 1dny wtqH hZ8yp wttks for she had said unto the worker, what man is this that walketh in the field to until-witness us? and the worker had said, it is my master: therefore she took a breaker, and covered herself. vatomer ’el ha‘ebed mi ha’ish halazeh haholekh basadeh liqratenu vayomer ha‘ebed hu ’adoni, vatiqakh haza‘if vatitkas.
wyspr h8bd lyZHq 1t kl hdbrym 1Sr 8Sh and the worker told laughter-isaac all things that he had done. vaysaper ha‘ebed leyizkhaq, kal hadebarim ’asher ‘asah.
wyb1h yZHq h1hlh Srh 1mw wyqH 1t rbqh wthy lw l1Sh wy1hbh wynHm yZHq 1Hry 1mw and laughter-isaac brought her into his mother her-soakedness-sarah's tent, and took stall-rebekah, and she became his woman; and he loved her: and laughter-isaac was comforted after his mother's death. vaybi’eha yizkhaq ha’ohelah sarah ’imo vayiqakh ribqah vatehi lo le’ishah vaye’ehabeha, vayinakhem yizkhaq ’akharei ’imo.
wysp 1brhm wyqH 1Sh wSmh qTwrh then again their-dick-abraham took a woman, and her name was complain-keturah. vayosef ’abraham vayiqakh ’ishah ushemah qeturah.
wtld lw 1t zmrn w1t yqSn w1t mdn w1t mdyn w1t ySbq w1t SwH and she conceived-of him their-singer-zimran, and straw-t-between-jokshan, and place-of-discussion-medan, and place-of-discussed-teaching-midian, and kiss-ishbak, and talk-shuah. vateled lo ’et zimran ve’et yaqeshan ve’et medan ve’et midyan, ve’et yishbaq ve’et shuakh.
wyqSn yld 1t Sb1 w1t ddn wbny ddn hyw 1Swrm wlTwSym wl1mym and straw-t-between-jokshan begat coming-sheba, and breast-discuss-dedan. and children-betweens of breast-discuss-dedan were beech-asshurim, and glitter-letushim, and to-mums-leummim. veyaqeshan yalad sheba ve’et dedan, ubenei dedan hayu ’ashurim uletushim ule’umim.
wbny mdyn 8yph w8pr wHnk w1byd8 w1ld8h kl 1lh bny qTwrh and children-betweens of place-of-discussed-teaching-midian; tired-ephah, and dust-epher, and educated-hanoch, and my-dad-knowledge-abidah, and towards-knows-eldaah. all these were children-betweens of complain-keturah. ubenei midyan ‘efah va‘efer vakhanokh va’abida‘ ve’elda‘ah, kal ’eleh benei qeturah.
wytn 1brhm 1t kl 1Sr lw lyZHq and their-dick-abraham gave all that he had unto laughter-isaac. vayiten ’abraham kal ’asher lo leyizkhaq.
wlbny hpylgSym 1Sr l1brhm ntn 1brhm mtnt wySlHm m8l yZHq bnw b8wdnw Hy qdmh 1l 1rZ qdm and unto children-betweens of the concubines, which their-dick-abraham had, their-dick-abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from laughter-isaac his child-between, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country. velibnei hapilagshim ’asher le’abraham natan ’abraham matanot, vayshalekhem me‘al yizkhaq beno be‘odenu khay qedemah ’el ’erez qedem.
w1lh ymy Sny Hyy 1brhm 1Sr Hy m1t Snh wSb8ym Snh wHmS Snym and these are the days of the years of their-dick-abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years. ve’eleh yemei shene khayei ’abraham ’asher khay, me’at shanah veshib‘im shanah vekhamesh shanim.
wygw8 wymt 1brhm bSybh Twbh zqn wSb8 wy1sp 1l 8myw then their-dick-abraham gave up the breath-spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was added to his with-mum-people. vayigva‘ vayamat ’abraham besebah tobah zaqen vesabea‘, vaye’asef ’el ‘amav.
wyqbrw 1tw yZHq wySm81l bnyw 1l m8rt hmkplh 1l Sdh 8prn bn ZHr hHty 1Sr 8l pny mmr1 and his children-betweens laughter-isaac and towards-hears-ishmael buried him in the cave of copy-product-machpelah, in the field of pencil-ephron child-between of bleach-zohar the cut-hittite, which is before-turns see-bitter-mamre; vayiqberu ’oto yizkhaq veyishma‘el banav ’el me‘arat hamakhpelah, ’el sedeh ‘efron ben zokhar hakhiti ’asher ‘al penei mamre.
hSdh 1Sr qnh 1brhm m1t bny Ht Smh qbr 1brhm wSrh 1Stw the field which their-dick-abraham purchased of children-betweens of bold-heth: there was their-dick-abraham buried, and her-soakedness-sarah his woman. hasadeh ’asher qanah ’abraham me’et bene khet, shamah qubar ’abraham vesarah ’ishto.
wyhy 1Hry mwt 1brhm wybrk 1lhym 1t yZHq bnw wySb yZHq 8m b1r lHy r1y and it came to pass after the death of their-dick-abraham, that towards-these-elohim knee-fluffy-blessed his child-between laughter-isaac; and laughter-isaac dwelt by the well i-see-to-my-life-lahairoi. vayhi ’akharei mot ’abraham vaybarekh ’elohim yizkhaq beno, vayesheb yizkhaq ‘im ro’i.
w1lh tldt ySm81l bn 1brhm 1Sr yldh hgr hmZryt SpHt Srh l1brhm now these are the generations of towards-hears-ishmael, their-dick-abraham's child-between, whom migrate-hagar the narrows-mizraimian, her-soakedness-sarah's handmaid, conceived-of unto their-dick-abraham: ve’eleh toledot yishma‘el ben ’abraham, ’asher yaledah hagar hamizrit shifkhat sarah le’abraham.
w1lh Smwt bny ySm81l bSmtm ltwldtm bkr ySm81l nbyt wqdr w1db1l wmbSm and these are the names of children-betweens of towards-hears-ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of towards-hears-ishmael, lets-house-nebajoth; and pottery-kedar, and slander-towards, and fragrance-mibsam, ve’eleh shemot benei yishma‘el bishmotam letoldotam, bekhor yishma‘el nebayot veqedar ve’adbe’el umibsam.
wmSm8 wdwmh wmS1 and from-hearing-mishma, and similar-dumah, and load-massa, umishma‘ vedumah umasa.
Hdd wtym1 yTwr npyS wqdmh sharpen-thunder-hadad, and right-tema, column-jetur, mental-naphish, and progress-kedemah: khadad vetema yetur nafish vaqedemah.
1lh hm bny ySm81l w1lh Smtm bHZryhm wbTyrtm Snym 8Sr nSy1m l1mtm these are children-betweens of towards-hears-ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations. eleh hem benei yishma‘el ve’eleh shemotam bekhazrehem ubetirotam, shenem ‘asar nesi’im le’umotam.
w1lh Sny Hyy ySm81l m1t Snh wSlSym Snh wSb8 Snym wygw8 wymt wy1sp 1l 8myw and these are the years of the life of towards-hears-ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the breath-spirit and died; and was added unto his with-mum-people. ve’eleh shenei khayei yishma‘el me’at shanah usheloshim shanah vesheba‘ shanim, vayigva‘ vayamat vaye’asef ’el ‘amav.
wySknw mHwylh 8d Swr 1Sr 8l pny mZrym b1kh 1Swrh 8l pny kl 1Hyw npl and they dwelt from sick-havilah unto wall-shur, that is before-turns narrows-mizraim, as thou goest toward beech-tree-assyri: and he died in the presence of all his brethren. vayishkenu mekhavilah ‘ad shur ’asher ‘al penei mizrayim bo’akhah ’ashurah, ‘al penei khal ’ekhav nafal.
w1lh twldt yZHq bn 1brhm 1brhm hwlyd 1t yZHq and these are the generations of laughter-isaac, their-dick-abraham's child-between: their-dick-abraham begat laughter-isaac: ve’eleh toldot yizkhaq ben ’abraham, ’abraham holid yizkhaq.
wyhy yZHq bn 1rb8ym Snh bqHtw 1t rbqh bt btw1l h1rmy mpdn 1rm 1Hwt lbn h1rmy lw l1Sh and laughter-isaac was forty years old when he took stall-rebekah to woman, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of his-house-towards-bethuel the high-arami of redeemed-stack-padanaram, the sister to white-laban the high-arami. vayhi yizkhaq ben ’arba‘im shanah beqakhto ribqah bat betu’el ha’arami mipadan ’aram, ’akhot laban ha’arami lo le’ishah.
wy8tr yZHq lyhwh lnkH 1Stw ky 8qrh hw1 wy8tr lw yhwh wthr rbqh 1Stw and laughter-isaac entreated yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou for his woman, because she was barren: and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was entreated of him, and stall-rebekah his woman conceived. vaye‘tar yizkhaq yhvh lenokhakh ’ishto ki ‘aqarah hi vaye‘ater lo yhvh vatahar ribqah ’ishto.
wytrZZw hbnym bqrbh wt1mr 1m kn lmh zh 1nky wtlk ldrS 1t yhwh and children-betweens struggled together within her; and she said, if it be so, why am i thus? and she went to inquire of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. vayitrozazu habanim beqirbah vatomer ’im ken lamah zeh ’anokhi, vatelekh lidrosh ’et yhvh.
wy1mr yhwh lh Sny gyym gwym bbTnk wSny l1mym mm8yk yprdw wl1m ml1m y1mZ wrb y8bd Z8yr and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto her, two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of with-mum-people be separated from thy bowels; and the one with-mum-people be stronger than the other with-mum-people; and the elder work for the younger. vayomer yhvh lah shenei goyim bebitnekh ushenei le’umim mime‘ayikh yiparedu, ule’om mil’om ye’emaz verab ya‘abod za‘ir.
wyml1w ymyh lldt whnh twmm bbTnh and when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb. vayimle’u yameha laledet, vehineh tomim bebitnah.
wyZ1 hr1Swn 1dmwny klw k1drt S8r wyqr1w Smw 8Sw and the first came out red, all over like an gate-hairy garment; and they called his name do-esau. vayezei harishon ’admoni kulo ke’aderet se‘ar, vayiqre’u shemo ‘esav.
w1Hry kn yZ1 1Hyw wydw 1Hzt b8qb 8Sw wyqr1 Smw y8qb wyZHq bn SSym Snh bldt 1tm and after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on do-esau's heel; and his name was called backstreet-jacob: and laughter-isaac was threescore years old when she conceived-of them. ve’akhare khen yaza ’akhiv veyado ’okhezet ba‘aqeb ‘esav vayiqra shemo ya‘aqob, veyizkhaq ben shishim shanah beledet ’otam.
wygdlw hn8rym wyhy 8Sw 1yS yd8 Zyd 1yS Sdh wy8qb 1yS tm ySb 1hlym and the boys grew: and do-esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and backstreet-jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents. vayigdelu hane‘arim vayhi ‘esav ’ish yodea‘ zayid ’ish sadeh, veya‘aqob ’ish tam yosheb ’ohalim.
wy1hb yZHq 1t 8Sw ky Zyd bpyw wrbqh 1hbt 1t y8qb and laughter-isaac loved do-esau, because he did eat of his venison: and stall-rebekah loved backstreet-jacob. vaye’ehab yizkhaq ‘esav ki zayid befiv, veribqah ’ohebet ya‘aqob.
wyzd y8qb nzyd wyb1 8Sw mn hSdh whw1 8yp and backstreet-jacob sod pottage: and do-esau came from the field, and he was faint: vayazed ya‘aqob nazid, vayabo ‘esav min hasadeh vehu ‘ayef.
wy1mr 8Sw 1l y8qb hl8yTny n1 mn h1dm h1dm hzh ky 8yp 1nky 8l kn qr1 Smw 1dwm and do-esau said to backstreet-jacob, feed me, i pray thee, with that same red pottage; for i am faint: therefore was his name called man-edom. vayomer ‘esav ’el ya‘aqob hal‘iteni na min ha’adom ha’adom hazeh ki ‘ayef ’anokhi, ‘al ken qara shemo ’edom.
wy1mr y8qb mkrh kywm 1t bkrtk ly and backstreet-jacob said, sell me this day thy birthright. vayomer ya‘aqob, mikhrah khayom bekhoratekha li.
wy1mr 8Sw hnh 1nky hwlk lmwt wlmh zh ly bkrh and do-esau said, behold, i am at the point to die: and what profit this birthright do to me? vayomer ‘esav hineh ’anokhi holekh lamut, velamah zeh li bekhorah.
wy1mr y8qb hSb8h ly kywm wySb8 lw wymkr 1t bkrtw ly8qb and backstreet-jacob said, swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto backstreet-jacob. vayomer ya‘aqob hishabe‘ah li kayom vayishaba‘ lo, vayimkor bekhorato leya‘aqob.
wy8qb ntn l8Sw lHm wnzyd 8dSym wy1kl wySt wyqm wylk wybz 8Sw 1t hbkrh then backstreet-jacob gave do-esau bread and pottage of lentils; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus do-esau despised his birthright. veya‘aqob natan le‘esav lekhem unezid ‘adashim vayokhal vayeshet vayaqam vayelakh, vayibez ‘esav habekhorah.
wyhy r8b b1rZ mlbd hr8b hr1Swn 1Sr hyh bymy 1brhm wylk yZHq 1l 1bymlk mlk plStym grrh and there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of their-dick-abraham. and laughter-isaac went unto my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech moloch-king of the griever-philistines unto tow-stranger-gerar. vayhi ra‘ab ba’arez milebad hara‘ab harishon ’asher hayah bimei ’abraham, vayelekh yizkhaq ’el ’abimelekh melekh pelishtim gerarah.
wyr1 1lyw yhwh wy1mr 1l trd mZrymh Skn b1rZ 1Sr 1mr 1lyk and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou appeared unto him, and said, go not down into narrows-mizraim; dwell in the land which i tell thee of: vayera ’elav yhvh vayomer ’al tered mizrayemah, shekhon ba’arez ’asher ’omar ’elekha.
gwr b1rZ hz1t w1hyh 8mk w1brkk ky lk wlzr8k 1tn 1t kl h1rZt h1l whqmty 1t hSb8h 1Sr nSb8ty l1brhm 1byk sojourn in this land, and i will be with thee, and will knee-fluffy-bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, i will give all these countries, and i will perform the toward-oath which i sware unto their-dick-abraham thy father; gur ba’arez hazot ve’ehyeh ‘imekha va’abarekheka, ki lekha ulezar‘akha ’eten kal ha’arazot ha’el vahaqimoti hashebu‘ah ’asher nishba‘ti le’abraham ’abikha.
whrbyty 1t zr8k kkwkby hSmym wntty lzr8k 1t kl h1rZt h1l whtbrkw bzr8k kl gwyy h1rZ and i will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of namespaces, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed all the nations of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed; vehirbeti zar‘akha kekhokhbei hashamayim venatati lezar‘akha kal ha’arazot ha’el, vehitbarakhu bezar‘akha kol goyei ha’arez.
8qb 1Sr Sm8 1brhm bqly wySmr mSmrty mZwty Hqwty wtwrty because that their-dick-abraham listened to my voice, and kept my charge, my order-prescriptions, my statutes, and my teachings. ‘eqeb ’asher shama‘ ’abraham beqoli, vayishmor mishmarti mizvotay khuqotay vetorotay.
wySb yZHq bgrr and laughter-isaac dwelt in tow-stranger-gerar: vayesheb yizkhaq bigrar.
wyS1lw 1nSy hmqwm l1Stw wy1mr 1Hty hw1 ky yr1 l1mr 1Sty pn yhrgny 1nSy hmqwm 8l rbqh ky Twbt mr1h hy1 and the men of the place asked him of his woman; and he said, she is my sister: for he feared to say, she is my woman; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for stall-rebekah; because she was fair to look upon. vayish’alu ’anshei hamaqom le’ishto vayomer ’akhoti hi ki yarei lemor ’ishti pen yaharguni ’anshei hamaqom ‘al ribqah ki tobat mar’eh hi.
wyhy ky 1rkw lw Sm hymym wySqp 1bymlk mlk plStym b8d hHlwn wyr1 whnh yZHq mZHq 1t rbqh 1Stw and it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech moloch-king of the griever-philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, laughter-isaac was sporting with stall-rebekah his woman. vayhi ki ’arekhu lo sham hayamim vayashqef ’abimelekh melekh pelishtim be‘ad hakhalon, vayar vehineh yizkhaq mezakheq ribqah ’ishto.
wyqr1 1bymlk lyZHq wy1mr 1k hnh 1Stk hw1 w1yk 1mrt 1Hty hw1 wy1mr 1lyw yZHq ky 1mrty pn 1mwt 8lyh and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech called laughter-isaac, and said, behold, of a surety she is thy woman; and how saidst thou, she is my sister? and laughter-isaac said unto him, because i said, lest i die for her. vayiqra ’abimelekh leyizkhaq vayomer ’akh hineh ’ishtekha hi ve’ekh ’amarta ’akhoti hi vayomer ’elav yizkhaq ki ’amarti pen ’amut ‘aleha.
wy1mr 1bymlk mh z1t 8Syt lnw km8T Skb 1Hd h8m 1t 1Stk whb1t 8lynw 1Sm and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech said, what is this thou hast done unto us? one of the with-mum-people might lightly have lien with thy woman, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us. vayomer ’abimelekh mah zot ‘asita lanu, kim‘at shakhab ’akhad ha‘am ’et ’ishtekha vehebeta ‘alenu ’asham.
wyZw 1bymlk 1t kl h8m l1mr hng8 b1yS hzh wb1Stw mwt ywmt and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech charged all his with-mum-people, saying, he that toucheth this man or his woman surely be put to death. vayzav ’abimelekh kal ha‘am lemor, hanogea‘ ba’ish hazeh ube’ishto mot yumat.
wyzr8 yZHq b1rZ hhw1 wymZ1 bSnh hhw1 m1h S8rym wybrkhw yhwh then laughter-isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou knee-fluffy-blessed him. vayizra‘ yizkhaq ba’arez hahiv vayimza bashanah hahiv me’ah she‘arim, vaybarakhehu yhvh.
wygdl h1yS wylk hlwk wgdl 8d ky gdl m1d and the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great: vayigdal ha’ish, vayelekh halokh vegadel ‘ad ki gadal me’od.
wyhy lw mqnh Z1n wmqnh bqr w8bdh rbh wyqn1w 1tw plStym for he had possession of flocks, and possession of visit-cattles, and great store of workers: and the griever-philistines envied him. vayhi miqneh zon umiqneh baqar va‘abudah rabah, vayqan’u ’oto pelishtim.
wkl hb1rt 1Sr Hprw 8bdy 1byw bymy 1brhm 1byw stmwm plStym wyml1wm 8pr for all the wells which his father's workers had digged in the days of their-dick-abraham his father, the griever-philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth. vekhal habe’erot ’asher khaferu ‘abdei ’abiv bimei ’abraham ’abiv, sitemum pelishtim vaymal’um ‘afar.
wy1mr 1bymlk 1l yZHq lk m8mnw ky 8Zmt mmnw m1d and my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech said unto laughter-isaac, go from us; for thou art much mightier than we. vayomer ’abimelekh ’el yizkhaq, lekh me‘imanu ki ‘azamta mimenu me’od.
wylk mSm yZHq wyHn bnHl grr wySb Sm and laughter-isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of tow-stranger-gerar, and dwelt there. vayelekh misham yizkhaq, vayikhan benakhal gerar vayesheb sham.
wySb yZHq wyHpr 1t b1rt hmym 1Sr Hprw bymy 1brhm 1byw wystmwm plStym 1Hry mwt 1brhm wyqr1 lhn Smwt kSmt 1Sr qr1 lhn 1byw and laughter-isaac digged again the wells of from-waters, which they had digged in the days of their-dick-abraham his father; for the griever-philistines had stopped them after the death of their-dick-abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them. vayashab yizkhaq vayakhpor be’erot hamayim ’asher khaferu bimei ’abraham ’abiv vaysatemum pelishtim ’akharei mot ’abraham, vayiqra lahen shemot kashemot ’asher qara lahen ’abiv.
wyHprw 8bdy yZHq bnHl wymZ1w Sm b1r mym Hyym and laughter-isaac's workers digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing from-waters. vayakhperu ‘abde yizkhaq banakhal, vayimze’u sham be’er mayim khayim.
wyrybw r8y grr 8m r8y yZHq l1mr lnw hmym wyqr1 Sm hb1r 8Sq ky ht8Sqw 8mw and the visit-cattlemen of tow-stranger-gerar did strive with laughter-isaac's visit-cattlemen, saying, the from-waters is ours: and he called the name of the well esek; because they strove with him. vayaribu ro‘ei gerar ‘im ro‘ei yizkhaq lemor lanu hamayim, vayiqra shem habe’er ‘eseq ki hit‘asequ ‘imo.
wyHprw b1r 1Hrt wyrybw gm 8lyh wyqr1 Smh STnh and they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it sitnah. vayakhperu be’er ’akheret vayaribu gam ‘aleha, vayiqra shemah sitnah.
wy8tq mSm wyHpr b1r 1Hrt wl1 rbw 8lyh wyqr1 Smh rHbwt wy1mr ky 8th hrHyb yhwh lnw wprynw b1rZ and he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it wide-area-wide-rehoboth; and he said, for now yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath made room for us, and we be fruitful in the land. vaya‘teq misham vayakhpor be’er ’akheret velo rabu ‘aleha, vayiqra shemah rekhobot vayomer ki ‘atah hirkhib yhvh lanu ufarinu ba’arez.
wy8l mSm b1r Sb8 and he went up from thence to well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba. vaya‘al misham be’er shaba‘.
wyr1 1lyw yhwh blylh hhw1 wy1mr 1nky 1lhy 1brhm 1byk 1l tyr1 ky 1tk 1nky wbrktyk whrbyty 1t zr8k b8bwr 1brhm 8bdy and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou appeared unto him the same night, and said, i am the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham thy father: fear not, for i am with thee, and will knee-fluffy-bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my worker their-dick-abraham's sake. vayera ’elav yhvh balaylah hahu vayomer ’anokhi ’elohei ’abraham ’abikha, ’al tira ki ’itekha ’anokhi uberakhtikha vehirbeti zar‘akha ba‘abur ’abraham ‘abdi.
wybn Sm mzbH wyqr1 bSm yhwh wyT Sm 1hlw wykrw Sm 8bdy yZHq b1r and he between-between-builded an butcher-kitchen there, and called upon the name of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, and pitched his tent there: and there laughter-isaac's workers digged a well. vayiben sham mizbeakh vayiqra beshem yhvh vayet sham ’aholo, vayikhru sham ‘abde yizkhaq be’er.
w1bymlk hlk 1lyw mgrr w1Hzt mr8hw wpykl Sr Zb1w then my-dad-moloch-king-abimelech went to him from tow-stranger-gerar, and held-on-ahuzzath one of his friends, and mouth-of-all-phichol the chief captain of his army. va’abimelekh halakh ’elav migerar, va’akhuzat mere‘ehu ufikhol sar zeba’o.
wy1mr 1lhm yZHq mdw8 b1tm 1ly w1tm Sn1tm 1ty wtSlHwny m1tkm and laughter-isaac said unto them, wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you? vayomer ’alehem yizkhaq madua‘ batem ’elay, ve’atem senetem ’oti vateshalekhuni me’itekhem.
wy1mrw r1w r1ynw ky hyh yhwh 8mk wn1mr thy n1 1lh bynwtynw bynynw wbynk wnkrth bryt 8mk and they said, we saw certainly that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was with thee: and we said, let there be now an toward-oath betwixt-bin us, even betwixt-bin us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee; vayomeru ra’o ra’inu ki hayah yhvh ‘imakh vanomer tehi na ’alah benotenu benenu ubenekha, venikhretah berit ‘imakh.
1m t8Sh 8mnw r8h k1Sr l1 ng8nwk wk1Sr 8Synw 8mk rq Twb wnSlHk bSlwm 1th 8th brwk yhwh that thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing and good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the knee-fluffy-blessed of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou. ’im ta‘aseh ‘imanu ra‘ah ka’asher lo nega‘anukha vekha’asher ‘asinu ‘imekha raq tob vaneshalekhakha beshalom, ’atah ‘atah berukh yhvh.
wy8S lhm mSth wy1klw wyStw and he made them a until-conception, and they did eat and drink. vaya‘as lahem mishteh vayokhelu vayishtu.
wySkymw bbqr wySb8w 1yS l1Hyw wySlHm yZHq wylkw m1tw bSlwm and they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and laughter-isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace. vayashkimu baboqer vayishabe‘u ’ish le’akhiv, vayshalekhem yizkhaq vayelekhu me’ito beshalom.
wyhy bywm hhw1 wyb1w 8bdy yZHq wygdw lw 8l 1dwt hb1r 1Sr Hprw wy1mrw lw mZ1nw mym and it came to pass the same day, that laughter-isaac's workers came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, we have found from-waters. vayhi bayom hahu vayabo’u ‘abdei yizkhaq vayagidu lo ‘al ’odot habe’er ’asher khafaru, vayomeru lo mazanu mayim.
wyqr1 1th Sb8h 8l kn Sm h8yr b1r Sb8 8d hywm hzh and he called it coming-shebah: therefore the name of the light-city is well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba unto this day. vayiqra ’otah shib‘ah, ‘al ken shem ha‘ir sheba‘ ‘ad hayom hazeh.
wyhy 8Sw bn 1rb8ym Snh wyqH 1Sh 1t yhwdyt bt b1ry hHty w1t bSmt bt 1yln hHty and do-esau was forty years old when he took to woman handy-know-judith the daughter-hoof-bat-child of my-well-well-beeri the cut-hittite, and perfumery-bashemath the daughter-hoof-bat-child of tree-elon the cut-hittite: vayhi ‘esav ben ’arba‘im shanah vayiqakh ’ishah yehudit bat be’eri hakhiti, ve’et basemat bat ’elon hakhiti.
wthyyn mrt rwH lyZHq wlrbqh which were a grief of mind unto laughter-isaac and to stall-rebekah. vatihyena morat ruakh, leyizkhaq uleribqah.
wyhy ky zqn yZHq wtkhyn 8ynyw mr1t wyqr1 1t 8Sw bnw hgdl wy1mr 1lyw bny wy1mr 1lyw hnny and it came to pass, that when laughter-isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called do-esau his eldest child-between, and said unto him, my child-between: and he said unto him, behold, here am i. vayhi ki zaqen yizkhaq vatikhhena ‘enav mere’ot, vayiqra ‘esav beno hagadol vayomer ’elav beni vayomer ’elav hineni.
wy1mr hnh n1 zqnty l1 yd8ty ywm mwty and he said, behold now, i am old, i hand-know not the day of my death: vayomer hineh na zaqanti, lo yada‘ti yom moti.
w8th S1 n1 klyk tlyk wqStk wZ1 hSdh wZwdh ly Zydh Zyd now therefore take, i pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison; ve‘atah sa na khelekha telyekha veqashtekha, vezei hasadeh vezudah li zayid.
w8Sh ly mT8mym k1Sr 1hbty whby1h ly w1klh b8bwr tbrkk npSy bTrm 1mwt and make me savory meat, such as i love, and bring it to me, that i may eat; that my being may knee-fluffy-bless thee before-turns i die. va‘aseh li mat‘amim ka’asher ’ahabti vehabi’ah li ve’okhelah, ba‘abur tebarekhkha nafshi beterem ’amut.
wrbqh Sm8t bdbr yZHq 1l 8Sw bnw wylk 8Sw hSdh lZwd Zyd lhby1 and stall-rebekah heard when laughter-isaac spake to do-esau his child-between. and do-esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it. veribqah shoma‘at bedaber yizkhaq ’el ‘esav beno, vayelekh ‘esav hasadeh lazud zayid lehabi.
wrbqh 1mrh 1l y8qb bnh l1mr hnh Sm8ty 1t 1byk mdbr 1l 8Sw 1Hyk l1mr and stall-rebekah spake unto backstreet-jacob her child-between, saying, behold, i heard thy father speak unto do-esau thy brother, saying, veribqah ’amerah ’el ya‘aqob benah lemor, hineh shama‘ti ’abikha medaber ’el ‘esav ’akhikha lemor.
hby1h ly Zyd w8Sh ly mT8mym w1klh w1brkkh lpny yhwh lpny mwty bring me venison, and make me savory meat, that i may eat, and knee-fluffy-bless thee before-turns yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou before-turns my death. habi’ah li zayid va‘aseh li mat‘amim ve’okhelah, va’abarekhkhah lifnei yhvh lifnei moti.
w8th bny Sm8 bqly l1Sr 1ny mZwh 1tk now therefore, my child-between, obey my voice according to that which i order-prescribe thee. ve‘atah beni shema‘ beqoli, la’asher ’ani mezavah ’otakh.
lk n1 1l hZ1n wqH ly mSm Sny gdyy 8zym Tbym w18Sh 1tm mT8mym l1byk k1Sr 1hb go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the intense-goats; and i will make them savory meat for thy father, such as he loveth: lekh na ’el hazon veqakh li misham shenei gedayei ‘izim tobim, ve’e‘eseh ’otam mat‘amim le’abikha ka’asher ’aheb.
whb1t l1byk w1kl b8br 1Sr ybrkk lpny mwtw and thou bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may knee-fluffy-bless thee before-turns his death. vehebeta le’abikha ve’akhal, ba‘abur yebarekhkha lifnei moto.
wy1mr y8qb 1l rbqh 1mw hn 8Sw 1Hy 1yS S8r w1nky 1yS Hlq and backstreet-jacob said to stall-rebekah his mother, behold, do-esau my brother is a gate-hairy man, and i am a smooth man: vayomer ya‘aqob ’el ribqah ’imo, hen ‘esav ’akhi ’ish sa‘ir ve’anokhi ’ish khalaq.
1wly ymSny 1by whyyty b8ynyw kmt8t8 whb1ty 8ly qllh wl1 brkh my father peradventure will feel me, and i seem to him as a deceiver; and i bring a curse upon me, and not a knee-fluffy-blessing. ’ulay yemusheni ’abi vehayiti be‘enav kimta‘tea‘, vehebeti ‘alay qelalah velo berakhah.
wt1mr lw 1mw 8ly qlltk bny 1k Sm8 bqly wlk qH ly and his mother said unto him, upon me be thy curse, my child-between: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them. vatomer lo ’imo ‘alay qilatekha beni, ’akh shema‘ beqoli velekh qakh li.
wylk wyqH wyb1 l1mw wt8S 1mw mT8mym k1Sr 1hb 1byw and he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savory meat, such as his father loved. vayelekh vayiqakh vayabei le’imo, vata‘as ’imo mat‘amim ka’asher ’aheb ’abiv.

wttn 1t hmT8mym w1t hlHm 1Sr 8Sth byd y8qb bnh and she gave the savory meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her child-between backstreet-jacob. vatiten hamat‘amim ve’et halekhem ’asher ‘asatah, beyad ya‘aqob benah.

wy1mr y8qb 1l 1byw 1nky 8Sw bkrk 8Syty k1Sr dbrt 1ly qwm n1 Sbh w1klh mZydy b8bwr tbrkny npSk and backstreet-jacob said unto his father, i am do-esau thy first born; i have done according as thou badest me: arise, i pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy being may knee-fluffy-bless me. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el ’abiv ’anokhi ‘esav bekhorekha ‘asiti ka’asher dibarta ’elay, qum na shebah ve’akhelah mizedi ba‘abur tebarakhani nafshekha.

wl1 hkyrw ky hyw ydyw kydy 8Sw 1Hyw S8rt wybrkhw and he discerned him not, because his hands were gate-hairy, as his brother do-esau's hands: so he knee-fluffy-blessed him. velo hikiro ki hayu yadav kidei ‘esav ’akhiv se‘irot, vaybarekhehu.
wy1mr 1th zh bny 8Sw wy1mr 1ny and he said, art thou my very child-between do-esau? and he said, i am. vayomer ’atah zeh beni ‘esav, vayomer ’ani.

y8bdwk 8mym wyStHw wyStHww lk l1mym hwh gbyr l1Hyk wyStHww lk bny 1mk 1rryk 1rwr wmbrkyk brwk let with-mum-people work for thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord-base over thy brethren, and let thy mother's children-betweens bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and knee-fluffy-blessed be he that knee-fluffy-blesseth thee. ya‘abdukha ‘amim veyishtakhavu lekha le’umim heveh gebir le’akhekha veyishtakhavu lekha benei ’imekha, ’orerekha ’arur umebarakhekha barukh.

wyHrd yZHq Hrdh gdlh 8d m1d wy1mr my 1pw1 hw1 hZd Zyd wyb1 ly w1kl mkl bTrm tbw1 w1brkhw gm brwk yhyh and laughter-isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and i have eaten of all before-turns thou camest, and have knee-fluffy-blessed him? yea, and he be knee-fluffy-blessed. vayekherad yizkhaq kharadah gedolah ‘ad me’od vayomer mi ’efo hu hazad zayid vayabei li va’okhal mikol beterem tabo va’abarakhehu, gam barukh yihyeh.

wy1mr b1 1Hyk bmrmh wyqH brktk and he said, thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy knee-fluffy-blessing. vayomer ba ’akhikha bemirmah, vayiqakh birkhatekha.
wy1mr hky qr1 Smw y8qb wy8qbny zh p8mym 1t bkrty lqH whnh 8th lqH brkty wy1mr hl1 1Zlt ly brkh and he said, is not he rightly named backstreet-jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my knee-fluffy-blessing. and he said, hast thou not reserved a knee-fluffy-blessing for me? vayomer hakhi qara shemo ya‘aqob vaya‘qebeni zeh fa‘amayim bekhorati laqakh vehineh ‘atah laqakh birkhati, vayomar halo ’azalta li berakhah.
wy8n yZHq wy1mr l8Sw hn gbyr Smtyw lk w1t kl 1Hyw ntty lw l8bdym wdgn wtyrS smktyw wlkh 1pw1 mh 18Sh bny and laughter-isaac answered and said unto do-esau, behold, i have made him thy lord-base, and all his brethren have i given to him for workers; and with corn-swimming and wine-inherit have i sustained him: and what i do now unto thee, my child-between? vaya‘an yizkhaq vayomer le‘esav hen gebir samtiv lakh ve’et kal ’ekhav natati lo la‘abadim vedagan vetirosh semakhtiv, ulekhah ’efo mah ’e‘eseh beni.
wy1mr 8Sw 1l 1byw hbrkh 1Ht hw1 lk 1by brkny gm 1ny 1by wyS1 8Sw qlw wybk and do-esau said unto his father, hast thou and one knee-fluffy-blessing, my father? knee-fluffy-bless me, even me also, o my father. and do-esau lifted up his voice, and wept. vayomer ‘esav ’el ’abiv habrakhah ’akhat hi lekha ’abi barakheni gam ’ani ’abi, vayisa ‘esav qolo vayebek.
wy8n yZHq 1byw wy1mr 1lyw hnh mSmny h1rZ yhyh mwSbk wmTl hSmym m8l and laughter-isaac his father answered and said unto him, behold, thy dwelling be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of namespaces from above; vaya‘an yizkhaq ’abiv vayomer ’elav, hineh mishmanei ha’arez yihyeh moshabekha umital hashamayim me‘al.
w8l Hrbk tHyh w1t 1Hyk t8bd whyh k1Sr tryd wprqt 8lw m8l Zw1rk and by thy sword thou live, and work for thy brother; and it come to pass when thou have the dominion, that thou break his yoke from off thy neck. ve‘al kharbekha tikhyeh ve’et ’akhikha ta‘abod, vehayah ka’asher tarid ufaraqta ‘ulo me‘al zavarekha.
wySTm 8Sw 1t y8qb 8l hbrkh 1Sr brkw 1byw wy1mr 8Sw blbw yqrbw ymy 1bl 1by w1hrgh 1t y8qb 1Hy and do-esau hated backstreet-jacob because of the knee-fluffy-blessing wherewith his father knee-fluffy-blessed him: and do-esau said in his heart, the days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will i slay my brother backstreet-jacob. vayistom ‘esav ya‘aqob ‘al haberakhah ’asher berakho ’abiv, vayomer ‘esav belibo yiqrebu yemei ’ebel ’abi ve’ahargah ya‘aqob ’akhi.
wygd lrbqh 1t dbry 8Sw bnh hgdl wtSlH wtqr1 ly8qb bnh hqTn wt1mr 1lyw hnh 8Sw 1Hyk mtnHm lk lhrgk and these bee-words of do-esau her elder child-between were told to stall-rebekah: and she sent and called backstreet-jacob her younger child-between, and said unto him, behold, thy brother do-esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee. vayugad leribqah dibrei ‘esav benah hagadol, vatishlakh vatiqra leya‘aqob benah haqatan vatomer ’elav hineh ‘esav ’akhikha mitnakhem lekha leharegekha.
w8th bny Sm8 bqly wqwm brH lk 1l lbn 1Hy Hrnh now therefore, my child-between, obey my voice; arise, flee thou to white-laban my brother to conceived-gladness-haran; ve‘atah beni shema‘ beqoli, vequm berakh ’el laban ’akhi kharanah.
wySbt 8mw ymym 1Hdym 8d 1Sr tSwb Hmt 1Hyk and tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away; veyashabta ‘imo yamim ’akhadim, ‘ad ’asher tashub khamat ’akhikha.
8d Swb 1p 1Hyk mmk wSkH 1t 1Sr 8Syt lw wSlHty wlqHtyk mSm lmh 1Skl gm Snykm ywm 1Hd until thy brother's nose-anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then i will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should i be deprived also of you both in one day? ‘ad shub ’af ’akhikha mimekha veshakhakh ’asher ‘asita lo veshalakhti uleqakhtikha misham, lamah ’eshkal gam shenekhem yom ’ekhad.
wt1mr rbqh 1l yZHq qZty bHyy mpny bnwt Ht 1m lqH y8qb 1Sh mbnwt Ht k1lh mbnwt h1rZ lmh ly Hyym and stall-rebekah said to laughter-isaac, i am weary of my life because of children-betweenesss of bold-heth: if backstreet-jacob take a woman of children-betweenesss of bold-heth, such as these which are of children-betweenesss of the land, what good my life do me? vatomer ribqah ’el yizkhaq qazti bekhayay mipenei benot khet, ’im loqeakh ya‘aqob ’ishah mibenot khet ka’eleh mibenot ha’arez lamah li khayim.
wyqr1 yZHq 1l y8qb wybrk 1tw wyZwhw wy1mr lw l1 tqH 1Sh mbnwt kn8n and laughter-isaac called backstreet-jacob, and knee-fluffy-blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, no take a woman of children-betweenesss of mobile-trade-canaan. vayiqra yizkhaq ’el ya‘aqob vaybarekh ’oto, vayzavehu vayomer lo lo tiqakh ’ishah mibenot kena‘an.
qwm lk pdnh 1rm byth btw1l 1by 1mk wqH lk mSm 1Sh mbnwt lbn 1Hy 1mk arise, go to redeemed-stack-padanaram, to the daughter-house of his-house-towards-bethuel thy mother's father; and take thee a woman from thence of children-betweenesss of white-laban thy mother's brother. qum lekh ’aram betah betu’el ’abi ’imekha, veqakh lekha misham ’ishah mibenot laban ’akhi ’imekha.
w1l Sdy ybrk 1tk wyprk wyrbk whyyt lqhl 8mym and towards-these-elohim almighty knee-fluffy-bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of with-mum-people; ve’el shaday yebarekh ’otekha veyafrekha veyarbekha, vehayita liqhal ‘amim.
wytn lk 1t brkt 1brhm lk wlzr8k 1tk lrStk 1t 1rZ mgryk 1Sr ntn 1lhym l1brhm and give thee the knee-fluffy-blessing of their-dick-abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which towards-these-elohim gave unto their-dick-abraham. veyiten lekha birkat ’abraham lekha ulezar‘akha ’itakh, lerishtekha ’erez megurekha ’asher natan ’elohim le’abraham.
wySlH yZHq 1t y8qb wylk pdnh 1rm 1l lbn bn btw1l h1rmy 1Hy rbqh 1m y8qb w8Sw and laughter-isaac sent away backstreet-jacob: and he went to redeemed-stack-padanaram unto white-laban, child-between of his-house-towards-bethuel the high-arami, the brother of stall-rebekah, backstreet-jacob's and do-esau's mother. vayishlakh yizkhaq ya‘aqob vayelekh ’aram, ’el laban ben betu’el ha’arami ’akhi ribqah ’em ya‘aqob ve‘esav.
wyr1 8Sw ky brk yZHq 1t y8qb wSlH 1tw pdnh 1rm lqHt lw mSm 1Sh bbrkw 1tw wyZw 8lyw l1mr l1 tqH 1Sh mbnwt kn8n when do-esau saw that laughter-isaac had knee-fluffy-blessed backstreet-jacob, and sent him away to redeemed-stack-padanaram, to take him a woman from thence; and that as he knee-fluffy-blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, no take a woman of children-betweenesss of mobile-trade-canaan; vayar ‘esav ki berakh yizkhaq ya‘aqob veshilakh ’oto ’aram laqakhat lo misham ’ishah, bebarakho ’oto vayzav ‘alav lemor lo tiqakh ’ishah mibenot kena‘an.
wySm8 y8qb 1l 1byw w1l 1mw wylk pdnh 1rm and that backstreet-jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to redeemed-stack-padanaram; vayishma‘ ya‘aqob ’abiv ve’el ’imo, vayelekh ’aram.
wyr1 8Sw ky r8wt bnwt kn8n b8yny yZHq 1byw and do-esau seeing that children-betweenesss of mobile-trade-canaan pleased not laughter-isaac his father; vayar ‘esav ki ra‘ot benot kena‘an, be‘enei yizkhaq ’abiv.
wylk 8Sw 1l ySm81l wyqH 1t mHlt bt ySm81l bn 1brhm 1Hwt nbywt 8l nSyw lw l1Sh then went do-esau unto towards-hears-ishmael, and took unto the women which he had mahalath the daughter-hoof-bat-child of towards-hears-ishmael their-dick-abraham's child-between, the sister of lets-house-nebajoth, to be his woman. vayelekh ‘esav ’el yishma‘el, vayiqakh makhalat bat yishma‘el ben ’abraham ’akhot nebayot ‘al nashav lo le’ishah.
wyZ1 y8qb mb1r Sb8 wylk Hrnh and backstreet-jacob went out from well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba, and went toward conceived-gladness-haran. vayezei ya‘aqob mibe’er shaba‘, vayelekh kharanah.
wypg8 bmqwm wyln Sm ky b1 hSmS wyqH m1bny hmqwm wySm mr1Styw wySkb bmqwm hhw1 and he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep. vayifga‘ bamaqom vayalen sham ki ba hashemesh vayiqakh me’abnei hamaqom vayasem mera’ashotav, vayishkab bamaqom hahu.
