wyHlm whnh slm mZb 1rZh wr1Sw mgy8 hSmymh whnh ml1ky 1lhym 8lym wyrdym bw and he dreamed, and behold a dabble-helix set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to namespaces: and behold the angel-messangers of towards-these-elohim ascending and descending on it. vayakhalom vehineh sulam muzab ’arzah verosho magia‘ hashamayemah, vehineh mal’akhei ’elohim ‘olim veyoredim bo.
whnh yhwh nZb 8lyw wy1mr 1ny yhwh 1lhy 1brhm 1byk w1lhy yZHq h1rZ 1Sr 1th Skb 8lyh lk 1tnnh wlzr8k and, behold, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou stood above it, and said, i am yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham thy father, and the towards-these-elohim of laughter-isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will i give it, and to thy seed; vehineh yhvh nizab ‘alav vayomar ’ani yhvh ’elohei ’abraham ’abikha velohei yizkhaq, ha’arez ’asher ’atah shokheb ‘aleha lekha ’etenenah ulezar‘ekha.
whyh zr8k k8pr h1rZ wprZt ymh wqdmh wZpnh wngbh wnbrkw bk kl mSpHt h1dmh wbzr8k and thy seed be as the dust of the earth, and thou spread abroad to the sea-west, and to the east, and to the hide-north, and to the dry-south: and in thee and in thy seed all the families of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed. vehayah zar‘akha ka‘afar ha’arez ufarazta yamah vaqedemah vezafonah vanegbah, venibrakhu bekha kal mishpekhot ha’adamah ubezar‘ekha.
whnh 1nky 8mk wSmrtyk bkl 1Sr tlk whSbtyk 1l h1dmh hz1t ky l1 18zbk 8d 1Sr 1m 8Syty 1t 1Sr dbrty lk and, behold, i am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for i will not leave thee, until i have done that which i have bee-spoken to thee of. vehineh ’anokhi ‘imakh ushemartikha bekhol ’asher telekh vahashibotikha ’el ha’adamah hazot, ki lo ’e‘ezabekha ‘ad ’asher ‘asiti ’asher dibarti lakh.
wyyqZ y8qb mSntw wy1mr 1kn yS yhwh bmqwm hzh w1nky l1 yd8ty and backstreet-jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, surely yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou is in this place; and i hand-knew it not. vayiqaz ya‘aqob mishenato vayomer ’akhen yesh yhvh bamaqom hazeh, ve’anokhi lo yada‘eti.
wyyr1 wy1mr mh nwr1 hmqwm hzh 1yn zh ky 1m byt 1lhym wzh S8r hSmym and he was afraid, and said, how dreadful is this place! this is none other and the daughter-house of towards-these-elohim, and this is the hair-gate of namespaces. vayira vayomar mah nora hamaqom hazeh, ’en zeh ki ’im bet ’elohim vezeh sha‘ar hashamayim.
wySkm y8qb bbqr wyqH 1t h1bn 1Sr Sm mr1Styw wySm 1th mZbh wyZq Smn 8l r1Sh and backstreet-jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the father-child-stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a column-stand, and poured name-from-oil upon the head of it. vayashkem ya‘aqob baboqer vayiqakh ha’eben ’asher sam mera’ashotav vayasem ’otah mazebah, vayizoq shemen ‘al roshah.
wyqr1 1t Sm hmqwm hhw1 byt 1l w1wlm lwz Sm h8yr lr1Snh and he called the name of that place house-of-towards-bethel: and the name of that light-city was called hazel-luz at the first. vayiqra shem hamaqom hahu ’el, ve’ulam luz shem ha‘ir larishonah.
wydr y8qb ndr l1mr 1m yhyh 1lhym 8mdy wSmrny bdrk hzh 1Sr 1nky hwlk wntn ly lHm l1kl wbgd llbS and backstreet-jacob vowed a vow, saying, if towards-these-elohim will be with me, and will keep me in this way that i go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on, vayidar ya‘aqob neder lemor, ’im yihyeh ’elohim ‘imadi ushemarani baderekh hazeh ’asher ’anokhi holekh venatan li lekhem le’ekhol ubeged lilbosh.
wSbty bSlwm 1l byt 1by whyh yhwh ly l1lhym so that i come again to my father's daughter-house in peace; then yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou be my towards-these-elohim: veshabti beshalom ’el bet ’abi, vehayah yhvh li lelohim.
wh1bn hz1t 1Sr Smty mZbh yhyh byt 1lhym wkl 1Sr ttn ly 8Sr 18Srnw lk and this father-child-stone, which i have set for a column-stand, be towards-these-elohim's daughter-house: and of all that thou give me i will surely give the tenth unto thee. veha’eben hazot ’asher samti mazebah yihyeh bet ’elohim, vekhol ’asher titen li ‘aser ’a‘aserenu lakh.
wyS1 y8qb rglyw wylk 1rZh bny qdm then backstreet-jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the with-mum-people of the east. vayisa ya‘aqob raglav, vayelekh ’arzah bene qedem.
wyr1 whnh b1r bSdh whnh Sm SlSh 8dry Z1n rbZym 8lyh ky mn hb1r hhw1 ySqw h8drym wh1bn gdlh 8l py hb1r and he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great father-child-stone was upon the well's mouth. vayar vehineh be’er basadeh vehineh sham sheloshah ‘edre zon robezim ‘aleha ki min habe’er hahiv yashqu ha‘adarim, veha’eben gedolah ‘al pi habe’er.
wn1spw Smh kl h8drym wgllw 1t h1bn m8l py hb1r whSqw 1t hZ1n whSybw 1t h1bn 8l py hb1r lmqmh and thither were all the flocks added: and they rolled the father-child-stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the father-child-stone again upon the well's mouth in his place. vene’esfu shamah khal ha‘adarim vegalalu ha’eben me‘al pi habe’er vehishqu hazon, veheshibu ha’eben ‘al pi habe’er limqomah.
wy1mr lhm y8qb 1Hy m1yn 1tm wy1mrw mHrn 1nHnw and backstreet-jacob said unto them, my brethren, whence be ye? and they said, of conceived-gladness-haran are we. vayomer lahem ya‘aqob ’akhay me’ayin ’atem, vayomeru mekharan ’anakhenu.
wy1mr lhm hyd8tm 1t lbn bn nHwr wy1mrw yd8nw and he said unto them, hand-know ye white-laban child-between of snore-nahor? and they said, we hand-know him. vayomer lahem hayda‘tem laban ben nakhor, vayomeru yada‘enu.
wy1mr lhm hSlwm lw wy1mrw Slwm whnh rHl btw b1h 8m hZ1n and he said unto them, is he well? and they said, he is well: and, behold, ewe-rachel his daughter-hoof-bat-child cometh with the sheep. vayomer lahem hashalom lo, vayomeru shalom vehineh rakhel bito ba’ah ‘im hazon.
wy1mr hn 8wd hywm gdwl l1 8t h1sp hmqnh hSqw hZ1n wlkw r8w and he said, lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the in-them-animal should be added together: from-waters ye the sheep, and go and feed them. vayomer hen ‘od hayom gadol lo ‘et he’asef hamiqneh, hashqu hazon ulekhu re‘u.
wy1mrw l1 nwkl 8d 1Sr y1spw kl h8drym wgllw 1t h1bn m8l py hb1r whSqynw hZ1n and they said, we cannot, until all the flocks be added together, and till they roll the father-child-stone from the well's mouth; then we from-waters the sheep. vayomeru lo nukhal ‘ad ’asher ye’asefu kal ha‘adarim vegalalu ha’eben me‘al pi habe’er, vehishqinu hazon.
8wdnw mdbr 8mm wrHl b1h 8m hZ1n 1Sr l1byh ky r8h hw1 and while he yet spake with them, ewe-rachel came with her father's sheep; for she kept them. ‘odenu medaber ‘imam, verakhel ba’ah ‘im hazon ’asher le’abiha ki ro‘ah hi
wyhy k1Sr r1h y8qb 1t rHl bt lbn 1Hy 1mw w1t Z1n lbn 1Hy 1mw wygS y8qb wygl 1t h1bn m8l py hb1r wySq 1t Z1n lbn 1Hy 1mw and it came to pass, when backstreet-jacob saw ewe-rachel the daughter-hoof-bat-child of white-laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of white-laban his mother's brother, that backstreet-jacob went near, and rolled the father-child-stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of white-laban his mother's brother. vayhi ka’asher ra’ah ya‘aqob rakhel bat laban ’akhi ’imo ve’et zon laban ’akhi ’imo, vayigash ya‘aqob vayagel ha’eben me‘al pi habe’er vayashq zon laban ’akhi ’imo.
wySq y8qb lrHl wyS1 1t qlw wybk and backstreet-jacob kissed ewe-rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept. vayishaq ya‘aqob lerakhel, vayisa qolo vayebek.
wygd y8qb lrHl ky 1Hy 1byh hw1 wky bn rbqh hw1 wtrZ wtgd l1byh and backstreet-jacob told ewe-rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was stall-rebekah's child-between: and she ran and told her father. vayaged ya‘aqob lerakhel ki ’akhi ’abiha hu vekhi ben ribqah hu, vataraz vataged le’abiha.
wyhy kSm8 lbn 1t Sm8 y8qb bn 1Htw wyrZ lqr1tw wyHbq lw wynSq lw wyby1hw 1l bytw wyspr llbn 1t kl hdbrym h1lh and it came to pass, when white-laban heard the tidings of backstreet-jacob his sister's child-between, that he ran to until-witness him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his daughter-house. and he told white-laban all these things. vayhi khishmoa‘ laban shema‘ ya‘aqob ben ’akhoto vayaraz liqrato vaykhabeq lo vaynasheq lo vaybi’ehu ’el beto, vaysaper lelaban kal hadebarim ha’eleh.
wy1mr lw lbn 1k 8Zmy wbSry 1th wySb 8mw HdS ymym and white-laban said to him, surely thou art my bone and my flesh. and he abode with him the space of a month. vayomer lo laban ’akh ‘azmi ubesari ’atah, vayesheb ‘imo khodesh yamim.
wy1mr lbn ly8qb hky 1Hy 1th w8bdtny Hnm hgydh ly mh mSkrtk and white-laban said unto backstreet-jacob, because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore work for me for nought? tell me, what thy wages be? vayomer laban leya‘aqob hakhi ’akhi ’atah va‘abadtani khinam, hagidah li mah maskurtekha.
wllbn Sty bnwt Sm hgdlh l1h wSm hqTnh rHl and white-laban had two children-betweenesss: the name of the elder was tired-leah, and the name of the younger was ewe-rachel. ulelaban shetei banot, shem hagedolah le’ah veshem haqetanah rakhel.
w8yny l1h rkwt wrHl hyth ypt t1r wypt mr1h tired-leah was tender eyed; and ewe-rachel was beautiful and well favored. ve‘enei le’ah rakot, verakhel hayetah yefat to’ar vifat mar’eh.
wy1hb y8qb 1t rHl wy1mr 18bdk Sb8 Snym brHl btk hqTnh and backstreet-jacob loved ewe-rachel; and said, i will work for thee seven years for ewe-rachel thy younger daughter-hoof-bat-child. vaye’ehab ya‘aqob rakhel, vayomer ’e‘ebadekha sheba‘ shanim berakhel bitekha haqetanah.
wy1mr lbn Twb tty 1th lk mtty 1th l1yS 1Hr Sbh 8mdy and white-laban said, it is better that i give her to thee, than that i should give her to another man: abide with me. vayomer laban tob titi ’otah lakh mititi ’otah le’ish ’akher, shebah ‘imadi.
wy8bd y8qb brHl Sb8 Snym wyhyw b8ynyw kymym 1Hdym b1hbtw 1th and backstreet-jacob worked for seven years for ewe-rachel; and they seemed unto him and a few days, for the love he had to her. vaya‘abod ya‘aqob berakhel sheba‘ shanim, vayihyu be‘enav keyamim ’akhadim be’ahabato ’otah.
wy1mr y8qb 1l lbn hbh 1t 1Sty ky ml1w ymy w1bw1h 1lyh and backstreet-jacob said unto white-laban, give me my woman, for my days are fulfilled, that i may go in unto her. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el laban habah ’ishti ki male’u yamay, ve’abo’ah ’eleha.
wy1sp lbn 1t kl 1nSy hmqwm wy8S mSth and white-laban added together all the men of the place, and made a until-conception. vaye’esof laban kal ’anshei hamaqom vaya‘as mishteh.
wyhy b8rb wyqH 1t l1h btw wyb1 1th 1lyw wyb1 1lyh and it came to pass in the evening, that he took tired-leah his daughter-hoof-bat-child, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her. vayhi ba‘ereb vayiqakh le’ah bito vayabei ’otah ’elav, vayabo ’eleha.
wytn lbn lh 1t zlph SpHtw ll1h btw SpHh and white-laban gave unto his daughter-hoof-bat-child tired-leah sprinkle-zilpah his maid for an handmaid. vayiten laban zilpah shifkhato, lele’ah bito shifkhah.
wyhy bbqr whnh hw1 l1h wy1mr 1l lbn mh z1t 8Syt ly hl1 brHl 8bdty 8mk wlmh rmytny and it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was tired-leah: and he said to white-laban, what is this thou hast done unto me? did not i work for with thee for ewe-rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me? vayhi baboqer vehineh hi le’ah, vayomer ’el laban mah zot ‘asita li halo berakhel ‘abadti ‘imakh velamah rimitani.
wy1mr lbn l1 y8Sh kn bmqwmnw ltt hZ8yrh lpny hbkyrh and white-laban said, it must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before-turns the firstborn. vayomer laban lo ye‘aseh khen bimqomenu, latet haze‘irah lifnei habekhirah.
ml1 Sb8 z1t wntnh lk gm 1t z1t b8bdh 1Sr t8bd 8mdy 8wd Sb8 Snym 1Hrwt fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the work which thou work for with me yet seven other years. malei shebua‘ zot, venitenah lekha gam zot ba‘abodah ’asher ta‘abod ‘imadi ‘od sheba‘ shanim ’akherot.
wy8S y8qb kn wyml1 Sb8 z1t wytn lw 1t rHl btw lw l1Sh and backstreet-jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him ewe-rachel his daughter-hoof-bat-child to woman also. vaya‘as ya‘aqob ken vaymalei shebua‘ zot, vayiten lo rakhel bito lo le’ishah.
wytn lbn lrHl btw 1t blhh SpHtw lh lSpHh and white-laban gave to ewe-rachel his daughter-hoof-bat-child good-times-bilhah his handmaid to be her maid. vayiten laban lerakhel bito bilhah shifkhato, lah leshifkhah.
wyb1 gm 1l rHl wy1hb gm 1t rHl ml1h wy8bd 8mw 8wd Sb8 Snym 1Hrwt and he went in also unto ewe-rachel, and he loved also ewe-rachel more than tired-leah, and worked for with him yet seven other years. vayabo gam ’el rakhel vaye’ehab gam rakhel mile’ah, vaya‘abod ‘imo ‘od sheba‘ shanim ’akherot.
wyr1 yhwh ky Snw1h l1h wyptH 1t rHmh wrHl 8qrh and when yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou saw that tired-leah was hated, he opened her womb: and ewe-rachel was barren. vayar yhvh ki senu’ah le’ah vayiftakh rakhmah, verakhel ‘aqarah.
wthr l1h wtld bn wtqr1 Smw r1wbn ky 1mrh ky r1h yhwh b8nyy ky 8th y1hbny 1ySy and tired-leah conceived, and conceived-of a child-between, and she called his name buddy-see-child-reuben: for she said, surely yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my man will love me. vatahar le’ah vateled ben vatiqra shemo re’uben, ki ’amerah ki ra’ah yhvh be‘anyi ki ‘atah ye’ehabani ’ishi.
wthr 8wd wtld bn wt1mr ky Sm8 yhwh ky Snw1h 1nky wytn ly gm 1t zh wtqr1 Smw Sm8wn and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between; and said, because yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath heard i was hated, he hath therefore given me this child-between also: and she called his name hear-home-simeon. vatahar ‘od vateled ben vatomer ki shama‘ yhvh ki senu’ah ’anokhi vayiten li gam zeh, vatiqra shemo shim‘on.
wthr 8wd wtld bn wt1mr 8th hp8m ylwh 1ySy 1ly ky yldty lw SlSh bnym 8l kn qr1 Smw lwy and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between; and said, now this time will my man be joined unto me, because i have born him three children-betweens: therefore was his name called join-levi. vatahar ‘od vateled ben vatomer ‘atah hapa‘am yilaveh ’ishi ’elay ki yaladti lo sheloshah banim, ‘al ken qara shemo levi.
wthr 8wd wtld bn wt1mr hp8m 1wdh 1t yhwh 8l kn qr1h Smw yhwdh wt8md mldt and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between: and she said, now will i praise yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou: therefore she called his name know-judah; and left bearing. vatahar ‘od vateled ben vatomer hapa‘am ’odeh yhvh ‘al ken qare’ah shemo yehudah, vata‘amod miledet.
wtr1 rHl ky l1 yldh ly8qb wtqn1 rHl b1Hth wt1mr 1l y8qb hbh ly bnym w1m 1yn mth 1nky and when ewe-rachel saw that she conceived-of backstreet-jacob no children-betweens, ewe-rachel envied her sister; and said unto backstreet-jacob, give me children-betweens, or else i die. vatere rakhel ki lo yaledah leya‘aqob vateqanei rakhel ba’akhotah, vatomer ’el ya‘aqob habah li banim ve’im ’ayin metah ’anokhi.
wyHr 1p y8qb brHl wy1mr htHt 1lhym 1nky 1Sr mn8 mmk pry bTn and backstreet-jacob's nose-anger was kindled against ewe-rachel: and he said, am i in towards-these-elohim's stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb? vayikhar ’af ya‘aqob berakhel, vayomer hatakhat ’elohim ’anokhi ’asher mana‘ mimekh peri baten.
wt1mr hnh 1mty blhh b1 1lyh wtld 8l brky w1bnh gm 1nky mmnh and she said, behold my maid good-times-bilhah, go in unto her; and she bear upon my knees, that i may also have children-betweens by her. vatomer hineh ’amati bilhah bo ’eleha, veteled ‘al birkay ve’ibaneh gam ’anokhi mimenah.
wttn lw 1t blhh SpHth l1Sh wyb1 1lyh y8qb and she gave him good-times-bilhah her handmaid to woman: and backstreet-jacob went in unto her. vatiten lo ’et bilhah shifkhatah le’ishah, vayabo ’eleha ya‘aqob.
wthr blhh wtld ly8qb bn and good-times-bilhah conceived, and conceived-of backstreet-jacob a child-between. vatahar bilhah vateled leya‘aqob ben.
wt1mr rHl dnny 1lhym wgm Sm8 bqly wytn ly bn 8l kn qr1h Smw dn and ewe-rachel said, towards-these-elohim hath decided me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a child-between: therefore called she his name discuss-dan. vatomer rakhel danani ’elohim vegam shama‘ beqoli vayiten li ben, ‘al ken qare’ah shemo dan.
wthr 8wd wtld blhh SpHt rHl bn Sny ly8qb and good-times-bilhah ewe-rachel's maid conceived again, and conceived-of backstreet-jacob a second child-between. vatahar ‘od vateled bilhah shifkhat rakhel, ben sheni leya‘aqob.
wt1mr rHl nptwly 1lhym nptlty 8m 1Hty gm yklty wtqr1 Smw nptly and ewe-rachel said, with great wrestlings have i wrestled with my sister, and i have prevailed: and she called his name twisted-naphtali. vatomer rakhel naftulei ’elohim niftalti ‘im ’akhoti gam yakholeti, vatiqra shemo naftali.
wtr1 l1h ky 8mdh mldt wtqH 1t zlph SpHth wttn 1th ly8qb l1Sh when tired-leah saw that she had left bearing, she took sprinkle-zilpah her maid, and gave her backstreet-jacob to woman. vatere le’ah ki ‘amedah miledet, vatiqakh zilpah shifkhatah vatiten ’otah leya‘aqob le’ishah.
wtld zlph SpHt l1h ly8qb bn and sprinkle-zilpah tired-leah's maid conceived-of backstreet-jacob a child-between. vateled zilpah shifkhat le’ah leya‘aqob ben.
wt1mr l1h bgd b1 gd wtqr1 1t Smw gd and tired-leah said, luck comet: and she called his name luck-gad. vatomer le’ah gad, vatiqra shemo gad.
wtld zlph SpHt l1h bn Sny ly8qb and sprinkle-zilpah tired-leah's maid conceived-of backstreet-jacob a second child-between. vateled zilpah shifkhat le’ah ben sheni leya‘aqob.
wt1mr l1h b1Sry ky 1Srwny bnwt wtqr1 1t Smw 1Sr and tired-leah said, blissful am i, for children-betweenesss will call me knee-fluffy-blessed: and she called his name bliss-asher. vatomer le’ah be’asheri ki ’isheruni banot, vatiqra shemo ’asher.
wylk r1wbn bymy qZyr HTym wymZ1 dwd1ym bSdh wyb1 1tm 1l l1h 1mw wt1mr rHl 1l l1h tny n1 ly mdwd1y bnk and buddy-see-child-reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother tired-leah. then ewe-rachel said to tired-leah, give me, i pray thee, of thy child-between's mandrakes. vayelekh re’uben bimei qezir khitim vayimza duda’im basadeh vayabei ’otam ’el le’ah ’imo, vatomer rakhel ’el le’ah teni na li miduda’ei benekh.
wt1mr lh hm8T qHtk 1t 1ySy wlqHt gm 1t dwd1y bny wt1mr rHl lkn ySkb 8mk hlylh tHt dwd1y bnk and she said unto her, is it a small matter that thou hast taken my man? and wouldest thou take away my child-between's mandrakes also? and ewe-rachel said, therefore he lie with thee to night for thy child-between's mandrakes. vatomer lah ham‘at qakhtekh ’ishi velaqakhat gam duda’ei beni, vatomer rakhel lakhen yishkab ‘imakh halaylah takhat duda’ei benekh.
wyb1 y8qb mn hSdh b8rb wtZ1 l1h lqr1tw wt1mr 1ly tbw1 ky Skr Skrtyk bdwd1y bny wySkb 8mh blylh hw1 and backstreet-jacob came out of the field in the evening, and tired-leah went out to until-witness him, and said, thou must come in unto me; for surely i have hired thee with my child-between's mandrakes. and he lay with her that night. vayabo ya‘aqob min hasadeh ba‘ereb vatezei le’ah liqrato vatomer ’elay tabo ki sakhor sekhartikha beduda’ei beni, vayishkab ‘imah balaylah hu.
wySm8 1lhym 1l l1h wthr wtld ly8qb bn HmySy and towards-these-elohim hearkened unto tired-leah, and she conceived, and conceived-of backstreet-jacob the fifth child-between. vayishma‘ ’elohim ’el le’ah, vatahar vateled leya‘aqob ben khamishi.
wt1mr l1h ntn 1lhym Skry 1Sr ntty SpHty l1ySy wtqr1 Smw ySSkr and tired-leah said, towards-these-elohim hath given me my wage, because i have given my maiden to my man: and she called his name wage-issachar. vatomer le’ah natan ’elohim sekhari ’asher natati shifkhati le’ishi, vatiqra shemo yisashkhar.
wthr 8wd l1h wtld bn SSy ly8qb and tired-leah conceived again, and conceived-of backstreet-jacob the sixth child-between. vatahar ‘od le’ah vateled ben shishi leya‘aqob
wt1mr l1h zbdny 1lhym 1ty zbd Twb hp8m yzblny 1ySy ky yldty lw SSh bnym wtqr1 1t Smw zblwn and tired-leah said, towards-these-elohim hath endued me with a good dowry; now will my man dwell with me, because i have born him six children-betweens: and she called his name fertile-zebulun. vatomer le’ah zebadani ’elohim ’oti zebed tob hapa‘am yizbeleni ’ishi ki yaladti lo shishah banim, vatiqra shemo zebulun.
w1Hr yldh bt wtqr1 1t Smh dynh and afterwards she conceived-of a daughter-hoof-bat-child, and called her name discuss-dinah. ve’akhar yaledah bat, vatiqra shemah dinah.
wyzkr 1lhym 1t rHl wySm8 1lyh 1lhym wyptH 1t rHmh and towards-these-elohim remembered ewe-rachel, and towards-these-elohim hearkened to her, and opened her womb. vayizkor ’elohim rakhel, vayishma‘ ’eleha ’elohim vayiftakh rakhmah.
wthr wtld bn wt1mr 1sp 1lhym 1t Hrpty and she conceived, and conceived-of a child-between; and said, towards-these-elohim hath taken away my reproach: vatahar vateled ben, vatomer ’asaf ’elohim kherpati.
wtqr1 1t Smw ywsp l1mr ysp yhwh ly bn 1Hr and she called his name add-joseph; and said, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou add to me another child-between. vatiqra shemo yosef lemor, yosef yhvh li ben ’akher.
wyhy k1Sr yldh rHl 1t ywsp wy1mr y8qb 1l lbn SlHny w1lkh 1l mqwmy wl1rZy and it came to pass, when ewe-rachel had born add-joseph, that backstreet-jacob said unto white-laban, send me away, that i may go unto mine own place, and to my country. vayhi ka’asher yaledah rakhel yosef, vayomer ya‘aqob ’el laban shalekheni ve’elekhah ’el meqomi ule’arzi.
tnh 1t nSy w1t yldy 1Sr 8bdty 1tk bhn w1lkh ky 1th yd8t 1t 8bdty 1Sr 8bdtyk give me my women and my children-betweens, for whom i have worked for thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my work which i have done thee. tenah ’et nashay ve’et yeladay ’asher ‘abadti ’otekha bahen ve’elekhah, ki ’atah yada‘ta ‘abodati ’asher ‘abadtikha.
wy1mr 1lyw lbn 1m n1 mZ1ty Hn b8ynyk nHSty wybrkny yhwh bgllk and white-laban said unto him, i pray thee, if i have found favor in thine eyes, tarry: for i have learned by experience that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath knee-fluffy-blessed me for thy sake. vayomer ’elav laban ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha, nikhashti vaybarakheni yhvh biglalekha.
wy1mr nqbh Skrk 8ly w1tnh and he said, appoint me thy wages, and i will give it. vayomar, naqebah sekharekha ‘alay ve’etenah.
wy1mr 1lyw 1th yd8t 1t 1Sr 8bdtyk w1t 1Sr hyh mqnk 1ty and he said unto him, thou knowest how i have worked for thee, and how thy in-them-animal was with me. vayomer ’elav ’atah yada‘ta ’asher ‘abadtikha, ve’et ’asher hayah miqnekha ’iti.
ky m8T 1Sr hyh lk lpny wyprZ lrb wybrk yhwh 1tk lrgly w8th mty 18Sh gm 1nky lbyty for it was little which thou hadst before-turns i came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath knee-fluffy-blessed thee since my coming: and now when i provide for mine own daughter-house also? ki me‘at ’asher hayah lekha lefanay vayifroz larob vaybarekh yhvh ’otekha leragli, ve‘atah matay ’e‘eseh gam ’anokhi lebeti.
wy1mr mh 1tn lk wy1mr y8qb l1 ttn ly m1wmh 1m t8Sh ly hdbr hzh 1Swbh 1r8h Z1nk 1Smr and he said, what i give thee? and backstreet-jacob said, no give me any thing: if thou wilt do this thing for me, i will again feed and keep thy flock. vayomer mah ’eten lakh, vayomer ya‘aqob lo titen li me’umah ’im ta‘aseh li hadabar hazeh ’ashubah ’er‘eh zonekha ’eshmor.
18br bkl Z1nk hywm hsr mSm kl Sh nqd wTlw1 wkl Sh Hwm bkSbym wTlw1 wnqd b8zym whyh Skry i will pass through all thy flock to day, removing from thence all the speckled and spotted in-them-animal, and all the brown in-them-animal among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the intense-goats: and of such be my hire. ’e‘ebor bekhal zonekha hayom haser misham kal seh naqod vetalu vekhal seh khum bakesabim vetalu venaqod ba‘izim, vehayah sekhari.
w8nth by Zdqty bywm mHr ky tbw1 8l Skry lpnyk kl 1Sr 1ynnw nqd wTlw1 b8zym wHwm bkSbym gnwb hw1 1ty so my being right answer for me in time to come, when it come for my hire before-turns thy face-turns: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the intense-goats, and brown among the sheep, that be counted stolen with me. ve‘anetah bi zidqati beyom makhar ki tabo ‘al sekhari lefanekha, kol ’asher ’enenu naqod vetalu ba‘izim vekhum bakesabim ganub hu ’iti.
wy1mr lbn hn lw yhy kdbrk and white-laban said, behold, i would it might be according to thy bee-word. vayomer laban hen, lu yehi khidbarekha.
wysr bywm hhw1 1t htySym h8qdym whTl1ym w1t kl h8zym hnqdwt whTl1t kl 1Sr lbn bw wkl Hwm bkSbym wytn byd bnyw and he removed that day the he intense-goats that were ring-streaked and spotted, and all the she intense-goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some to-between-bin-between-build-white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his children-betweens. vayasar bayom hahu hateyashim ha‘aqudim vehatelu’im ve’et kal ha‘izim hanequdot vehatelu’ot kol ’asher laban bo vekhal khum bakesabim, vayiten beyad banav.
wySm drk SlSt ymym bynw wbyn y8qb wy8qb r8h 1t Z1n lbn hnwtrt and he set three days' journey betwixt-bin himself and backstreet-jacob: and backstreet-jacob fed the rest of white-laban's flocks. vayasem derekh sheloshet yamim beno uben ya‘aqob, veya‘aqob ro‘eh zon laban hanotarot.
wyqH lw y8qb mql lbnh lH wlwz w8rmwn wypZl bhn pZlwt lbnwt mHSp hlbn 1Sr 8l hmqlwt and backstreet-jacob took him pens of green poplar, and of the hazel and chestnut tree; and pilled to-between-bin-between-build-white streaks in them, and made the to-between-bin-between-build-white appear which was in the pens. vayiqakh lo ya‘aqob maqal libneh lakh veluz ve‘ermon, vayfazel bahen pezalot lebanot makhsof halaban ’asher ‘al hamaqlot.
wyZg 1t hmqlwt 1Sr pZl brhTym bSqtwt hmym 1Sr tb1n hZ1n lStwt lnkH hZ1n wyHmnh bb1n lStwt and he set the pens which he had pilled before-turns the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink. vayazeg hamaqlot ’asher pizel barohatim beshiqatot hamayim, ’asher tabona hazon lishtot lenokhakh hazon vayekhamnah bebo’an lishtot.
wyHmw hZ1n 1l hmqlwt wtldn hZ1n 8qdym nqdym wTl1ym and the flocks conceived before-turns the pens, and brought forth in-them-animal ring-streaked, speckled, and spotted. vayekhemu hazon ’el hamaqlot, vateladna hazon ‘aqudim nequdim utelu’im.
whkSbym hpryd y8qb wytn pny hZ1n 1l 8qd wkl Hwm bZ1n lbn wySt lw 8drym lbdw wl1 Stm 8l Z1n lbn and backstreet-jacob did separate the lambs, and set the face-turns-turns of the flocks toward the ring-streaked, and all the brown in the flock of white-laban; and he put his own flocks by themselves, and put them not unto white-laban's in-them-animal. vehakesabim hifrid ya‘aqob vayiten penei hazon ’el ‘aqod vekhal khum bezon laban, vayashet lo ‘adarim lebado velo shatam ‘al zon laban.
whyh bkl yHm hZ1n hmqSrwt wSm y8qb 1t hmqlwt l8yny hZ1n brhTym lyHmnh bmqlwt and it came to pass, whensoever the stronger in-them-animal did conceive, that backstreet-jacob laid the pens before-turns the eyes of the in-them-animal in the gutters, that they might conceive among the pens. vehayah bekhal yakhem hazon hamqusharot vesam ya‘aqob hamaqlot le‘enei hazon barohatim, leyakhmenah bamaqlot.
wbh8Typ hZ1n l1 ySym whyh h8Tpym llbn whqSrym ly8qb and when the in-them-animal were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were white-laban's, and the stronger backstreet-jacob's. ubeha‘atif hazon lo yasim, vehayah ha‘atufim lelaban vehaqeshurim leya‘aqob.
wyprZ h1yS m1d m1d wyhy lw Z1n rbwt wSpHwt w8bdym wgmlym wHmrym and the man increased exceedingly, and had much in-them-animal, and maid-mothers, and workers, and ripen-camels, and asses. vayifroz ha’ish me’od me’od, vayhi lo zon rabot ushefakhot va‘abadim ugemalim vakhamorim.
wySm8 1t dbry bny lbn l1mr lqH y8qb 1t kl 1Sr l1bynw wm1Sr l1bynw 8Sh 1t kl hkbd hzh and he heard the bee-words of white-laban's children-betweens, saying, backstreet-jacob hath taken away all that was our father's; and of that which was our father's hath he gotten all this heaviness. vayishma‘ dibrei bene laban lemor laqakh ya‘aqob kal ’asher le’abinu, ume’asher le’abinu ‘asah kal hakabod hazeh.
wyr1 y8qb 1t pny lbn whnh 1ynnw 8mw ktmwl SlSwm and backstreet-jacob beheld the countenance of white-laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before-turns. vayar ya‘aqob penei laban, vehineh ’enenu ‘imo kitmol shilshom.
wy1mr yhwh 1l y8qb Swb 1l 1rZ 1bwtyk wlmwldtk w1hyh 8mk and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto backstreet-jacob, return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and i will be with thee. vayomer yhvh ’el ya‘aqob shub ’el ’erez ’abotekha ulemoladtekha, ve’ehyeh ‘imakh.
wySlH y8qb wyqr1 lrHl wll1h hSdh 1l Z1nw and backstreet-jacob sent and called ewe-rachel and tired-leah to the field unto his flock, vayishlakh ya‘aqob vayiqra lerakhel ulele’ah, hasadeh ’el zono.
wy1mr lhn r1h 1nky 1t pny 1bykn ky 1ynnw 1ly ktml SlSm w1lhy 1by hyh 8mdy and said unto them, i see your father's countenance, that it is not toward me as before-turns; and the towards-these-elohim of my father hath been with me. vayomer lahen ro’eh ’anokhi penei ’abikhen ki ’enenu ’elay kitmol shilshom, velohei ’abi hayah ‘imadi.
w1tnh yd8tn ky bkl kHy 8bdty 1t 1bykn and ye hand-know that with all my dynamic i have worked for your father. ve’atenah yeda‘ten, ki bekhal kokhi ‘abadti ’abikhen.
w1bykn htl by whHlp 1t mSkrty 8Srt mnym wl1 ntnw 1lhym lhr8 8mdy and your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; and towards-these-elohim suffered him not to hurt me. va’abikhen hetel bi vehekhelif maskurti ‘aseret monim, velo netano ’elohim lehara‘ ‘imadi.
1m kh y1mr nqdym yhyh Skrk wyldw kl hZ1n nqdym w1m kh y1mr 8qdym yhyh Skrk wyldw kl hZ1n 8qdym if he said thus, the speckled be thy wages; then all the in-them-animal conceived-of speckled: and if he said thus, the ring-streaked be thy hire; then conceived-of all the in-them-animal ring-streaked. ’im koh yomar nequdim yihyeh sekharekha veyaledu khal hazon nequdim, ve’im koh yomar ‘aqudim yihyeh sekharekha veyaledu khal hazon ‘aqudim.
wyZl 1lhym 1t mqnh 1bykm wytn ly thus towards-these-elohim hath taken away the in-them-animal of your father, and given them to me. vayazel ’elohim miqneh ’abikhem vayiten li.
wyhy b8t yHm hZ1n w1S1 8yny w1r1 bHlwm whnh h8tdym h8lym 8l hZ1n 8qdym nqdym wbrdym and it came to pass at the time that the in-them-animal conceived, that i lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the voiceless-rams which leaped upon the in-them-animal were ring-streaked, speckled, and grizzled. vayhi be‘et yakhem hazon va’esa ‘enay va’ere bakhalom, vehineh ha‘atudim ha‘olim ‘al hazon ‘aqudim nequdim uberudim.
wy1mr 1ly ml1k h1lhym bHlwm y8qb w1mr hnny and the angel-messanger of towards-these-elohim spake unto me in a dream, saying, backstreet-jacob: and i said, here am i. vayomer ’elay mal’akh ha’elohim bakhalom ya‘aqob, va’omar hineni.
wy1mr S1 n1 8ynyk wr1h kl h8tdym h8lym 8l hZ1n 8qdym nqdym wbrdym ky r1yty 1t kl 1Sr lbn 8Sh lk and he said, lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the voiceless-rams which leap upon the in-them-animal are ring-streaked, speckled, and grizzled: for i have seen all that white-laban doeth unto thee. vayomer sa na ‘enekha ure’eh kal ha‘atudim ha‘olim ‘al hazon ‘aqudim nequdim uberudim, ki ra’iti kal ’asher laban ‘oseh lakh.
1nky h1l byt 1l 1Sr mSHt Sm mZbh 1Sr ndrt ly Sm ndr 8th qwm Z1 mn h1rZ hz1t wSwb 1l 1rZ mwldtk i am the towards-these-elohim of house-of-towards-bethel, where thou lubeedst the column-stand, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred. ’anokhi ha’el bet ’el ’asher mashakhta mazebah ’asher nadarta li neder, ‘atah qum zei min ha’arez hazot veshub ’el ’erez moladtekha.
wt8n rHl wl1h wt1mrnh lw h8wd lnw Hlq wnHlh bbyt 1bynw and ewe-rachel and tired-leah answered and said unto him, is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's daughter-house? vata‘an rakhel vele’ah vatomarnah lo, ha‘od lanu kheleq venakhalah bebet ’abinu.
hlw1 nkrywt nHSbnw lw ky mkrnw wy1kl gm 1kwl 1t kspnw are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money. halo nakheriyot nekhshabnu lo ki mekharanu, vayokhal gam ’akhol kaspenu.
ky kl h8Sr 1Sr hZyl 1lhym m1bynw lnw hw1 wlbnynw w8th kl 1Sr 1mr 1lhym 1lyk 8Sh for all the riches which towards-these-elohim hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children-betweens's: now then, whatsoever towards-these-elohim hath said unto thee, do. ki khal ha‘osher ’asher hizil ’elohim me’abinu lanu hu ulebanenu, ve‘atah kol ’amar ’elohim ’elekha ‘aseh.
wyqm y8qb wyS1 1t bnyw w1t nSyw 8l hgmlym then backstreet-jacob rose up, and set his children-betweens and his women upon ripen-camels; vayaqam ya‘aqob, vayisa banav ve’et nashav ‘al hagemalim.
wynhg 1t kl mqnhw w1t kl rkSw 1Sr rkS mqnh qnynw 1Sr rkS bpdn 1rm lbw1 1l yZHq 1byw 1rZh kn8n and he carried away all his in-them-animal, and all his goods which he had gotten, the in-them-animal of his getting, which he had gotten in redeemed-stack-padanaram, for to go to laughter-isaac his father in the land of mobile-trade-canaan. vayinhag kal miqnehu ve’et kal rekhusho ’asher rakhash miqneh qinyano ’asher rakhash befadan ’aram, labo ’el yizkhaq ’abiv ’arzah kena‘an.
wlbn hlk lgzz 1t Z1nw wtgnb rHl 1t htrpym 1Sr l1byh and white-laban went to shear his sheep: and ewe-rachel had stolen the images that were her father's. velaban halakh ligzoz zono, vatignob rakhel haterafim ’asher le’abiha.
wygnb y8qb 1t lb lbn h1rmy 8l bly hgyd lw ky brH hw1 and backstreet-jacob stole away unawares to white-laban the high-arami, in that he told him not that he fled. vayignob ya‘aqob leb laban ha’arami, ‘al beli higid lo ki boreakh hu.
wybrH hw1 wkl 1Sr lw wyqm wy8br 1t hnhr wySm 1t pnyw hr hgl8d so he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face-turns toward the mount roll-until-heap-gilead. vayibrakh hu vekhal ’asher lo vayaqam vaya‘abor hanahar, vayasem panav har hagil‘ad.
wygd llbn bywm hSlySy ky brH y8qb and it was told white-laban on the third day that backstreet-jacob was fled. vayugad lelaban bayom hashelishi, ki barakh ya‘aqob.
wyqH 1t 1Hyw 8mw wyrdp 1Hryw drk Sb8t ymym wydbq 1tw bhr hgl8d and he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount roll-until-heap-gilead. vayiqakh ’ekhav ‘imo vayirdof ’akharav derekh shib‘at yamim, vayadbeq ’oto behar hagil‘ad.
wyb1 1lhym 1l lbn h1rmy bHlm hlylh wy1mr lw hSmr lk pn tdbr 8m y8qb mTwb 8d r8 and towards-these-elohim came to white-laban the high-arami in a dream by night, and said unto him, take heed that thou speak not to backstreet-jacob either good or bad. vayabo ’elohim ’el laban ha’arami bakhalom halayelah, vayomer lo hishamer lekha pen tedaber ‘im ya‘aqob mitob ‘ad ra‘.
wySg lbn 1t y8qb wy8qb tq8 1t 1hlw bhr wlbn tq8 1t 1Hyw bhr hgl8d then white-laban overtook backstreet-jacob. now backstreet-jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and white-laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of roll-until-heap-gilead. vayaseg laban ya‘aqob, veya‘aqob taqa‘ ’aholo bahar velaban taqa‘ ’et ’ekhav behar hagil‘ad.
wy1mr lbn ly8qb mh 8Syt wtgnb 1t lbby wtnhg 1t bnty kSbywt Hrb and white-laban said to backstreet-jacob, what hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my children-betweenesss, as captives taken with the sword? vayomer laban leya‘aqob meh ‘asita vatignob lebabi, vatenaheg benotay kishbuyot khareb.
lmh nHb1t lbrH wtgnb 1ty wl1 hgdt ly w1SlHk bSmHh wbSrym btp wbknwr wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that i might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp? lamah nakhbeta libroakh vatignob ’oti, velo higadta li va’ashalekhakha besimkhah ubeshirim betof ubekhinor.
wl1 nTStny lnSq lbny wlbnty 8th hsklt 8Sw and hast not suffered me to kiss my children-betweens and my children-betweenesss? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing. velo netashtani lenasheq lebanay velibnotay, ‘atah hiskalta ‘aso.
yS l1l ydy l8Swt 8mkm r8 w1lhy 1bykm 1mS 1mr 1ly l1mr hSmr lk mdbr 8m y8qb mTwb 8d r8 it is in the dynamic of my hand to do you hurt: and the towards-these-elohim of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, take thou heed that thou speak not to backstreet-jacob either good or bad. yesh le’el yadi la‘asot ‘imakhem ra‘, velohei ’abikhem ’emesh ’amar ’elay lemor hishamer midaber ‘im ya‘aqob mitob ‘ad ra‘.
w8th hlk hlkt ky nksp nkspth lbyt 1byk lmh gnbt 1t 1lhy and now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father's daughter-house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my towards-these-elohim? ve‘atah halokh halakhta ki nikhsof nikhsaftah lebet ’abikha, lamah ganabta ’elohay.
wy8n y8qb wy1mr llbn ky yr1ty ky 1mrty pn tgzl 1t bnwtyk m8my and backstreet-jacob answered and said to white-laban, because i was afraid: for i said, peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy children-betweenesss from me. vaya‘an ya‘aqob vayomer lelaban, ki yareti ki ’amarti pen tigzol benotekha me‘imi.
8m 1Sr tmZ1 1t 1lhyk l1 yHyh ngd 1Hynw hkr lk mh 8mdy wqH lk wl1 yd8 y8qb ky rHl gnbtm with whomsoever thou findest thy towards-these-elohim, let him not live: before-turns our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. for backstreet-jacob hand-knew not that ewe-rachel had stolen them. ‘im ’asher timza ’elohekha lo yikhyeh neged ’akhenu haker lekha mah ‘imadi veqakh lakh, velo yada‘ ya‘aqob ki rakhel genabatam.
wyb1 lbn b1hl y8qb wb1hl l1h wb1hl Sty h1mht wl1 mZ1 wyZ1 m1hl l1h wyb1 b1hl rHl and white-laban went into backstreet-jacob's tent, and into tired-leah's tent, and into the two maid-mothers' tents; and he found them not. then went he out of tired-leah's tent, and entered into ewe-rachel's tent. vayabo laban be’ohel ya‘aqob ube’ohel le’ah ube’ohel shetei ha’amahot velo maza, vayezei me’ohel le’ah vayabo be’ohel rakhel.
wrHl lqHh 1t htrpym wtSmm bkr hgml wtSb 8lyhm wymSS lbn 1t kl h1hl wl1 mZ1 now ewe-rachel had taken the images, and put them in the ripen-camel's all-tool, and sat upon them. and white-laban searched all the tent, and found them not. verakhel laqekhah haterafim vatesimem bekhar hagamal vatesheb ‘alehem, vaymashesh laban kal ha’ohel velo maza.
wt1mr 1l 1byh 1l yHr b8yny 1dny ky lw1 1wkl lqwm mpnyk ky drk nSym ly wyHpS wl1 mZ1 1t htrpym and she said to her father, let it not displease my lord-base that i cannot rise up before-turns thee; for the custom of women is upon me. and he searched and found not the images. vatomer ’el ’abiha ’al be‘enei ’adoni ki lo ’ukhal laqum mipanekha ki derekh nashim li, vaykhapes velo maza haterafim.
wyHr ly8qb wyrb blbn wy8n y8qb wy1mr llbn mh pS8y mh HT1ty ky dlqt 1Hry and backstreet-jacob was wroth, and chode with white-laban: and backstreet-jacob answered and said to white-laban, what is my fire-name? what is my miss, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me? vayikhar leya‘aqob vayareb belaban, vaya‘an ya‘aqob vayomer lelaban mah pish‘i mah khatati ki dalaqta ’akharay.
ky mSSt 1t kl kly mh mZ1t mkl kly bytk Sym kh ngd 1Hy w1Hyk wywkyHw byn Snynw whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy daughter-household stuff? set it here before-turns my brethren and thy brethren, that they may decide betwixt-bin us both. ki mishashta kal kelay mah mazata mikol kele betekha sim koh neged ’akhay ve’akhekha, veyokhikhu ben shenenu.
zh 8Srym Snh 1nky 8mk rHlyk w8zyk l1 Sklw w1yly Z1nk l1 1klty this double-ten-twenty years have i been with thee; thy ewes and thy she intense-goats have not cast their young, and the voiceless-rams of thy flock have i not eaten. zeh ‘esrim shanah ’anokhi ‘imakh rekhelekha ve‘izekha lo shikelu, ve’elei zonekha lo ’akhaleti.
Trph l1 hb1ty 1lyk 1nky 1HTnh mydy tbqSnh gnbty ywm wgnbty lylh that which was torn of beasts i brought not unto thee; i conceived-of the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night. terefah lo hebeti ’elekha ’anokhi ’akhatenah miyadi tebaqshenah, genubti yom ugenubti layelah.
hyyty bywm 1klny Hrb wqrH blylh wtdd Snty m8yny thus i was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes. hayiti bayom ’akhalani khoreb veqerakh balayelah, vatidad shenati me‘enay.
zh ly 8Srym Snh bbytk 8bdtyk 1rb8 8Srh Snh bSty bntyk wSS Snym bZ1nk wtHlp 1t mSkrty 8Srt mnym thus have i been double-ten-twenty years in thy daughter-house; i worked for thee fourteen years for thy two children-betweenesss, and six years for thy in-them-animal: and thou hast changed my wages ten times. zeh li ‘esrim shanah bebetekha ‘abadtikha ’arba‘ ‘esreh shanah bishtei benotekha veshesh shanim bezonekha, vatakhalef maskurti ‘aseret monim.
lwly 1lhy 1by 1lhy 1brhm wpHd yZHq hyh ly ky 8th ryqm SlHtny 1t 8nyy w1t ygy8 kpy r1h 1lhym wywkH 1mS except the towards-these-elohim of my father, the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham, and the fear of laughter-isaac, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. towards-these-elohim hath seen mine affliction and the labor of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight. lulei ’elohei ’abi ’elohei ’abraham ufakhad yizkhaq hayah li ki ‘atah reqam shilakhtani,. ‘aneyi ve’et yegia‘ kapay ra’ah ’elohim vayokhakh ’amesh.
wy8n lbn wy1mr 1l y8qb hbnwt bnty whbnym bny whZ1n Z1ny wkl 1Sr 1th r1h ly hw1 wlbnty mh 18Sh l1lh hywm 1w lbnyhn 1Sr yldw and white-laban answered and said unto backstreet-jacob, these children-betweenesss are my children-betweenesss, and these children-betweens are my children-betweens, and these in-them-animal are my in-them-animal, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can i do this day unto these my children-betweenesss, or unto their children-betweens which they have born? vaya‘an laban vayomer ’el ya‘aqob habanot benotay vehabanim banay vehazon zoni vekhol ’asher ’atah ro’eh li hu, velibnotay mah ’e‘eseh la’eleh hayom ’o libnehen ’asher yaladu.
w8th lkh nkrth bryt 1ny w1th whyh l8d byny wbynk now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, i and thou; and let it be for a witness between-bin me and thee. ve‘atah lekhah nikhretah berit ’ani va’atah, vehayah le‘ed beni ubenekha.
wyqH y8qb 1bn wyrymh mZbh and backstreet-jacob took a father-child-stone, and set it up for a column-stand. vayiqakh ya‘aqob ’aben, vayrimeha mazebah.
wy1mr y8qb l1Hyw lqTw 1bnym wyqHw 1bnym wy8Sw gl wy1klw Sm 8l hgl and backstreet-jacob said unto his brethren, gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap. vayomer ya‘aqob le’ekhav liqtu ’abanim vayiqkhu ’abanim vaya‘asu gal, vayokhelu sham ‘al hagal.
wyqr1 lw lbn ygr Shdwt1 wy8qb qr1 lw gl8d and white-laban called it awe-of-data-jegarsahadutha: and backstreet-jacob called it roll-until-heap-galeed. vayiqra lo laban yegar sahaduta, veya‘aqob qara gal‘ed.
wy1mr lbn hgl hzh 8d byny wbynk hywm 8l kn qr1 Smw gl8d and white-laban said, this heap is a witness between-bin me and thee this day. therefore was the name of it called roll-until-heap-galeed; vayomer laban hagal hazeh ‘ed beni ubenekha hayom, ‘al ken qara shemo gal‘ed.
whmZph 1Sr 1mr yZp yhwh byny wbynk ky nstr 1yS mr8hw and watch-mizpah; for he said, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou watch between-bin me and thee, when we are absent one from another. vehamizpah ’asher ’amar yizef yhvh beni ubenekha, ki nisater ’ish mere‘ehu.
1m t8nh 1t bnty w1m tqH nSym 8l bnty 1yn 1yS 8mnw r1h 1lhym 8d byny wbynk if thou afflict my children-betweenesss, or if thou take other women beside my children-betweenesss, no man is with us; see, towards-these-elohim is witness betwixt-bin me and thee. ’im te‘aneh benotay ve’im tiqakh nashim ‘al benotay ’en ’ish ‘imanu, re’eh ’elohim ‘ed beni ubenekha.
wy1mr lbn ly8qb hnh hgl hzh whnh hmZbh 1Sr yryty byny wbynk and white-laban said to backstreet-jacob, behold this heap, and behold this column-stand, which i have cast betwixt-bin me and thee: vayomer laban leya‘aqob, hineh hagal hazeh vehineh hamazebah ’asher yariti beni ubenekha.
8d hgl hzh w8dh hmZbh 1m 1ny l1 18br 1lyk 1t hgl hzh w1m 1th l1 t8br 1ly 1t hgl hzh w1t hmZbh hz1t lr8h this heap be witness, and this column-stand be witness, that i will not pass over this heap to thee, and that no pass over this heap and this column-stand unto me, for harm. ‘ed hagal hazeh ve‘edah hamazebah, ’im ’ani lo ’e‘ebor ’elekha hagal hazeh ve’im ’atah lo ta‘abor ’elay hagal hazeh ve’et hamazebah hazot lera‘ah.
1lhy 1brhm w1lhy nHwr ySpTw bynynw 1lhy 1byhm wySb8 y8qb bpHd 1byw yZHq the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham, and the towards-these-elohim of snore-nahor, the towards-these-elohim of their father, decide betwixt-bin us. and backstreet-jacob sware by the fear of his father laughter-isaac. ’elohei ’abraham velohei nakhor yishpetu benenu ’elohei ’abihem, vayishaba‘ ya‘aqob befakhad ’abiv yizkhaq.
wyzbH y8qb zbH bhr wyqr1 l1Hyw l1kl lHm wy1klw lHm wylynw bhr then backstreet-jacob butchered butch upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount. vayizbakh ya‘aqob zebakh bahar vayiqra le’ekhav le’ekhal lakhem, vayokhelu lekhem vayalinu bahar.
wySkm lbn bbqr wynSq lbnyw wlbnwtyw wybrk 1thm wylk wySb lbn lmqmw and early in the morning white-laban rose up, and kissed his children-betweens and his children-betweenesss, and knee-fluffy-blessed them: and white-laban departed, and returned unto his place. vayashkem laban baboqer vaynasheq lebanav velibnotav vaybarekh ’ethem, vayelekh vayashab laban limqomo.
wy8qb hlk ldrkw wypg8w bw ml1ky 1lhym and backstreet-jacob went on his way, and the angel-messangers of towards-these-elohim met him. veya‘aqob halakh ledarko, vayifge‘u bo mal’akhei ’elohim.
wy1mr y8qb k1Sr r1m mHnh 1lhym zh wyqr1 Sm hmqwm hhw1 mHnym and when backstreet-jacob saw them, he said, this is towards-these-elohim's troop-cluster: and he called the name of that place camping-mahanaim. vayomer ya‘aqob ka’asher ra’am makhaneh ’elohim zeh, vayiqra shem hamaqom hahu makhanayim.
wySlH y8qb ml1kym lpnyw 1l 8Sw 1Hyw 1rZh S8yr Sdh 1dwm and backstreet-jacob sent messengers before-turns him to do-esau his brother unto the land of hair-style-seir, the country of man-edom. vayishlakh ya‘aqob mal’akhim lefanav ’el ‘esav ’akhiv, ’arzah se‘ir sedeh ’edom.
wyZw 1tm l1mr kh t1mrwn l1dny l8Sw kh 1mr 8bdk y8qb 8m lbn grty w1Hr 8d 8th and he order-prescribed them, saying, thus ye speak unto my lord-base do-esau; thy worker backstreet-jacob saith thus, i have sojourned with white-laban, and stayed there until now: vayzav ’otam lemor koh tomerun ladoni le‘esav, koh ’amar ‘abdekha ya‘aqob ‘im laban garti va’ekhar ‘ad ‘atah.
wyhy ly Swr wHmwr Z1n w8bd wSpHh w1SlHh lhgyd l1dny lmZ1 Hn b8ynyk and i have wall-oxen, and asses, flocks, and workers, and familiars: and i have sent to tell my lord-base, that i may find attractiveness in thy sight. vayhi li shor vakhamor zon ve‘ebed veshifkhah, va’eshlekhah lehagid ladoni limzo khen be‘enekha.
wySbw hml1kym 1l y8qb l1mr b1nw 1l 1Hyk 1l 8Sw wgm hlk lqr1tk w1rb8 m1wt 1yS 8mw and the messengers returned to backstreet-jacob, saying, we came to thy brother do-esau, and also he cometh to until-witness thee, and four hundred men with him. vayashubu hamal’akhim ’el ya‘aqob lemor, banu ’el ’akhikha ‘esav vegam holekh liqratekha ve’arba‘ me’ot ’ish ‘imo.
wyyr1 y8qb m1d wyZr lw wyHZ 1t h8m 1Sr 1tw w1t hZ1n w1t hbqr whgmlym lSny mHnwt then backstreet-jacob was greatly afraid and distressed: and he divided the with-mum-people that was with him, and the flocks, and visit-cattles, and the ripen-camels, into two bands; vayira ya‘aqob me’od vayezer lo, vayakhaz ha‘am ’asher ’ito ve’et hazon ve’et habaqar vehagemalim lishnei makhanot.
wy1mr 1m ybw1 8Sw 1l hmHnh h1Ht whkhw whyh hmHnh hnS1r lplyTh and said, if do-esau come to the one company, and hit it, then the other company which is left escape. vayomer ’im yabo ‘esav ’el hamakhaneh ha’akhat vehikahu, vehayah hamakhaneh hanish’ar lifletah.
wy1mr y8qb 1lhy 1by 1brhm w1lhy 1by yZHq yhwh h1mr 1ly Swb l1rZk wlmwldtk w1yTybh 8mk and backstreet-jacob said, o towards-these-elohim of my father their-dick-abraham, and towards-these-elohim of my father laughter-isaac, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou which saidst unto me, return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and i will deal well with thee: vayomer ya‘aqob ’elohei ’abi ’abraham velohei ’abi yizkhaq, yhvh ha’omer ’elay shub le’arzekha ulemoladtekha ve’etibah ‘imakh.
qTnty mkl hHsdym wmkl h1mt 1Sr 8Syt 1t 8bdk ky bmqly 8brty 1t hyrdn hzh w8th hyyty lSny mHnwt i am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy worker; for with my staff i passed over this its-going-down-jordan; and now i am become two bands. qatoneti mikol hakhasadim umikal ha’emet ’asher ‘asita ‘abdekha, ki bemaqli ‘abarti hayarden hazeh ve‘atah hayiti lishnei makhanot.
hZylny n1 myd 1Hy myd 8Sw ky yr1 1nky 1tw pn ybw1 whkny 1m 8l bnym deliver me, i pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of do-esau: for i fear him, lest he will come and hit me, and the mother with children-betweens. hazileni na miyad ’akhi miyad ‘esav, ki yarei ’anokhi ’oto pen yabo vehikani ’em ‘al banim.
w1th 1mrt hyTb 1yTyb 8mk wSmty 1t zr8k kHwl hym 1Sr l1 yspr mrb and thou saidst, i will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude. ve’atah ’amarta heteb ’etib ‘imakh, vesamti zar‘akha kekhol hayam ’asher lo yisafer merob.
wyln Sm blylh hhw1 wyqH mn hb1 bydw mnHh l8Sw 1Hyw and he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for do-esau his brother; vayalen sham balaylah hahu, vayiqakh min haba beyado minkhah le‘esav ’akhiv.
8zym m1tym wtySym 8Srym rHlym m1tym w1ylym 8Srym two hundred she intense-goats, and double-ten-twenty he intense-goats, two hundred ewes, and double-ten-twenty voiceless-rams, ‘izim matayim uteyashim ‘esrim, rekhelim matayim ve’elim ‘esrim.
gmlym mynyqwt wbnyhm SlSym prwt 1rb8ym wprym 8Srh 1tnt 8Srym w8yrm 8Srh thirty milch ripen-camels with their colts, forty kine, and ten bulls, double-ten-twenty she asses, and ten foals. gemalim meniqot ubenehem sheloshim, parot ’arba‘im ufarim ‘asarah ’atonot ‘esrim va‘yarim ‘asarah.
wytn byd 8bdyw 8dr 8dr lbdw wy1mr 1l 8bdyw 8brw lpny wrwH tSymw byn 8dr wbyn 8dr and he delivered them into the hand of his workers, every drove by themselves; and said unto his workers, pass over before-turns me, and put a space betwixt-bin drove and drove. vayiten beyad ‘abadav ‘eder ‘eder lebado, vayomer ’el ‘abadav ‘ibru lefanay verevakh tasimu ben ‘eder uben ‘eder.
wyZw 1t hr1Swn l1mr ky ypgSk 8Sw 1Hy wS1lk l1mr lmy 1th w1nh tlk wlmy 1lh lpnyk and he order-prescribed the foremost, saying, when do-esau my brother until-witnesseth thee, and asketh thee, saying, whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before-turns thee? vayzav harishon lemor, ki yifgashekha ‘esav ’akhi vish’elekha lemor lemi ’atah ve’anah telekh ulemi ’eleh lefanekha.
w1mrt l8bdk ly8qb mnHh hw1 SlwHh l1dny l8Sw whnh gm hw1 1Hrynw then thou say, they be thy worker backstreet-jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord-base do-esau: and, behold, also he is behind us. ve’amarta le‘abdekha leya‘aqob minkhah hi shelukhah ladoni le‘esav, vehineh gam hu ’akharenu.
wyZw gm 1t hSny gm 1t hSlySy gm 1t kl hhlkym 1Hry h8drym l1mr kdbr hzh tdbrwn 1l 8Sw bmZ1km 1tw and so order-prescribed he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, on this manner ye speak unto do-esau, when ye find him. vayzav hasheni gam hashelishi gam kal haholekhim ha‘adarim lemor, kadabar hazeh tedaberun ’el ‘esav bemoza’akhem ’oto.
w1mrtm gm hnh 8bdk y8qb 1Hrynw ky 1mr 1kprh pnyw bmnHh hhlkt lpny w1Hry kn 1r1h pnyw 1wly yS1 pny and say ye moreover, behold, thy worker backstreet-jacob is behind us. for he said, i will appease him with the present that goeth before-turns me, and afterward i will see his face-turns; peradventure he will accept of me. va’amartem gam hineh ‘abdekha ya‘aqob ’akharenu, ki ’amar ’akhaperah fanav baminkhah haholekhet lefanay ve’akhare khen ’er’eh fanav ’ulay yisa fanay.
wt8br hmnHh 8l pnyw whw1 ln blylh hhw1 bmHnh so went the present over before-turns him: and himself lodged that night in the company. vata‘abor haminkhah ‘al panav, vehu lan balaylah hahu bamakhaneh.
wyqm blylh hw1 wyqH 1t Sty nSyw w1t Sty SpHtyw w1t 1Hd 8Sr yldyw wy8br 1t m8br ybq and he rose up that night, and took his two women, and his two familiars, and his eleven children-betweens, and passed over the ford boxwood-jaboq. vayaqam balaylah hu vayiqakh shetei nashav ve’et shetei shifkhotav ve’et ’akhad ‘asar yeladav, vaya‘abor ma‘abar yaboq.
wyqHm wy8brm 1t hnHl wy8br 1t 1Sr lw and he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over that he had. vayiqakhem vaya‘abirem hanakhal, vaya‘aber ’asher lov
wywtr y8qb lbdw wy1bq 1yS 8mw 8d 8lwt hSHr and backstreet-jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day. vayivater ya‘aqob lebado, vaye’abeq ’ish ‘imo ‘ad ‘alot hashakhar.
wyr1 ky l1 ykl lw wyg8 bkp yrkw wtq8 kp yrk y8qb bh1bqw 8mw and when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of backstreet-jacob's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him. vayar ki lo yakhol lo vayiga‘ bekhaf yerekho, vateqa‘ kaf yerekh ya‘aqob behe’abeqo ‘imo.
wy1mr SlHny ky 8lh hSHr wy1mr l1 1SlHk ky 1m brktny and he said, let me go, for the day breaketh. and he said, i will not let thee go, except thou knee-fluffy-bless me. vayomer shalekheni ki ‘alah hashakhar, vayomer lo ’ashalekhakha ki ’im berakhtani.
wy1mr 1lyw mh Smk wy1mr y8qb and he said unto him, what is thy name? and he said, backstreet-jacob. vayomer ’elav mah shemekha, vayomer ya‘aqob.
wy1mr l1 y8qb y1mr 8wd Smk ky 1m ySr1l ky Sryt 8m 1lhym w8m 1nSym wtwkl and he said, thy name be called no more backstreet-jacob, and saturated-towards-israel: for you are fluent in towards-these-elohim and in men, and you can do it. vayomer lo ya‘aqob ye’amer ‘od shimkha ’im yisra’el, ki sarita ‘im ’elohim ve‘im ’anashim vatukhal.
wyS1l y8qb wy1mr hgydh n1 Smk wy1mr lmh zh tS1l lSmy wybrk 1tw Sm and backstreet-jacob asked him, and said, tell me, i pray thee, thy name. and he said, wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? and he knee-fluffy-blessed him there. vayish’al ya‘aqob vayomer hagidah na shemekha vayomer lamah zeh tish’al lishmi, vaybarekh ’oto sham.
wyqr1 y8qb Sm hmqwm pny1l ky r1yty 1lhym pnym 1l pnym wtnZl npSy and backstreet-jacob called the name of the place face-turnings-of-towards: for i have seen towards-these-elohim face-turns to face-turns, and my life is preserved. vayiqra ya‘aqob shem hamaqom peni’el, ki ra’iti ’elohim panim ’el panim vatinazel nafshi.
wyzrH lw hSmS k1Sr 8br 1t pnw1l whw1 Zl8 8l yrkw and as he passed over penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his side-zoleah. vayizrakh lo hashemesh ka’asher ‘abar penu’el, vehu zolea‘ ‘al yerekho.
8l kn l1 y1klw bny ySr1l 1t gyd hnSh 1Sr 8l kp hyrk 8d hywm hzh ky ng8 bkp yrk y8qb bgyd hnSh therefore children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of backstreet-jacob's thigh in the sinew that shrank. ‘al ken lo yokhelu bene yisra’el gid hanasheh ’asher ‘al kaf hayarekh ‘ad hayom hazeh, ki naga‘ bekhaf yerekh ya‘aqob begid hanasheh.
wyS1 y8qb 8ynyw wyr1 whnh 8Sw b1 w8mw 1rb8 m1wt 1yS wyHZ 1t hyldym 8l l1h w8l rHl w8l Sty hSpHwt and backstreet-jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, do-esau came, and with him four hundred men. and he divided children-betweens unto tired-leah, and unto ewe-rachel, and unto the two handmaids. vayisa ya‘aqob ‘enav vayar vehineh ‘esav ba ve‘imo ’arba‘ me’ot ’ish, vayakhaz hayladim ‘al le’ah ve‘al rakhel ve‘al shetei hashefakhot.
wySm 1t hSpHwt w1t yldyhn r1Snh w1t l1h wyldyh 1Hrnym w1t rHl w1t ywsp 1Hrnym and he put the handmaids and their children-betweens foremost, and tired-leah and her children-betweens after, and ewe-rachel and add-joseph here-hindermost. vayasem hashefakhot ve’et yaldehen rishonah, ve’et le’ah viladeha ’akharonim ve’et rakhel ve’et yosef ’akharonim.
whw1 8br lpnyhm wyStHw 1rZh Sb8 p8mym 8d gStw 8d 1Hyw and he passed over before-turns them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother. vehu ‘abar lifnehem, vayishtakhu ’arzah sheba‘ pe‘amim ‘ad gishto ‘ad ’akhiv.
wyrZ 8Sw lqr1tw wyHbqhw wypl 8l Zw1rw wySqhw wybkw and do-esau ran to until-witness him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept. vayaraz ‘esav liqrato vaykhabeqehu vayipol ‘al zavarav vayishaqehu, vayibku.
wyS1 1t 8ynyw wyr1 1t hnSym w1t hyldym wy1mr my 1lh lk wy1mr hyldym 1Sr Hnn 1lhym 1t 8bdk and he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and children-betweens; and said, who are those with thee? and he said, children-betweens which towards-these-elohim hath graciously given thy worker. vayisa ‘enav vayar hanashim ve’et hayladim vayomer mi ’eleh lakh, vayomar hayladim ’asher khanan ’elohim ‘abdekha.
wtgSn hSpHwt hnh wyldyhn wtStHwyn then the handmaidens came near, they and their children-betweens, and they bowed themselves. vatigashna hashefakhot henah veyaldehen vatishtakhavena.
wtgS gm l1h wyldyh wyStHww w1Hr ngS ywsp wrHl wyStHww and tired-leah also with her children-betweens came near, and bowed themselves: and after came add-joseph near and ewe-rachel, and they bowed themselves. vatigash gam le’ah viladeha vayishtakhavu, ve’akhar nigash yosef verakhel vayishtakhavu.
wy1mr my lk kl hmHnh hzh 1Sr pgSty wy1mr lmZ1 Hn b8yny 1dny and he said, what meanest thou by all this drove which i met? and he said, these are to find attractiveness in the sight of my lord-base. vayomer mi lekha kal hamakhaneh hazeh ’asher pagasheti, vayomer limzo khen be‘enei ’adoni.
wy1mr 8Sw yS ly rb 1Hy yhy lk 1Sr lk and do-esau said, i have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast unto thyself. vayomer ‘esav yesh li rab, ’akhi yehi ’asher lakh.
wy1mr y8qb 1l n1 1m n1 mZ1ty Hn b8ynyk wlqHt mnHty mydy ky 8l kn r1yty pnyk kr1t pny 1lhym wtrZny and backstreet-jacob said, nay, i pray thee, if now i have found attractiveness in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore i have seen thy face-turns, as though i had seen the face-turns of towards-these-elohim, and thou wast pleased with me. vayomer ya‘aqob ’al na ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha velaqakhta minkhati miyadi, ki ‘al ken ra’iti fanekha kir’ot penei ’elohim vatirzeni.
qH n1 1t brkty 1Sr hb1t lk ky Hnny 1lhym wky yS ly kl wypZr bw wyqH take, i pray thee, my knee-fluffy-blessing that is brought to thee; because towards-these-elohim hath dealt graciously with me, and because i have enough. and he urged him, and he took it. qakh na birkhati ’asher hubat lakh ki khanani ’elohim vekhi yesh li khol, vayifzar bo vayiqakh.
wy1mr ns8h wnlkh w1lkh lngdk and he said, let us take our journey, and let us go, and i will go before-turns thee. vayomer nis‘ah venelekhah, ve’elekhah lenegdekha.
wy1mr 1lyw 1dny yd8 ky hyldym rkym whZ1n whbqr 8lwt 8ly wdpqwm ywm 1Hd wmtw kl hZ1n and he said unto him, my lord-base knoweth that children-betweens are tender, and the flocks and visit-cattles with young are with me: and if men should overdrive them one day, all the flock will die. vayomer ’elav ’adoni yodea‘ ki hayladim rakim vehazon vehabaqar ‘alot ‘alay, udefaqum yom ’ekhad vametu kal hazon.
y8br n1 1dny lpny 8bdw w1ny 1tnhlh l1Ty lrgl hml1kh 1Sr lpny wlrgl hyldym 8d 1Sr 1b1 1l 1dny S8yrh let my lord-base, i pray thee, pass over before-turns his worker: and i will lead on softly, according as the in-them-animal that goeth before-turns me and children-betweens be able to endure, until i come unto my lord-base unto hair-style-seir. ya‘abar na ’adoni lifnei ‘abdo, va’ani ’etnahalah le’iti leregel hamelakhah ’asher lefanay uleregel hayladim ‘ad ’asher ’abo ’el ’adoni se‘irah.
wy1mr 8Sw 1Zygh n1 8mk mn h8m 1Sr 1ty wy1mr lmh zh 1mZ1 Hn b8yny 1dny and do-esau said, let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. and he said, what needeth it? let me find attractiveness in the sight of my lord-base. vayomer ‘esav ’azigah na ‘imekha min ha‘am ’asher ’iti, vayomer lamah zeh ’emza khen be‘enei ’adoni.
wySb bywm hhw1 8Sw ldrkw S8yrh so do-esau returned that day on his way unto hair-style-seir. vayashab bayom hahu ‘esav ledarko se‘irah.
wy8qb ns8 skth wybn lw byt wlmqnhw 8Sh skt 8l kn qr1 Sm hmqwm skwt and backstreet-jacob journeyed to booths-succoth, and between-built him an daughter-house, and made booths for his in-them-animal: therefore the name of the place is called booths-succoth. veya‘aqob nasa‘ sukotah vayiben lo bayit, ulemiqnehu ‘asah sukot ‘al ken qara shem hamaqom sukot.
wyb1 y8qb Slm 8yr Skm 1Sr b1rZ kn8n bb1w mpdn 1rm wyHn 1t pny h8yr and backstreet-jacob came to whole-shalem, a light-city of shoulder-shechem, which is in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, when he came from redeemed-stack-padanaram; and pitched his tent before-turns the light-city. vayabo ya‘aqob shalem ‘ir shekhem ’asher be’erez kena‘an bebo’o mipadan ’aram, vayikhan penei ha‘ir.
wyqn 1t Hlqt hSdh 1Sr nTh Sm 1hlw myd bny Hmwr 1by Skm bm1h qSyTh and he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of children-betweens of hot-hamor, shoulder-shechem's father, for an hundred pieces of money. vayiqen khelqat hasadeh ’asher natah ’aholo miyad bene khamor ’abi shekhem, beme’ah qesitah.
wyZb Sm mzbH wyqr1 lw 1l 1lhy ySr1l and he erected there an butcher-kitchen, and called it theohries-of-immersion-eleloheisrael. vayazeb sham mizbeakh, vayiqra lo ’el ’elohei yisra’el.
wtZ1 dynh bt l1h 1Sr yldh ly8qb lr1wt bbnwt h1rZ and discuss-dinah the daughter-hoof-bat-child of tired-leah, which she conceived-of unto backstreet-jacob, went out to see children-betweenesss of the land. vatezei dinah bat le’ah ’asher yaledah leya‘aqob, lir’ot bibnot ha’arez.
wyr1 1th Skm bn Hmwr hHwy nSy1 h1rZ wyqH 1th wySkb 1th wy8nh and when shoulder-shechem child-between of hot-hamor the experience-hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and answered her. vayar ’otah shekhem ben khamor hakhivi nesi ha’arez, vayiqakh ’otah vayishkab ’otah vay‘aneha.
wtdbq npSw bdynh bt y8qb wy1hb 1t hn8r wydbr 8l lb hn8r and his being clave unto discuss-dinah the daughter-hoof-bat-child of backstreet-jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel. vatidbaq nafsho bedinah bat ya‘aqob, vaye’ehab hana‘ara vaydaber ‘al leb hana‘ara.
wy1mr Skm 1l Hmwr 1byw l1mr qH ly 1t hyldh hz1t l1Sh and shoulder-shechem spake unto his father hot-hamor, saying, get me this damsel to woman. vayomer shekhem ’el khamor ’abiv lemor, qakh li hayaldah hazot le’ishah.
wy8qb Sm8 ky Tm1 1t dynh btw wbnyw hyw 1t mqnhw bSdh whHrS y8qb 8d b1m and backstreet-jacob heard that he had tama discuss-dinah his daughter-hoof-bat-child: now his children-betweens were with his in-them-animal in the field: and backstreet-jacob held his peace until they were come. veya‘aqob shama‘ ki timei dinah bito ubanav hayu ’et miqnehu basadeh, vehekherish ya‘aqob ‘ad bo’am.
wyZ1 Hmwr 1by Skm 1l y8qb ldbr 1tw and hot-hamor the father of shoulder-shechem went out unto backstreet-jacob to commune with him. vayezei khamor ’abi shekhem ’el ya‘aqob, ledaber ’ito.
wbny y8qb b1w mn hSdh kSm8m wyt8Zbw h1nSym wyHr lhm m1d ky nblh 8Sh bySr1l lSkb 1t bt y8qb wkn l1 y8Sh and children-betweens of backstreet-jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in saturated-towards-israel in lying with backstreet-jacob's daughter-hoof-bat-child: which thing ought not to be done. ubenei ya‘aqob ba’u min hasadeh keshame‘am vayit‘azebu ha’anashim vayikhar me’od, ki nebalah ‘asah beyisra’el lishkab ’et bat ya‘aqob vekhen lo ye‘aseh.
wydbr Hmwr 1tm l1mr Skm bny HSqh npSw bbtkm tnw n1 1th lw l1Sh and hot-hamor communed with them, saying, the being of my child-between shoulder-shechem longeth for your daughter-hoof-bat-child: i pray you give her him to woman. vaydaber khamor ’itam lemor, shekhem beni khasheqah nafsho bebitekhem tenu na ’otah lo le’ishah.
whtHtnw 1tnw bntykm ttnw lnw w1t bntynw tqHw lkm and make ye marriages with us, and give your children-betweenesss unto us, and take our children-betweenesss unto you. vehitkhatenu ’otanu, benotekhem titenu lanu ve’et benotenu tiqkhu lakhem.
w1tnw tSbw wh1rZ thyh lpnykm Sbw wsHrwh wh1Hzw bh and ye dwell with us: and the land be before-turns you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein. ve’itanu teshebu, veha’arez tihyeh lifnekhem shebu usekharuha vehe’akhazu bah.
wy1mr Skm 1l 1byh w1l 1Hyh 1mZ1 Hn b8ynykm w1Sr t1mrw 1ly 1tn and shoulder-shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, let me find attractiveness in your eyes, and what ye say unto me i will give. vayomer shekhem ’el ’abih ve’el ’akheha ’emza khen be‘enekhem, va’asher tomeru ’elay ’eten.
hrbw 8ly m1d mhr wmtn w1tnh k1Sr t1mrw 1ly wtnw ly 1t hn8r l1Sh ask me never so much dowry and gift, and i will give according as ye say unto me: and give me the damsel to woman. harbu ‘alay me’od mohar umatan ve’etenah ka’asher tomeru ’elay, utenu li hana‘ara le’ishah.
wy8nw bny y8qb 1t Skm w1t Hmwr 1byw bmrmh wydbrw 1Sr Tm1 1t dynh 1Htm and children-betweens of backstreet-jacob answered shoulder-shechem and hot-hamor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had tama discuss-dinah their sister: vaya‘anu bene ya‘aqob shekhem ve’et khamor ’abiv bemirmah vaydaberu, ’asher time dinah ’akhotam.
wy1mrw 1lyhm l1 nwkl l8Swt hdbr hzh ltt 1t 1Htnw l1yS 1Sr lw 8rlh ky Hrph hw1 lnw and they said unto them, we cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is foreskinned; for that were a reproach unto us: vayomeru ’alehem lo nukhal la‘asot hadabar hazeh latet ’akhotenu le’ish ’asher ‘arelah, ki kherpah hi lanu.
1k bz1t n1wt lkm 1m thyw kmnw lhml lkm kl zkr and in this will we consent unto you: if ye will be as we be, that every rememberer of you be scribe-circumcised; ’akh bezot ne’ot lakhem, ’im tihyu khamonu lehimol lakhem kal zakhar.
wntnw 1t bntynw lkm w1t bntykm nqH lnw wySbnw 1tkm whyynw l8m 1Hd then will we give our children-betweenesss unto you, and we will take your children-betweenesss to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one with-mum-people. venatanu benotenu lakhem ve’et benotekhem niqakh lanu, veyashabnu ’itekhem vehayinu le‘am ’ekhad.
w1m l1 tSm8w 1lynw lhmwl wlqHnw 1t btnw whlknw and if ye will not hearken unto us, to be scribe-circumcised; then will we take our daughter-hoof-bat-child, and we will be gone. ve’im lo tishme‘u ’elenu lehimol, velaqakhnu bitenu vehalakhenu.
wyyTbw dbryhm b8yny Hmwr wb8yny Skm bn Hmwr and their bee-words pleased hot-hamor, and shoulder-shechem hot-hamor's child-between. vayitebu dibrehem khamor, ube‘enei shekhem ben khamor.
wl1 1Hr hn8r l8Swt hdbr ky HpZ bbt y8qb whw1 nkbd mkl byt 1byw and the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in backstreet-jacob's daughter-hoof-bat-child: and he was more honorable than all the daughter-house of his father. velo ’ekhar hana‘ar la‘asot hadabar ki khafez bebat ya‘aqob, vehu nikhbad mikol bet ’abiv.
wyb1 Hmwr wSkm bnw 1l S8r 8yrm wydbrw 1l 1nSy 8yrm l1mr and hot-hamor and shoulder-shechem his child-between came unto the hair-gate of their light-city, and communed with the men of their light-city, saying, vayabo khamor ushekhem beno ’el sha‘ar ‘iram, vaydaberu ’el ’anshei ‘iram lemor.
h1nSym h1lh Slmym hm 1tnw wySbw b1rZ wysHrw 1th wh1rZ hnh rHbt ydym lpnyhm 1t bntm nqH lnw lnSym w1t bntynw ntn lhm these men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their children-betweenesss to us for women, and let us give them our children-betweenesss. ha’anashim ha’eleh shelemim hem ’itanu veyeshebu ba’arez veyiskharu ’otah veha’arez hineh rakhabat yadayim lifnehem, benotam niqakh lanu lenashim ve’et benotenu niten lahem.
1k bz1t y1tw lnw h1nSym lSbt 1tnw lhywt l8m 1Hd bhmwl lnw kl zkr k1Sr hm nmlym only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be one with-mum-people, if every rememberer among us be scribe-circumcised, as they are scribe-circumcised. ’akh bezot ye’otu ha’anashim lashebet ’itanu lihyot le‘am ’ekhad, behimol lanu kal zakhar ka’asher hem nimolim.
mqnhm wqnynm wkl bhmtm hlw1 lnw hm 1k n1wth lhm wySbw 1tnw not their in-them-animal and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us. miqnehem veqinyanam vekhal behemtam halo lanu hem, ’akh ne’otah lahem veyeshebu ’itanu.
wySm8w 1l Hmwr w1l Skm bnw kl yZ1y S8r 8yrw wymlw kl zkr kl yZ1y S8r 8yrw and unto hot-hamor and unto shoulder-shechem his child-between hearkened all that went out of the hair-gate of his light-city; and every rememberer was scribe-circumcised, all that went out of the hair-gate of his light-city. vayishme‘u ’el khamor ve’el shekhem beno kal yoze’ei sha‘ar ‘iro, vayimolu kal zakhar kal yoze’ei sha‘ar ‘iro.
wyhy bywm hSlySy bhywtm k1bym wyqHw Sny bny y8qb Sm8wn wlwy 1Hy dynh 1yS Hrbw wyb1w 8l h8yr bTH wyhrgw kl zkr and it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of children-betweens of backstreet-jacob, hear-home-simeon and join-levi, discuss-dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the light-city boldly, and slew all the rememberers. vayhi bayom hashelishi bihyotam ko’abim vayiqkhu shene bene ya‘aqob shim‘on velevi ’akhei dinah ’ish kharbo vayabo’u ‘al ha‘ir betakh, vayahargu kal zakhar.
w1t Hmwr w1t Skm bnw hrgw lpy Hrb wyqHw 1t dynh mbyt Skm wyZ1w and they slew hot-hamor and shoulder-shechem his child-between with the edge of the sword, and took discuss-dinah out of shoulder-shechem's daughter-house, and went out. ve’et khamor ve’et shekhem beno haregu lefi khareb, vayiqkhu dinah mibet shekhem vayeze’u.
bny y8qb b1w 8l hHllym wybzw h8yr 1Sr Tm1w 1Hwtm children-betweens of backstreet-jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the light-city, because they had ceased their sister. benei ya‘aqob ba’u ‘al hakhalalim vayabozu ha‘ir, ’asher time’u ’akhotam.
1t Z1nm w1t bqrm w1t Hmryhm w1t 1Sr b8yr w1t 1Sr bSdh lqHw they took their sheep, and their wall-oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the light-city, and that which was in the field, zonam ve’et beqaram ve’et khamorehem, ve’et ’asher ba‘ir ve’et ’asher basadeh laqakhu.
w1t kl Hylm w1t kl Tpm w1t nSyhm Sbw wybzw w1t kl 1Sr bbyt and all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their women took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the daughter-house. ve’et kal khelam ve’et kal tapam ve’et neshehem shabu vayabozu, ve’et kal ’asher babayit.
wy1mr y8qb 1l Sm8wn w1l lwy 8krtm 1ty lhb1ySny bySb h1rZ bkn8ny wbprzy w1ny mty mspr wn1spw 8ly whkwny wnSmdty 1ny wbyty and backstreet-jacob said to hear-home-simeon and join-levi, ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the mobile-trade-canaanites and the unwalled-perizzites: and i being few in number, they gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and i be destroyed, i and my daughter-house. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el shim‘on ve’el levi ‘akhartem ’oti lehab’isheni beyosheb ha’arez bakena‘ani ubaperizi, va’ani metei mispar vene’esfu ‘alay vehikuni venishmadti ’ani ubeti.
wy1mrw hkzwnh y8Sh 1t 1Hwtnw and they said, should he deal with our sister as with an harlot? vayomeru, hakhzonah ya‘aseh ’akhotenu.
wy1mr 1lhym 1l y8qb qwm 8lh byt 1l wSb Sm w8Sh Sm mzbH l1l hnr1h 1lyk bbrHk mpny 8Sw 1Hyk and towards-these-elohim said unto backstreet-jacob, arise, go up to house-of-towards-bethel, and dwell there: and make there an butcher-kitchen unto towards-these-elohim, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face-turns of do-esau thy brother. vayomer ’elohim ’el ya‘aqob qum ‘aleh bet ’el vesheb sham, va‘aseh sham mizbeakh la’el hanir’eh ’elekha bebarekhakha mipenei ‘esav ’akhikha.
wy1mr y8qb 1l bytw w1l kl 1Sr 8mw hsrw 1t 1lhy hnkr 1Sr btkkm whThrw whHlypw Smltykm then backstreet-jacob said unto his daughter-household, and to all that were with him, put away the strange towards-these-elohim that are among you, and be bright-climaxing, and change your garments: vayomer ya‘aqob ’el beto ve’el kal ’asher ‘imo, hasiru ’elohei hanekhar ’asher betokhekhem vehitaharu vehakhalifu simlotekhem.
wnqwmh wn8lh byt 1l w18Sh Sm mzbH l1l h8nh 1ty bywm Zrty wyhy 8mdy bdrk 1Sr hlkty and let us arise, and go up to house-of-towards-bethel; and i will make there an butcher-kitchen unto towards-these-elohim, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which i went. venaqumah vena‘aleh ’el, ve’e‘eseh sham mizbeakh la’el ha‘oneh ’oti beyom zarati vayhi ‘imadi baderekh ’asher halakheti.
wytnw 1l y8qb 1t kl 1lhy hnkr 1Sr bydm w1t hnzmym 1Sr b1znyhm wyTmn 1tm y8qb tHt h1lh 1Sr 8m Skm and they gave unto backstreet-jacob all the strange towards-these-elohim which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and backstreet-jacob hid them under the oak which was by shoulder-shechem. vayitenu ’el ya‘aqob kal ’elohei hanekhar ’asher beyadam ve’et hanezamim ’asher be’azenehem, vayitmon ’otam ya‘aqob takhat ha’elah ’asher ‘im shekhem.
wys8w wyhy Htt 1lhym 8l h8rym 1Sr sbybtyhm wl1 rdpw 1Hry bny y8qb and they journeyed: and the terror of towards-these-elohim was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after children-betweens of backstreet-jacob. vayisa‘u, vayhi khitat ’elohim ‘al he‘arim ’asher sebibotehem velo radefu ’akharei benei ya‘aqob.
wyb1 y8qb lwzh 1Sr b1rZ kn8n hw1 byt 1l hw1 wkl h8m 1Sr 8mw so backstreet-jacob came to hazel-luz, which is in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, that is, house-of-towards-bethel, he and all the with-mum-people that were with him. vayabo ya‘aqob luzah ’asher be’erez kena‘an hi bet ’el, hu vekhal ha‘am ’asher ‘imo.
wybn Sm mzbH wyqr1 lmqwm 1l byt 1l ky Sm nglw 1lyw h1lhym bbrHw mpny 1Hyw and he between-built there an butcher-kitchen, and called the place towards-house-towards: because there towards-these-elohim appeared unto him, when he fled from the face-turns of his brother. vayiben sham mizbeakh vayiqra lamaqom ’el ’el, ki sham niglu ’elav ha’elohim bebarekho mipenei ’akhiv.
wtmt dbrh mynqt rbqh wtqbr mtHt lbyt 1l tHt h1lwn wyqr1 Smw 1lwn bkwt and bee-deborah stall-rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath house-of-towards-bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called tree-of-crying-alonbachut. vatamat deborah meneqet ribqah vatiqaber mitakhat ’el takhat ha’alon, vayiqra shemo bakhut.
wyr1 1lhym 1l y8qb 8wd bb1w mpdn 1rm wybrk 1tw and towards-these-elohim appeared unto backstreet-jacob again, when he came out of redeemed-stack-padanaram, and knee-fluffy-blessed him. vayera ’elohim ’el ya‘aqob ‘od bebo’o mipadan ’aram, vaybarekh ’oto.
wy1mr lw 1lhym Smk y8qb l1 yqr1 Smk 8wd y8qb ky 1m ySr1l yhyh Smk wyqr1 1t Smw ySr1l and towards-these-elohim said unto him, thy name is backstreet-jacob: thy name not be called any more backstreet-jacob, and saturated-towards-israel be thy name: and he called his name saturated-towards-israel. vayomer lo ’elohim shimkha ya‘aqob, lo yiqarei shimkha ‘od ya‘aqob ki ’im yisra’el yihyeh shemekha vayiqra shemo yisra’el.
wy1mr lw 1lhym 1ny 1l Sdy prh wrbh gwy wqhl gwym yhyh mmk wmlkym mHlZyk yZ1w and towards-these-elohim said unto him, i am towards-these-elohim almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations be of thee, and moloch-kings come out of thy loins; vayomer lo ’elohim ’ani ’el shaday pereh urebeh go uqehal goyim yihyeh mimeka, umelakhim mekhalazekha yeze’u.
w1t h1rZ 1Sr ntty l1brhm wlyZHq lk 1tnnh wlzr8k 1Hryk 1tn 1t h1rZ and the land which i gave their-dick-abraham and laughter-isaac, to thee i will give it, and to thy seed after thee will i give the land. ve’et ha’arez ’asher natati le’abraham uleyizkhaq lekha ’etenenah, ulezar‘akha ’akharekha ’eten ha’arez.
wy8l m8lyw 1lhym bmqwm 1Sr dbr 1tw and towards-these-elohim went up from him in the place where he talked with him. vaya‘al me‘alav ’elohim, bamaqom ’asher diber ’ito.
wyZb y8qb mZbh bmqwm 1Sr dbr 1tw mZbt 1bn wysk 8lyh nsk wyZq 8lyh Smn and backstreet-jacob set up a column-stand in the place where he talked with him, even a page-column-erection of father-child-stone: and he poured a pouring thereon, and he poured name-from-oil thereon. vayazeb ya‘aqob mazebah bamaqom ’asher diber ’ito mazebet ’aben, vayasekh ‘aleha nesekh vayizoq ‘aleha shamen.
wyqr1 y8qb 1t Sm hmqwm 1Sr dbr 1tw Sm 1lhym byt 1l and backstreet-jacob called the name of the place where towards-these-elohim spake with him, house-of-towards-bethel. vayiqra ya‘aqob shem hamaqom ’asher diber ’ito ’elohim ’el.
wys8w mbyt 1l wyhy 8wd kbrt h1rZ lbw1 1prth wtld rHl wtqS bldth and they journeyed from house-of-towards-bethel; and there was and a little way to come to wishy-washy-ephrath: and ewe-rachel travailed, and she had hard labor. vayis‘u mibet ’el vayhi ‘od kibrat ha’arez labo ’efratah, vateled rakhel vateqash belidtah.
wyhy bhqSth bldth wt1mr lh hmyldt 1l tyr1y ky gm zh lk bn and it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said unto her, fear not; thou have this child-between also. vayhi behaqshotah belidtah, vatomer lah hamyaledet ’al tire’i ki gam zeh lakh ben.
wyhy bZ1t npSh ky mth wtqr1 Smw bn 1wny w1byw qr1 lw bnymyn and it came to pass, as her being was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name he-between-of-my-sexual-potency-benoni: and his father called him he-between-of-righthand-benjamin. vayhi bezet nafshah ki metah vatiqra shemo ’oni, ve’abiv qara lo binyamin.
wtmt rHl wtqbr bdrk 1prth hw1 byt lHm and ewe-rachel died, and was buried in the way to wishy-washy-ephrath, which is house-of-bread-bethlehem. vatamat rakhel, vatiqaber bederekh ’efratah hi lakhem.
wyZb y8qb mZbh 8l qbrth hw1 mZbt qbrt rHl 8d hywm and backstreet-jacob set a column-stand upon her grave: that is the page-column-erection of ewe-rachel's grave unto this day. vayazeb ya‘aqob mazebah ‘al qeburatah, hi mazebet qeburat rakhel ‘ad hayom.
wys8 ySr1l wyT 1hlh mhl1h lmgdl 8dr and saturated-towards-israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of visit-cattle-edar. vayisa‘ yisra’el, vayet ’aholoh mehale’ah ‘eder.
wyhy bSkn ySr1l b1rZ hhw1 wylk r1wbn wySkb 1t blhh pylgS 1byw wySm8 ySr1l wyhyw bny y8qb Snym 8Sr and it came to pass, when saturated-towards-israel dwelt in that land, that buddy-see-child-reuben went and lay with good-times-bilhah his father's concubine: and saturated-towards-israel heard it. now children-betweens of backstreet-jacob were twelve: vayhi bishkon yisra’el ba’arez hahiv vayelekh re’uben vayishkab bilhah pilegesh ’abiv vayishma‘ yisra’el vayihyu bene ya‘aqob shenem ‘asar.
bny l1h bkwr y8qb r1wbn wSm8wn wlwy wyhwdh wySSkr wzbwln children-betweens of tired-leah; buddy-see-child-reuben, backstreet-jacob's firstborn, and hear-home-simeon, and join-levi, and know-judah, and wage-issachar, and fertile-zebulun: benei le’ah bekhor ya‘aqob re’uben, veshim‘on velevi vihudah veyisashkhar uzebulun.
