wbny zlph SpHt l1h gd w1Sr 1lh bny y8qb 1Sr yld lw bpdn 1rm and children-betweens of sprinkle-zilpah, tired-leah's handmaid: luck-gad, and bliss-asher: these are children-betweens of backstreet-jacob, which were born to him in redeemed-stack-padanaram. ubenei zilpah shifkhat le’ah gad ve’asher, ’eleh benei ya‘aqob ’asher yulad lo befadan ’aram.
wyb1 y8qb 1l yZHq 1byw mmr1 qryt h1rb8 hw1 Hbrwn 1Sr gr Sm 1brhm wyZHq and backstreet-jacob came unto laughter-isaac his father unto see-bitter-mamre, unto the light-city of ambush-arba, which is friend-joy-hebron, where their-dick-abraham and laughter-isaac sojourned. vayabo ya‘aqob ’el yizkhaq ’abiv mamrei ha’arba‘, hi khebron ’asher gar sham ’abraham veyizkhaq.
wyhyw ymy yZHq m1t Snh wSmnym Snh and the days of laughter-isaac were an hundred and fourscore years. vayihyu yemei yizkhaq, me’at shanah ushemonim shanah.
wygw8 yZHq wymt wy1sp 1l 8myw zqn wSb8 ymym wyqbrw 1tw 8Sw wy8qb bnyw and laughter-isaac gave up the breath-spirit, and died, and was added unto his with-mum-people, being old and full of days: and his children-betweens do-esau and backstreet-jacob buried him. vayigva‘ yizkhaq vayamat vaye’asef ’el ‘amav zaqen useba‘ yamim, vayiqberu ’oto ‘esav veya‘aqob banav.
w1lh tldwt 8Sw hw1 1dwm now these are the generations of do-esau, who is man-edom. ve’eleh toledot ‘esav hu ’edom.

w1t bSmt bt ySm81l 1Hwt nbywt and perfumery-bashemath towards-hears-ishmael's daughter-hoof-bat-child, sister of lets-house-nebajoth. ve’et basemat bat yishma‘el ’akhot nebayot.
wtld 8dh l8Sw 1t 1lypz wbSmt yldh 1t r8w1l and witness-adah conceived-of to do-esau my-towards-gold-eliphaz; and perfumery-bashemath conceived-of buddy-reuel; vateled ‘adah le‘esav ’elifaz, ubasemat yaledah re‘u’el.

wyqH 8Sw 1t nSyw w1t bnyw w1t bntyw w1t kl npSwt bytw w1t mqnhw w1t kl bhmtw w1t kl qnynw 1Sr rkS b1rZ kn8n wylk 1l 1rZ mpny y8qb 1Hyw and do-esau took his women, and his children-betweens, and his children-betweenesss, and all the persons of his daughter-house, and his in-them-animal, and all his beasts, and all his substance, which he had got in the land of mobile-trade-canaan; and went into the country from the face-turns of his brother backstreet-jacob. vayiqakh ‘esav nashav ve’et banav ve’et benotav ve’et kal nafshot beto ve’et miqnehu ve’et kal behemto ve’et kal qinyano ’asher rakhash be’erez kena‘an, vayelekh ’el ’erez mipenei ya‘aqob ’akhiv.
ky hyh rkwSm rb mSbt yHdw wl1 yklh 1rZ mgwryhm lS1t 1tm mpny mqnyhm for their riches were more than that they might dwell together; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their in-them-animal. ki hayah rekhusham rab mishebet yakhdav, velo yakhelah ’erez megurehem laset ’otam mipenei miqnehem.

wySb y8qb b1rZ mgwry 1byw b1rZ kn8n and backstreet-jacob dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of mobile-trade-canaan. vayesheb ya‘aqob be’erez megurei ’abiv, be’erez kena‘an.
1lh tldwt y8qb ywsp bn Sb8 8Srh Snh hyh r8h 1t 1Hyw bZ1n whw1 n8r 1t bny blhh w1t bny zlph nSy 1byw wyb1 ywsp 1t dbtm r8h 1l 1byhm these are the generations of backstreet-jacob. add-joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with children-betweens of good-times-bilhah, and with children-betweens of sprinkle-zilpah, his father's women: and add-joseph brought unto his father their bad report. ’eleh toledot ya‘aqob yosef ben sheba‘ ‘esreh shanah hayah ro‘eh ’et ’ekhav bazon vehu na‘ar ’et benei bilhah ve’et benei zilpah neshei ’abiv, vayabei yosef dibatam ra‘ah ’el ’abihem.
wySr1l 1hb 1t ywsp mkl bnyw ky bn zqnym hw1 lw w8Sh lw ktnt psym now saturated-towards-israel loved add-joseph more than all his children-betweens, because he was child-between of his old age: and he made him a you-wrote-coat of technicolor-stripes. veyisra’el ’ahab yosef mikal banav ki ben zequnim hu lo, ve‘asah lo ketonet pasim.
wyr1w 1Hyw ky 1tw 1hb 1byhm mkl 1Hyw wySn1w 1tw wl1 yklw dbrw lSlm and when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him. vayir’u ’ekhav ki ’oto ’ahab ’abihem mikal ’ekhav vayisne’u ’oto, velo yakhelu dabero leshalom.
wyHlm ywsp Hlwm wygd l1Hyw wywspw 8wd Sn1 1tw and add-joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more. vayakhalom yosef khalom vayaged le’ekhav, vayosifu ‘od seno ’oto.
wy1mr 1lyhm Sm8w n1 hHlwm hzh 1Sr Hlmty and he said unto them, hear, i pray you, this dream which i have dreamed: vayomer ’alehem, shim‘u na hakhalom hazeh ’asher khalameti.
whnh 1nHnw m1lmym 1lmym btwk hSdh whnh qmh 1lmty wgm nZbh whnh tsbynh 1lmtykm wtStHwyn l1lmty for, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf. vehineh ’anakhnu me’alemim ’alumim betokh hasadeh vehineh qamah ’alumati vegam nizabah, vehineh tesubenah ’alumotekhem vatishtakhavena la’alumati.
wy1mrw lw 1Hyw hmlk tmlk 8lynw 1m mSwl tmSl bnw wywspw 8wd Sn1 1tw 8l Hlmtyw w8l dbryw and his brethren said to him, thou indeed reign over us? or thou indeed have dominion over us? and they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his bee-words. vayomeru lo ’ekhav hamalokh timlokh ‘alenu ’im mashol timshol banu, vayosifu ‘od seno ’oto ‘al khalomotav ve‘al debarav.
wyHlm 8wd Hlwm 1Hr wyspr 1tw l1Hyw wy1mr hnh Hlmty Hlwm 8wd whnh hSmS whyrH w1Hd 8Sr kwkbym mStHwym ly and he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, behold, i have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me. vayakhalom ‘od khalom ’akher vaysaper ’oto le’ekhav, vayomer hineh khalamti khalom ‘od vehineh hashemesh vehayareakh ve’akhad ‘asar kokhabim mishtakhavim li.
wyspr 1l 1byw w1l 1Hyw wyg8r bw 1byw wy1mr lw mh hHlwm hzh 1Sr Hlmt hbw1 nbw1 1ny w1mk w1Hyk lhStHwt lk 1rZh and he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, what is this dream that thou hast dreamed? i and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth? vaysaper ’el ’abiv ve’el ’ekhav vayig‘ar bo ’abiv vayomer lo mah hakhalom hazeh ’asher khalameta, habo nabo ’ani ve’imekha ve’akhekha lehishtakhavot lekha ’arezah.
wyqn1w bw 1Hyw w1byw Smr 1t hdbr and his brethren envied him; and his father guard-observed the saying. vayqan’u bo ’ekhav, ve’abiv shamar hadabar.
wylkw 1Hyw lr8wt 1t Z1n 1byhm bSkm and his brethren went to feed their father's flock in shoulder-shechem. vayelekhu ’ekhav, lir‘ot zon ’abihem bishkhem.
wy1mr ySr1l 1l ywsp hlw1 1Hyk r8ym bSkm lkh w1SlHk 1lyhm wy1mr lw hnny and saturated-towards-israel said unto add-joseph, do not thy brethren feed the flock in shoulder-shechem? come, and i will send thee unto them. and he said to him, here am i. vayomer yisra’el ’el yosef halo ’akhekha ro‘im bishkhem lekhah ve’eshlakhakha ’alehem, vayomer lo hineni.
wy1mr lw lk n1 r1h 1t Slwm 1Hyk w1t Slwm hZ1n whSbny dbr wySlHhw m8mq Hbrwn wyb1 Skmh and he said to him, go, i pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me bee-word again. so he sent him out of the vale of friend-joy-hebron, and he came to shoulder-shechem. vayomer lo lekh na re’eh shelom ’akhekha ve’et shelom hazon vahashibeni dabar, vayishlakhehu me‘emeq khebron vayabo shekhemah.
wymZ1hw 1yS whnh t8h bSdh wyS1lhw h1yS l1mr mh tbqS and a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, what seekest thou? vayimza’ehu ’ish vehineh to‘eh basadeh, vayish’alehu ha’ish lemor mah tebaqesh.
wy1mr 1t 1Hy 1nky mbqS hgydh n1 ly 1yph hm r8ym and he said, i seek my brethren: tell me, i pray thee, where they feed their flocks. vayomer ’akhay ’anokhi mebaqesh, hagidah na li ’efoh hem ro‘im.
wy1mr h1yS ns8w mzh ky Sm8ty 1mrym nlkh dtynh wylk ywsp 1Hr 1Hyw wymZ1m bdtn and the man said, they are departed hence; for i heard them say, let us go to decree-dothan. and add-joseph went after his brethren, and found them in decree-dothan. vayomer ha’ish nase‘u mizeh ki shama‘ti ’omerim nelekhah dotayenah, vayelekh yosef ’akhar ’ekhav vayimza’em bedotan.
wyr1w 1tw mrHq wbTrm yqrb 1lyhm wytnklw 1tw lhmytw and when they saw him afar off, even before-turns he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him. vayir’u ’oto merakhoq, ubeterem yiqrab ’alehem vayitnakelu ’oto lahamito.
wy1mrw 1yS 1l 1Hyw hnh b8l hHlmwt hlzh b1 and they said one to another, behold, this dreamer cometh. vayomeru ’ish ’el ’akhiv, hineh hakhalomot halazeh ba.
w8th lkw wnhrghw wnSlkhw b1Hd hbrwt w1mrnw Hyh r8h 1klthw wnr1h mh yhyw Hlmtyw come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, some bad beast hath devoured him: and we see what will become of his dreams. ve‘atah lekhu venahargehu venashlikhehu be’akhad haborot ve’amarnu khayah ra‘ah ’akhalatehu, venir’eh mah yihyu khalomotav.
wySm8 r1wbn wyZlhw mydm wy1mr l1 nknw npS and buddy-see-child-reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, let us not kill him. vayishma‘ re’uben vayazilehu miyadam, vayomer lo nakenu nafesh.
wy1mr 1lhm r1wbn 1l tSpkw dm hSlykw 1tw 1l hbwr hzh 1Sr bmdbr wyd 1l tSlHw bw lm8n hZyl 1tw mydm lhSybw 1l 1byw and buddy-see-child-reuben said unto them, shed no blood, and cast him into this pit that is in the place-of-word-desert, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again. vayomer ’alehem re’uben ’al tishpekhu dam hashlikhu ’oto ’el habor hazeh ’asher bamidbar veyad ’al tishlekhu bo, lema‘an hazil ’oto miyadam lahashibo ’el ’abiv.
wyhy k1Sr b1 ywsp 1l 1Hyw wypSyTw 1t ywsp 1t ktntw 1t ktnt hpsym 1Sr 8lyw and it came to pass, when add-joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stripped add-joseph out of his you-wrote-coat, his you-wrote-coat of many colors that was on him; vayhi ka’asher ba yosef ’el ’ekhav, vayafshitu yosef kutaneto ketonet hapasim ’asher ‘alav.
wyqHhw wySlkw 1tw hbrh whbwr rq 1yn bw mym and they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no from-waters in it. vayiqakhuhu vayashlikhu ’oto haborah, vehabor req ’en bo mayim.
wySbw l1kl lHm wyS1w 8ynyhm wyr1w whnh 1rHt ySm81lym b1h mgl8d wgmlyhm nS1ym nk1t wZry wlT hwlkym lhwryd mZrymh and they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of towards-hears-ishmaelites came from roll-until-heap-gilead with their ripen-camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to narrows-mizraim. vayeshebu le’ekhal lekhem vayis’u ‘enehem vayir’u vehineh ’orekhat yishme‘elim ba’ah migil‘ad, ugemalehem nose’im nekhot uzeri valot holkhim lehorid mizrayemah.
wy1mr yhwdh 1l 1Hyw mh bZ8 ky nhrg 1t 1Hynw wksynw 1t dmw and know-judah said unto his brethren, what profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood? vayomer yehudah ’el ’ekhav, mah beza‘ ki naharog ’akhinu vekhisinu damo.
lkw wnmkrnw lySm81lym wydnw 1l thy bw ky 1Hynw bSrnw hw1 wySm8w 1Hyw come, and let us sell him to the towards-hears-ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. and his brethren were content. lekhu venimkerenu layishme‘elim veyadenu ’al tehi bo ki ’akhinu besarenu hu, vayishme‘u ’ekhav.
wy8brw 1nSym mdynym sHrym wymSkw wy8lw 1t ywsp mn hbwr wymkrw 1t ywsp lySm81lym b8Srym ksp wyby1w 1t ywsp mZrymh then there passed by place-of-discussed-teaching-midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up add-joseph out of the pit, and sold add-joseph to the towards-hears-ishmaelites for double-ten-twenty pieces of silver: and they brought add-joseph into narrows-mizraim. vaya‘abru ’anashim midyanim sokharim vayimshekhu vaya‘alu yosef min habor vayimkeru yosef layishme‘elim be‘esrim kasef, vayabi’u yosef mizrayemah.
wySb r1wbn 1l hbwr whnh 1yn ywsp bbwr wyqr8 1t bgdyw and buddy-see-child-reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, add-joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes. vayashab re’uben ’el habor vehineh ’en yosef babor, vayiqra‘ begadav.
wySb 1l 1Hyw wy1mr hyld 1ynnw w1ny 1nh 1ny b1 and he returned unto his brethren, and said, child is not; and i, whither i go? vayashab ’el ’ekhav vayomar, hayeled ’enenu va’ani ’anah ’ani ba.
wyqHw 1t ktnt ywsp wySHTw S8yr 8zym wyTblw 1t hktnt bdm and they took add-joseph's you-wrote-coat, and killed a kid of the intense-goats, and dipped the you-wrote-coat in the blood; vayiqkhu ketonet yosef, vayishkhatu se‘ir ‘izim vayitbelu hakutonet badam.
wySlHw 1t ktnt hpsym wyby1w 1l 1byhm wy1mrw z1t mZ1nw hkr n1 hktnt bnk hw1 1m l1 and they sent the you-wrote-coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father; and said, this have we found: hand-know now whether it be thy child-between's you-wrote-coat or no. vayshalekhu ketonet hapasim vayabi’u ’el ’abihem vayomeru zot mazanu, haker na haketonet binkha hi ’im lo.
wykyrh wy1mr ktnt bny Hyh r8h 1klthw Trp Trp ywsp and he hand-knew it, and said, it is my child-between's you-wrote-coat; an bad beast hath devoured him; add-joseph is without doubt rent in pieces. vayakirah vayomer ketonet beni khayah ra‘ah ’akhalatehu, tarof toraf yosef.
wyqr8 y8qb Smltyw wySm Sq bmtnyw wyt1bl 8l bnw ymym rbym and backstreet-jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his child-between many days. vayiqra‘ ya‘aqob simlotav vayasem saq bematenav, vayit’abel ‘al beno yamim rabim.
wyqmw kl bnyw wkl bntyw lnHmw wym1n lhtnHm wy1mr ky 1rd 1l bny 1bl S1lh wybk 1tw 1byw and all his children-betweens and all his children-betweenesss rose up to comfort him; and he refused to be comforted; and he said, for i will go down into the grave unto my child-between mourning. thus his father wept for him. vayaqumu khal banav vekhal benotav lenakhamo vayma’en lehitnakhem vayomer ki ’ered ’el beni ’abel she’olah, vayebek ’oto ’abiv.
whmdnym mkrw 1tw 1l mZrym lpwTypr srys pr8h Sr hTbHym and the place-of-discussed-teaching-midianites sold him into narrows-mizraim unto given-by-ra-potiphar, an officer of big-house-pharaoh's, and captain of the guard. vehamedanim makheru ’oto ’el mizrayim, lefotifar seris par‘oh sar hatabakhim.
wyhy b8t hhw1 wyrd yhwdh m1t 1Hyw wyT 8d 1yS 8dlmy wSmw Hyrh and it came to pass at that time, that know-judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain just-fleeing-adullamite, whose name was freedom-hirah. vayhi ba‘et hahiv vayered yehudah me’et ’ekhav, vayet ‘ad ’ish ‘adulami ushemo khirah.
wyr1 Sm yhwdh bt 1yS kn8ny wSmw Sw8 wyqHh wyb1 1lyh and know-judah saw there a daughter-hoof-bat-child of a certain mobile-trade-canaanite, whose name was talk-shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her. vayar sham yehudah bat ’ish kena‘ani ushemo shua‘, vayiqakheha vayabo ’eleha.
wthr wtld bn wyqr1 1t Smw 8r and she conceived, and conceived-of a child-between; and he called his name awake-er. vatahar vateled ben, vayiqra shemo ‘er.
wthr 8wd wtld bn wtqr1 1t Smw 1wnn and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between; and she called his name trouble-vigor-onan. vatahar ‘od vateled ben, vatiqra shemo ’onan.
wtsp 8wd wtld bn wtqr1 1t Smw Slh whyh bkzyb bldth 1tw and she yet again conceived, and conceived-of a child-between; and called his name pulled-out-shelah: and he was at in-a-lie-chezib, when she conceived-of him. vatosef ‘od vateled ben vatiqra shemo shelah, vehayah bikhzib belidtah ’oto.
wyqH yhwdh 1Sh l8r bkwrw wSmh tmr and know-judah took a woman for awake-er his firstborn, whose name was palm-date-tamar. vayiqakh yehudah ’ishah le‘er bekhoro, ushemah tamar.
wyhy 8r bkwr yhwdh r8 b8yny yhwh wymthw yhwh and awake-er, know-judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou; and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou slew him. vayhi ‘er bekhor yehudah ra‘ be‘enei yhvh, vaymitehu yhvh.
wy1mr yhwdh l1wnn b1 1l 1St 1Hyk wybm 1th whqm zr8 l1Hyk and know-judah said unto trouble-vigor-onan, go in unto thy brother's woman, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother. vayomer yehudah le’onan bo ’el ’eshet ’akhikha veyabem ’otah, vehaqem zera‘ le’akhikha.
wyd8 1wnn ky l1 lw yhyh hzr8 whyh 1m b1 1l 1St 1Hyw wSHt 1rZh lblty ntn zr8 l1Hyw and trouble-vigor-onan hand-knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's woman, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother. vayeda‘ ’onan ki lo lo yihyeh hazara‘, vehayah ’im ba ’el ’eshet ’akhiv veshikhet ’arzah lebilti netan zera‘ le’akhiv.
wyr8 b8yny yhwh 1Sr 8Sh wymt gm 1tw and the thing which he did displeased yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou: wherefore he slew him also. vayera‘ be‘enei yhvh ’asher ‘asah, vayamet gam ’oto.
wy1mr yhwdh ltmr kltw Sby 1lmnh byt 1byk 8d ygdl Slh bny ky 1mr pn ymwt gm hw1 k1Hyw wtlk tmr wtSb byt 1byh then said know-judah to palm-date-tamar his daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching, remain a widow at thy father's daughter-house, till pulled-out-shelah my child-between be grown: for he said, lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. and palm-date-tamar went and dwelt in her father's daughter-house. vayomer yehudah letamar kalato shebi ’almanah bet ’abikh ‘ad yigdal shelah beni ki ’amar pen yamut gam hu ke’ekhav, vatelekh tamar vatesheb bet ’abiha.
wyrbw hymym wtmt bt Sw8 1St yhwdh wynHm yhwdh wy8l 8l gzzy Z1nw hw1 wHyrh r8hw h8dlmy tmnth and in process of time the daughter-hoof-bat-child of talk-shuah know-judah's woman died; and know-judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to prevent-timnath, he and his friend freedom-hirah the just-fleeing-adullamite. vayirbu hayamim vatamat bat shua‘ ’eshet yehudah, vayinakhem yehudah vaya‘al ‘al gozazei zono hu vekhirah re‘ehu ha‘adulami timnatah.
wygd ltmr l1mr hnh Hmyk 8lh tmnth lgz Z1nw and it was told palm-date-tamar, saying, behold thy father in law goeth up to prevent-timnath to shear his sheep. vayugad letamar lemor, hineh khamikh ‘oleh timnatah lagoz zono.
wtsr bgdy 1lmnwth m8lyh wtks bZ8yp wtt8lp wtSb bptH 8ynym 1Sr 8l drk tmnth ky r1th ky gdl Slh whw1 l1 ntnh lw l1Sh and she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a breaker, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to prevent-timnath; for she saw that pulled-out-shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to woman. vatasar bigdei ’almenutah me‘aleha vatekhas baza‘if vatit‘alaf vatesheb befetakh ‘enayim ’asher ‘al derekh timnatah, ki ra’atah ki gadal shelah vehiv lo nitenah lo le’ishah.
wyr1h yhwdh wyHSbh lzwnh ky ksth pnyh when know-judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face-turns. vayir’eha yehudah vayakhshebeha lezonah, ki khisetah paneha.
wyT 1lyh 1l hdrk wy1mr hbh n1 1bw1 1lyk ky l1 yd8 ky kltw hw1 wt1mr mh ttn ly ky tbw1 1ly and he turned unto her by the way, and said, go to, i pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he hand-knew not that she was his daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching.) and she said, what wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me? vayet ’eleha ’el haderekh vayomer habah na ’abo ’elayikh ki lo yada‘ ki khalato hi vatomer mah titen li ki tabo ’elay.
wy1mr 1nky 1SlH gdy 8zym mn hZ1n wt1mr 1m ttn 8rbwn 8d SlHk and he said, i will send thee a kid from the flock. and she said, wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it? vayomer ’anokhi ’ashalakh gedi ‘izim min hazon, vatomer ’im titen ‘erabon ‘ad shalekhekha.
wy1mr mh h8rbwn 1Sr 1tn lk wt1mr Htmk wptylk wmTk 1Sr bydk wytn lh wyb1 1lyh wthr lw and he said, what pledge i give thee? and she said, thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. and he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him. vayomer mah ha‘erabon ’asher ’eten lakh vatomer khotamekha ufetilekha umatekha ’asher beyadekha, vayiten lah vayabo ’eleha vatahar lo.
wtqm wtlk wtsr Z8yph m8lyh wtlbS bgdy 1lmnwth and she arose, and went away, and laid by her breaker from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood. vataqam vatelekh vatasar ze‘ifah me‘aleha, vatilbash bigdei ’almenutah.
wySlH yhwdh 1t gdy h8zym byd r8hw h8dlmy lqHt h8rbwn myd h1Sh wl1 mZ1h and know-judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the just-fleeing-adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: and he found her not. vayishlakh yehudah gedi ha‘izim beyad re‘ehu ha‘adulami laqakhat ha‘erabon miyad ha’ishah, velo meza’ah.
wyS1l 1t 1nSy mqmh l1mr 1yh hqdSh hw1 b8ynym 8l hdrk wy1mrw l1 hyth bzh qdSh then he asked the men of that place, saying, where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? and they said, there was no harlot in this place. vayish’al ’anshei meqomah lemor ’ayeh haqedeshah hi ba‘enayim ‘al hadarekh, vayomeru lo hayetah bazeh qedeshah.
wySb 1l yhwdh wy1mr l1 mZ1tyh wgm 1nSy hmqwm 1mrw l1 hyth bzh qdSh and he returned to know-judah, and said, i cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place. vayashab ’el yehudah vayomer lo mezatiha, vegam ’anshei hamaqom ’ameru lo hayetah bazeh qedeshah.
wy1mr yhwdh tqH lh pn nhyh lbwz hnh SlHty hgdy hzh w1th l1 mZ1th and know-judah said, let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, i sent this kid, and thou hast not found her. vayomer yehudah tiqakh lah pen nihyeh labuz, hineh shalakhti hagedi hazeh ve’atah lo mezatah.
wyhy kmSlS HdSym wygd lyhwdh l1mr znth tmr kltk wgm hnh hrh lznwnym wy1mr yhwdh hwZy1wh wtSrp and it came to pass about three months after, that it was told know-judah, saying, palm-date-tamar thy daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. and know-judah said, bring her forth, and let her be burnt. vayhi kemishlosh khodashim vayugad lihudah lemor zanetah tamar kalatekha vegam hineh harah liznunim, vayomer yehudah hozi’uha vetisaref.
hw1 mwZ1t why1 SlHh 1l Hmyh l1mr l1yS 1Sr 1lh lw 1nky hrh wt1mr hkr n1 lmy hHtmt whptylym whmTh h1lh when she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, by the man, whose these are, am i with child: and she said, discern, i pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff. hi muzet vehi shalekhah ’el khamiha lemor le’ish ’asher ’eleh lo ’anokhi harah, vatomer haker na lemi hakhotemet vehapetilim vehamateh ha’eleh.
wykr yhwdh wy1mr Zdqh mmny ky 8l kn l1 nttyh lSlh bny wl1 ysp 8wd ld8th and know-judah acknowledged them, and said, she hath been more just than i; because that i gave her not to pulled-out-shelah my child-between. and he hand-knew her again no more. vayaker yehudah vayomer zadeqah mimeni ki ‘al ken lo netatiha leshelah beni, velo yasaf ‘od leda‘tah
wyhy b8t ldth whnh t1wmym bbTnh and it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb. vayhi be‘et lidtah, vehineh te’omim bebitnah.
wyhy bldth wytn yd wtqH hmyldt wtqSr 8l ydw Sny l1mr zh yZ1 r1Snh and it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a two caterpillars thread, saying, this came out first. vayhi belidtah vayiten yad, vatiqakh hamyaledet vatiqshor ‘al yado shani lemor zeh yaza rishonah.
wyhy kmSyb ydw whnh yZ1 1Hyw wt1mr mh prZt 8lyk prZ wyqr1 Smw prZ and it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, how hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called breach-parez. vayhi kemeshib yado vehineh yaza ’akhiv vatomer mah parazta ‘alekha parez, vayiqra shemo parez.
w1Hr yZ1 1Hyw 1Sr 8l ydw hSny wyqr1 Smw zrH and afterward came out his brother, that had the two caterpillars thread upon his hand: and his name was called shine-zarah. ve’akhar yaza ’akhiv ’asher ‘al yado hashani, vayiqra shemo zarakh.
wywsp hwrd mZrymh wyqnhw pwTypr srys pr8h Sr hTbHym 1yS mZry myd hySm81lym 1Sr hwrdhw Smh and add-joseph was brought down to narrows-mizraim; and given-by-ra-potiphar, an officer of big-house-pharaoh, captain of the guard, an narrows-mizraimian, bought him of the hands of the towards-hears-ishmaelites, which had brought him down thither. veyosef hurad mizrayemah, vayiqnehu potifar seris par‘oh sar hatabakhim mizri miyad hayishme‘elim ’asher horiduhu shamah.
wyhy yhwh 1t ywsp wyhy 1yS mZlyH wyhy bbyt 1dnyw hmZry and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was with add-joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the daughter-house of his master the narrows-mizraimian. vayhi yhvh ’et yosef vayhi ’ish mazliakh, vayhi bebet ’adonav hamizri.
wyr1 1dnyw ky yhwh 1tw wkl 1Sr hw1 8Sh yhwh mZlyH bydw and his master saw that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was with him, and that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou made all that he did to prosper in his hand. vayar ’adonav ki yhvh ’ito, vekhol ’asher hu ‘oseh yhvh mazliakh beyado.
wymZ1 ywsp Hn b8ynyw wySrt 1tw wypqdhw 8l bytw wkl yS lw ntn bydw and add-joseph found attractiveness in his sight, and he worked for him: and he made him overseer over his daughter-house, and all that he had he put into his hand. vayimza yosef khen be‘enav vaysharet ’oto, vayafqidehu ‘al beto vekhal yesh lo natan beyado.
wyhy m1z hpqyd 1tw bbytw w8l kl 1Sr yS lw wybrk yhwh 1t byt hmZry bgll ywsp wyhy brkt yhwh bkl 1Sr yS lw bbyt wbSdh and it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his daughter-house, and over all that he had, that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou knee-fluffy-blessed the narrows-mizraimian's daughter-house for add-joseph's sake; and the knee-fluffy-blessing of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was upon all that he had in the daughter-house, and in the field. vayhi me’az hifqid ’oto bebeto ve‘al kal ’asher yesh lo vaybarekh yhvh bet hamizri biglal yosef, vayhi birkat yhvh bekhal ’asher yesh lo babayit ubasadeh.
wy8zb kl 1Sr lw byd ywsp wl1 yd8 1tw m1wmh ky 1m hlHm 1Sr hw1 1wkl wyhy ywsp yph t1r wyph mr1h and he left all that he had in add-joseph's hand; and he hand-knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. and add-joseph was a goodly person, and well favored. vaya‘azob kal ’asher lo beyad yosef velo yada‘ ’ito me’umah ki ’im halekhem ’asher hu ’okhel, vayhi yosef yefeh to’ar vifeh mar’eh.
wyhy 1Hr hdbrym h1lh wtS1 1St 1dnyw 1t 8ynyh 1l ywsp wt1mr Skbh 8my and it came to pass after these things, that his master's woman cast her eyes upon add-joseph; and she said, lie with me. vayhi ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh vatisa ’eshet ’adonav ‘eneha ’el yosef, vatomer shikhbah ‘imi.
wym1n wy1mr 1l 1St 1dnyw hn 1dny l1 yd8 1ty mh bbyt wkl 1Sr yS lw ntn bydy and he refused, and said unto his master's woman, behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the daughter-house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand; vayma’en vayomer ’el ’eshet ’adonav hen ’adoni lo yada‘ ’iti mah babayit, vekhol ’asher yesh lo natan beyadi.
1ynnw gdwl bbyt hzh mmny wl1 HSk mmny m1wmh ky 1m 1wtk b1Sr 1t 1Stw w1yk 18Sh hr8h hgdlh hz1t wHT1ty l1lhym there is none greater in this daughter-house than i; neither hath he kept back any thing from me and thee, because thou art his woman: how then can i do this great wickedness, and miss against towards-these-elohim? ’enenu gadol babayit hazeh mimeni velo khasakh mimeni me’umah ki ’im ’otakh ba’asher ’at ’ishto, ve’ekh ’e‘eseh hara‘ah hagedolah hazot vekhatati lelohim.
wyhy kdbrh 1l ywsp ywm ywm wl1 Sm8 1lyh lSkb 1Zlh lhywt 8mh and it came to pass, as she spake to add-joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her. vayhi kedaberah ’el yosef yom yom, velo shama‘ ’eleha lishkab ’ezlah lihyot ‘imah.
wyhy khywm hzh wyb1 hbyth l8Swt ml1ktw w1yn 1yS m1nSy hbyt Sm bbyt and it came to pass about this time, that add-joseph went into the daughter-house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the daughter-house there within. vayhi kehayom hazeh vayabo habaytah la‘asot melakhto, ve’en ’ish me’anshei habayit sham babayit.
wttpShw bbgdw l1mr Skbh 8my wy8zb bgdw bydh wyns wyZ1 hHwZh and she caught him by his garment, saying, lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out. vatitpesehu bebigdo lemor shikhbah ‘imi, vaya‘azob bigdo beyadah vayanas vayezei hakhuzah.
wyhy kr1wth ky 8zb bgdw bydh wyns hHwZh and it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth, vayhi kir’otah ki ‘azab bigdo beyadah, vayanas hakhuzah.
wtqr1 l1nSy byth wt1mr lhm l1mr r1w hby1 lnw 1yS 8bry lZHq bnw b1 1ly lSkb 8my w1qr1 bqwl gdwl that she called unto the men of her daughter-house, and spake unto them, saying, see, he hath brought in an cross-over-hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and i cried with a loud voice: vatiqra le’anshei betah vatomer lahem lemor re’u hebi lanu ’ish ‘ibri lezakheq banu, ba ’elay lishkab ‘imi va’eqra beqol gadol.
wyhy kSm8w ky hrymty qwly w1qr1 wy8zb bgdw 1Zly wyns wyZ1 hHwZh and it came to pass, when he heard that i lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out. vayhi kheshame‘o ki harimoti qoli va’eqra, vaya‘azob bigdo ’ezli vayanas vayezei hakhuzah.
wtnH bgdw 1Zlh 8d bw1 1dnyw 1l bytw and she laid up his garment by her, until his lord-base came home. vatanakh bigdo ’ezlah, ‘ad bo ’adonav ’el beto.
wtdbr 1lyw kdbrym h1lh l1mr b1 1ly h8bd h8bry 1Sr hb1t lnw lZHq by and she spake unto him according to these bee-words, saying, the cross-over-hebrew worker, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me: vatedaber ’elav kadebarim ha’eleh lemor, ba ’elay ha‘ebed ha‘ibri ’asher hebeta lanu lezakheq bi.
wyhy khrymy qwly w1qr1 wy8zb bgdw 1Zly wyns hHwZh and it came to pass, as i lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out. vayhi kaharimi qoli va’eqra, vaya‘azob bigdo ’ezli vayanas hakhuzah.
wyhy kSm8 1dnyw 1t dbry 1Stw 1Sr dbrh 1lyw l1mr kdbrym h1lh 8Sh ly 8bdk wyHr 1pw and it came to pass, when his master heard the bee-words of his woman, which she spake unto him, saying, after this manner did thy worker to me; that his wrath was kindled. vayhi khishmoa‘ ’adonav dibrei ’ishto ’asher diberah ’elav lemor kadebarim ha’eleh ‘asah li ‘abdekha, vayikhar ’apo.
wyqH 1dny ywsp 1tw wytnhw 1l byt hshr mqwm 1Sr 1swry 1syry hmlk 1swrym wyhy Sm bbyt hshr and add-joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the moloch-king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison. vayiqakh ’adonei yosef ’oto vayitenehu ’el bet hasohar meqom ’asher ’asirei hamelekh ’asurim, vayhi sham bebet hasohar.
wyhy yhwh 1t ywsp wyT 1lyw Hsd wytn Hnw b8yny Sr byt hshr and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was with add-joseph, and showed him mercy, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison. vayhi yhvh ’et yosef vayet ’elav khased, vayiten khino be‘enei sar bet hasohar.
wytn Sr byt hshr byd ywsp 1t kl h1syrm 1Sr bbyt hshr w1t kl 1Sr 8Sym Sm hw1 hyh 8Sh and the keeper of the prison committed to add-joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it. vayiten sar bet hasohar beyad yosef kal ha’asirim ’asher bebet hasohar, ve’et kal ’asher ‘osim sham hu hayah ‘oseh.
1yn Sr byt hshr r1h 1t kl m1wmh bydw b1Sr yhwh 1tw w1Sr hw1 8Sh yhwh mZlyH the keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was with him, and that which he did, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou made it to prosper. ’en sar bet hasohar ro’eh kal me’umah beyado ba’asher yhvh ’ito, va’asher hu ‘oseh yhvh mazliakh.
wyhy 1Hr hdbrym h1lh HT1w mSqh mlk mZrym wh1ph l1dnyhm lmlk mZrym and it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim and his baker had offended their lord-base the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim. vayhi ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh khate’u mashqeh melekh mizrayim veha’ofeh, la’adonehem lemelekh mizrayim.
wyqZp pr8h 8l Sny srysyw 8l Sr hmSqym w8l Sr h1wpym and big-house-pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers. vayiqzof par‘oh ‘al shenei sarisav, ‘al sar hamashqim ve‘al sar ha’ofim.
wytn 1tm bmSmr byt Sr hTbHym 1l byt hshr mqwm 1Sr ywsp 1swr Sm and he put them in ward in the daughter-house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where add-joseph was bound. vayiten ’otam bemishmar bet sar hatabakhim ’el bet hasohar, meqom ’asher yosef ’asur.
wypqd Sr hTbHym 1t ywsp 1tm wySrt 1tm wyhyw ymym bmSmr and the captain of the guard charged add-joseph with them, and he worked for them: and they continued a season in ward. vayifqod sar hatabakhim yosef ’itam vaysharet ’otam, vayihyu yamim bemishmar.
wyHlmw Hlwm Snyhm 1yS Hlmw blylh 1Hd 1yS kptrwn Hlmw hmSqh wh1ph 1Sr lmlk mZrym 1Sr 1swrym bbyt hshr and they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim, which were bound in the prison. vayakhalmu khalom shenehem ’ish khalomo belaylah ’ekhad ’ish kefitron khalomo, hamashqeh veha’ofeh ’asher lemelekh mizrayim ’asher ’asurim bebet hasohar.
wyb1 1lyhm ywsp bbqr wyr1 1tm whnm z8pym and add-joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad. vayabo ’alehem yosef baboqer, vayar ’otam vehinam zo‘afim.
wyS1l 1t srysy pr8h 1Sr 1tw bmSmr byt 1dnyw l1mr mdw8 pnykm r8ym hywm and he asked big-house-pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord-base's daughter-house, saying, wherefore look ye so sadly to day? vayish’al serisei far‘oh ’asher ’ito bemishmar bet ’adonav lemor, madua‘ penekhem ra‘im hayom.
wy1mrw 1lyw Hlwm Hlmnw wptr 1yn 1tw wy1mr 1lhm ywsp hlw1 l1lhym ptrnym sprw n1 ly and they said unto him, we have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. and add-joseph said unto them, do not interpretations belong to towards-these-elohim? tell me them, i pray you. vayomeru ’elav khalom khalamnu ufoter ’en ’oto, vayomer ’alehem yosef halo lelohim pitronim saperu na li.
wyspr Sr hmSqym 1t Hlmw lywsp wy1mr lw bHlwmy whnh gpn lpny and the chief butler told his dream to add-joseph, and said to him, in my dream, behold, a vine was before-turns me; vaysaper sar hamashqim khalomo leyosef, vayomer lo bakhalomi vehineh gefen lefanay.
wbgpn SlSh Srygm why1 kprHt 8lth nZh hbSylw 1Skltyh 8nbym and in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes: ubagefen sheloshah sarigim, vehi kheforakhat ‘aletah nizah hibshilu ’ashkeloteha ‘anabim.
wkws pr8h bydy w1qH 1t h8nbym w1SHT 1tm 1l kws pr8h w1tn 1t hkws 8l kp pr8h and big-house-pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and i took the grapes, and pressed them into big-house-pharaoh's cup, and i gave the cup into big-house-pharaoh's hand. vekhos par‘oh beyadi, va’eqakh ha‘anabim va’eskhat ’otam ’el kos par‘oh va’eten hakos ‘al kaf par‘oh.
wy1mr lw ywsp zh ptrnw SlSt hSrgym SlSt ymym hm and add-joseph said unto him, this is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days: vayomer lo yosef zeh pitrono, sheloshet hasarigim sheloshet yamim hem.
b8wd SlSt ymym yS1 pr8h 1t r1Sk whSybk 8l knk wntt kws pr8h bydw kmSpT hr1Swn 1Sr hyyt mSqhw yet within three days big-house-pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou deliver big-house-pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler. be‘od sheloshet yamim yisa far‘oh roshekha vahashibekha ‘al kanekha, venatata khos par‘oh beyado kamishpat harishon ’asher hayita mashqehu.
ky 1m zkrtny 1tk k1Sr yyTb lk w8Syt n1 8mdy Hsd whzkrtny 1l pr8h whwZ1tny mn hbyt hzh and think on me when it be well with thee, and show kindness, i pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto big-house-pharaoh, and bring me out of this daughter-house: ki ’im zekhartani ’itekha ka’asher yitab lakh ve‘asita na ‘imadi khased, vehizkartani ’el par‘oh vehozetani min habayit hazeh.
ky gnb gnbty m1rZ h8brym wgm ph l1 8Syty m1wmh ky Smw 1ty bbwr for indeed i was stolen away out of the land of the cross-over-hebrews: and here also have i done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon. ki gunob gunabti me’erez ha‘ibrim, vegam poh lo ‘asiti me’umah ki samu ’oti babor.
wyr1 Sr h1pym ky Twb ptr wy1mr 1l ywsp 1p 1ny bHlwmy whnh SlSh sly Hry 8l r1Sy when the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto add-joseph, i also was in my dream, and, behold, i had three to-between-bin-between-build-white baskets on my head: vayar sar ha’ofim ki tob patar, vayomer ’el yosef ’af ’ani bakhalomi vehineh sheloshah salei khori ‘al roshi.
wbsl h8lywn mkl m1kl pr8h m8Sh 1ph wh8wp 1kl 1tm mn hsl m8l r1Sy and in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for big-house-pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head. ubasal ha‘elyon mikol ma’akhal par‘oh ma‘aseh ’ofeh, veha‘of ’okhel ’otam min hasal me‘al roshi.
wy8n ywsp wy1mr zh ptrnw SlSt hslym SlSt ymym hm and add-joseph answered and said, this is the interpretation thereof: the three baskets are three days: vaya‘an yosef vayomer zeh pitrono, sheloshet hasalim sheloshet yamim hem.
b8wd SlSt ymym yS1 pr8h 1t r1Sk m8lyk wtlh 1wtk 8l 8Z w1kl h8wp 1t bSrk m8lyk yet within three days big-house-pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and hang thee on a tree; and the birds eat thy flesh from off thee. be‘od sheloshet yamim yisa far‘oh roshekha me‘alekha vetalah ’otkha ‘al ‘ez, ve’akhal ha‘of besarekha me‘alekha.
wyhy bywm hSlySy ywm hldt 1t pr8h wy8S mSth lkl 8bdyw wyS1 1t r1S Sr hmSqym w1t r1S Sr h1pym btwk 8bdyw and it came to pass the third day, which was big-house-pharaoh's birthday, that he made a until-conception unto all his workers: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his workers. vayhi bayom hashelishi yom huledet par‘oh vaya‘as mishteh lekhal ‘abadav, vayisa rosh sar hamashqim ve’et rosh sar ha’ofim betokh ‘abadav.
wySb 1t Sr hmSqym 8l mSqhw wytn hkws 8l kp pr8h and he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into big-house-pharaoh's hand: vayasheb sar hamashqim ‘al mashqehu, vayiten hakos ‘al kaf par‘oh.
w1t Sr h1pym tlh k1Sr ptr lhm ywsp and he hanged the chief baker: as add-joseph had interpreted to them. ve’et sar ha’ofim talah, ka’asher patar lahem yosef.
wl1 zkr Sr hmSqym 1t ywsp wySkHhw yet did not the chief butler remember add-joseph, and forgat him. velo zakhar sar hamashqim yosef vayishkakhehu.
wyhy mqZ Sntym ymym wpr8h Hlm whnh 8md 8l hy1r and it came to pass at the end of two full years, that big-house-pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river. vayhi miqez shenatayim yamim, ufar‘oh kholem vehineh ‘omed ‘al hay’or.
whnh mn hy1r 8lt Sb8 prwt ypwt mr1h wbry1t bSr wtr8ynh b1Hw and, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favored kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow. vehineh min hay’or ‘olot sheba‘ parot yefot mar’eh uberi’ot basar, vatir‘enah ba’akhu.
whnh Sb8 prwt 1Hrwt 8lwt 1Hryhn mn hy1r r8wt mr1h wdqwt bSr wt8mdnh 1Zl hprwt 8l Spt hy1r and, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favored and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river. vehineh sheba‘ parot ’akherot ‘olot ’akharehen min hay’or ra‘ot mar’eh vedaqot basar, vata‘amodenah ’ezel haparot ‘al sefat hay’or.
wt1klnh hprwt r8wt hmr1h wdqt hbSr 1t Sb8 hprwt ypt hmr1h whbry1t wyyqZ pr8h and the ill favored and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favored and fat kine. so big-house-pharaoh awoke. vatokhalnah haparot ra‘ot hamar’eh vedaqot habasar sheba‘ haparot yefot hamar’eh vehaberi’ot, vayiqaz par‘oh.
wyySn wyHlm Snyt whnh Sb8 Sblym 8lwt bqnh 1Hd bry1wt wTbwt and he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn-swimming came up upon one stalk, rank and good. vayishan vayakhalom shenit, vehineh sheba‘ shibolim ‘olot beqaneh ’ekhad beri’ot vetobot.
whnh Sb8 Sblym dqwt wSdwpt qdym ZmHwt 1Hryhn and, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them. vehineh sheba‘ shibolim daqot ushedufot qadim, zomekhot ’akharehen.
wtbl8nh hSblym hdqwt 1t Sb8 hSblym hbry1wt whml1wt wyyqZ pr8h whnh Hlwm and the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. and big-house-pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream. vatibla‘nah hashibolim hadaqot sheba‘ hashibolim haberi’ot vehamele’ot, vayiqaz par‘oh vehineh khalom.
wyhy bbqr wtp8m rwHw wySlH wyqr1 1t kl HrTmy mZrym w1t kl Hkmyh wyspr pr8h lhm 1t Hlmw w1yn pwtr 1wtm lpr8h and it came to pass in the morning that his breath-spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of narrows-mizraim, and all the wise men thereof: and big-house-pharaoh told them his dream; and there was none that could interpret them unto big-house-pharaoh. vayhi baboqer vatipa‘em rukho vayishlakh vayiqra kal khartumei mizrayim ve’et kal khakhameha, vaysaper par‘oh lahem khalomo ve’en poter ’otam lefar‘oh.
wydbr Sr hmSqym 1t pr8h l1mr 1t HT1y 1ny mzkyr hywm then spake the chief butler unto big-house-pharaoh, saying, i do remember my faults this day: vaydaber sar hamashqim ’et par‘oh lemor, khata’ay ’ani mazkir hayom.
pr8h qZp 8l 8bdyw wytn 1ty bmSmr byt Sr hTbHym 1ty w1t Sr h1pym big-house-pharaoh was wroth with his workers, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard's daughter-house, both me and the chief baker: par‘oh qazaf ‘al ‘abadav, vayiten ’oti bemishmar bet sar hatabakhim ’oti ve’et sar ha’ofim.
wnHlmh Hlwm blylh 1Hd 1ny whw1 1yS kptrwn Hlmw Hlmnw and we dreamed a dream in one night, i and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream. vanakhalmah khalom belaylah ’ekhad ’ani vahu, ’ish kefitron khalomo khalamenu.
wSm 1tnw n8r 8bry 8bd lSr hTbHym wnspr lw wyptr lnw 1t Hlmtynw 1yS kHlmw ptr and there was there with us a young man, an cross-over-hebrew, worker to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret. vesham ’itanu na‘ar ‘ibri ‘ebed lesar hatabakhim vanesaper lo vayiftar lanu khalomotenu, ’ish kakhalomo patar.
wyhy k1Sr ptr lnw kn hyh 1ty hSyb 8l kny w1tw tlh and it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged. vayhi ka’asher patar lanu ken hayah, ’oti heshib ‘al kani ve’oto talah.
wySlH pr8h wyqr1 1t ywsp wyryZhw mn hbwr wyglH wyHlp Smltyw wyb1 1l pr8h then big-house-pharaoh sent and called add-joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto big-house-pharaoh. vayishlakh par‘oh vayiqra yosef vayrizuhu min habor, vaygalakh vaykhalef simlotav vayabo ’el par‘oh.
wy1mr pr8h 1l ywsp Hlwm Hlmty wptr 1yn 1tw w1ny Sm8ty 8lyk l1mr tSm8 Hlwm lptr 1tw and big-house-pharaoh said unto add-joseph, i have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and i have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it. vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef khalom khalamti ufoter ’en ’oto, va’ani shama‘ti ‘alekha lemor tishma‘ khalom liftor ’oto.
wy8n ywsp 1t pr8h l1mr bl8dy 1lhym y8nh 1t Slwm pr8h and add-joseph answered big-house-pharaoh, saying, it is not in me: towards-these-elohim give big-house-pharaoh an answer of peace. vaya‘an yosef par‘oh lemor bil‘aday, ’elohim ya‘aneh shelom par‘oh.
wydbr pr8h 1l ywsp bHlmy hnny 8md 8l Spt hy1r and big-house-pharaoh said unto add-joseph, in my dream, behold, i stood upon the bank of the river: vaydaber par‘oh ’el yosef, bakhalomi hini ‘omed ‘al sefat hay’or.
whnh mn hy1r 8lt Sb8 prwt bry1wt bSr wypt t1r wtr8ynh b1Hw and, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favored; and they fed in a meadow: vehineh min hay’or ‘olot sheba‘ parot beri’ot basar vifot to’ar, vatir‘enah ba’akhu.
whnh Sb8 prwt 1Hrwt 8lwt 1Hryhn dlwt wr8wt t1r m1d wrqwt bSr l1 r1yty khnh bkl 1rZ mZrym lr8 and, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favored and leanfleshed, such as i never saw in all the land of narrows-mizraim for badness: vehineh sheba‘ parot ’akherot ‘olot ’akharehen dalot vera‘ot to’ar me’od veraqot basar, lo ra’iti khahenah bekhal ’erez mizrayim laroa‘.
wt1klnh hprwt hrqwt whr8wt 1t Sb8 hprwt hr1Snwt hbry1t and the lean and the ill favored kine did eat up the first seven fat kine: vatokhalnah haparot haraqot vehara‘ot, sheba‘ haparot harishonot haberi’ot.
wtb1nh 1l qrbnh wl1 nwd8 ky b1w 1l qrbnh wmr1yhn r8 k1Sr btHlh w1yqZ and when they had eaten them up, it could not be hand-known that they had eaten them; and they were still ill favored, as at the beginning. so i awoke. vatabonah qirbenah velo noda‘ ki ba’u qirbenah umar’ehen ra‘ ka’asher batekhilah, va’iqaz.
w1r1 bHlmy whnh Sb8 Sblym 8lt bqnh 1Hd ml1t wTbwt and i saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good: va’ere bakhalomi, vehineh sheba‘ shibolim ‘olot beqaneh ’ekhad mele’ot vetobot.
whnh Sb8 Sblym Znmwt dqwt Sdpwt qdym ZmHwt 1Hryhm and, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them: vehineh sheba‘ shibolim zenumot daqot shedufot qadim, zomekhot ’akharehem.
wtbl8n hSblym hdqt 1t Sb8 hSblym hTbwt w1mr 1l hHrTmym w1yn mgyd ly and the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and i told this unto the magicians; and there was none that could declare it to me. vatibla‘na hashibolim hadaqot sheba‘ hashibolim hatobot, va’omar ’el hakhartumim ve’en magid li.
wy1mr ywsp 1l pr8h Hlwm pr8h 1Hd hw1 1t 1Sr h1lhym 8Sh hgyd lpr8h and add-joseph said unto big-house-pharaoh, the dream of big-house-pharaoh is one: towards-these-elohim hath showed big-house-pharaoh what he is about to do. vayomer yosef ’el par‘oh khalom par‘oh ’ekhad hu, ’asher ha’elohim ‘oseh higid lefar‘oh.
Sb8 prt hTbt Sb8 Snym hnh wSb8 hSblym hTbt Sb8 Snym hnh Hlwm 1Hd hw1 the seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one. sheba‘ parot hatobot sheba‘ shanim henah vesheba‘ hashibolim hatobot sheba‘ shanim henah, khalom ’ekhad hu.
wSb8 hprwt hrqwt whr8t h8lt 1Hryhn Sb8 Snym hnh wSb8 hSblym hrqwt Sdpwt hqdym yhyw Sb8 Sny r8b and the seven thin and ill favored kine that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind be seven years of famine. vesheba‘ haparot haraqot vehara‘ot ha‘olot ’akharehen sheba‘ shanim henah vesheba‘ hashibolim hareqot shedufot haqadim, yihyu sheba‘ shenei ra‘ab.
hw1 hdbr 1Sr dbrty 1l pr8h 1Sr h1lhym 8Sh hr1h 1t pr8h this is the thing which i have bee-spoken unto big-house-pharaoh: what towards-these-elohim is about to do he showeth unto big-house-pharaoh. hu hadabar ’asher dibarti ’el par‘oh, ’asher ha’elohim ‘oseh her’ah par‘oh.
hnh Sb8 Snym b1wt Sb8 gdwl bkl 1rZ mZrym behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of narrows-mizraim: hineh sheba‘ shanim ba’ot, saba‘ gadol bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
wqmw Sb8 Sny r8b 1Hryhn wnSkH kl hSb8 b1rZ mZrym wklh hr8b 1t h1rZ and there arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty be forgotten in the land of narrows-mizraim; and the famine consume the land; veqamu sheba‘ shenei ra‘ab ’akharehen venishkakh kal hasaba‘ be’erez mizrayim, vekhilah hara‘ab ha’arez.
wl1 ywd8 hSb8 b1rZ mpny hr8b hhw1 1Hry kn ky kbd hw1 m1d and the plenty not be hand-known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it be very grievous. velo yivada‘ hasaba‘ ba’arez mipenei hara‘ab hahu ’akhare khen, ki khabed hu me’od.
w8l hSnwt hHlwm 1l pr8h p8mym ky nkwn hdbr m8m h1lhym wmmhr h1lhym l8Stw and for that the dream was doubled unto big-house-pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by towards-these-elohim, and towards-these-elohim will shortly bring it to pass. ve‘al hishanot hakhalom ’el par‘oh pa‘amayim, ki nakhon hadabar me‘im ha’elohim umemaher ha’elohim la‘asoto.
w8th yr1 pr8h 1yS nbwn wHkm wySythw 8l 1rZ mZrym now therefore let big-house-pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of narrows-mizraim. ve‘atah yere far‘oh ’ish nabon vekhakham, vishitehu ‘al ’erez mizrayim.
y8Sh pr8h wypqd pqdym 8l h1rZ wHmS 1t 1rZ mZrym bSb8 Sny hSb8 let big-house-pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of narrows-mizraim in the seven plenteous years. ya‘aseh far‘oh veyafqed peqidim ‘al ha’arez, vekhimesh ’erez mizrayim besheba‘ shenei hasaba‘.
wyqbZw 1t kl 1kl hSnym hTbt hb1t h1lh wyZbrw br tHt yd pr8h 1kl b8rym wSmrw and let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn-swimming under the hand of big-house-pharaoh, and let them keep food in the cities. veyiqbezu kal ’okhel hashanim hatobot haba’ot ha’eleh, veyizberu bar takhat yad par‘oh ’okhel be‘arim veshamaru.
whyh h1kl lpqdwn l1rZ lSb8 Sny hr8b 1Sr thyyn b1rZ mZrym wl1 tkrt h1rZ br8b and that food be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, which be in the land of narrows-mizraim; that the land perish not through the famine. vehayah ha’okhel lefiqadon la’arez lesheba‘ shenei hara‘ab ’asher tihyena be’erez mizrayim, velo tikaret ha’arez bara‘ab.
wyyTb hdbr b8yny pr8h wb8yny kl 8bdyw and the thing was good in the eyes of big-house-pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his workers. vayitab hadabar be‘enei far‘oh, ube‘enei kal ‘abadav.
wy1mr pr8h 1l 8bdyw hnmZ1 kzh 1yS 1Sr rwH 1lhym bw and big-house-pharaoh said unto his workers, can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom breath-spirit of towards-these-elohim is? vayomer par‘oh ’el ‘abadav, hanimza khazeh ’ish ’asher ruakh ’elohim bo.
wy1mr pr8h 1l ywsp 1Hry hwdy8 1lhym 1wtk 1t kl z1t 1yn nbwn wHkm kmwk and big-house-pharaoh said unto add-joseph, forasmuch as towards-these-elohim hath showed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art: vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef ’akharei hodia‘ ’elohim ’otkha kal zot, ’en nabon vekhakham kamokha.
1th thyh 8l byty w8l pyk ySq kl 8my rq hks1 1gdl mmk thou be over my daughter-house, and according unto thy bee-word all my with-mum-people be ruled: only in the throne will i be greater than thou. ’atah tihyeh ‘al beti ve‘al pikha yishaq kal ‘ami, raq hakisei ’egdal mimeka.
wy1mr pr8h 1l ywsp r1h ntty 1tk 8l kl 1rZ mZrym and big-house-pharaoh said unto add-joseph, see, i have set thee over all the land of narrows-mizraim. vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef, re’eh natati ’otekha ‘al kal ’erez mizrayim.
wysr pr8h 1t Tb8tw m8l ydw wytn 1th 8l yd ywsp wylbS 1tw bgdy SS wySm rbd hzhb 8l Zw1rw and big-house-pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon add-joseph's hand, and arrayed him in vestures six, and put a gold chain about his neck; vayasar par‘oh taba‘to me‘al yado vayiten ’otah ‘al yad yosef, vayalbesh ’oto bigde shesh vayasem rebid hazahab ‘al zavaro.
wyrkb 1tw bmrkbt hmSnh 1Sr lw wyqr1w lpnyw 1brk wntwn 1tw 8l kl 1rZ mZrym and he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before-turns him, bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of narrows-mizraim. vayarkeb ’oto bemirkebet hamishneh ’asher lo vayiqre’u lefanav ’abrekh, venaton ’oto ‘al kal ’erez mizrayim.
wy1mr pr8h 1l ywsp 1ny pr8h wbl8dyk l1 yrym 1yS 1t ydw w1t rglw bkl 1rZ mZrym and big-house-pharaoh said unto add-joseph, i am big-house-pharaoh, and without thee no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of narrows-mizraim. vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef ’ani far‘oh, ubil‘adekha lo yarim ’ish yado ve’et raglo bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
wyqr1 pr8h Sm ywsp Zpnt p8nH wytn lw 1t 1snt bt pwTy pr8 khn 1n l1Sh wyZ1 ywsp 8l 1rZ mZrym and big-house-pharaoh called add-joseph's name ; and he gave him to woman thorn-bush-asenath the daughter-hoof-bat-child of given-by-ra-potipherah dimmer-server of on. and add-joseph went out over all the land of narrows-mizraim. vayiqra far‘oh shem yosef pa‘neakh vayiten lo ’asenat bat poti fera‘ kohen ’on le’ishah, vayezei yosef ‘al ’erez mizrayim.
wywsp bn SlSym Snh b8mdw lpny pr8h mlk mZrym wyZ1 ywsp mlpny pr8h wy8br bkl 1rZ mZrym and add-joseph was thirty years old when he stood before-turns big-house-pharaoh moloch-king of narrows-mizraim. and add-joseph went out from the presence of big-house-pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of narrows-mizraim. veyosef ben sheloshim shanah be‘amedo lifnei par‘oh melekh mizrayim, vayezei yosef milifnei far‘oh vaya‘bor bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
wt8S h1rZ bSb8 Sny hSb8 lqmZym and in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls. vata‘as ha’arez besheba‘ shenei hasaba‘, liqmazim.
wyqbZ 1t kl 1kl Sb8 Snym 1Sr hyw b1rZ mZrym wytn 1kl b8rym 1kl Sdh h8yr 1Sr sbybtyh ntn btwkh and he added up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of narrows-mizraim, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every light-city, laid he up in the same. vayiqboz kal ’okhel sheba‘ shanim ’asher hayu be’erez mizrayim vayiten ’okhel be‘arim, ’okhel sedeh ha‘ir ’asher sebiboteha natan betokhah.
wyZbr ywsp br kHwl hym hrbh m1d 8d ky Hdl lspr ky 1yn mspr and add-joseph added corn-swimming as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number. vayizbor yosef bar kekhol hayam harbeh me’od, ‘ad ki khadal lispor ki ’en mispar.
wlywsp yld Sny bnym bTrm tbw1 Snt hr8b 1Sr yldh lw 1snt bt pwTy pr8 khn 1wn and unto add-joseph were born two children-betweens before-turns the years of famine came, which thorn-bush-asenath the daughter-hoof-bat-child of given-by-ra-potipherah dimmer-server of on conceived-of unto him. uleyosef yulad shenei banim beterem tabo shenat hara‘ab, ’asher yaledah lo ’asenat bat poti fera‘ kohen ’on.
wyqr1 ywsp 1t Sm hbkwr mnSh ky nSny 1lhym 1t kl 8mly w1t kl byt 1by and add-joseph called the name of the firstborn place-of-sleep-manasseh: for towards-these-elohim, said he, hath let me sleep over my toil, and all my father's daughter-house. vayiqra yosef shem habekhor menasheh, ki nashani ’elohim kal ‘amali ve’et kal bet ’abi.
w1t Sm hSny qr1 1prym ky hprny 1lhym b1rZ 8nyy and the name of the second called he fruitful-ephraim: for towards-these-elohim hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction. ve’et shem hasheni qara ’efrayim, ki hifrani ’elohim be’erez ‘aneyi.
wtklynh Sb8 Sny hSb8 1Sr hyh b1rZ mZrym and the seven years of plenteousness, that was in the land of narrows-mizraim, were ended. vatikhlenah sheba‘ shenei hasaba‘, ’asher hayah be’erez mizrayim.
wtHlynh Sb8 Sny hr8b lbw1 k1Sr 1mr ywsp wyhy r8b bkl h1rZwt wbkl 1rZ mZrym hyh lHm and the seven years of dearth began to come, according as add-joseph had said: and the dearth was in all lands; and in all the land of narrows-mizraim there was bread. vatekhilenah sheba‘ shenei hara‘ab labo ka’asher ’amar yosef, vayhi ra‘ab bekhal ha’arazot ubekhal ’erez mizrayim hayah lakhem.
wtr8b kl 1rZ mZrym wyZ8q h8m 1l pr8h llHm wy1mr pr8h lkl mZrym lkw 1l ywsp 1Sr y1mr lkm t8Sw and when all the land of narrows-mizraim was famished, the with-mum-people cried to big-house-pharaoh for bread: and big-house-pharaoh said unto all the narrows-mizraimians, go unto add-joseph; what he saith to you, do. vatir‘ab kal ’erez mizrayim vayiz‘aq ha‘am ’el par‘oh lalakhem, vayomer par‘oh lekhal mizrayim lekhu ’el yosef ’asher yomar lakhem ta‘asu.
whr8b hyh 8l kl pny h1rZ wyptH ywsp 1t kl 1Sr bhm wySbr lmZrym wyHzq hr8b b1rZ mZrym and the famine was over all the face-turns of the earth: and add-joseph opened all the storehouses, and sold unto the narrows-mizraimians; and the famine waxed sore in the land of narrows-mizraim. vehara‘ab hayah ‘al kal penei ha’arez, vayiftakh yosef kal ’asher bahem vayishbor lemizrayim vayekhezaq hara‘ab be’erez mizrayim.
wkl h1rZ b1w mZrymh lSbr 1l ywsp ky Hzq hr8b bkl h1rZ and all countries came into narrows-mizraim to add-joseph for to buy corn-swimming; because that the famine was so sore in all lands. vekhal ha’arez ba’u mizraymah lishbor ’el yosef, ki khazaq hara‘ab bekhal ha’arez.
wyr1 y8qb ky yS Sbr bmZrym wy1mr y8qb lbnyw lmh ttr1w now when backstreet-jacob saw that there was corn-swimming in narrows-mizraim, backstreet-jacob said unto his children-betweens, why do ye look one upon another? vayar ya‘aqob ki yesh sheber bemizrayim, vayomer ya‘aqob lebanav lamah titra’u.
wy1mr hnh Sm8ty ky yS Sbr bmZrym rdw Smh wSbrw lnw mSm wnHyh wl1 nmwt and he said, behold, i have heard that there is corn-swimming in narrows-mizraim: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die. vayomer hineh shama‘ti ki yesh sheber bemizrayim, redu shamah veshibru lanu misham venikhyeh velo namut.
wyrdw 1Hy ywsp 8Srh lSbr br mmZrym and add-joseph's ten brethren went down to buy corn-swimming in narrows-mizraim. vayeredu ’akhe yosef ‘asarah, lishbor bar mimizrayim.
w1t bnymyn 1Hy ywsp l1 SlH y8qb 1t 1Hyw ky 1mr pn yqr1nw 1swn and he-between-of-righthand-benjamin, add-joseph's brother, backstreet-jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, lest peradventure mischief befall him. ve’et binyamin ’akhi yosef lo shalakh ya‘aqob ’et ’ekhav, ki ’amar pen yiqra’enu ’ason.
wyb1w bny ySr1l lSbr btwk hb1ym ky hyh hr8b b1rZ kn8n and children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel came to buy corn-swimming among those that came: for the famine was in the land of mobile-trade-canaan. vayabo’u benei yisra’el lishbor betokh haba’im, ki hayah hara‘ab be’erez kena‘an.
wywsp hw1 hSlyT 8l h1rZ hw1 hmSbyr lkl 8m h1rZ wyb1w 1Hy ywsp wyStHww lw 1pym 1rZh and add-joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the with-mum-people of the land: and add-joseph's brethren came, and bowed down themselves before-turns him with their face-turns-turns to the earth. veyosef hu hashalit ‘al ha’arez hu hamashbir lekhal ‘am ha’arez, vayabo’u ’akhei yosef vayishtakhavu lo ’apayim ’arezah.
wyr1 ywsp 1t 1Hyw wykrm wytnkr 1lyhm wydbr 1tm qSwt wy1mr 1lhm m1yn b1tm wy1mrw m1rZ kn8n lSbr 1kl and add-joseph saw his brethren, and he hand-knew them, and made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them, whence come ye? and they said, from the land of mobile-trade-canaan to buy food. vayar yosef ’ekhav vayakirem, vayitnaker ’alehem vaydaber ’itam qashot vayomer ’alehem me’ayin batem vayomeru me’erez kena‘an lishbar ’okhel.
wykr ywsp 1t 1Hyw whm l1 hkrhw and add-joseph hand-knew his brethren, and they hand-knew not him. vayaker yosef ’ekhav, vehem lo hikiruhu.
wyzkr ywsp 1t hHlmwt 1Sr Hlm lhm wy1mr 1lhm mrglym 1tm lr1wt 1t 8rwt h1rZ b1tm and add-joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come. vayizkor yosef hakhalomot ’asher khalam lahem, vayomer ’alehem meragelim ’atem lir’ot ‘ervat ha’arez batem.
wy1mrw 1lyw l1 1dny w8bdyk b1w lSbr 1kl and they said unto him, nay, my lord-base, and to buy food are thy workers come. vayomeru ’elav lo ’adoni, va‘abadekha ba’u lishbar ’okhel.
klnw bny 1yS 1Hd nHnw knym 1nHnw l1 hyw 8bdyk mrglym we are all one man's children-betweens; we are true men, thy workers are no spies. kulanu benei ’ish ’ekhad nakhenu, kenim ’anakhnu lo hayu ‘abadekha meragelim.
wy1mr 1lhm l1 ky 8rwt h1rZ b1tm lr1wt and he said unto them, nay, and to see the nakedness of the land ye are come. vayomer ’alehem, lo ki ‘ervat ha’arez batem lir’ot.
wy1mrw Snym 8Sr 8bdyk 1Hym 1nHnw bny 1yS 1Hd b1rZ kn8n whnh hqTn 1t 1bynw hywm wh1Hd 1ynnw and they said, thy workers are twelve brethren, children-betweens of one man in the land of mobile-trade-canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not. vayomeru shenem ‘asar ‘abadekha ’akhim ’anakhnu benei ’ish ’ekhad be’erez kena‘an, vehineh haqaton ’et ’abinu hayom veha’ekhad ’enenu.
wy1mr 1lhm ywsp hw1 1Sr dbrty 1lkm l1mr mrglym 1tm and add-joseph said unto them, that is it that i spake unto you, saying, ye are spies: vayomer ’alehem yosef, hu ’asher dibarti ’alekhem lemor meragelim ’atem.
bz1t tbHnw Hy pr8h 1m tZ1w mzh ky 1m bbw1 1Hykm hqTn hnh hereby ye be proved: by the life of big-house-pharaoh ye not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither. bezot tibakhenu, khei far‘oh ’im teze’u mizeh ki ’im bebo ’akhikhem haqaton henah.
SlHw mkm 1Hd wyqH 1t 1Hykm w1tm h1srw wybHnw dbrykm h1mt 1tkm w1m l1 Hy pr8h ky mrglym 1tm send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye be kept in prison, that your bee-words may be proved, whether there be any truth in you: or else by the life of big-house-pharaoh surely ye are spies. shilkhu mikem ’ekhad veyiqakh ’akhikhem ve’atem he’aseru veyibakhanu dibrekhem ha’emet ’itekhem, ve’im lo khei far‘oh ki meragelim ’atem.
wy1sp 1tm 1l mSmr SlSt ymym and he put them all together into ward three days. vaye’esof ’otam ’el mishmar sheloshet yamim.
wy1mr 1lhm ywsp bywm hSlySy z1t 8Sw wHyw 1t h1lhym 1ny yr1 and add-joseph said unto them the third day, this do, and live; for i fear towards-these-elohim: vayomer ’alehem yosef bayom hashelishi zot ‘asu vikhyu, ha’elohim ’ani yare.
1m knym 1tm 1Hykm 1Hd y1sr bbyt mSmrkm w1tm lkw hby1w Sbr r8bwn btykm if ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in the daughter-house of your prison: go ye, carry corn-swimming for the famine of your daughter-houses: ’im kenim ’atem ’akhikhem ’ekhad ye’aser bebet mishmarkhem, ve’atem lekhu habi’u sheber ra‘abon batekhem.
w1t 1Hykm hqTn tby1w 1ly wy1mnw dbrykm wl1 tmwtw wy8Sw kn and bring your youngest brother unto me; so your bee-words be verified, and ye not die. and they did so. ve’et ’akhikhem haqaton tabi’u ’elay veye’amenu dibrekhem velo tamutu, vaya‘asu khen.
wy1mrw 1yS 1l 1Hyw 1bl 1Smym 1nHnw 8l 1Hynw 1Sr r1ynw Zrt npSw bhtHnnw 1lynw wl1 Sm8nw 8l kn b1h 1lynw hZrh hz1t and they said one to another, we are verily fire-name concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his being, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us. vayomeru ’ish ’el ’akhiv ’abal ’ashemim ’anakhnu ‘al ’akhinu ’asher ra’inu zarat nafsho behitkhano ’elenu velo shama‘enu, ‘al ken ba’ah ’elenu hazarah hazot.
wy8n r1wbn 1tm l1mr hlw1 1mrty 1lykm l1mr 1l tHT1w byld wl1 Sm8tm wgm dmw hnh ndrS and buddy-see-child-reuben answered them, saying, spake i not unto you, saying, do not miss against child; and ye would not hear? therefore, behold, also his blood is required. vaya‘an re’uben ’otam lemor halo ’amarti ’alekhem lemor ’al tekhet’u bayeled velo shema‘tem, vegam damo hineh nidrash.
whm l1 yd8w ky Sm8 ywsp ky hmlyZ byntm and they hand-knew not that add-joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter. vehem lo yade‘u ki shomea‘ yosef, ki hameliz benotam.
wysb m8lyhm wybk wySb 1lhm wydbr 1lhm wyqH m1tm 1t Sm8wn wy1sr 1tw l8ynyhm and he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them hear-home-simeon, and bound him before-turns their eyes. vayisob me‘alehem vayebek, vayashab ’alehem vaydaber ’alehem vayiqakh me’itam shim‘on vaye’esor ’oto le‘enehem.
wyZw ywsp wyml1w 1t klyhm br wlhSyb kspyhm 1yS 1l Sqw wltt lhm Zdh ldrk wy8S lhm kn then add-joseph order-prescribed to fill their sacks with corn-swimming, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he unto them. vayzav yosef vaymal’u kelehem bar ulehashib kaspehem ’ish ’el saqo velatet lahem zedah ladarekh, vaya‘as lahem ken.
wyS1w 1t Sbrm 8l Hmryhm wylkw mSm and they laded their asses with the corn-swimming, and departed thence. vayis’u shibram ‘al khamorehem, vayelekhu misham.
wyptH h1Hd 1t Sqw ltt mspw1 lHmrw bmlwn wyr1 1t kspw whnh hw1 bpy 1mtHtw and as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money; for, behold, it was in his sack's mouth. vayiftakh ha’ekhad saqo latet mispo lakhamoro bamalon, vayar kaspo vehineh hu befi ’amtakhto.
wy1mr 1l 1Hyw hwSb kspy wgm hnh b1mtHty wyZ1 lbm wyHrdw 1yS 1l 1Hyw l1mr mh z1t 8Sh 1lhym lnw and he said unto his brethren, my money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, what is this that towards-these-elohim hath done unto us? vayomer ’el ’ekhav hushab kaspi vegam hineh be’amtakhti, vayezei libam vayekherdu ’ish ’el ’akhiv lemor mah zot ‘asah ’elohim lanu.
wyb1w 1l y8qb 1byhm 1rZh kn8n wygydw lw 1t kl hqrt 1tm l1mr and they came unto backstreet-jacob their father unto the land of mobile-trade-canaan, and told him all that befell unto them; saying, vayabo’u ’el ya‘aqob ’abihem ’arzah kena‘an, vayagidu lo kal haqorot ’otam lemor.
dbr h1yS 1dny h1rZ 1tnw qSwt wytn 1tnw kmrglym 1t h1rZ the man, who is the lord-base of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country. diber ha’ish ’adonei ha’arez ’itanu qashot, vayiten ’otanu kimragelim ha’arez.
wn1mr 1lyw knym 1nHnw l1 hyynw mrglym and we said unto him, we are true men; we are no spies: vanomer ’elav kenim ’anakhenu, lo hayinu meragelim.
Snym 8Sr 1nHnw 1Hym bny 1bynw h1Hd 1ynnw whqTn hywm 1t 1bynw b1rZ kn8n we be twelve brethren, children-betweens of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of mobile-trade-canaan. shenem ‘asar ’anakhnu ’akhim benei ’abinu, ha’ekhad ’enenu vehaqaton hayom ’et ’abinu be’erez kena‘an.
wy1mr 1lynw h1yS 1dny h1rZ bz1t 1d8 ky knym 1tm 1Hykm h1Hd hnyHw 1ty w1t r8bwn btykm qHw wlkw and the man, the lord-base of the country, said unto us, hereby i hand-know that ye are true men; leave one of your brethren here with me, and take food for the famine of your daughter-households, and be gone: vayomer ’elenu ha’ish ’adonei ha’arez bezot ’eda‘ ki khenim ’atem, ’akhikhem ha’ekhad hanikhu ’iti ve’et ra‘abon batekhem qekhu valekhu.
whby1w 1t 1Hykm hqTn 1ly w1d8h ky l1 mrglym 1tm ky knym 1tm 1t 1Hykm 1tn lkm w1t h1rZ tsHrw and bring your youngest brother unto me: then i hand-know that ye are no spies, and that ye are true men: so will i deliver you your brother, and ye traffic in the land. vehabi’u ’akhikhem haqaton ’elay ve’ede‘ah ki lo meragelim ’atem ki khenim ’atem,. ’akhikhem ’eten lakhem ve’et ha’arez tiskharu.
wyhy hm mryqym Sqyhm whnh 1yS Zrwr kspw bSqw wyr1w 1t Zrrwt kspyhm hmh w1byhm wyyr1w and it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack: and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid. vayhi hem meriqim saqehem vehineh ’ish zeror kaspo besaqo, vayir’u zerorot kaspehem hemah va’abihem vayira’u.
wy1mr 1lhm y8qb 1byhm 1ty Skltm ywsp 1ynnw wSm8wn 1ynnw w1t bnymn tqHw 8ly hyw klnh and backstreet-jacob their father said unto them, me have ye bereaved of my children-betweens: add-joseph is not, and hear-home-simeon is not, and ye will take he-between-of-righthand-benjamin away: all these things are against me. vayomer ’alehem ya‘aqob ’abihem ’oti shikaltem, yosef ’enenu veshim‘on ’enenu ve’et binyamin tiqakhu ‘alay hayu khulanah.
wy1mr r1wbn 1l 1byw l1mr 1t Sny bny tmyt 1m l1 1by1nw 1lyk tnh 1tw 8l ydy w1ny 1Sybnw 1lyk and buddy-see-child-reuben spake unto his father, saying, slay my two children-betweens, if i bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and i will bring him to thee again. vayomer re’uben ’el ’abiv lemor shenei banay tamit ’im lo ’abi’enu ’elekha, tenah ’oto ‘al yadi va’ani ’ashibenu ’elekha.
wy1mr l1 yrd bny 8mkm ky 1Hyw mt whw1 lbdw nS1r wqr1hw 1swn bdrk 1Sr tlkw bh whwrdtm 1t Sybty bygwn S1wlh and he said, my child-between not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then ye bring down my gray gate-hairs with sorrow to the grave. vayomer lo yered beni ‘imakhem, ki ’akhiv met vehu lebado nish’ar uqera’ahu ’ason baderekh ’asher telekhu bah vehoradtem sebati beyagon she’olah.
whr8b kbd b1rZ and the famine was sore in the land. vehara‘ab kabed ba’arez.
wyhy k1Sr klw l1kl 1t hSbr 1Sr hby1w mmZrym wy1mr 1lyhm 1byhm Sbw Sbrw lnw m8T 1kl and it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn-swimming which they had brought out of narrows-mizraim, their father said unto them, go again, buy us a little food. vayhi ka’asher kilu le’ekhol hasheber ’asher hebi’u mimizrayim, vayomer ’alehem ’abihem shubu shibru lanu me‘at ’okhel.
wy1mr 1lyw yhwdh l1mr h8d h8d bnw h1yS l1mr l1 tr1w pny blty 1Hykm 1tkm and know-judah spake unto him, saying, the man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, ye not see my face-turns, except your brother be with you. vayomer ’elav yehudah lemor, ha‘ed he‘id banu ha’ish lemor lo tir’u fanay bilti ’akhikhem ’itekhem.
1m ySk mSlH 1t 1Hynw 1tnw nrdh wnSbrh lk 1kl if thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food: ’im yeshkha meshaleakh ’akhinu ’itanu, neredah venishberah lekha ’okhel.
w1m 1ynk mSlH l1 nrd ky h1yS 1mr 1lynw l1 tr1w pny blty 1Hykm 1tkm and if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, ye not see my face-turns, except your brother be with you. ve’im ’enekha meshaleakh lo nered, ki ha’ish ’amar ’elenu lo tir’u fanay bilti ’akhikhem ’itekhem.
wy1mr ySr1l lmh hr8tm ly lhgyd l1yS h8wd lkm 1H and saturated-towards-israel said, wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother? vayomer yisra’el lamah hare‘otem li, lehagid la’ish ha‘od lakhem ’akh.
wy1mrw S1wl S1l h1yS lnw wlmwldtnw l1mr h8wd 1bykm Hy hyS lkm 1H wngd lw 8l py hdbrym h1lh hydw8 nd8 ky y1mr hwrydw 1t 1Hykm and they said, the man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these bee-words: could we certainly hand-know that he would say, bring your brother down? vayomeru sha’ol sha’al ha’ish lanu ulemoladtenu lemor ha‘od ’abikhem khay hayesh lakhem ’akh vanaged lo ‘al pi hadebarim ha’eleh, hayadoa‘ neda‘ ki yomar horidu ’akhikhem.
wy1mr yhwdh 1l ySr1l 1byw SlHh hn8r 1ty wnqwmh wnlkh wnHyh wl1 nmwt gm 1nHnw gm 1th gm Tpnw and know-judah said unto saturated-towards-israel his father, send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones. vayomer yehudah ’el yisra’el ’abiv shilkhah hana‘ar ’iti venaqumah venelekhah, venikhyeh velo namut gam ’anakhnu gam ’atah gam tapenu.
1nky 18rbnw mydy tbqSnw 1m l1 hby1tyw 1lyk whZgtyw lpnyk wHT1ty lk kl hymym i will be surety for him; of my hand thou require him: if i bring him not unto thee, and set him before-turns thee, then let me bear the blame for ever: ’anokhi ’e‘erbenu miyadi tebaqshenu, ’im lo habi’otiv ’elekha vehizagtiv lefanekha vekhatati lekha kal hayamim.
ky lwl1 htmhmhnw ky 8th Sbnw zh p8mym for except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time. ki lulei hitmahmahenu, ki ‘atah shabnu zeh fa‘amayim.
wy1mr 1lhm ySr1l 1byhm 1m kn 1pw1 z1t 8Sw qHw mzmrt h1rZ bklykm whwrydw l1yS mnHh m8T Zry wm8T dbS nk1t wlT bTnym wSqdym and their father saturated-towards-israel said unto them, if it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your tools, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, scents, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds: vayomer ’alehem yisra’el ’abihem ’im ken ’efo zot ‘asu qekhu mizimrat ha’arez bikhlekhem vehoridu la’ish minkhah, me‘at zori ume‘at debash nekhot valot batenim usheqedim.
wksp mSnh qHw bydkm w1t hksp hmwSb bpy 1mtHtykm tSybw bydkm 1wly mSgh hw1 and take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry it again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight: vekhesef mishneh qekhu beyedkhem, ve’et hakesef hamushab befi ’amtekhotekhem tashibu beyedkhem ’ulay mishgeh hu.
w1t 1Hykm qHw wqwmw Swbw 1l h1yS take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man: ve’et ’akhikhem qakhu, vequmu shubu ’el ha’ish.
w1l Sdy ytn lkm rHmym lpny h1yS wSlH lkm 1t 1Hykm 1Hr w1t bnymyn w1ny k1Sr Sklty Sklty and towards-these-elohim almighty give you mercy before-turns the man, that he may send away your other brother, and he-between-of-righthand-benjamin. if i be bereaved of my children-betweens, i am bereaved. ve’el shaday yiten lakhem rakhamim lifnei ha’ish veshilakh lakhem ’akhikhem ’akher ve’et binyamin, va’ani ka’asher shakholeti shakhaleti.
wyqHw h1nSym 1t hmnHh hz1t wmSnh ksp lqHw bydm w1t bnymn wyqmw wyrdw mZrym wy8mdw lpny ywsp and the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand and he-between-of-righthand-benjamin; and rose up, and went down to narrows-mizraim, and stood before-turns add-joseph. vayiqkhu ha’anashim haminkhah hazot umishneh kesef laqekhu beyadam ve’et binyamin, vayaqumu vayeredu mizrayim vaya‘amdu lifnei yosef.
wyr1 ywsp 1tm 1t bnymyn wy1mr l1Sr 8l bytw hb1 1t h1nSym hbyth wTbH TbH whkn ky 1ty y1klw h1nSym bZhrym and when add-joseph saw he-between-of-righthand-benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his daughter-house, bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these men dine with me at noon. vayar yosef ’itam binyamin vayomer la’asher ‘al beto habei ha’anashim habayetah, uteboakh tebakh vehakhen ki ’iti yokhelu ha’anashim bazahorayim.
wy8S h1yS k1Sr 1mr ywsp wyb1 h1yS 1t h1nSym byth ywsp and the man did as add-joseph bade; and the man brought the men into add-joseph's daughter-house. vaya‘as ha’ish ka’asher ’amar yosef, vayabei ha’ish ha’anashim betah yosef.
wyyr1w h1nSym ky hwb1w byt ywsp wy1mrw 8l dbr hksp hSb b1mtHtynw btHlh 1nHnw mwb1ym lhtgll 8lynw wlhtnpl 8lynw wlqHt 1tnw l8bdym w1t Hmrynw and the men were afraid, because they were brought into add-joseph's daughter-house; and they said, because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for workers, and our asses. vayire’u ha’anashim ki hube’u bet yosef vayomeru ‘al debar hakesef hashab be’amtekhotenu batekhilah ’anakhnu muba’im, lehitgolel ‘alenu ulehitnapel ‘alenu velaqakhat ’otanu la‘abadim ve’et khamorenu.
wygSw 1l h1yS 1Sr 8l byt ywsp wydbrw 1lyw ptH hbyt and they came near to the steward of add-joseph's daughter-house, and they communed with him at the opening of the daughter-house, vayigeshu ’el ha’ish ‘al bet yosef, vaydaberu ’elav petakh habayit.
wy1mrw by 1dny yrd yrdnw btHlh lSbr 1kl and said, o sir, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food: vayomeru ’adoni, yarod yaradnu batekhilah lishbar ’okhel.
wyhy ky b1nw 1l hmlwn wnptHh 1t 1mtHtynw whnh ksp 1yS bpy 1mtHtw kspnw bmSqlw wnSb 1tw bydnw and it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand. vayhi ki banu ’el hamalon vaniftekhah ’amtekhotenu vehineh khesef ’ish befi ’amtakhto kaspenu bemishqalo, vanasheb ’oto beyadenu.
wksp 1Hr hwrdnw bydnw lSbr 1kl l1 yd8nw my Sm kspnw b1mtHtynw and other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks. vekhesef ’akher horadnu beyadenu lishbar ’okhel, lo yada‘nu mi sam kaspenu be’amtekhotenu.
wy1mr Slwm lkm 1l tyr1w 1lhykm w1lhy 1bykm ntn lkm mTmwn b1mtHtykm kspkm b1 1ly wywZ1 1lhm 1t Sm8wn and he said, peace be to you, fear not: your towards-these-elohim, and the towards-these-elohim of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: i had your money. and he brought hear-home-simeon out unto them. vayomer shalom lakhem ’al tira’u ’elohekhem velohei ’abikhem natan lakhem matmon be’amtekhotekhem kaspekhem ba ’elay, vayozei ’alehem shim‘on.
wyb1 h1yS 1t h1nSym byth ywsp wytn mym wyrHZw rglyhm wytn mspw1 lHmryhm and the man brought the men into add-joseph's daughter-house, and gave them from-waters, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender. vayabei ha’ish ha’anashim betah yosef, vayiten mayim vayirkhazu raglehem vayiten mispo lakhamorehem.
wykynw 1t hmnHh 8d bw1 ywsp bZhrym ky Sm8w ky Sm y1klw lHm and they made ready the present against add-joseph came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there. vayakhinu haminkhah ‘ad bo yosef bazahorayim, ki shame‘u ki sham yokhelu lakhem.
wyb1 ywsp hbyth wyby1w lw 1t hmnHh 1Sr bydm hbyth wyStHww lw 1rZh and when add-joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the daughter-house, and bowed themselves to him to the earth. vayabo yosef habaytah vayabi’’u lo haminkhah ’asher beyadam habayetah, vayishtakhavu lo ’arezah.
wyS1l lhm lSlwm wy1mr hSlwm 1bykm hzqn 1Sr 1mrtm h8wdnw Hy and he asked them of their welfare, and said, is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? is he yet alive? vayish’al lahem leshalom vayomer hashalom ’abikhem hazaqen ’asher ’amartem, ha‘odenu khay.
wy1mrw Slwm l8bdk l1bynw 8wdnw Hy wyqdw wyStHw wyStHww and they answered, thy worker our father is in good health, he is yet alive. and they bowed down their heads, and made obeisance. vayomeru shalom le‘abdekha le’abinu ‘odenu khay, vayiqedu vayishtakhavu
wyS1 8ynyw wyr1 1t bnymyn 1Hyw bn 1mw wy1mr hzh 1Hykm hqTn 1Sr 1mrtm 1ly wy1mr 1lhym yHnk bny and he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother he-between-of-righthand-benjamin, his mother's child-between, and said, is this your younger brother, of whom ye spake unto me? and he said, towards-these-elohim be attracted unto thee, my child-between. vayisa ‘enav vayar binyamin ’akhiv ben ’imo vayomer hazeh ’akhikhem haqaton ’asher ’amartem ’elay, vayomar ’elohim yakhenekha beni.
wymhr ywsp ky nkmrw rHmyw 1l 1Hyw wybqS lbkwt wyb1 hHdrh wybk Smh and add-joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there. vaymaher yosef ki nikhmeru rakhamav ’el ’akhiv vaybaqesh libkot, vayabo hakhadrah vayebek shamah.
wyrHZ pnyw wyZ1 wyt1pq wy1mr Symw lHm and he washed his face-turns, and went out, and refrained himself, and said, set on bread. vayirkhaz panav vayeze, vayit’apaq vayomer simu lakhem.
wySymw lw lbdw wlhm lbdm wlmZrym h1klym 1tw lbdm ky l1 ywklwn hmZrym l1kl 1t h8brym lHm ky tw8bh hw1 lmZrym and they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the narrows-mizraimians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the narrows-mizraimians might not eat bread with the cross-over-hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the narrows-mizraimians. vayasimu lo lebado velahem lebadam, velamizrim ha’okhelim ’ito lebadam ki lo yukhelun hamizrim le’ekhol ’et ha‘ibrim lekhem ki to‘ebah hi lemizrayim.
wySbw lpnyw hbkr kbkrtw whZ8yr kZ8rtw wytmhw h1nSym 1yS 1l r8hw and they sat before-turns him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marveled one at another. vayeshebu lefanav habekhor kibkhorato vehaza‘ir kiz‘irato, vayitmehu ha’anashim ’ish ’el re‘ehu.
wyS1 mS1t m1t pnyw 1lhm wtrb mS1t bnymn mmS1t klm HmS ydwt wyStw wySkrw 8mw and he took and sent messes unto them from before-turns him: and he-between-of-righthand-benjamin's mess was five times so much as any of theirs. and they drank, and were merry with him. vayisa mas’ot me’et panav ’alehem vatereb mas’at binyamin mimas’ot kulam khamesh yadot, vayishtu vayishkeru ‘imo.
wyZw 1t 1Sr 8l bytw l1mr ml1 1t 1mtHt h1nSym 1kl k1Sr ywklwn S1t wSym ksp 1yS bpy 1mtHtw and he order-prescribed the steward of his daughter-house, saying, fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth. vayzav ’asher ‘al beto lemor malei ’amtekhot ha’anashim ’okhel ka’asher yukhelun se’et, vesim kesef ’ish befi ’amtakhto.
w1t gby8y gby8 hksp tSym bpy 1mtHt hqTn w1t ksp Sbrw wy8S kdbr ywsp 1Sr dbr and put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and his corn-swimming money. and he did according to the bee-word that add-joseph had bee-spoken. ve’et gebi‘i gebia‘ hakesef tasim befi ’amtakhat haqaton ve’et kesef shibro, vaya‘as kidbar yosef ’asher diber.
hbqr 1wr wh1nSym SlHw hmh wHmryhm as soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses. haboqer ’or, veha’anashim shulekhu hemah vakhamorehem.
