hm yZ1w 1t h8yr l1 hrHyqw wywsp 1mr l1Sr 8l bytw qwm rdp 1Hry h1nSym whSgtm w1mrt 1lhm lmh Slmtm r8h tHt Twbh and when they were gone out of the light-city, and not yet far off, add-joseph said unto his steward, up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, wherefore have ye rewarded bad for good? hem yaze’u ’et ha‘ir lo hirkhiqu veyosef ’amar la’asher ‘al beto qum redof ’akharei ha’anashim, vehisagtam ve’amarta ’alehem lamah shilamtem ra‘ah takhat tobah.
hlw1 zh 1Sr ySth 1dny bw whw1 nHS ynHS bw hr8tm 1Sr 8Sytm is not this it in which my lord-base drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done bad in so doing. halo zeh ’asher yishteh ’adoni bo vehu nakhesh yenakhesh bo, hare‘otem ’asher ‘asitem.
wySgm wydbr 1lhm 1t hdbrym h1lh and he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same bee-words. vayasigem, vaydaber ’alehem hadebarim ha’eleh.
wy1mrw 1lyw lmh ydbr 1dny kdbrym h1lh Hlylh l8bdyk m8Swt kdbr hzh and they said unto him, wherefore saith my lord-base these bee-words? towards-these-elohim forbid that thy workers should do according to this thing: vayomeru ’elav lamah yedaber ’adoni kadebarim ha’eleh, khalilah la‘abadekha me‘asot kadabar hazeh.
hn ksp 1Sr mZ1nw bpy 1mtHtynw hSybnw 1lyk m1rZ kn8n w1yk ngnb mbyt 1dnyk ksp 1w zhb behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of mobile-trade-canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord-base's daughter-house silver or gold? hen kesef ’asher mazanu befi ’amtekhotenu heshibonu ’elekha me’erez kena‘an, ve’ekh nignob mibet ’adonekha kesef ’o zahab.
1Sr ymZ1 1tw m8bdyk wmt wgm 1nHnw nhyh l1dny l8bdym with whomsoever of thy workers it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord-base's workers. ’asher yimazei ’ito me‘abadekha vamet, vegam ’anakhnu nihyeh ladoni la‘abadim.
wy1mr gm 8th kdbrykm kn hw1 1Sr ymZ1 1tw yhyh ly 8bd w1tm thyw nqym and he said, now also let it be according unto your bee-words: he with whom it is found be my worker; and ye be blameless. vayomer gam ‘atah khedibrekhem ken hu, ’asher yimazei ’ito yihyeh li ‘abed ve’atem tihyu neqiyim.
wymhrw wywrdw 1yS 1t 1mtHtw 1rZh wyptHw 1yS 1mtHtw then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack. vaymaharu vayoridu ’ish ’amtakhto ’arezah, vayiftekhu ’ish ’amtakhto.
wyHpS bgdwl hHl wbqTn klh wymZ1 hgby8 b1mtHt bnymn and he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in he-between-of-righthand-benjamin's sack. vaykhapes bagadol hekhel ubaqaton kilah, vayimazei hagabia‘ be’amtakhat binyamin.
wyqr8w Smltm wy8ms 1yS 8l Hmrw wySbw h8yrh then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the light-city. vayiqre‘u simlotam, vaya‘amos ’ish khamoro vayashubu ha‘irah.
wyb1 yhwdh w1Hyw byth ywsp whw1 8wdnw Sm wyplw lpnyw 1rZh and know-judah and his brethren came to add-joseph's daughter-house; for he was yet there: and they fell before-turns him on the ground. vayabo yehudah ve’ekhav betah yosef vehu ‘odenu sham, vayipelu lefanav ’arezah.
wy1mr lhm ywsp mh hm8Sh hzh 1Sr 8Sytm hlw1 yd8tm ky nHS ynHS 1yS 1Sr kmny and add-joseph said unto them, what deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as i can certainly divine? vayomer lahem yosef mah hama‘aseh hazeh ’asher ‘asitem, halo yeda‘tem ki nakhesh yenakhesh ’ish ’asher kamoni.
wy1mr yhwdh mh n1mr l1dny mh ndbr wmh nZTdq h1lhym mZ1 1t 8wn 8bdyk hnnw 8bdym l1dny gm 1nHnw gm 1Sr nmZ1 hgby8 bydw and know-judah said, what we say unto my lord-base? what we speak? or how we clear ourselves? towards-these-elohim hath found out the torment of thy workers: behold, we are my lord-base's workers, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found. vayomer yehudah mah nomar ladoni mah nedaber umah niztadaq, ha’elohim maza ‘avon ‘abadekha hinenu ‘abadim ladoni gam ’anakhnu gam ’asher nimza hagabia‘ beyado.
wy1mr Hlylh ly m8Swt z1t h1yS 1Sr nmZ1 hgby8 bydw hw1 yhyh ly 8bd w1tm 8lw lSlwm 1l 1bykm and he said, towards-these-elohim forbid that i should do so: and the man in whose hand the cup is found, he be my worker; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father. vayomer khalilah li me‘asot zot, ha’ish ’asher nimza hagabia‘ beyado hu yihyeh li ‘abed ve’atem ‘alu leshalom ’el ’abikhem.
wygS 1lyw yhwdh wy1mr by 1dny ydbr n1 8bdk dbr b1zny 1dny w1l yHr 1pk b8bdk ky kmwk kpr8h then know-judah came near unto him, and said, oh my lord-base, let thy worker, i pray thee, speak a bee-word in my lord-base's ears, and let not thine nose-anger burn against thy worker: for thou art even as big-house-pharaoh. vayigash ’elav yehudah vayomer bi ’adoni yedaber na ‘abdekha dabar be’azenei ’adoni ve’al yikhar ’apekha be‘abdekha, ki khamokha kefar‘oh.
1dny S1l 1t 8bdyw l1mr hyS lkm 1b 1w 1H my lord-base asked his workers, saying, have ye a father, or a brother? ’adoni sha’al ‘abadav lemor, hayesh lakhem ’ab ’o ’akh.
wn1mr 1l 1dny yS lnw 1b zqn wyld zqnym qTn w1Hyw mt wywtr hw1 lbdw l1mw w1byw 1hbw and we said unto my lord-base, we have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him. vanomer ’el ’adoni yesh lanu ’ab zaqen veyeled zequnim qatan, ve’akhiv met vayivater hu lebado le’imo ve’abiv ’ahebo.
wt1mr 1l 8bdyk hwrdhw 1ly w1Symh 8yny 8lyw and thou saidst unto thy workers, bring him down unto me, that i may set mine eyes upon him. vatomer ’el ‘abadekha horiduhu ’elay, ve’asimah ‘eni ‘alav.
wn1mr 1l 1dny l1 ywkl hn8r l8zb 1t 1byw w8zb 1t 1byw wmt and we said unto my lord-base, the lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die. vanomer ’el ’adoni lo hana‘ar la‘azob ’abiv, ve‘azab ’abiv vamet.
wt1mr 1l 8bdyk 1m l1 yrd 1Hykm hqTn 1tkm l1 tspwn lr1wt pny and thou saidst unto thy workers, except your youngest brother come down with you, ye see my face-turns no more. vatomer ’el ‘abadekha ’im lo yered ’akhikhem haqaton ’itekhem, lo tosifun lir’ot panay.
wyhy ky 8lynw 1l 8bdk 1by wngd lw 1t dbry 1dny and it came to pass when we came up unto thy worker my father, we told him the bee-words of my lord-base. vayhi ki ‘alinu ’el ‘abdekha ’abi, vanaged lo ’et dibrei ’adoni.
wy1mr 1bynw Sbw Sbrw lnw m8T 1kl and our father said, go again, and buy us a little food. vayomer ’abinu, shubu shibru lanu me‘at ’okhel.
wn1mr l1 nwkl lrdt 1m yS 1Hynw hqTn 1tnw wyrdnw ky l1 nwkl lr1wt pny h1yS w1Hynw hqTn 1ynnw 1tnw and we said, we cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man's face-turns, except our youngest brother be with us. vanomer lo nukhal laredet, ’im yesh ’akhinu haqaton ’itanu veyaradnu ki lo nukhal lir’ot penei ha’ish ve’akhinu haqaton ’enenu ’itanu.
wy1mr 8bdk 1by 1lynw 1tm yd8tm ky Snym yldh ly 1Sty and thy worker my father said unto us, ye hand-know that my woman conceived-of me two children-betweens: vayomer ‘abdekha ’abi ’elenu, ’atem yeda‘tem ki shenayim yaledah li ’ishti.
wyZ1 h1Hd m1ty w1mr 1k Trp Trp wl1 r1ytyw 8d hnh and the one went out from me, and i said, surely he is torn in pieces; and i saw him not since: vayezei ha’ekhad me’iti va’omar ’akh tarof toraf, velo re’itiv ‘ad
wlqHtm gm 1t zh m8m pny wqrhw 1swn whwrdtm 1t Sybty br8h S1lh and if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye bring down my gray gate-hairs with sorrow to the grave. uleqakhtem gam zeh me‘im panay veqarahu ’ason, vehoradtem sebati bera‘ah she’olah.
w8th kb1y 1l 8bdk 1by whn8r 1ynnw 1tnw wnpSw qSwrh bnpSw now therefore when i come to thy worker my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life; ve‘atah kebo’i ’el ‘abdekha ’abi vehana‘ar ’enenu ’itanu, venafsho qeshurah benafsho.
whyh kr1wtw ky 1yn hn8r wmt whwrydw 8bdyk 1t Sybt 8bdk 1bynw bygwn S1lh it come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy workers bring down the gray gate-hairs of thy worker our father with sorrow to the grave. vehayah kir’oto ki ’en hana‘ar vamet, vehoridu ‘abadekha sebat ‘abdekha ’abinu beyagon she’olah.
ky 8bdk 8rb 1t hn8r m8m 1by l1mr 1m l1 1by1nw 1lyk wHT1ty l1by kl hymym for thy worker became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, if i bring him not unto thee, then i bear the blame to my father for ever. ki ‘abdekha ‘arab hana‘ar me‘im ’abi lemor, ’im lo ’abi’enu ’elekha vekhatati le’abi kal hayamim.
w8th ySb n1 8bdk tHt hn8r 8bd l1dny whn8r y8l 8m 1Hyw now therefore, i pray thee, let thy worker abide instead of the lad a worker to my lord-base; and let the lad go up with his brethren. ve‘atah yesheb na ‘abdekha takhat hana‘ar ‘ebed ladoni, vehana‘ar ya‘al ‘im ’ekhav.
ky 1yk 18lh 1l 1by whn8r 1ynnw 1ty pn 1r1h br8 1Sr ymZ1 1t 1by for how i go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure i see the bad that come on my father. ki ’ekh ’e‘eleh ’el ’abi vehana‘ar ’enenu ’iti, pen ’er’eh bara‘ ’asher yimza ’abi.
wl1 ykl ywsp lht1pq lkl hnZbym 8lyw wyqr1 hwZy1w kl 1yS m8ly wl1 8md 1yS 1tw bhtwd8 ywsp 1l 1Hyw then add-joseph could not refrain himself before-turns all them that stood by him; and he cried, cause every man to go out from me. and there stood no man with him, while add-joseph made himself hand-known unto his brethren. velo yakhol yosef lehit’apeq lekhol hanizabim ‘alav vayiqra hozi’u khal ’ish me‘alay, velo ‘amad ’ish ’ito behitvada‘ yosef ’el ’ekhav.
wytn 1t qlw bbky wySm8w mZrym wySm8 byt pr8h and he wept aloud: and the narrows-mizraimians and the daughter-house of big-house-pharaoh heard. vayiten qolo bibkhi, vayishme‘u mizrayim vayishma‘ bet par‘oh.
wy1mr ywsp 1l 1Hyw 1ny ywsp h8wd 1by Hy wl1 yklw 1Hyw l8nwt 1tw ky nbhlw mpnyw and add-joseph said unto his brethren, i am add-joseph; doth my father yet live? and his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence. vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav ’ani yosef ha‘od ’abi khay, velo yakhelu ’ekhav la‘anot ’oto ki nibhalu mipanav.
wy1mr ywsp 1l 1Hyw gSw n1 1ly wygSw wy1mr 1ny ywsp 1Hykm 1Sr mkrtm 1ty mZrymh and add-joseph said unto his brethren, come near to me, i pray you. and they came near. and he said, i am add-joseph your brother, whom ye sold into narrows-mizraim. vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav geshu na ’elay vayigashu, vayomer ’ani yosef ’akhikhem ’asher mekhartem mizrayemah.
w8th 1l t8Zbw w1l yHr b8ynykm ky mkrtm 1ty hnh ky lmHyh SlHny 1lhym lpnykm now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for towards-these-elohim did send me before-turns you to preserve life. ve‘atah ’al te‘azebu ve’al yikhar be‘enekhem ki mekhartem ’oti henah, ki lemikhyah shelakhani ’elohim lifnekhem.
ky zh Sntym hr8b bqrb h1rZ w8wd HmS Snym 1Sr 1yn HryS wqZyr for these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in the which there neither be earing nor harvest. ki zeh shenatayim hara‘ab beqereb ha’arez, ve‘od khamesh shanim ’asher ’en kharish veqazir
wySlHny 1lhym lpnykm lSwm lkm S1ryt b1rZ wlhHywt lkm lplyTh gdlh and towards-these-elohim sent me before-turns you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance. vayishlakheni ’elohim lifnekhem lasum lakhem she’erit ba’arez, ulehakhayot lakhem lifletah gedolah.
w8th l1 1tm SlHtm 1ty hnh ky h1lhym wySymny l1b lpr8h wl1dwn lkl bytw wmSl bkl 1rZ mZrym so now it was not you that sent me hither, and towards-these-elohim: and he hath made me a father to big-house-pharaoh, and lord-base of all his daughter-house, and a ruler throughout all the land of narrows-mizraim. ve‘atah lo ’atem shelakhtem ’oti henah ki ha’elohim, vaysimeni le’ab lefar‘oh ule’adon lekhal beto umoshel bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
mhrw w8lw 1l 1by w1mrtm 1lyw kh 1mr bnk ywsp Smny 1lhym l1dwn lkl mZrym rdh 1ly 1l t8md haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, thus saith thy child-between add-joseph, towards-these-elohim hath made me lord-base of all narrows-mizraim: come down unto me, tarry not: maharu va‘alu ’el ’abi va’amartem ’elav koh ’amar binkha yosef samani ’elohim le’adon lekhal mizrayim, redah ’elay ’al ta‘amod.
wySbt b1rZ gSn whyyt qrwb 1ly 1th wbnyk wbny bnyk wZ1nk wbqrk wkl 1Sr lk and thou dwell in the land of rain-goshen, and thou be near unto me, thou, and thy children-betweens, and thy children-betweens's children-betweens, and thy flocks, and thy visit-cattles, and all that thou hast: veyashabta be’erez goshen vehayita qarob ’elay ’atah ubanekha ubenei banekha, vezonekha ubeqarekha vekhal ’asher lakh.
wklklty 1tk Sm ky 8wd HmS Snym r8b pn twrS 1th wbytk wkl 1Sr lk and there will i nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy daughter-household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty. vekhilkalti ’otekha sham ki ‘od khamesh shanim ra‘ab, pen tivaresh ’atah ubetekha vekhal ’asher lakh.
whnh 8ynykm r1wt w8yny 1Hy bnymyn ky py hmdbr 1lykm and, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother he-between-of-righthand-benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you. vehineh ‘enekhem ro’ot ve‘enei ’akhi binyamin, ki fi hamdaber ’alekhem.
whgdtm l1by 1t kl kbwdy bmZrym w1t kl 1Sr r1ytm wmhrtm whwrdtm 1t 1by hnh and ye tell my father of all my heaviness in narrows-mizraim, and of all that ye have seen; and ye haste and bring down my father hither. vehigadtem le’abi kal kebodi bemizrayim ve’et kal ’asher re’item, umihartem vehoradtem ’abi henah.
wypl 8l Zw1ry bnymn 1Hyw wybk wbnymn bkh 8l Zw1ryw and he fell upon his brother he-between-of-righthand-benjamin's neck, and wept; and he-between-of-righthand-benjamin wept upon his neck. vayipol ‘al zaverei binyamin ’akhiv vayebek, ubinyamin bakhah ‘al zavarav.
wynSq lkl 1Hyw wybk 8lyhm w1Hry kn dbrw 1Hyw 1tw moreover he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and after that his brethren talked with him. vaynasheq lekhal ’ekhav vayebek ‘alehem, ve’akharei khen diberu ’ekhav ’ito.
whql nSm8 byt pr8h l1mr b1w 1Hy ywsp wyyTb b8yny pr8h wb8yny 8bdyw and the fame thereof was heard in big-house-pharaoh's daughter-house, saying, add-joseph's brethren are come: and it was good in the eyes of big-house-pharaoh well, and his workers. vehaqol nishma‘ bet par‘oh lemor ba’u ’akhei yosef, vayitab be‘enei far‘oh ube‘enei ‘abadav.
wy1mr pr8h 1l ywsp 1mr 1l 1Hyk z1t 8Sw T8nw 1t b8yrkm wlkw b1w 1rZh kn8n and big-house-pharaoh said unto add-joseph, say unto thy brethren, this do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of mobile-trade-canaan; vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef ’emor ’el ’akhekha zot ‘asu, ta‘anu be‘irekhem ulekhu bo’u ’arzah kena‘an.
wqHw 1t 1bykm w1t btykm wb1w 1ly w1tnh lkm 1t Twb 1rZ mZrym w1klw 1t Hlb h1rZ and take your father and your daughter-households, and come unto me: and i will give you the good of the land of narrows-mizraim, and ye eat the fat of the land. uqekhu ’abikhem ve’et batekhem ubo’u ’elay, ve’etenah lakhem tub ’erez mizrayim ve’ikhlu kheleb ha’arez.
w1th Zwyth z1t 8Sw qHw lkm m1rZ mZrym 8glwt lTpkm wlnSykm wnS1tm 1t 1bykm wb1tm now thou art order-prescribed, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of narrows-mizraim for your little ones, and for your women, and bring your father, and come. ve’atah zuvetah zot ‘asu, qekhu lakhem me’erez mizrayim ‘agalot letapekhem velinshekhem unesatem ’abikhem ubatem.
w8ynkm 1l tHs 8l klykm ky Twb kl 1rZ mZrym lkm hw1 also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of narrows-mizraim is yours. ve‘enekhem ’al takhos ‘al kelekhem, ki tub kal ’erez mizrayim lakhem hu.
wy8Sw kn bny ySr1l wytn lhm ywsp 8glwt 8l py pr8h wytn lhm Zdh ldrk and children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel did so: and add-joseph gave them wagons, according to the order-prescription of big-house-pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way. vaya‘asu khen benei yisra’el vayiten lahem yosef ‘agalot ‘al pi far‘oh, vayiten lahem zedah ladarekh.
lklm ntn l1yS Hlpwt Smlt wlbnymn ntn SlS m1wt ksp wHmS Hlpt Smlt to all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; and to he-between-of-righthand-benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment. lekhulam natan la’ish khalifot semalot, ulebinyamin natan shelosh me’ot kesef vekhamesh khalifot semalot.
wl1byw SlH kz1t 8Srh Hmrym nS1ym mTwb mZrym w8Sr 1tnt nS1t br wlHm wmzwn l1byw ldrk and to his father he sent after this manner; ten asses laden with the good things of narrows-mizraim, and ten she asses laden with corn-swimming and bread and meat for his father by the way. ule’abiv shalakh kezot ‘asarah khamorim nose’im mitub mizrayim, ve‘eser ’atonot nose’ot bar valekhem umazon le’abiv ladarekh.
wySlH 1t 1Hyw wylkw wy1mr 1lhm 1l trgzw bdrk so he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, see that ye fall not out by the way. vayshalakh ’ekhav vayelekhu, vayomer ’alehem ’al tirgezu badarekh.
wy8lw mmZrym wyb1w 1rZ kn8n 1l y8qb 1byhm and they went up out of narrows-mizraim, and came into the land of mobile-trade-canaan unto backstreet-jacob their father, vaya‘alu mimizrayim, vayabo’u ’erez kena‘an ’el ya‘aqob ’abihem.
wygdw lw l1mr 8wd ywsp Hy wky hw1 mSl bkl 1rZ mZrym wypg lbw ky l1 h1myn lhm and told him, saying, add-joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of narrows-mizraim. and backstreet-jacob's heart fainted, for he was coached by them not. vayagidu lo lemor ‘od yosef khay vekhi hu moshel bekhal ’erez mizrayim, vayafag libo ki lo he’emin lahem.
wydbrw 1lyw 1t kl dbry ywsp 1Sr dbr 1lhm wyr1 1t h8glwt 1Sr SlH ywsp lS1t 1tw wtHy rwH y8qb 1byhm and they told him all the bee-words of add-joseph, which he had said unto them: and when he saw the wagons which add-joseph had sent to carry him, breath-spirit of backstreet-jacob their father revived: vaydaberu ’elav kal dibrei yosef ’asher diber ’alehem vayar ha‘agalot ’asher shalakh yosef laset ’oto, vatekhi ruakh ya‘aqob ’abihem.
wy1mr ySr1l rb 8wd ywsp bny Hy 1lkh w1r1nw bTrm 1mwt and saturated-towards-israel said, it is enough; add-joseph my child-between is yet alive: i will go and see him before-turns i die. vayomer yisra’el rab ‘od yosef beni khay, ’elekhah ve’er’enu beterem ’amut.
wys8 ySr1l wkl 1Sr lw wyb1 b1rh Sb8 wyzbH zbHym l1lhy 1byw yZHq and saturated-towards-israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba, and butchered butchs unto the towards-these-elohim of his father laughter-isaac. vayisa‘ yisra’el vekhal ’asher lo vayabo be’erah shaba‘, vayizbakh zebakhim lelohei ’abiv yizkhaq.
wy1mr 1lhym lySr1l bmr1t hlylh wy1mr y8qb y8qb wy1mr hnny and towards-these-elohim spake unto saturated-towards-israel in the visions of the night, and said, backstreet-jacob, backstreet-jacob. and he said, here am i. vayomer ’elohim leyisra’el bemar’ot halaylah vayomer ya‘aqob ya‘aqob, vayomer hineni.
wy1mr 1nky h1l 1lhy 1byk 1l tyr1 mrdh mZrymh ky lgwy gdwl 1Symk Sm and he said, i am towards-these-elohim, the towards-these-elohim of thy father: fear not to go down into narrows-mizraim; for i will there make of thee a great nation: vayomer ’anokhi ha’el ’elohei ’abikha, ’al tira meredah mizraymah ki lego gadol ’asimekha sham.
1nky 1rd 8mk mZrymh w1nky 18lk gm 8lh wywsp ySyt ydw 8l 8ynyk i will go down with thee into narrows-mizraim; and i will also surely bring thee up again: and add-joseph put his hand upon thine eyes. ’anokhi ’ered ‘imekha mizraymah ve’anokhi ’a‘alkha gam ‘aloh, veyosef yashit yado ‘al ‘enekha.
wyqm y8qb mb1r Sb8 wyS1w bny ySr1l 1t y8qb 1byhm w1t Tpm w1t nSyhm b8glwt 1Sr SlH pr8h lS1t 1tw and backstreet-jacob rose up from well-of-seven-swear-well-beersheba: and children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel carried backstreet-jacob their father, and their little ones, and their women, in the wagons which big-house-pharaoh had sent to carry him. vayaqam ya‘aqob mibe’er shaba‘, vayis’u bene yisra’el ya‘aqob ’abihem ve’et tapam ve’et neshehem ba‘agalot ’asher shalakh par‘oh laset ’oto.
wyqHw 1t mqnyhm w1t rkwSm 1Sr rkSw b1rZ kn8n wyb1w mZrymh y8qb wkl zr8w 1tw and they took their in-them-animal, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, and came into narrows-mizraim, backstreet-jacob, and all his seed with him: vayiqkhu miqnehem ve’et rekhusham ’asher rakheshu be’erez kena‘an vayabo’u mizrayemah, ya‘aqob vekhal zar‘o ’ito.
bnyw wbny bnyw 1tw bntyw wbnwt bnyw wkl zr8w hby1 1tw mZrymh his children-betweens, and his children-betweens' children-betweens with him, his children-betweenesss, and his children-betweens' children-betweenesss, and all his seed brought he with him into narrows-mizraim. banav ubenei banav ’ito benotav ubenot banav vekhal zar‘o, hebi ’ito mizrayemah.
w1lh Smwt bny ySr1l hb1ym mZrymh y8qb wbnyw bkr y8qb r1wbn and these are the names of children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, which came into narrows-mizraim, backstreet-jacob and his children-betweens: buddy-see-child-reuben, backstreet-jacob's firstborn. ve’eleh shemot bene yisra’el haba’im mizraymah ya‘aqob ubanav, bekhor ya‘aqob re’uben.
wbny r1wbn Hnwk wplw1 wHZrwn wkrmy and children-betweens of buddy-see-child-reuben; educated-hanoch, and his-fall-phallu, and courtyard-hezron, and my-wine-inherityard-carmi. ubenei re’uben, khanokh ufalu vekhezron vekharmi.
wbny Sm8wn ymw1l wymyn w1hd wykyn wZHr wS1wl bn hkn8nyt and children-betweens of hear-home-simeon; his-sea-towards, and righthand-jamin, and one-ohad, and prepare-jachin, and bleach-zohar, and lent-shaul child-between of a mobile-trade-canaanitish woman. ubenei shim‘on yemu’el veyamin ve’ohad veyakhin vezokhar, vesha’ul ben hakena‘anit.

wbny yhwdh 8r w1wnn wSlh wprZ wzrH wymt 8r w1wnn b1rZ kn8n wyhyw bny prZ HZrwn wHmwl and children-betweens of know-judah; awake-er, and trouble-vigor-onan, and pulled-out-shelah, and breach-parez, and shine-zarah: and awake-er and trouble-vigor-onan died in the land of mobile-trade-canaan. and children-betweens of breach-parez were courtyard-hezron and hot-hamul. ubenei yehudah ‘er ve’onan veshelah vaferez vazarakh, vayamat ‘er ve’onan be’erez kena‘an vayihyu bene ferez khezron vekhamul.

wbny zbwln srd w1lwn wyHl1l and children-betweens of fertile-zebulun; survive-sered, and tree-elon, and begin-towards-jahleel. ubenei zebulun, sered ve’elon veyakhle’el.
1lh bny l1h 1Sr yldh ly8qb bpdn 1rm w1t dynh btw kl npS bnyw wbnwtyw SlSym wSlS these be children-betweens of tired-leah, which she conceived-of unto backstreet-jacob in redeemed-stack-padanaram, with his daughter-hoof-bat-child discuss-dinah: all the beings of his children-betweens and his children-betweenesss were thirty and three. ’eleh benei le’ah ’asher yaledah leya‘aqob befadan ’aram ve’et dinah bito, kal nefesh banav ubenotav sheloshim veshalosh.
wbny gd Zpywn wHgy Swny w1Zbn 8ry w1rwdy w1r1ly and children-betweens of luck-gad; hide-north-ziphion, and my-holiday-haggi, my-difference-shuni, and finger-ezbon, cities-eri, and my-bronze-bronze-arodi, and my-light-up-towards. ubenei gad zifyon vekhagi shuni ve’ezbon, ‘eri va’arodi ve’ar’eli.
wbny 1Sr ymnh wySwh wySwy wbry8h wSrH 1Htm wbny bry8h Hbr wmlky1l and children-betweens of bliss-asher; appoint-count-appoint-jimnah, and save-ishuah, and my-save-ishui, and grazing-beriah, and street-serah their sister: and children-betweens of grazing-beriah; friend-heber, and my-moloch-king-towards-malchiel. ubenei ’asher yimnah veyishvah veyishvi uberi‘ah veserakh ’akhotam, ubenei beri‘ah kheber umalki’el.
1lh bny zlph 1Sr ntn lbn ll1h btw wtld 1t 1lh ly8qb SS 8Srh npS these are children-betweens of sprinkle-zilpah, whom white-laban gave to tired-leah his daughter-hoof-bat-child, and these she conceived-of unto backstreet-jacob, even sixteen beings. ’eleh benei zilpah ’asher natan laban lele’ah bito, vateled ’eleh leya‘aqob shesh ‘esreh nafesh.

1lh bny blhh 1Sr ntn lbn lrHl btw wtld 1t 1lh ly8qb kl npS Sb8h these are children-betweens of good-times-bilhah, which white-laban gave unto ewe-rachel his daughter-hoof-bat-child, and she conceived-of these unto backstreet-jacob: all the beings were seven. ’eleh benei bilhah ’asher natan laban lerakhel bito, vateled ’eleh leya‘aqob kal nefesh shib‘ah.
kl hnpS hb1h ly8qb mZrymh yZ1y yrkw mlbd nSy bny y8qb kl npS SSym wSS all the beings that came with backstreet-jacob into narrows-mizraim, which came out of his loins, besides backstreet-jacob's children-betweens' women, all the beings were threescore and six; kal hanefesh haba’ah leya‘aqob mizraymah yoze’ei yerekho milebad neshei bene ya‘aqob, kal nefesh shishim vashesh.
wbny ywsp 1Sr yld lw bmZrym npS Snym kl hnpS lbyt y8qb hb1h mZrymh Sb8ym and children-betweens of add-joseph, which were born him in narrows-mizraim, were two beings: all the beings of the daughter-house of backstreet-jacob, which came into narrows-mizraim, were threescore and ten. ubenei yosef ’asher yulad lo bemizrayim nefesh shenayim, kal hanefesh lebet ya‘aqob haba’ah mizraymah shib‘im.
w1t yhwdh SlH lpnyw 1l ywsp lhwrt lpnyw gSnh wyb1w 1rZh gSn and he sent know-judah before-turns him unto add-joseph, to direct his face-turns unto rain-goshen; and they came into the land of rain-goshen. ve’et yehudah shalakh lefanav ’el yosef lehorot lefanav goshenah, vayabo’u ’arzah goshen.
wy1sr ywsp mrkbtw wy8l lqr1t ySr1l 1byw gSnh wyr1 1lyw wypl 8l Zw1ryw wybk 8l Zw1ryw 8wd and add-joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to until-witness saturated-towards-israel his father, to rain-goshen, and presented himself unto him; and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while. vaye’sor yosef merkabto vaya‘al liqrat yisra’el ’abiv goshenah, vayera ’elav vayipol ‘al zavarav vayebek ‘al zavarav ‘od.
wy1mr ySr1l 1l ywsp 1mwth hp8m 1Hry r1wty 1t pnyk ky 8wdk Hy and saturated-towards-israel said unto add-joseph, now let me die, since i have seen thy face-turns, because thou art yet alive. vayomer yisra’el ’el yosef ’amutah hapa‘am, ’akharei re’oti panekha ki ‘odkha khay.
wy1mr ywsp 1l 1Hyw w1l byt 1byw 18lh w1gydh lpr8h w1mrh 1lyw 1Hy wbyt 1by 1Sr b1rZ kn8n b1w 1ly and add-joseph said unto his brethren, and unto his father's daughter-house, i will go up, and show big-house-pharaoh, and say unto him, my brethren, and my father's daughter-house, which were in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, are come unto me; vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav ve’el bet ’abiv ’e‘eleh ve’agidah lefar‘oh, ve’omerah ’elav ’akhay ubet ’abi ’asher be’erez kena‘an ba’u ’elay.
wh1nSym r8y Z1n ky 1nSy mqnh hyw wZ1nm wbqrm wkl 1Sr lhm hby1w and the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed in-them-animal; and they have brought their flocks, and their visit-cattles, and all that they have. veha’anashim ro‘ei zon ki ’anshei miqneh hayu, vezonam ubeqaram vekhal ’asher lahem hebi’u.
whyh ky yqr1 lkm pr8h w1mr mh m8Sykm and it come to pass, when big-house-pharaoh call you, and say, what is your occupation? vehayah ki yiqra lakhem par‘oh, ve’amar mah ma‘asekhem.
w1mrtm 1nSy mqnh hyw 8bdyk mn8wrynw w8d 8th gm 1nHnw gm 1btynw b8bwr tSbw b1rZ gSn ky tw8bt mZrym kl r8h Z1n that ye say, thy workers' trade hath been about in-them-animal from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of rain-goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the narrows-mizraimians. va’amartem ’anshei miqneh hayu ‘abadekha mine‘urenu ve‘ad ‘atah gam ’anakhnu gam ’abotenu, ba‘abur teshebu be’erez goshen ki to‘abat mizrayim kal ro‘eh zon.
wyb1 ywsp wygd lpr8h wy1mr 1by w1Hy wZ1nm wbqrm wkl 1Sr lhm b1w m1rZ kn8n whnm b1rZ gSn then add-joseph came and told big-house-pharaoh, and said, my father and my brethren, and their flocks, and their visit-cattles, and all that they have, are come out of the land of mobile-trade-canaan; and, behold, they are in the land of rain-goshen. vayabo yosef vayaged lefar‘oh vayomer ’abi ve’akhay vezonam ubeqaram vekhal ’asher lahem ba’u me’erez kena‘an, vehinam be’erez goshen.
wmqZh 1Hyw lqH HmSh 1nSym wyZgm lpny pr8h and he took some of his brethren, even five men, and presented them unto big-house-pharaoh. umiqzeh ’ekhav laqakh khamishah ’anashim, vayazigem lifnei far‘oh.
wy1mr pr8h 1l 1Hyw mh m8Sykm wy1mrw 1l pr8h r8h Z1n 8bdyk gm 1nHnw gm 1bwtynw and big-house-pharaoh said unto his brethren, what is your occupation? and they said unto big-house-pharaoh, thy workers are shepherds, both we, and also our fathers. vayomer par‘oh ’el ’ekhav mah ma‘asekhem, vayomeru ’el par‘oh ro‘eh zon ‘abadekha gam ’anakhnu gam ’abotenu.
wy1mrw 1l pr8h lgwr b1rZ b1nw ky 1yn mr8h lZ1n 1Sr l8bdyk ky kbd hr8b b1rZ kn8n w8th ySbw n1 8bdyk b1rZ gSn they said moreover unto big-house-pharaoh, for to sojourn in the land are we come; for thy workers have no pasture for their flocks; for the famine is sore in the land of mobile-trade-canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy workers dwell in the land of rain-goshen. vayomeru ’el par‘oh lagur ba’arez banu ki ’en mir‘eh lazon ’asher la‘abadekha ki khabed hara‘ab be’erez kena‘an, ve‘atah yeshebu na ‘abadekha be’erez goshen.
wy1mr pr8h 1l ywsp l1mr 1byk w1Hyk b1w 1lyk and big-house-pharaoh spake unto add-joseph, saying, thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee: vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef lemor, ’abikha ve’akhekha ba’u ’elekha.
1rZ mZrym lpnyk hw1 bmyTb h1rZ hwSb 1t 1byk w1t 1Hyk ySbw b1rZ gSn w1m yd8t wyS bm 1nSy Hyl wSmtm Sry mqnh 8l 1Sr ly the land of narrows-mizraim is before-turns thee; in the best of the land make thy father and brethren to dwell; in the land of rain-goshen let them dwell: and if thou knowest any men of activity among them, then make them rulers over my in-them-animal. ’erez mizrayim lefanekha hi bemetab ha’arez hosheb ’abikha ve’et ’akhekha, yeshebu be’erez goshen ve’im yada‘ta veyesh bam ’anshe khayil vesamtam sarei miqneh ‘al ’asher li.
wyb1 ywsp 1t y8qb 1byw wy8mdhw lpny pr8h wybrk y8qb 1t pr8h and add-joseph brought in backstreet-jacob his father, and set him before-turns big-house-pharaoh: and backstreet-jacob knee-fluffy-blessed big-house-pharaoh. vayabei yosef ya‘aqob ’abiv vaya‘amidehu lifnei far‘oh, vaybarekh ya‘aqob par‘oh.
wy1mr pr8h 1l y8qb kmh ymy Sny Hyyk and big-house-pharaoh said unto backstreet-jacob, how old art thou? vayomer par‘oh ’el ya‘aqob, kamah yemei shenei khayekha.
wy1mr y8qb 1l pr8h ymy Sny mgwry SlSym wm1t Snh m8T wr8ym hyw ymy Sny Hyy wl1 hSygw 1t ymy Sny Hyy 1bty bymy mgwryhm and backstreet-jacob said unto big-house-pharaoh, the days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years: few and bad have the days of the years of my life been, and have not attained unto the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el par‘oh yemei shenei meguray sheloshim ume’at shanah, me‘at vera‘im hayu yemei shenei khayay velo hisigu yemei shenei khayei ’abotay bimei megurehem.
wybrk y8qb 1t pr8h wyZ1 mlpny pr8h and backstreet-jacob knee-fluffy-blessed big-house-pharaoh, and went out from before-turns big-house-pharaoh. vaybarekh ya‘aqob par‘oh, vayezei milifnei far‘oh.
wywSb ywsp 1t 1byw w1t 1Hyw wytn lhm 1Hzh b1rZ mZrym bmyTb h1rZ b1rZ r8mss k1Sr Zwh pr8h and add-joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of narrows-mizraim, in the best of the land, in the land of born-by-ra-voiceless-ramses, as big-house-pharaoh had order-prescribed. vayosheb yosef ’abiv ve’et ’ekhav vayiten lahem ’akhuzah be’erez mizrayim bemetab ha’arez be’erez ra‘meses, ka’asher zivah far‘oh.
wyklkl ywsp 1t 1byw w1t 1Hyw w1t kl byt 1byw lHm lpy hTp and add-joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father's daughter-household, with bread, according to their families. vaykhalkel yosef ’abiv ve’et ’ekhav ve’et kal bet ’abiv, lekhem lefi hataf.
wlHm 1yn bkl h1rZ ky kbd hr8b m1d wtlh 1rZ mZrym w1rZ kn8n mpny hr8b and there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very sore, so that the land of narrows-mizraim and all the land of mobile-trade-canaan fainted by reason of the famine. velekhem ’en bekhal ha’arez ki khabed hara‘ab me’od, vatelah ’erez mizrayim ve’erez kena‘an mipenei hara‘ab.
wylqT ywsp 1t kl hksp hnmZ1 b1rZ mZrym wb1rZ kn8n bSbr 1Sr hm Sbrym wyb1 ywsp 1t hksp byth pr8h and add-joseph added up all the money that was found in the land of narrows-mizraim, and in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, for the corn-swimming which they bought: and add-joseph brought the money into big-house-pharaoh's daughter-house. vaylaqet yosef kal hakesef hanimza be’erez mizrayim ube’erez kena‘an basheber ’asher hem shoberim, vayabei yosef hakesef betah far‘oh.
wytm hksp m1rZ mZrym wm1rZ kn8n wyb1w kl mZrym 1l ywsp l1mr hbh lnw lHm wlmh nmwt ngdk ky 1ps ksp and when money failed in the land of narrows-mizraim, and in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, all the narrows-mizraimians came unto add-joseph, and said, give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence? for the money faileth. vayitom hakesef me’erez mizrayim ume’erez kena‘an vayabo’u khal mizrayim ’el yosef lemor habah lanu lekhem velamah namut negdekha, ki ’afes kasef.
wy1mr ywsp hbw mqnykm w1tnh lkm bmqnykm 1m 1ps ksp and add-joseph said, give your in-them-animal; and i will give you for your in-them-animal, if money fail. vayomer yosef habu miqnekhem ve’etenah lakhem bemiqnekhem, ’im ’afes kasef.
wyby1w 1t mqnyhm 1l ywsp wytn lhm ywsp lHm bswsym wbmqnh hZ1n wbmqnh hbqr wbHmrym wynhlm blHm bkl mqnhm bSnh hhw1 and they brought their in-them-animal unto add-joseph: and add-joseph gave them bread in exchange for horses, and for the flocks, and for the in-them-animal of the visit-cattles, and for the asses: and he fed them with bread for all their in-them-animal for that year. vayabi’u miqnehem ’el yosef vayiten lahem yosef lekhem basusim ubemiqneh hazon ubemiqneh habaqar ubakhamorim, vaynahalem balekhem bekhal miqnehem bashanah hahiv.
wttm hSnh hhw1 wyb1w 1lyw bSnh hSnyt wy1mrw lw l1 nkHd m1dny ky 1m tm hksp wmqnh hbhmh 1l 1dny l1 nS1r lpny 1dny blty 1m gwytnw w1dmtnw when that year was ended, they came unto him the second year, and said unto him, we will not hide it from my lord-base, how that our money is spent; my lord-base also hath our visit-cattles of in-them-animal; there is not ought left in the sight of my lord-base, and our bodies, and our lands: vatitom hashanah hahiv vayabo’u ’elav bashanah hashenit vayomeru lo lo nekhakhed me’adoni ki ’im tam hakesef umiqneh habehemah ’el ’adoni, lo nish’ar lifnei ’adoni bilti ’im geviyatenu ve’admatenu.
lmh nmwt l8ynyk gm 1nHnw gm 1dmtnw qnh 1tnw w1t 1dmtnw blHm wnhyh 1nHnw w1dmtnw 8bdym lpr8h wtn zr8 wnHyh wl1 nmwt wh1dmh l1 tSm wherefore we die before-turns thine eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be workers unto big-house-pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that the land be not desolate. lamah namut le‘enekha gam ’anakhnu gam ’admatenu qeneh ’otanu ve’et ’admatenu balakhem, venihyeh ’anakhnu ve’admatenu ‘abadim lefar‘oh veten zera‘ venikhyeh velo namut veha’adamah lo tesham.
wyqn ywsp 1t kl 1dmt mZrym lpr8h ky mkrw mZrym 1yS Sdhw ky Hzq 8lhm hr8b wthy h1rZ lpr8h and add-joseph bought all the land of narrows-mizraim for big-house-pharaoh; for the narrows-mizraimians sold every man his field, because the famine prevailed over them: so the land became big-house-pharaoh's. vayiqen yosef kal ’admat mizrayim lefar‘oh ki makheru mizrayim ’ish sadehu ki khazaq ‘alehem hara‘ab, vatehi ha’arez lefar‘oh.
w1t h8m h8byr 1tw l8rym mqZh gbwl mZrym w8d qZhw and as for the with-mum-people, he removed them to cities from one end of the borders of narrows-mizraim even to the other end thereof. ve’et ha‘am he‘ebir ’oto le‘arim, miqzeh gebul mizrayim ve‘ad qazehu.
rq 1dmt hkhnym l1 qnh ky Hq lkhnym m1t pr8h w1klw 1t Hqm 1Sr ntn lhm pr8h 8l kn l1 mkrw 1t 1dmtm only the land of the dimmer-servers bought he not; for the dimmer-servers had a portion assigned them of big-house-pharaoh, and did eat their portion which big-house-pharaoh gave them: wherefore they sold not their lands. raq ’admat hakohanim lo qanah, ki khoq lakohanim me’et par‘oh ve’akhelu khuqam ’asher natan lahem par‘oh ‘al ken lo makheru ’admatam.
wy1mr ywsp 1l h8m hn qnyty 1tkm hywm w1t 1dmtkm lpr8h h1 lkm zr8 wzr8tm 1t h1dmh then add-joseph said unto the with-mum-people, behold, i have bought you this day and your land for big-house-pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you, and ye sow the land. vayomer yosef ’el ha‘am hen qaniti ’etkhem hayom ve’et ’admatkhem lefar‘oh, he lakhem zera‘ uzera‘tem ha’adamah.
whyh btbw1t wnttm HmySyt lpr8h w1rb8 hydt yhyh lkm lzr8 hSdh wl1klkm wl1Sr bbtykm wl1kl lTpkm and it come to pass in the increase, that ye give the fifth part unto big-house-pharaoh, and four parts be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your daughter-households, and for food for your little ones. vehayah batebu’ot unetatem khamishit lefar‘oh, ve’arba‘ hayadot yihyeh lakhem lezera‘ hasadeh ule’akhelekhem vela’asher bebatekhem vele’ekhol letapekhem.
wy1mrw hHytnw nmZ1 Hn b8yny 1dny whyynw 8bdym lpr8h and they said, thou hast saved our lives: let us find attractiveness in the sight of my lord-base, and we will be big-house-pharaoh's workers. vayomeru hekheyitanu, nimza khen be‘enei ’adoni vehayinu ‘abadim lefar‘oh.
wySm 1th ywsp lHq 8d hywm hzh 8l 1dmt mZrym lpr8h lHmS rq 1dmt hkhnym lbdm l1 hyth lpr8h and add-joseph made it a teaching over the land of narrows-mizraim unto this day, that big-house-pharaoh should have the fifth part, except the land of the dimmer-servers only, which became not big-house-pharaoh's. vayasem ’otah yosef lekhoq ‘ad hayom hazeh ‘al ’admat mizrayim lefar‘oh lakhomesh, raq ’admat hakohanim lebadam lo hayetah lefar‘oh.
wySb ySr1l b1rZ mZrym b1rZ gSn wy1Hzw bh wyprw wyrbw m1d and saturated-towards-israel dwelt in the land of narrows-mizraim, in the country of rain-goshen; and they had possessions therein, and grew, and multiplied exceedingly. vayesheb yisra’el be’erez mizrayim be’erez goshen, vaye’akhazu bah vayifru vayirbu me’od.
wyHy y8qb b1rZ mZrym Sb8 8Srh Snh wyhy ymy y8qb Sny Hyyw Sb8 Snym w1rb8ym wm1t Snh and backstreet-jacob lived in the land of narrows-mizraim seventeen years: so the whole age of backstreet-jacob was an hundred forty and seven years. vaykhi ya‘aqob be’erez mizrayim sheba‘ ‘esreh shanah, vayhi yeme ya‘aqob shenei khayav sheba‘ shanim ve’arba‘im ume’at shanah.
wyqrbw ymy ySr1l lmwt wyqr1 lbnw lywsp wy1mr lw 1m n1 mZ1ty Hn b8ynyk Sym n1 ydk tHt yrky w8Syt 8mdy Hsd w1mt 1l n1 tqbrny bmZrym and the time drew nigh that saturated-towards-israel must die: and he called his child-between add-joseph, and said unto him, if now i have found attractiveness in thy sight, put, i pray thee, thy hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me; bury me not, i pray thee, in narrows-mizraim: vayiqrebu yeme yisra’el lamut vayiqra libno leyosef vayomer lo ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha sim na yadekha takhat yerekhi, ve‘asita ‘imadi khesed ve’emet ’al na tiqbereni bemizrayim.
wSkbty 8m 1bty wnS1tny mmZrym wqbrtny bqbrtm wy1mr 1nky 18Sh kdbrk and i will lie with my fathers, and thou carry me out of narrows-mizraim, and bury me in their buryingplace. and he said, i will do as thou hast said. veshakhabti ‘im ’abotay unesatani mimizrayim uqebartani biqburatam, vayomar ’anokhi ’e‘eseh khidbarekha.
wy1mr hSb8h ly wySb8 lw wyStHw ySr1l 8l r1S hmTh and he said, swear unto me. and he sware unto him. and saturated-towards-israel bowed himself upon the bed's head. vayomer hishabe‘ah li vayishaba‘ lo, vayishtakhu yisra’el ‘al rosh hamitah.
wyhy 1Hry hdbrym h1lh wy1mr lywsp hnh 1byk Hlh wyqH 1t Sny bnyw 8mw 1t mnSh w1t 1prym and it came to pass after these things, that one told add-joseph, behold, thy father is sick: and he took with him his two children-betweens, place-of-sleep-manasseh and fruitful-ephraim. vayhi ’akharei hadebarim ha’eleh vayomer leyosef hineh ’abikha kholeh, vayiqakh shenei banav ‘imo menasheh ve’et ’efrayim.
wygd ly8qb wy1mr hnh bnk ywsp b1 1lyk wytHzq ySr1l wySb 8l hmTh and one told backstreet-jacob, and said, behold, thy child-between add-joseph cometh unto thee: and saturated-towards-israel strengthened himself, and sat upon the bed. vayaged leya‘aqob vayomer hineh binkha yosef ba ’elekha, vayitkhazeq yisra’el vayesheb ‘al hamitah.
wy1mr y8qb 1l ywsp 1l Sdy nr1h 1ly blwz b1rZ kn8n wybrk 1ty and backstreet-jacob said unto add-joseph, towards-these-elohim almighty appeared unto me at hazel-luz in the land of mobile-trade-canaan, and knee-fluffy-blessed me, vayomer ya‘aqob ’el yosef ’el shaday nir’ah ’elay beluz be’erez kena‘an, vaybarekh ’oti.
wy1mr 1ly hnny mprk whrbytk wnttyk lqhl 8mym wntty 1t h1rZ hz1t lzr8k 1Hryk 1Hzt 8wlm and said unto me, behold, i will make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, and i will make of thee a multitude of with-mum-people; and will give this land to thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession. vayomer ’elay hini mafrekha vehirbitikha unetatikha liqhal ‘amim, venatati ha’arez hazot lezar‘akha ’akharekha ’akhuzat ‘olam.

w1ny bb1y mpdn mth 8ly rHl b1rZ kn8n bdrk b8wd kbrt 1rZ lb1 1prth w1qbrh Sm bdrk 1prt hw1 byt lHm and as for me, when i came from padan, ewe-rachel died by me in the land of mobile-trade-canaan in the way, when yet there was and a little way to come unto wishy-washy-ephrath: and i buried her there in the way of wishy-washy-ephrath; the same is house-of-bread-bethlehem. va’ani bebo’i mipadan metah ‘alay rakhel be’erez kena‘an baderekh be‘od kibrat ’erez labo ’efratah, va’eqbereha sham bederekh ’efrat hi lakhem.

wyb1w 8d grn h1Td 1Sr b8br hyrdn wyspdw Sm mspd gdwl wkbd m1d wy8S l1byw 1bl Sb8t ymym and they came to the threshingfloor of atad, which is beyond its-going-down-jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days. vayabo’u ‘ad goren ha’atad ’asher be‘eber hayarden vayispedu sham misped gadol vekhabed me’od, vaya‘as le’abiv ’ebel shib‘at yamim.
wyr1 ywSb h1rZ hkn8ny 1t h1bl bgrn h1Td wy1mrw 1bl kbd zh lmZrym 8l kn qr1 Smh 1bl mZrym 1Sr b8br hyrdn and when the inhabitants of the land, the mobile-trade-canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of atad, they said, this is a grievous mourning to the narrows-mizraimians: wherefore the name of it was called vapor-abelmizraim, which is beyond its-going-down-jordan. vayar yosheb ha’arez hakena‘ani ha’ebel begoren ha’atad vayomeru ’ebel kabed zeh lemizrayim, ken qara shemah mizrayim ’asher be‘eber hayarden.
wy8Sw bnyw lw kn k1Sr Zwm and his children-betweens did unto him according as he order-prescribed them: vaya‘asu banav lo, ken ka’asher zivam.
wyS1w 1tw bnyw 1rZh kn8n wyqbrw 1tw bm8rt Sdh hmkplh 1Sr qnh 1brhm 1t hSdh l1Hzt qbr m1t 8prn hHty 8l pny mmr1 for his children-betweens carried him into the land of mobile-trade-canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of copy-product-machpelah, which their-dick-abraham bought with the field for a possession of a buryingplace of pencil-ephron the cut-hittite, before-turns see-bitter-mamre. vayis’u ’oto banav ’arzah kena‘an vayiqberu ’oto bim‘arat sedeh hamakhpelah, ’asher qanah ’abraham hasadeh la’akhuzat qeber me’et ‘efron hakhiti ‘al penei mamre.
wySb ywsp mZrymh hw1 w1Hyw wkl h8lym 1tw lqbr 1t 1byw 1Hry qbrw 1t 1byw and add-joseph returned into narrows-mizraim, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father. vayashab yosef mizraymah hu ve’ekhav vekhal ha‘olim ’ito liqbor ’abiv, ’akharei qabero ’abiv.
wyr1w 1Hy ywsp ky mt 1byhm wy1mrw lw ySTmnw ywsp whSb ySyb lnw 1t kl hr8h 1Sr gmlnw 1tw and when add-joseph's brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, add-joseph will peradventure hate us, and will certainly requite us all the bad which we did unto him. vayir’u ’akhe yosef ki met ’abihem vayomeru lu yistemenu yosef, vehasheb yashib lanu kal hara‘ah ’asher gamalnu ’oto.
wyZww 1l ywsp l1mr 1byk Zwh lpny mwtw l1mr and they sent a messenger unto add-joseph, saying, thy father did order-prescribe before-turns he died, saying, vayzavu ’el yosef lemor, ’abikha zivah lifnei moto lemor.
kh t1mrw lywsp 1n1 S1 n1 pS8 1Hyk wHT1tm ky r8h gmlwk w8th S1 n1 lpS8 8bdy 1lhy 1byk wybk ywsp bdbrm 1lyw so ye say unto add-joseph, forgive, i pray thee now, the fire-name of thy brethren, and their miss; for they did unto thee bad: and now, we pray thee, forgive the fire-name of the workers of the towards-these-elohim of thy father. and add-joseph wept when they spake unto him. koh tomeru leyosef ’ana sa na pesha‘ ’akhekha vekhatatam ki ra‘ah gemalukha ve‘atah sa na lefesha‘ ‘abdei ’elohei ’abikha, vayebek yosef bedaberam ’elav.
wylkw gm 1Hyw wyplw lpnyw wy1mrw hnnw lk l8bdym and his brethren also went and fell down before-turns his face-turns; and they said, behold, we be thy workers. vayelekhu gam ’ekhav vayipelu lefanav, vayomeru hinenu lekha la‘abadim.
wy1mr 1lhm ywsp 1l tyr1w ky htHt 1lhym 1ny and add-joseph said unto them, fear not: for am i in the place of towards-these-elohim? vayomer ’alehem yosef ’al tira’u, ki hatakhat ’elohim ’ani.
w1tm HSbtm 8ly r8h 1lhym HSbh lTbh lm8n 8Sh kywm hzh lhHyt 8m rb and as for you, ye thought bad against me; and towards-these-elohim meant it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much with-mum-people alive. ve’atem khashabtem ‘alay ra‘ah, ’elohim khashabah letobah lema‘an ‘asoh kayom hazeh lehakhayot ‘am rab.
w8th 1l tyr1w 1nky 1klkl 1tkm w1t Tpkm wynHm 1wtm wydbr 8l lbm now therefore fear ye not: i will nourish you, and your little ones. and he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them. ve‘atah ’al tira’u ’anokhi ’akhalkel ’etkhem ve’et tapekhem, vaynakhem ’otam vaydaber ‘al libam.
wySb ywsp bmZrym hw1 wbyt 1byw wyHy ywsp m1h w8Sr Snym and add-joseph dwelt in narrows-mizraim, he, and his father's daughter-house: and add-joseph lived an hundred and ten years. vayesheb yosef bemizrayim hu ubet ’abiv, vaykhi yosef me’ah va‘eser shanim.
wyr1 ywsp l1prym bny SlSym gm bny mkyr bn mnSh yldw 8l brky ywsp and add-joseph saw fruitful-ephraim's children-betweens of the third generation: children-betweens also of recognize-of-beat-machir child-between of place-of-sleep-manasseh were brought up upon add-joseph's knees. vayar yosef le’efrayim benei shileshim, gam benei makhir ben menasheh yuledu ‘al birkei yosef.
wy1mr ywsp 1l 1Hyw 1nky mt w1lhym pqd ypqd 1tkm wh8lh 1tkm mn h1rZ hz1t 1l h1rZ 1Sr nSb8 l1brhm lyZHq wly8qb and add-joseph said unto his brethren, i die: and towards-these-elohim will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land unto the land which he sware to their-dick-abraham, to laughter-isaac, and to backstreet-jacob. vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav ’anokhi met, velohim paqod yifqod ’etkhem vehe‘elah ’etkhem min ha’arez hazot ’el ha’arez ’asher nishba‘ le’abraham leyizkhaq uleya‘aqob.
wySb8 ywsp 1t bny ySr1l l1mr pqd ypqd 1lhym 1tkm wh8ltm 1t 8Zmty mzh and add-joseph took an toward-oath of children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, saying, towards-these-elohim will surely visit you, and ye carry up my bones from hence. vayashba‘ yosef benei yisra’el lemor, paqod yifqod ’elohim ’etkhem veha‘alitem ‘azmotay mizeh.
wymt ywsp bn m1h w8Sr Snym wyHnTw 1tw wyySm b1rwn bmZrym so add-joseph died, being an hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in narrows-mizraim. vayamat yosef ben me’ah va‘eser shanim, vayakhantu ’oto vayisem ba’aron bemizrayim.
w1lh Smwt bny ySr1l hb1ym mZrymh 1t y8qb 1yS wbytw b1w now these are the names of children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, which came into narrows-mizraim; every man and his daughter-household came with backstreet-jacob. ve’eleh shemot benei yisra’el haba’im mizrayemah, ’et ya‘aqob ’ish ubeto ba’u.
r1wbn Sm8wn lwy wyhwdh buddy-see-child-reuben, hear-home-simeon, join-levi, and know-judah, re’uben shim‘on levi vihudah.
ySSkr zbwln wbnymn wage-issachar, fertile-zebulun, and he-between-of-righthand-benjamin, yisashkhar zebulun ubeneyamin
dn wnptly gd w1Sr discuss-dan, and twisted-naphtali, luck-gad, and bliss-asher. dan venaftali gad ve’asher.
wyhy kl npS yZ1y yrk y8qb Sb8ym npS wywsp hyh bmZrym and all the beings that came out of the loins of backstreet-jacob were seventy beings: for add-joseph was in narrows-mizraim already. vayhi kal nefesh yoze’ei yerekh ya‘aqob shib‘im nafesh, veyosef hayah bemizrayim.
wymt ywsp wkl 1Hyw wkl hdwr hhw1 and add-joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation. vayamat yosef vekhal ’ekhav vekhol hador hahu.
wbny ySr1l prw wySrZw wyrbw wy8Zmw bm1d m1d wtml1 h1rZ 1tm and children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them. ubenei yisra’el paru vayishrezu vayirbu vaya‘azmu bim’od me’od, vatimalei ha’arez ’otam.
wyqm mlk HdS 8l mZrym 1Sr l1 yd8 1t ywsp now there arose up a new moloch-king over narrows-mizraim, which hand-knew not add-joseph. vayaqam melekh khadash ‘al mizrayim, ’asher lo yada‘ yosef.
wy1mr 1l 8mw hnh 8m bny ySr1l rb w8Zwm mmnw and he said unto his with-mum-people, behold, the with-mum-people of children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel are more and mightier than we: vayomer ’el ‘amo, hineh ‘am benei yisra’el rab ve‘azum mimenu.
hbh ntHkmh lw pn yrbh whyh ky tqr1nh mlHmh wnwsp gm hw1 8l Sn1ynw wnlHm bnw w8lh mn h1rZ come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our father-adversaries, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land. habah nitkhakemah lo, pen yirbeh vehayah ki tiqrenah milkhamah venosaf gam hu ‘al sone’enu venilkham banu ve‘alah min ha’arez.
wySymw 8lyw Sry msym lm8n 8ntw bsbltm wybn 8ry msknwt lpr8h 1t ptm w1t r8mss therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. and they between-built for big-house-pharaoh treasure cities, pithom and raamses. vayasimu ‘alav misim lema‘an ‘anoto besiblotam, vayiben ‘arei miskenot lefar‘oh pitom ve’et ra‘amses.
wk1Sr y8nw 1tw kn yrbh wkn yprZ wyqZw mpny bny ySr1l and the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. and they were grieved because of children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel. vekha’asher ye‘anu ’oto ken yirbeh vekhen yifroz, vayaquzu mipenei benei yisra’el.
wy8bdw mZrym 1t bny ySr1l bprk and the narrows-mizraimians made children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel to work for with rigor: vaya‘abidu mizrayim benei yisra’el befarekh.
wymrrw 1t Hyyhm b8bdh qSh bHmr wblbnym wbkl 8bdh bSdh 1t kl 8bdtm 1Sr 8bdw bhm bprk and they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in mortar, and in brick-l-between, and in all manner of work in the field: all their work, wherein they made them work for, was with rigor. vaymareru khayehem ba‘abodah qashah bekhomer ubilbenim ubekhal ‘abodah basadeh, kal ‘abodatam ’asher ‘abedu bahem befarekh.
wy1mr mlk mZrym lmyldt h8bryt 1Sr Sm h1Ht Sprh wSm hSnyt pw8h and the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim spake to the cross-over-hebrew midwives, of which the name of the one was book-cow-shiphrah, and the name of the other cry-beauty-puah: vayomer melekh mizrayim lamyaledot ha‘ibriyot, ’asher shem ha’akhat shifrah veshem hashenit pu‘ah.
wy1mr byldkn 1t h8brywt wr1ytn 8l h1bnym 1m bn hw1 whmtn 1tw w1m bt hy1 wHyh and he said, when ye do the office of a midwife to the cross-over-hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a child-between, then ye kill him: and if it be a daughter-hoof-bat-child, then she live. vayomer beyaledkhen ’et ha‘ibriyot ure’iten ‘al ha’abenayim, ’im ben hu vahamiten ’oto ve’im bat hi vakhayah.
wtyr1n hmyldt 1t h1lhym wl1 8Sw k1Sr dbr 1lyhn mlk mZrym wtHyyn 1t hyldym and the midwives feared towards-these-elohim, and did not as the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim order-prescribed them, and saved the men children-betweens alive. vatirena hamyaledot ha’elohim velo ‘asu ka’asher diber ’alehen melekh mizrayim, vatekhayena hayladim.
wyqr1 mlk mZrym lmyldt wy1mr lhn mdw8 8Sytn hdbr hzh wtHyyn 1t hyldym and the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim called for the midwives, and said unto them, why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children-betweens alive? vayiqra melekh mizrayim lamyaledot vayomer lahen madua‘ ‘asiten hadabar hazeh, vatekhayena hayladim.
wt1mrn hmyldt 1l pr8h ky l1 knSym hmZryt h8bryt ky Hywt hnh bTrm tbw1 1lhn hmyldt wyldw and the midwives said unto big-house-pharaoh, because the cross-over-hebrew women are not as the narrows-mizraimian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them. vatomarna hamyaledot ’el par‘oh ki lo khanashim hamizriyot ha‘ibriyot, ki khayot henah beterem tabo ’alehen hamyaledet veyaladu.
wyyTb 1lhym lmyldt wyrb h8m wy8Zmw m1d therefore towards-these-elohim dealt well with the midwives: and the with-mum-people multiplied, and waxed very mighty. vayeteb ’elohim lamyaledot, vayireb ha‘am vaya‘azmu me’od.
wyhy ky yr1w hmyldt 1t h1lhym wy8S lhm btym and it came to pass, because the midwives feared towards-these-elohim, that he made them daughter-houses. vayhi ki yare’u hamyaledot ha’elohim, vaya‘as lahem batim.
wyZw pr8h lkl 8mw l1mr kl hbn hylwd hy1rh tSlykhw wkl hbt tHywn and big-house-pharaoh charged all his with-mum-people, saying, every child-between that is born ye cast into the river, and every daughter-hoof-bat-child ye save alive. vayzav par‘oh lekhal ‘amo lemor, kal haben hayilod hay’orah tashlikhuhu vekhal habat tekhayun.
wylk 1yS mbyt lwy wyqH 1t bt lwy and there went a man of the daughter-house of join-levi, and took to woman a daughter-hoof-bat-child of join-levi. vayelekh ’ish mibet levi, vayiqakh ’et bat levi.
wthr h1Sh wtld bn wtr1 1tw ky Twb hw1 wtZpnhw SlSh yrHym and the woman conceived, and conceived-of a child-between: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months. vatahar ha’ishah vateled ben, vatere ki tob hu vatizpenehu sheloshah yerakhim.
wl1 yklh 8wd hZpynw wtqH lw tbt gm1 wtHmrh bHmr wbzpt wtSm bh 1t hyld wtSm bswp 8l Spt hy1r and when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an cabinet of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river's brink. velo yakhelah ‘od hazefino vatiqakh lo tebat gome vatakhmerah bakhemar ubazafet, vatasem bah hayeled vatasem basuf ‘al sefat hay’or.
wttZb 1Htw mrHq ld8h mh y8Sh lw and his sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him. vatetazab ’akhoto merakhoq, lede‘ah mah ye‘aseh lo.
wtrd bt pr8h lrHZ 8l hy1r wn8rtyh hlkt 8l yd hy1r wtr1 1t htbh btwk hswp wtSlH 1t 1mth wtqHh and the daughter-hoof-bat-child of big-house-pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river's side; and when she saw the cabinet among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it. vatered bat par‘oh lirkhoz ‘al hay’or vena‘aroteha holekhot ‘al yad hay’or, vatere hatebah betokh hasuf vatishlakh ’amatah vatiqakheha
wtptH wtr1hw 1t hyld whnh n8r bkh wtHml 8lyw wt1mr myldy h8brym zh and when she had opened it, she saw child: and, behold, the babe wept. and she had compassion on him, and said, this is one of the cross-over-hebrews' children-betweens. vatiftakh vatir’ehu hayeled vehineh na‘ar bokheh, vatakhmol ‘alav vatomer miyaldei ha‘ibrim zeh.
wt1mr 1Htw 1l bt pr8h h1lk wqr1ty lk 1Sh mynqt mn h8bryt wtynq lk 1t hyld then said his sister to big-house-pharaoh's daughter-hoof-bat-child, i go and call to thee a nurse of the cross-over-hebrew women, that she may nurse child for thee? vatomer ’akhoto ’el bat par‘oh ha’elekh veqarati lakh ’ishah meneqet min ha‘ibriyot, veteniq lakh hayaled.
wt1mr lh bt pr8h lky wtlk h8lmh wtqr1 1t 1m hyld and big-house-pharaoh's daughter-hoof-bat-child said to her, go. and the maid went and called child's mother. vatomer lah bat par‘oh lekhi, vatelekh ha‘almah vatiqra ’em hayaled.
wt1mr lh bt pr8h hylyky 1t hyld hzh whynqhw ly w1ny 1tn 1t Skrk wtqH h1Sh hyld wtnyqhw and big-house-pharaoh's daughter-hoof-bat-child said unto her, take this child away, and nurse it for me, and i will give thee thy wages. and the women took child, and nursed it. vatomer lah bat par‘oh helikhi hayeled hazeh veheniqihu li va’ani ’eten sekharekh, vatiqakh ha’ishah hayeled vateniqehu.
wygdl hyld wtb1hw lbt pr8h wyhy lh lbn wtqr1 Smw mSh wt1mr ky mn hmym mSythw and child grew, and she brought him unto big-house-pharaoh's daughter-hoof-bat-child, and he became her child-between. and she called his name extracted-mose: and she said, because i drew him out of the from-waters. vayigdal hayeled vatebi’ehu lebat par‘oh vayhi lah leben, vatiqra shemo mosheh vatomer ki min hamayim meshitihu.
wyhy bymym hhm wygdl mSh wyZ1 1l 1Hyw wyr1 bsbltm wyr1 1yS mZry mkh 1yS 8bry m1Hyw and it came to pass in those days, when extracted-mose was grown, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an narrows-mizraimian smiting an cross-over-hebrew, one of his brethren. vayhi bayamim hahem vayigdal mosheh vayezei ’el ’ekhav vayar besiblotam, vayar mizri makeh ‘ibri me’ekhav.
wypn kh wkh wyr1 ky 1yn 1yS wyk 1t hmZry wyTmnhw bHwl and he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he slew the narrows-mizraimian, and hid him in the sand. vayifen koh vakhoh vayar ki ’en ’ish, vayakh hamizri vayitmenehu bakhol.
wyZ1 bywm hSny whnh Sny 1nSym 8brym nZym wy1mr lrS8 lmh tkh r8k and when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the cross-over-hebrews strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, wherefore hitst thou thy fellow? vayezei bayom hasheni vehineh shene ’anashim ‘ibrim nizim, vayomer larasha‘ lamah takeh re‘ekha.
wy1mr my Smk l1yS Sr wSpT 8lynw hlhrgny 1th 1mr k1Sr hrgt 1t hmZry wyyr1 mSh wy1mr 1kn nwd8 hdbr and he said, who made thee a prince and a decide over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the narrows-mizraimian? and extracted-mose feared, and said, surely this thing is hand-known. vayomer mi samekha sar veshofet ‘alenu halharegeni ’atah ’omer ka’asher haragta hamizri, vayira mosheh vayomar ’akhen noda‘ hadabar.
wySm8 pr8h 1t hdbr hzh wybqS lhrg 1t mSh wybrH mSh mpny pr8h wySb b1rZ mdyn wySb 8l hb1r now when big-house-pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay extracted-mose. and extracted-mose fled from the face-turns of big-house-pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of place-of-discussed-teaching-midian: and he sat down by a well. vayishma‘ par‘oh hadabar hazeh vaybaqesh laharog mosheh, vayibrakh mosheh mipenei far‘oh vayesheb be’erez midyan vayesheb ‘al habe’er.
wlkhn mdyn Sb8 bnwt wtb1nh wtdlnh wtml1nh 1t hrhTym lhSqwt Z1n 1byhn now the dimmer-server of place-of-discussed-teaching-midian had seven children-betweenesss: and they came and drew from-waters, and filled the troughs to from-waters their father's flock. ulekhohen midyan sheba‘ banot, vatabonah vatidlenah vatemalenah ’et harehatim lehashqot zon ’abihen.
wyb1w hr8ym wygrSwm wyqm mSh wywS8n wySq 1t Z1nm and the shepherds came and drove them away: and extracted-mose stood up and helped them, and watered their flock. vayabo’u haro‘im vaygareshum, vayaqam mosheh vayoshi‘an vayashq zonam.
wtb1nh 1l r8w1l 1byhn wy1mr mdw8 mhrtn b1 hywm and when they came to buddy-reuel their father, he said, how is it that ye are come so soon to day? vatabonah ’el re‘u’el ’abihen, vayomer madua‘ miharten bo hayom.
wt1mrn 1yS mZry hZylnw myd hr8ym wgm dlh dlh lnw wySq 1t hZ1n and they said, an narrows-mizraimian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew from-waters enough for us, and watered the flock. vatomarna mizri hizilanu miyad haro‘im, vegam daloh dalah lanu vayashq hazon.
wy1mr 1l bntyw w1yw lmh zh 8zbtn 1t h1yS qr1n lw wy1kl lHm and he said unto his children-betweenesss, and where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread. vayomer ’el benotav ve’ayo, lamah zeh ‘azabten ha’ish qir’en lo veyokhal lakhem.
wyw1l mSh lSbt 1t h1yS wytn 1t Zprh btw lmSh and extracted-mose was content to dwell with the man: and he gave extracted-mose bird-bird-ziporah his daughter-hoof-bat-child. vayo’el mosheh lashebet ’et ha’ish, vayiten ziporah bito lemosheh.
wtld bn wyqr1 1t Smw grSm ky 1mr gr hyyty b1rZ nkryh and she conceived-of him a child-between, and he called his name stranger-gershom: for he said, i have been a stranger in a strange land. vateled ben vayiqra shemo gereshom, ki ’amar ger hayiti be’erez nakheriyah.
wyhy bymym hrbym hhm wymt mlk mZrym wy1nHw bny ySr1l mn h8bdh wyz8qw wt8l Sw8tm 1l h1lhym mn h8bdh and it came to pass in process of time, that the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim died: and children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto towards-these-elohim by reason of the bondage. vayhi bayamim harabim hahem vayamat melekh mizrayim vaye’anekhu bene yisra’el min ha‘abodah vayiz‘aqu, vata‘al shav‘atam ’el ha’elohim min ha‘abodah.
wySm8 1lhym 1t n1qtm wyzkr 1lhym 1t brytw 1t 1brhm 1t yZHq w1t y8qb and towards-these-elohim heard their groaning, and towards-these-elohim remembered his covenant with their-dick-abraham, with laughter-isaac, and with backstreet-jacob. vayishma‘ ’elohim na’aqatam, vayizkor ’elohim berito ’et ’abraham ’et yizkhaq ve’et ya‘aqob.
wyr1 1lhym 1t bny ySr1l wyd8 1lhym and towards-these-elohim looked upon children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, and towards-these-elohim had respect unto them. vayar ’elohim benei yisra’el, vayeda‘ ’elohim.
wmSh hyh r8h 1t Z1n ytrw Htnw khn mdyn wynhg 1t hZ1n 1Hr hmdbr wyb1 1l hr h1lhym Hrbh now extracted-mose kept the flock of look-jethro his father in law, the dimmer-server of place-of-discussed-teaching-midian: and he led the flock to the backside of the place-of-word-desert, and came to the mountain of towards-these-elohim, even to sword-horeb. umosheh ro‘eh zon yitro khoteno kohen midyan, vayinhag hazon ’akhar hamidbar vayabo ’el har ha’elohim khorebah.
wyr1 ml1k yhwh 1lyw blbt 1S mtwk hsnh wyr1 whnh hsnh b8r b1S whsnh 1ynnw 1kl and the angel-messanger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed. vayera mal’akh yhvh ’elav belabat ’esh mitokh haseneh, vayar vehineh haseneh bo‘er ba’esh vehaseneh ’enenu ’ukal.
wy1mr mSh 1srh n1 w1r1h 1t hmr1h hgdl hzh mdw8 l1 yb8r hsnh and extracted-mose said, i will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt. vayomer mosheh ’asurah na ve’er’eh hamar’eh hagadol hazeh, madua‘ lo yib‘ar haseneh.
wyr1 yhwh ky sr lr1wt wyqr1 1lyw 1lhym mtwk hsnh wy1mr mSh mSh wy1mr hnny and when yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou saw that he turned aside to see, towards-these-elohim called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, extracted-mose, extracted-mose. and he said, here am i. vayar yhvh ki sar lir’ot, vayiqra ’elav ’elohim mitokh haseneh vayomer mosheh mosheh vayomer hineni.
wy1mr 1l tqrb hlm Sl n8lyk m8l rglyk ky hmqwm 1Sr 1th 8wmd 8lyw 1dmt qdS hw1 and he said, draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is dedicated-finished ground. vayomer ’al tiqrab halom, shal ne‘alekha me‘al raglekha ki hamaqom ’asher ’atah ‘omed ’admat qodesh hu.
wy1mr 1nky 1lhy 1byk 1lhy 1brhm 1lhy yZHq w1lhy y8qb wystr mSh pnyw ky yr1 mhbyT 1l h1lhym moreover he said, i am the towards-these-elohim of thy father, the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham, the towards-these-elohim of laughter-isaac, and the towards-these-elohim of backstreet-jacob. and extracted-mose hid his face-turns; for he was afraid to look upon towards-these-elohim. vayomer ’anokhi ’elohei ’abikha ’elohei ’abraham ’elohei yizkhaq velohei ya‘aqob, vayaster mosheh panav ki yare mehabit ’el ha’elohim.
wy1mr yhwh r1h r1yty 1t 8ny 8my 1Sr bmZrym w1t Z8qtm Sm8ty mpny ngSyw ky yd8ty 1t mk1byw and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said, i have surely seen the affliction of my with-mum-people which are in narrows-mizraim, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for i hand-know their sorrows; vayomer yhvh ra’oh ra’iti ‘oni ‘ami ’asher bemizrayim, ve’et za‘aqatam shama‘ti mipenei nogesav ki yada‘ti makh’obav.
w1rd lhZylw myd mZrym wlh8ltw mn h1rZ hhw1 1l 1rZ Twbh wrHbh 1l 1rZ zbt Hlb wdbS 1l mqwm hkn8ny whHty wh1mry whprzy whHwy whybwsy and i am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the narrows-mizraimians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the mobile-trade-canaanites, and the tusk-cut-hittites, and the talker-amorites, and the unwalled-perizzites, and the experience-hivites, and the trampler-jebusites. va’ered lehazilo miyad mizrayim uleha‘aloto min ha’arez hahiv ’el ’erez tobah urekhabah ’el ’erez zabat khalab udebash, ’el meqom hakena‘ani vehakhiti veha’emori vehaperizi vehakhivi vehaybusi.
w8th hnh Z8qt bny ySr1l b1h 1ly wgm r1yty 1t hlHZ 1Sr mZrym lHZym 1tm now therefore, behold, the cry of children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel is come unto me: and i have also seen the oppression wherewith the narrows-mizraimians oppress them. ve‘atah hineh za‘aqat bene yisra’el ba’ah ’elay, vegam ra’iti halakhaz ’asher mizrayim lokhazim ’otam.
w8th lkh w1SlHk 1l pr8h whwZ1 1t 8my bny ySr1l mmZrym come now therefore, and i will send thee unto big-house-pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my with-mum-people children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel out of narrows-mizraim. ve‘atah lekhah ve’eshlakhakha ’el par‘oh, vehozei ‘ami bene yisra’el mimizrayim.
wy1mr mSh 1l h1lhym my 1nky ky 1lk 1l pr8h wky 1wZy1 1t bny ySr1l mmZrym and extracted-mose said unto towards-these-elohim, who am i, that i should go unto big-house-pharaoh, and that i should bring forth children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel out of narrows-mizraim? vayomer mosheh ’el ha’elohim mi ’anokhi ki ’elekh ’el par‘oh, vekhi ’ozi benei yisra’el mimizrayim.
wy1mr ky 1hyh 8mk wzh lk h1wt ky 1nky SlHtyk bhwZy1k 1t h8m mmZrym t8bdwn 1t h1lhym 8l hhr hzh and he said, certainly i will be with thee; and this be a token unto thee, that i have sent thee: when thou hast brought forth the with-mum-people out of narrows-mizraim, ye work for towards-these-elohim upon this mountain. vayomer ki ’ehyeh ‘imakh vezeh lekha ha’ot ki ’anokhi shelakhtikha, behozi’akha ha‘am mimizrayim ta‘abdun ha’elohim ‘al hahar hazeh.
wy1mr mSh 1l h1lhym hnh 1nky b1 1l bny ySr1l w1mrty lhm 1lhy 1bwtykm SlHny 1lykm w1mrw ly mh Smw mh 1mr 1lhm and extracted-mose said unto towards-these-elohim, behold, when i come unto children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, and say unto them, the towards-these-elohim of your fathers hath sent me unto you; and they say to me, what is his name? what i say unto them? vayomer mosheh ’el ha’elohim hineh ’anokhi ba ’el benei yisra’el ve’amarti lahem ’elohei ’abotekhem shelakhani ’alekhem, ve’ameru li mah shemo mah ’omar ’alehem.
wy1mr 1lhym 1l mSh 1hyh 1Sr 1hyh wy1mr kh t1mr lbny ySr1l 1hyh SlHny 1lykm and towards-these-elohim said unto extracted-mose, i am that i am: and he said, thus thou say unto children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, i am hath sent me unto you. vayomer ’elohim ’el mosheh ’ehyeh ’asher ’ehyeh, vayomer koh tomar libnei yisra’el ’ehyeh shelakhani ’alekhem.
wy1mr 8wd 1lhym 1l mSh kh t1mr 1l bny ySr1l yhwh 1lhy 1btykm 1lhy 1brhm 1lhy yZHq w1lhy y8qb SlHny 1lykm zh Smy l8lm wzh zkry ldr dr and towards-these-elohim said moreover unto extracted-mose, thus thou say unto children-betweens of saturated-towards-israel, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of your fathers, the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham, the towards-these-elohim of laughter-isaac, and the towards-these-elohim of backstreet-jacob, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations. vayomer ‘od ’elohim ’el mosheh koh tomar ’el benei yisra’el yhvh ’elohei ’abotekhem ’elohei ’abraham ’elohei yizkhaq velohei ya‘aqob shelakhani ’alekhem, zeh shemi le‘olam vezeh zikhri ledor dor.
lk w1spt 1t zqny ySr1l w1mrt 1lhm yhwh 1lhy 1btykm nr1h 1ly 1lhy 1brhm yZHq wy8qb l1mr pqd pqdty 1tkm w1t h8Swy lkm bmZrym go, and gather the elders of saturated-towards-israel together, and say unto them, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of your fathers, the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham, of laughter-isaac, and of backstreet-jacob, appeared unto me, saying, i have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in narrows-mizraim: lekh ve’asafta ziqnei yisra’el ve’amarta ’alehem yhvh ’elohei ’abotekhem nir’ah ’elay ’elohei ’abraham yizkhaq veya‘aqob lemor, paqod paqadti ’etkhem ve’et he‘asui lakhem bemizrayim.
w1mr 18lh 1tkm m8ny mZrym 1l 1rZ hkn8ny whHty wh1mry whprzy whHwy whybwsy 1l 1rZ zbt Hlb wdbS and i have said, i will bring you up out of the affliction of narrows-mizraim unto the land of the mobile-trade-canaanites, and the tusk-cut-hittites, and the talker-amorites, and the unwalled-perizzites, and the experience-hivites, and the trampler-jebusites, unto a land flowing with milk and honey. va’omar ’a‘aleh ’etkhem me‘oni mizrayim ’el ’erez hakena‘ani vehakhiti veha’emori vehaperizi vehakhivi vehaybusi, ’el ’erez zabat khalab udebash.
wSm8w lqlk wb1t 1th wzqny ySr1l 1l mlk mZrym w1mrtm 1lyw yhwh 1lhy h8bryym nqrh 8lynw w8th nlkh n1 drk SlSt ymym bmdbr wnzbHh lyhwh 1lhynw and they hearken to thy voice: and thou come, thou and the elders of saturated-towards-israel, unto the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim, and ye say unto him, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of the cross-over-hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the place-of-word-desert, that we may butcher to yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou our towards-these-elohim. veshame‘u leqolekha, ubata ’atah veziqnei yisra’el ’el melekh mizrayim va’amartem ’elav yhvh ’elohei ha‘ibriyim niqrah ‘alenu ve‘atah nelakhah na derekh sheloshet yamim bamidbar venizbekhah yhvh ’elohenu.
w1ny yd8ty ky l1 ytn 1tkm mlk mZrym lhlk wl1 byd Hzqh and i am sure that the moloch-king of narrows-mizraim will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand. va’ani yada‘ti ki lo yiten ’etkhem melekh mizrayim lahalokh, velo beyad khazaqah.
wSlHty 1t ydy whkyty 1t mZrym bkl npl1ty 1Sr 18Sh bqrbw w1Hry kn ySlH 1tkm and i will stretch out my hand, and hit narrows-mizraim with all my wonders which i will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go. veshalakhti yadi vehiketi mizrayim bekhol nifle’otay ’asher ’e‘eseh beqirbo, ve’akhare khen yeshalakh ’etkhem.
wntty 1t Hn h8m hzh b8yny mZrym whyh ky tlkwn l1 tlkw ryqm and i will give this with-mum-people favor in the sight of the narrows-mizraimians: and it come to pass, that, when ye go, ye not go empty. venatati khen ha‘am hazeh be‘enei mizrayim, vehayah ki telekhun lo telekhu reqam.
wS1lh 1Sh mSknth wmgrt byth kly ksp wkly zhb wSmlt wSmtm 8l bnykm w8l bntykm wnZltm 1t mZrym and every woman borrow of her neighbor, and of her that sojourneth in her daughter-house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye put them upon your children-betweens, and upon your children-betweenesss; and ye spoil the narrows-mizraimians. vesha’alah ’ishah mishekhentah umigarat betah kele khesef ukhelei zahab usemalot, vesamtem ‘al benekhem ve‘al benotekhem venizaltem mizrayim.
wy8n mSh wy1mr whn l1 y1mynw ly wl1 ySm8w bqly ky y1mrw l1 nr1h 1lyk yhwh and extracted-mose answered and said, and, behold, they will not be coached by me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou hath not appeared unto thee. vaya‘an mosheh vayomer vehen lo ya’aminu li velo yishme‘u beqoli, ki yomeru lo nir’ah ’elekha yhvh.
wy1mr 1lyw yhwh mzh mh zh bydk wy1mr mTh and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto him, what is that in thine hand? and he said, a pen. vayomer ’elav yhvh mah zeh beyadekha, vayomer mateh.
wy1mr hSlykhw 1rZh wySlykhw 1rZh wyhy lnHS wyns mSh mpnyw and he said, cast it on the ground. and he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and extracted-mose fled from before-turns it. vayomer hashlikhehu ’arzah vayashlikhehu ’arzah vayhi lenakhash, vayanas mosheh mipanav.
wy1mr yhwh 1l mSh SlH ydk w1Hz bznbw wySlH ydw wyHzq bw wyhy lmTh bkpw and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto extracted-mose, put forth thine hand, and take it by the tail. and he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a pen in his hand: vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh shelakh yadekha ve’ekhoz biznabo, vayishlakh yado vayakhazeq bo vayhi lemateh bekhapo.
lm8n y1mynw ky nr1h 1lyk yhwh 1lhy 1btm 1lhy 1brhm 1lhy yZHq w1lhy y8qb that they may be coached by that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou towards-these-elohim of their fathers, the towards-these-elohim of their-dick-abraham, the towards-these-elohim of laughter-isaac, and the towards-these-elohim of backstreet-jacob, hath appeared unto thee. lema‘an ya’aminu ki nir’ah ’elekha yhvh ’elohei ’abotam, ’elohei ’abraham ’elohei yizkhaq velohei ya‘aqob.
wy1mr yhwh lw 8wd hb1 n1 ydk bHyqk wyb1 ydw bHyqw wywZ1h whnh ydw mZr8t kSlg and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said furthermore unto him, put now thine hand into thy bosom. and he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand was waspish-speckled-speckled as snow. vayomer yhvh lo ‘od habe na yadekha bekheqekha vayabei yado bekheqo, vayozi’ah vehineh yado mezora‘at kashaleg.
wy1mr hSb ydk 1l Hyqk wySb ydw 1l Hyqw wywZ1h mHyqw whnh Sbh kbSrw and he said, put thine hand into thy bosom again. and he put his hand into his bosom again; and plucked it out of his bosom, and, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh. vayomer hasheb yadekha ’el kheqekha vayasheb yado ’el kheqo, vayozi’ah mekheqo vehineh shabah kibsaro.
whyh 1m l1 y1mynw lk wl1 ySm8w lql h1t hr1Swn wh1mynw lql h1t h1Hrwn and it come to pass, if they will not be coached by thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will be coached by the voice of the latter sign. vehayah ’im lo ya’aminu lakh velo yishme‘u leqol ha’ot harishon, vehe’eminu leqol ha’ot ha’akharon.
whyh 1m l1 y1mynw gm lSny h1twt h1lh wl1 ySm8wn lqlk wlqHt mmymy hy1r wSpkt hybSh whyw hmym 1Sr tqH mn hy1r whyw ldm bybSt and it come to pass, if they will not be coached by also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou take of the from-waters of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the from-waters which thou takest out of the river become blood upon the dry land. vehayah ’im lo ya’aminu gam lishnei ha’otot ha’eleh velo yishme‘un leqolekha velaqakhta mimemei hay’or veshafakhta hayabashah, vehayu hamayim ’asher tiqakh min hay’or vehayu ledam bayabashet.
wy1mr mSh 1l yhwh by 1dny l1 1yS dbrym 1nky gm mtmwl gm mSlSm gm m1z dbrk 1l 8bdk ky kbd ph wkbd lSwn 1nky and extracted-mose said unto yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, o my yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, i am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast bee-spoken unto thy worker: and i am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue. vayomer mosheh ’el yhvh bi ’adonay lo ’ish debarim ’anokhi gam mitemol gam mishilshom gam me’az daberkha ’el ‘abdekha, ki khebad peh ukhebad lashon ’anokhi.
wy1mr yhwh 1lyw my Sm ph l1dm 1w my ySwm 1lm 1w HrS 1w pqH 1w 8wr hl1 1nky yhwh and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto him, who hath made man's mouth? or who maketh the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not i yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou? vayomer yhvh ’elav mi sam peh la’adam ’o mi yasum ’ilem ’o kheresh ’o fiqeakh ’o ‘iver, halo ’anokhi yhvh.
w8th lk w1nky 1hyh 8m pyk whwrytyk 1Sr tdbr now therefore go, and i will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou say. ve‘atah lekh, ve’anokhi ’ehyeh ‘im pikha vehoretikha ’asher tedaber.
wy1mr by 1dny SlH n1 byd tSlH and he said, o my yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, send, i pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send. vayomer bi ’adonay, shelakh na beyad tishlakh.
wyHr 1p yhwh bmSh wy1mr hl1 1hrn 1Hyk hlwy yd8ty ky dbr ydbr hw1 wgm hnh hw1 yZ1 lqr1tk wr1k wSmH blbw and the nose-anger of yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou was kindled against extracted-mose, and he said, is not cabinet-aaron the join-levite thy brother? i hand-know that he can speak well. and also, behold, he cometh forth to until-witness thee: and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart. vayikhar ’af yhvh bemosheh vayomer halo ’aharon ’akhikha halevi yada‘ti ki daber yedaber hu, vegam hineh hu yozei liqratekha vera’akha vesamakh belibo.
wdbrt 1lyw wSmt 1t hdbrym bpyw w1nky 1hyh 8m pyk w8m pyhw whwryty 1tkm 1t 1Sr t8Swn and thou speak unto him, and put bee-words in his mouth: and i will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye do. vedibarta ’elav vesamta hadebarim befiv, ve’anokhi ’ehyeh ‘im pikha ve‘im pihu vehoreti ’etkhem ’asher ta‘asun.
wdbr hw1 lk 1l h8m whyh hw1 yhyh lk lph w1th thyh lw l1lhym and he be thy spokesman unto the with-mum-people: and he be, even he be to thee instead of a mouth, and thou be to him instead of towards-these-elohim. vediber hu lekha ’el ha‘am, vehayah hu yihyeh lekha lefeh ve’atah tihyeh lo lelohim.
w1t hmTh hzh tqH bydk 1Sr t8Sh bw 1t h1tt and thou take this pen in thine hand, wherewith thou do signs. ve’et hamateh hazeh tiqakh beyadekha, ’asher ta‘aseh bo ha’otot.
wylk mSh wySb 1l ytr Htnw wy1mr lw 1lkh n1 w1Swbh 1l 1Hy 1Sr bmZrym w1r1h h8wdm Hyym wy1mr ytrw lmSh lk lSlwm and extracted-mose went and returned to look-jethro his father in law, and said unto him, let me go, i pray thee, and return unto my brethren which are in narrows-mizraim, and see whether they be yet alive. and look-jethro said to extracted-mose, go in peace. vayelekh mosheh vayashab ’el yeter khoteno vayomer lo ’elekhah na ve’ashubah ’el ’akhay ’asher bemizrayim ve’er’eh ha‘odam khayim, vayomer yitro lemosheh lekh leshalom.
wy1mr yhwh 1l mSh bmdyn lk Sb mZrym ky mtw kl h1nSym hmbqSym 1t npSk and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto extracted-mose in place-of-discussed-teaching-midian, go, return into narrows-mizraim: for all the men are dead which sought thy life. vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh bemidyan lekh shub mizrayim, ki metu kal ha’anashim hambaqshim nafshekha.
wyqH mSh 1t 1Stw w1t bnyw wyrkbm 8l hHmr wySb 1rZh mZrym wyqH mSh 1t mTh h1lhym bydw and extracted-mose took his woman and his children-betweens, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of narrows-mizraim: and extracted-mose took the pen of towards-these-elohim in his hand. vayiqakh mosheh ’ishto ve’et banav vayarkibem ‘al hakhamor vayashab ’arzah mizrayim, vayiqakh mosheh mateh ha’elohim beyado.
wy1mr yhwh 1l mSh blktk lSwb mZrymh r1h kl hmptym 1Sr Smty bydk w8Sytm lpny pr8h w1ny 1Hzq 1t lbw wl1 ySlH 1t h8m and yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou said unto extracted-mose, when thou goest to return into narrows-mizraim, see that thou do all those wonders before-turns big-house-pharaoh, which i have put in thine hand: and i will harden his heart, that he not let the with-mum-people go. vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh belekhtekha lashub mizraymah re’eh kal hamofetim ’asher samti beyadekha va‘asitam lifnei far‘oh, va’ani ’akhazeq libo velo yeshalakh ha‘am.
w1mrt 1l pr8h kh 1mr yhwh bny bkry ySr1l and thou say unto big-house-pharaoh, thus saith yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou, saturated-towards-israel is my child-between, even my firstborn: ve’amarta ’el par‘oh, koh ’amar yhvh beni bekhori yisra’el.
w1mr 1lyk SlH 1t bny wy8bdny wtm1n lSlHw hnh 1nky hrg 1t bnk bkrk and i say unto thee, let my child-between go, that he may work for me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, i will slay thy child-between, even thy firstborn. va’omar ’elekha shalakh beni veya‘abdeni vatema’en leshalekho, hineh ’anokhi horeg binkha bekhorekha.
wyhy bdrk bmlwn wypgShw yhwh wybqS hmytw and it came to pass by the way in the inn, that yeahoh-yhwh-aeiou met him, and sought to kill him. vayhi baderekh bamalon, vayifgeshehu yhvh vaybaqesh hamito.
wtqH Zprh Zr wtkrt 1t 8rlt bnh wtg8 lrglyw wt1mr ky Htn dmym 1th ly then bird-bird-ziporah took a sharp father-child-stone, and cut off the foreskin of her child-between, and cast it at his feet, and said, surely a bloody man art thou to me. vatiqakh ziporah zor vatikhrot ‘arelat benah vataga‘ leraglav, vatomer ki khatan damim ’atah li.
wyrp mmnw 1z 1mrh Htn dmym lmwlt so he let him go: then she said, a bloody man thou art, because of the script-circumcision. vayiref mimenu, ’az ’amerah khatan damim lamulot.
